verses.latin: Verba Jeremiae filii Helciae de sacerdotibus, qui fuerunt in Anathoth, in terra Benjamin.
verses.english: These are the prophetic words of Jeremiah, son of Hilkiah, who was one of the priests from the town of Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Quod factum est verbum Domini ad ipsum in diebus Josiae filii Amon regis Juda, in tertiodecimo anno regni ejus.
verses.english: The Word of the Lord first came to him in the thirteenth year of the reign of Josiah, son of Amon, king of Judah.

verses.latin: Et factum est in diebus Joakim filii Josiae regis Juda, usque ad consummationem undecimi anni Sedeciae filii Josiae regis Juda, usque ad transmigrationem Jerusalem, in mense quinto.
verses.english: It continued through the reign of Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, king of Judah, and lasted until the eleventh year of Zedekiah, son of Josiah, king of Judah, when Jerusalem was carried away into exile during the fifth month — this was the full duration of his prophetic ministry.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Word of the Lord came directly to me, saying:

verses.latin: Priusquam te formarem in utero, novi te: et antequam exires de vulva, sanctificavi te, et prophetam in gentibus dedi te.
verses.english: “Before I created your physical form in your mother’s womb, I knew you. And before you were born, I consecrated you to My service, appointing you as a prophet to all the nations.”

verses.latin: Et dixi: A, a, a, Domine Deus: ecce nescio loqui, quia puer ego sum.
verses.english: But I said: “Oh, Lord God! I cannot speak for You, for I am but a youth and I don’t know what to say.”

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Noli dicere: Puer ego sum: quoniam ad omnia quaecumque mittam te, ibis: et universa quaecumque mandavero tibi, loqueris.
verses.english: But the Lord said to me: “Do not say, ‘I am a youth.’ For wherever I send you, you shall go, and everything I command you to say, you shall speak.

verses.latin: Non timebis a facie eorum: quia ego tecum sum, ut eruam te, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Do not be afraid of anyone’s presence, because I Myself am with you to deliver you,” declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Et misit Dominus manum suam, et tetigit os meum: et dixit Dominus ad me: Ecce dedi verba mea in ore tuo.
verses.english: Then the Lord stretched out His hand and touched my mouth — an act of divine commissioning and empowerment. And the Lord said to me: “Behold, I have now put My very own words in your mouth.

verses.latin: Ecce constitui te hodie super gentes et super regna, ut evellas, et destruas, et disperdas, et dissipes, et aedifices, et plantes.
verses.english: Look! Today I have given you authority over nations and over kingdoms. You are to uproot nations, tear them down, destroy them, and overthrow them through your prophecies. And you are also to build up and to plant new beginnings through your prophecies.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens: Quid tu vides, Jeremia? Et dixi: Virgam vigilantem ego video.
verses.english: Then the Word of the Lord came to me again, saying: “Jeremiah, what do you see?” And I answered: “I see an almond branch” — the first tree to wake and blossom in spring, symbolizing God’s watchful readiness.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Bene vidisti: quia vigilabo ego super verbum meum, ut faciam illud.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me: “You have seen well! For I Myself will be watchful over My word to ensure that I perform it.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini secundo ad me, dicens: Quid tu vides? Et dixi: Ollam succensam ego video, et faciem ejus a facie aquilonis.
verses.english: The Word of the Lord came to me a second time, saying: “What do you see now?” And I said: “I see a boiling pot, and its mouth is tilted from the north,” indicating the direction from which the judgment will come.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Ab aquilone pandetur malum super omnes habitatores terrae.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to me: “Calamity and evil will be unleashed from the north upon all the inhabitants of this land.

verses.latin: Quia ecce ego convocabo omnes cognationes regnorum aquilonis, ait Dominus: et venient, et ponent unusquisque solium suum in introitu portarum Jerusalem, et super omnes muros ejus in circuitu, et super universas civitates Juda.
verses.english: For behold, I am summoning all the families of the kingdoms of the north,” declares the Lord. “And they will come, and each one will set his royal throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem. They will also attack all its surrounding walls and all the cities of Judah.”

verses.latin: Et loquar judicia mea cum eis, super omnem malitiam eorum qui reliquerunt me, et libaverunt diis alienis, et adoraverunt opus manuum suarum.
verses.english: I will then pronounce My judgments against them for all their wickedness. They abandoned Me, offered libations to foreign gods, and worshipped the idols made by their own hands.

verses.latin: Tu ergo accinge lumbos tuos, et surge, et loquere ad eos omnia quae ego mando tibi: ne timeas a facie eorum: nec enim formidabis vultum eorum.
verses.english: Therefore, you, Jeremiah, must prepare yourself for action. Arise and speak to them everything that I command you. Do not be afraid of their presence or dread their faces,

verses.latin: Ego quippe dedi te hodie in civitatem munitam, et in columnam ferream, et in murum aereum, super omnem terram, regibus Juda, et principibus ejus, et sacerdotibus, et populo terrae.
verses.english: “—for behold, I have made you today like a fortified city, an iron pillar, and a bronze wall against the entire land — against the kings of Judah, its princes, its priests, and the people of the land.

verses.latin: Et bellabunt adversum te, et non prevalent: quia ego tecum sum, ait Dominus, ut liberem te.
verses.english: They will fight against you, but they will not prevail over you, because I am with you,” declares the Lord, “to deliver you from them.”

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Vade, et clama in auribus Jerusalem, dicens: Hæc dicit Dominus: Recordatus sum tui, miserans adolescentiam tuam, et caritatem desponsationis tuæ, quando secuta es me in deserto, in terra non seminata.
verses.english: Go and proclaim to Jerusalem, saying: The Lord declares: "I remember your devotion from when you were young, and the great love you had for Me when we were first espoused. You followed Me through the wilderness, through land that was not cultivated."

verses.latin: Sanctus Israel Domino, primitiæ frugum ejus: omnes qui devorant eum, delinquunt: mala venient super eos, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Israel was consecrated to the Lord, the very firstfruits of His harvest. Anyone who tried to destroy Israel was found guilty and brought disaster upon themselves, the Lord declares.

verses.latin: Audite verbum Domini, domus Jacob, et omnes cognationes domus Israel:
verses.english: Listen to the word of the Lord, O house of Jacob, and all the families within the house of Israel:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Quid invenerunt patres vestri in me iniquitatis, quia elongaverunt a me, et ambulaverunt post vanitatem, et vani facti sunt?
verses.english: The Lord declares: "What injustice did your ancestors find in Me that made them abandon Me? They pursued empty idols and became empty themselves."

verses.latin: Et non dixerunt: Ubi est Dominus qui ascendere nos fecit de terra Ægypti, qui transduxit nos per desertum, per terram inhabitabilem et inviam, per terram sitis et imaginem mortis, per terram in qua nemo perambulabat, neque homo habitabat?
verses.english: They did not ask: "Where is the Lord who brought us up from the land of Egypt? Where is the One who led us through the wilderness—through a desolate and impassable land, through a land of drought and the shadow of death, a land where no one journeyed and no human dwelled?"

verses.latin: Et induxi vos in terram carmeli, ut comedatis fructum ejus et optima illius. Et ingressi contaminastis terram meam, et hereditatem meam posuistis in abominationem.
verses.english: I brought you into a fertile land—a garden paradise—to enjoy its fruits and its goodness. But when you entered, you defiled My land and made My inheritance an abomination.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes non dixerunt: Ubi est Dominus? et tenentes legem nescierunt me, et pastores prævaricati sunt in me, et prophetæ prophetaverunt in Baal, et post idola ambulaverunt quæ non proderant.
verses.english: Even the priests did not ask: "Where is the Lord?" Those who were supposed to teach the Law did not truly know Me. The leaders of the people rebelled against Me. The prophets spoke in the name of Baal and pursued worthless idols.

verses.latin: Propterea adhuc judicio contendam vobiscum, ait Dominus, et cum filiis filiorum vestrorum disceptabo.
verses.english: Therefore, I will again bring a charge against you, declares the Lord. I will contend with your children's children, and they will answer for your sins.

verses.latin: Quia transite ad insulas Cetthim, et videte: et in Cedar mittite, et considerate vehementer, si factum est hujusmodi.
verses.english: Cross over to the coasts of the Cypriots and observe! Send messengers to Kedar and carefully consider if anything like this has ever happened!

verses.latin: Si mutavit gens deos suos, et certe ipsi non sunt dii: populus vero meus mutavit gloriam suam in idolum cui non prodest.
verses.english: Has any nation ever changed its gods, even though those gods are not real? Yet My people have exchanged their true glory—Me—for an idol that brings no benefit.

verses.latin: Obstupescite cœli super hoc, et intueamini, et desolamini vehementer, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Be utterly shocked, O universe, at this! Look with horror and be completely devastated, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Duplicia enim mala fecit populus meus: me dereliquerunt fontem aquæ vivæ, et foderunt sibi cisternas dissipatas, quæ continere non valent aquas.
verses.english: For My people have committed two great evils: they have abandoned Me, the very spring of life-giving water, and they have dug for themselves cracked cisterns that cannot hold water.

verses.latin: Numquid servus est Israel, aut alumnus? quare ergo factus est in prædam?
verses.english: Is Israel a slave? Or was he born into slavery? Why then has he become prey to his enemies?

verses.latin: Super eum rugierunt leones, et dederunt vocem suam: posuerunt terram ejus in solitudinem: civitates ejus exustæ sunt, et non est qui habitet in eis.
verses.english: Lions have roared over him; they have raised their voices in triumph. They have made his land a desolate wasteland. His cities have been burned to ashes, and no one lives in them.

verses.latin: Filii quoque Memphis et Taphnes decipierunt te usque ad verticem.
verses.english: Even the people of Memphis and Tahpanhes—the Egyptians—have utterly disgraced you. They have shaved your head bare, taking away your dignity.

verses.latin: Numquid non istud factum est tibi, quia dereliquisti Dominum Deum tuum eo tempore quo ducebat te per viam?
verses.english: Did this not happen to you because you abandoned the Lord your God, at the very time He was leading you on your path?

verses.latin: Et nunc quid sibi vis in via Ægypti, ut bibas aquam turbidam? Et quid tibi cum via Assyriorum, ut bibas aquam Nili?
verses.english: And now, what do you want for yourself on the way to Egypt, that you may drink the muddy waters of the Shihor? And what good will it do you on the way to Assyria, that you may drink the waters of the Nile?

verses.latin: Nocumentum tuum te corriget, et aversio tua arguet te. Scito et vide quia malum et amarum est dereliquisse te Dominum Deum tuum, et non esse timorem mei apud te, dicit Dominus Deus exercituum.
verses.english: Your own wickedness will punish you, and your turning away will condemn you. Know and see that it is evil and bitter for you to abandon the Lord your God, and that you have no reverent fear of Me, declares the Lord God of all creation.

verses.latin: A sæculo confregisti jugum meum, rupisti vincula mea, et dixisti: Non serviam. In omni enim colle sublimi et sub omni ligno frondoso tu prosternebaris meretrix.
verses.english: Long ago, you broke My yoke and tore off My bonds, declaring: "I will not serve You!" Indeed, on every high hill and under every leafy tree, you prostrated yourself like a prostitute.

verses.latin: Ego autem plantavi te vineam electam, totum semen verum: quomodo ergo conversus es mihi in pravum, vinea aliena?
verses.english: I Myself planted you as a choice vine, an entirely true seed. How then have you turned into a degenerate, wild vine in My sight?

verses.latin: Si laveris te nitro, et multiplicaveris tibi herbam borith, inquinata es in iniquitate tua coram me, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: Even if you wash yourself with soda and use much lye soap, the stain of your guilt remains before Me, declares the Lord God.

verses.latin: Quomodo dicis: Non sum polluta, nec post Baalim ambulavi? Vide vias tuas in convalle, scito quid feceris: cursor levis, infidelis camelus.
verses.english: How can you say: "I am not defiled; I have not run after the Baals"? Look at your ways in the valley, understand what you have done! You are like a swift, restive young camel, running aimlessly.

verses.latin: Onager assuetus in solitudine, in desiderio animæ suæ attraxit ventum amoris sui: libidinem ejus quis avertet? omnes qui quærunt eam non deficient, in menstruis ejus invenient eam.
verses.english: You are like a wild ass, accustomed to the wilderness, snorting for passion in her desire. Who can turn her away from her lust? All who seek her will find her when she is in heat.

verses.latin: Prohibe pedem tuum a nuditate, et guttur tuum a siti. Et dixisti: Desperavi, nequaquam fiet: non enim, dilexi alienos, et post eos ambulabo.
verses.english: You try to hold your foot back from running bare, and your throat from thirst. But you said: "It's hopeless! No, I have loved foreign gods, and after them I will go!"

verses.latin: Sicut confunditur fur quando deprehenditur, sic confusi sunt domus Israel, ipsi et reges eorum, principes, et sacerdotes, et prophetæ eorum.
verses.english: Just as a thief is put to shame when he is caught, so the house of Israel will be put to shame—they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets.

verses.latin: Dicentes ligno: Pater meus es tu; et lapidi: Tu me genuisti. Converterunt ad me terga, et non facies: et in tempore afflictionis suæ dicent: Surge, et libera nos.
verses.english: They say to a wooden idol: "You are my father," and to a stone idol: "You gave birth to me." They have turned their backs to Me, not their faces. But in the time of their affliction, they will say: "Arise and deliver us!"

verses.latin: Ubi sunt dii tui, quos fecisti tibi? surgant, et liberent te in tempore afflictionis tuæ: secundum numerum enim civitatum tuarum facti sunt dii tui, Juda.
verses.english: Where are your gods that you made for yourselves? Let them rise up and deliver you in your time of affliction! For you have as many gods, O Judah, as you have cities.

verses.latin: Quid vultis mecum judicio contendere? omnes dereliquistis me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Why do you want to bring a charge against Me? You have all abandoned Me, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Frustra percussi filios vestros: disciplinam non receperunt. Gladius vester comedit prophetas vestros, quasi leo vastator.
verses.english: In vain I struck your children; they did not accept correction. Your own sword devoured your prophets, like a devastating lion.

verses.latin: Generatio vestra, videte verbum Domini: Numquid solitudo factus sum Israeli, aut terra serotina? quare ergo dixit populus meus: Recessimus, non veniemus ultra ad te?
verses.english: O generation, consider the word of the Lord! Have I been a wilderness to Israel? Or a land that yields nothing? Why then do My people say: "We have broken free; we will not come to You any more"?

verses.latin: Numquid obliviscitur virgo ornamenti sui, aut sponsa fasciæ pectoralis suæ? Populus vero meus oblitus est mei diebus innumeris.
verses.english: Can a virgin forget her jewelry, or a bride her wedding dress? Yet My people have forgotten Me for countless days.

verses.latin: Quid solertem te facis ad exquirendam viam tuam? Ideo et scelera tua docuisti malas vias tuas.
verses.english: How skillfully you prepare your path to pursue your lovers! So much so that you have taught even the wicked women your evil ways.

verses.latin: Et in alis tuis inventus est sanguis animarum pauperum innocentum: quos non in fossis invenisti, sed super omnem faciem.
verses.english: Even on your clothes, the blood of innocent, poor people is found. You did not catch them breaking into your house; their blood was openly shed for all to see.

verses.latin: Et dixisti: Absque peccato ego sum, et propterea aversus est furor ejus a me. Ecce ego judicio contendam tecum, eo quod dixeris: Non peccavi.
verses.english: Yet you say: "I am innocent; surely His anger has turned away from me." Behold, I will bring a charge against you because you insist: "I have not sinned."

verses.latin: Quam vilis facta es nimis, iterans vias tuas! Et ab Ægypto confunderis sicut confusa es ab Assur.
verses.english: How contemptible you have made yourself, so readily changing your paths! You will be disappointed by Egypt, just as you were disappointed by Assyria.

verses.latin: Nam et ab ista egredieris cum manibus tuis super caput tuum: quoniam detruit Dominus confidentiam tuam, et non habebis succursum in ea.
verses.english: Even from there you will go forth with your hands on your head in shame, for the Lord has rejected those you trusted, and you will find no help from them.

verses.latin: Dicunt: Si dimiserit vir uxorem suam, et illam dimissam duxerit alter vir: numquid revertetur ad illam ultra? nonne polluta et maculata est mulier illa? Tu autem fornicata es cum amatoribus multis: tamen revertere ad me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: They have a saying: 'If a man divorces his wife, and that divorced woman marries another man, will she ever return to him? Wouldn't that woman be defiled and stained forever?' Yet you, O Israel, have committed spiritual adultery with many false lovers; nevertheless, return to Me, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Leva oculos tuos in directum, et vide ubi non procideris: super vias sedebas exspectans eos, quasi latro in solitudine: et polluti sunt terra a fornicationibus tuis, et malitiis tuis.
verses.english: Look up to the barren heights and see where you have not prostituted yourself. You sat by the roadsides, waiting for your lovers, like a highwayman ambushing in the desert, and the land has been defiled by your spiritual adultery and your wickedness.

verses.latin: Ob quam causam prohibitae sunt stillae pluviarum, et serotinus imber non fuit: frons mulieris meretricis facta est tibi, noluisti erubescere.
verses.english: Because of this, the early rains were withheld, and there was no spring rain. You have taken on the shameless face of a harlot; you refused to be ashamed of your sins.

verses.latin: Saltem nunc vocasti me: Pater meus, dux virginitatis meae tu es.
verses.english: Even now you call out to Me, saying: 'My Father, You were the guide of my youth, the One who led me in purity.'

verses.latin: numquid irascetur in perpetuum, aut perseverabit in finem? ecce locuta es, et fecisti mala, et potuisti.
verses.english: Will God be angry forever? Will His wrath endure to the very end? This is what you say, but you continued to do all the evil things you possibly could.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Numquid vidisti quae fecerit aversatrix Israel? Abiit sibi super omnem montem excelsum, et sub omni ligno frondoso fornicata est ibi.
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to me, saying: 'Have you seen what unfaithful Israel has done? She has gone up to every high mountain and under every green tree, practicing spiritual prostitution there.'

verses.latin: Et dixi: Postquam fecerit haec omnia, ad me revertetur. Et non est reversa. Et vidit praevaricatrix Juda,
verses.english: And I thought: 'After she has done all these things, she will surely return to Me.' But she did not return to Me. And her treacherous sister, Judah, saw all this.

verses.latin: quia pro eo quod fornicata esset aversatrix Israel, dimisi eam, et dedi ei libellum repudii: et non timuit praevaricatrix Juda soror ejus, sed et ipsa abiit, et fornicata est.
verses.english: I saw that because unfaithful Israel had committed spiritual adultery, I had divorced her and given her a certificate of divorce. Yet her treacherous sister Judah was not afraid to do the same, but she too went and acted like a prostitute.

verses.latin: Et a nihilo duxit fornicationem suam, et mochata est lapide et ligno.
verses.english: And with utter disregard, she committed her spiritual adultery. She defiled the land by committing adultery with idols of stone and wood.

verses.latin: Et in his omnibus non est reversa ad me praevaricatrix Juda in toto corde suo, sed mendaciter, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: And in spite of all these warnings, treacherous Judah did not return to Me with her whole heart, but only pretended to repent, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Justificavit animam suam aversatrix Israel, comparatione praevaricatricis Juda.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to me: 'Apostate Israel has proven herself more righteous than treacherous Judah by comparison.'

verses.latin: Vade, et clama sermones istos contra aquilonem, et dices: Revertere aversatrix Israel, dicit Dominus, et non irascar tibi: quia sanctus sum ego, dicit Dominus, et non servabo in perpetuum iram.
verses.english: Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say: 'Return, apostate Israel!' declares the Lord. 'I will not look on you with anger, for I am merciful,' declares the Lord, 'and I will not remain angry forever.'

verses.latin: Verumtamen scito iniquitatem tuam, quia in Dominum Deum tuum peccasti: et dissipasti vias tuas alienis sub omni ligno frondoso, et vocem meam non audisti, dicit Dominus Deus tuus.
verses.english: 'Only acknowledge your guilt—that you have rebelled against the Lord your God, and have given your love to foreign gods under every green tree, and have not obeyed My voice,' declares the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Convertimini filii aversatores, dicit Dominus, quia ego maritus vester: et assumam vos unum de civitate, et duos de cognatione, et introducam vos in Sion.
verses.english: Return, O wayward children!' declares the Lord, 'for I am your true husband. I will take you, one from a city and two from a family, and bring you to My holy mountain, Zion.'

verses.latin: Et dabo vobis pastores juxta cor meum, et pascent vos scientia et doctrina.
verses.english: And I will give you shepherds who follow My heart, and they will nourish you with true knowledge and sound teaching.

verses.latin: Et cum multiplicati fueritis, et creveritis in terra in diebus illis, dicit Dominus, non dicent ultra: Arca testamenti Domini: neque ascendet super cor, neque commemorabuntur, neque visitabitur, neque fiet ultra.
verses.english: And in those days, when you have multiplied and become fruitful in the land,' declares the Lord, 'people will no longer speak of the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord. It will not come to mind, nor will they remember it or miss it; no new one will be made.'

verses.latin: In tempore illo vocabunt Jerusalem solium Domini: et congregabuntur ad eam omnes gentes in nomine Domini in Jerusalem, et non ambulabunt ultra post pravitatem cordis sui pessimi.
verses.english: At that time, Jerusalem will be called 'The Throne of the Lord.' And all nations will gather there, to Jerusalem, in the name of the Lord, and they will no longer follow the stubborn evil of their hearts.

verses.latin: In diebus illis ibit domus Juda ad domum Israel: et venient simul de terra aquilonis ad terram quam requiem dare feci patribus vestris.
verses.english: In those days, the house of Judah will unite with the house of Israel, and they will come together from the land of the north to the land that I gave to your fathers as an inheritance and a place of rest.

verses.latin: Ego autem dixi: Quomodo ponam te in filios, et dabo tibi terram desiderabilem, haereditatem praeclaram exercituum Gentium? Et dixi: Pater meus vocaberis, et post me ingredi non desines.
verses.english: But I myself said, 'How will I adopt you as My children and give you a desirable land, a glorious heritage among the nations?' And I said, 'You will call Me 'My Father' and will not turn away from following Me.'

verses.latin: Verumtamen sicut contemnit mulier amicum suum, sic contempsit me domus Israel, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: But just as a wife proves faithless to her husband, so have you, O house of Israel, been unfaithful to Me,' declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Vox in excelsis audita est, ploratus et fletus filiorum Israel: quia depravaverunt viam suam, obliti sunt Domini Dei sui.
verses.english: A sound is heard on the barren heights—the weeping and cries for mercy of the children of Israel, because they have corrupted their ways and forgotten the Lord their God.

verses.latin: Convertimini filii aversatores, et sanabo aversiones vestras. Ecce nos venimus ad te: quia tu es Dominus Deus noster.
verses.english: 'Return, you wayward children, and I will heal your waywardness.' And they answer: 'Here we are! We come to You, for You are the Lord our God!'

verses.latin: Vere mendaces erant colles multitudinis, et strepitus montium: vere in Domino Deo nostro salus Israel.
verses.english: Surely, the worship on the multitude of hills and the clamor on the mountains were deceptive and vain. Truly, in the Lord our God alone is the salvation of Israel.

verses.latin: Et confusio operuit montes ab adolescentia nostra, nomen eorum, argentum eorum, et aurum eorum, et ligna eorum, et lapides eorum.
verses.english: And shame has covered what we worshipped on the mountains since our youth: their names, their silver, their gold, their wood, and their stones—all the idols we made.

verses.latin: Dormivimus in confusione nostra, et operuit nos ignominia nostra: quoniam Domino Deo nostro peccavimus, nos, et patres nostri ab adolescentia nostra usque ad hunc diem: et non audivimus vocem Domini Dei nostri.
verses.english: We must lie down in our shame, and our disgrace will cover us. For we have sinned against the Lord our God, both we and our fathers, from our youth even to this very day, and we have not listened to the voice of the Lord our God.

verses.latin: Si reverteris, Israel, ait Dominus, ad me converteris: et si abstuleris idola tua de facie mea, non commoveberis.
verses.english: “If you truly return, O Israel,” says the Lord, “you must turn back to Me completely. And if you remove all your idols from My sight, then you will not be disturbed or cast away.

verses.latin: Et jurabis: Vivit Dominus in veritate, et in judicio, et in justitia: et benedicent eum gentes, et in ipso laudabuntur.
verses.english: Then you will solemnly swear: ‘As the Lord lives!’ and you will do so truthfully, justly, and righteously. And then, the nations who observe this will bless Him, and find their own praise and honor in Him.”

verses.latin: Hæc enim dicit Dominus viro Juda, et Jerusalem: Novate vobis novale, et nolite serere super spinas.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord says to the people of Judah and to Jerusalem: “Break up your uncultivated land. Prepare your hearts for a new beginning. Do not sow among thorns, which will choke out any good seed.”

verses.latin: Circumcidimini Domino, et auferte præputia cordium vestrorum, viri Juda, et habitatores Jerusalem: ne forte egrediatur quasi ignis indignatio mea, et succendatur, et non sit qui extinguat, propter malitiam studiorum vestrorum.
verses.english: Circumcise yourselves spiritually for the Lord. Remove the foreskins of your hearts, O men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem. Do this lest My righteous indignation go forth like a fire and burn so fiercely that no one can extinguish it, all because of the evil practices and pursuits you continue.”

verses.latin: Annunciate in Juda, et in Jerusalem auditum facite: dicite, clangite tuba in terra, clamate vehementer, et dicite: Congregamini, et ingrediamur civitates munitas.
verses.english: “Announce this throughout Judah and make it heard in Jerusalem! Speak up! Blow the trumpet in the land! Shout urgently and declare: ‘Gather together! Let us retreat into the fortified cities for protection!’”

verses.latin: Levate signum in Sion, confortamini, nolite stare, quia malum ego adduco ab aquilone, et contritionem magnam.
verses.english: “Raise a warning flag in Zion! Brace yourselves! Do not stand still or hesitate, because I am bringing disaster from the north, a great and terrible destruction.”

verses.latin: Ascendit leo de cubili suo, et prædo gentium excitatus est: egressus est de loco suo, ut ponat terram tuam in solitudinem: civitates tuæ vastabuntur, et non erunt habitantes in eis.
verses.english: A lion has come up from his lair—a destructive enemy, the plunderer of nations, has been stirred up. He has left his place to make your land a wasteland. Your cities will be devastated, and no one will live in them.

verses.latin: Super hoc accingite vos ciliciis, plangite et ululate, quia aversus est furor Domini a nobis.
verses.english: Because of this coming disaster, put on sackcloth. Mourn deeply and wail aloud, for the Lord’s fierce anger has indeed turned against us.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa, ait Dominus: peribit cor regis, et cor principum: et obstupescent sacerdotes, et prophetæ mirabuntur.
verses.english: “And it will happen on that day,” says the Lord, “that the king’s courage will fail, and the princes’ resolve will collapse. The priests will be utterly astonished, and the prophets will be amazed and confounded.”

verses.latin: Et dixi: Heu, heu, heu, Domine Deus, ergone decepisti populum istum et Jerusalem, dicens: Pax erit vobis: et ecce pervenit gladius usque ad animam.
verses.english: Then I, Jeremiah, said: “Alas, alas, alas, O Lord God! Have You then deceived this people and Jerusalem, by saying: ‘Peace will be for you’? Yet now, behold, the sword of war has reached even to our very souls, bringing death and despair.”

verses.latin: In tempore illo dicetur populo huic, et Jerusalem: Ventus urens in viam deserti, filiæ populi mei, non ad refrigerandum, et non ad purandum.
verses.english: In that appointed time, it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem: “A scorching wind comes from the desert road, O daughter of My people. It is not a gentle wind to cool you or to cleanse you.”

verses.latin: Spiritus plenus ab his veniet mihi, nunc quoque ego loquar judicia mea cum eis.
verses.english: A mighty, destructive wind will come to Me from those northern lands. Now indeed, I will speak My judgments and execute them against My people.”

verses.latin: Ecce quasi nubes ascendet, et quasi tempestas currus ejus: velociores aquilis equi illius: Væ nobis, quoniam vastati sumus.
verses.english: Behold, the enemy will advance like storm clouds, and his chariots will rush forward like a tempest. His horses are swifter than eagles. Woe to us! For we are utterly devastated!

verses.latin: Lava a malitia cor tuum, Jerusalem, ut salveris: usquequo morabuntur in te cogitationes noxiæ?
verses.english: Wash your heart clean from wickedness, O Jerusalem, so that you may be saved! How long will these harmful and sinful thoughts dwell within you?

verses.latin: Vox enim annuncians a Dan, et auditum faciens idolum de monte Ephraim.
verses.english: For a voice is now announcing the approaching danger from Dan, the northernmost tribe. And it is making known the idol-worship from Mount Ephraim, which is the cause of this coming judgment.

verses.latin: Annunciate gentibus, ecce audiit, in Jerusalem custodes: et obsidio venit de terra longinqua, et dedit super civitates Juda vocem suam.
verses.english: Announce to the nations! Behold, Jerusalem has heard the news through her watchmen: a siege is coming from a distant land! The enemy has raised its battle cry against the cities of Judah.

verses.latin: Quasi custodes agrorum facti sunt super eam in gyro, quia me contempsit, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Like watchmen guarding fields, they—the invaders—have encircled Jerusalem, because she despised Me, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Viæ tuæ, et studia tua fecerunt hæc tibi: ista est malitia tua, quoniam amara, et quoniam pervenit usque ad cor tuum.
verses.english: Your own ways and your evil practices have brought these things upon you. This is your wickedness, because it is bitter in its fruits, and because it has penetrated deep into your very heart.

verses.latin: Ventrem meum, ventrem meum doleo, et sensus cordis mei: conturbati sunt in me latus cordis mei, non tacebo, quoniam vocem bucinæ audivit anima mea, vocem clamoris.
verses.english: My inner being, my inner being is in pain, and my heart aches with anguish! My very core is disturbed within me; I cannot be silent. For my soul has heard the sound of the trumpet, the dreadful sound of the battle cry!

verses.latin: Contritionem super contritionem nuntiata est, et vastata est omnis terra: repente vastata sunt tabernacula mea, subito pelles meæ.
verses.english: Destruction upon destruction is announced! All the land is being laid waste. Suddenly my dwelling places are destroyed; in an instant, my tents are in ruins.

verses.latin: Usquequo videbo fugientem, audiam vocem bucinæ?
verses.english: How long must I witness the people fleeing, and hear the terrifying sound of the trumpet?

verses.latin: “Quia stultus est populus meus, me non cognovit: filii insipientes sunt et vecordes: sapientes sunt ut faciant mala, bene agere nescierunt.
verses.english: “Because My people are foolish, they have not truly known Me. They are senseless children, lacking understanding and wisdom. They are skilled and wise only in doing evil, but they have not learned how to do good.”

verses.latin: Aspexi terram, et ecce vacua erat, et nihili: et cælos, et non erat lux in eis.
verses.english: I looked at the earth, and behold, it was desolate and utterly void, like the primordial chaos. And I looked at the skies, and there was no light in them.

verses.latin: Vidi montes, et ecce movebantur: et omnes colles conturbati sunt.
verses.english: I saw the mountains, and behold, they were trembling. All the hills were disturbed and shaking.

verses.latin: Intuitus sum, et ecce non erat homo: et omne volatile cæli recesserat.
verses.english: I looked, and behold, there was no human being. Every bird of the sky had fled away.

verses.latin: Vidi, et ecce Carmelus desertus: et omnis civitas ejus demolita est a facie Domini, et a facie iræ furoris ejus.
verses.english: I saw, and behold, the fertile land of Carmel was a desert. Every city belonging to it was demolished before the face of the Lord, and before the terrible wrath of His fury.

verses.latin: Hæc enim dicit Dominus: Deserta erit omnis terra, sed tamen consummationem non faciam.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord says: “All the land will be a desolation. However, I will not make a complete end of it, so that some remnant will remain.”

verses.latin: Super hoc lugebit terra, et morebunt cæli desuper: eo quod locutus sum, cogitavi, et non pœnituit me, nec aversus sum ab ea.
verses.english: Because of this, the earth will mourn, and the skies above will darken in sorrow. This is because I have spoken, I have intended it, and I have not repented of My decision, nor have I turned away from My decree.

verses.latin: A voce equitis et sagittarii fugerunt: introierunt silvas, et ascenderunt petras: universæ civitates derelictæ sunt, et non habitabat in eis homo.
verses.english: From the sound of the cavalry and the archers, the people fled. They ran into the forests and climbed upon the rocks for refuge. All the cities were abandoned, and no human being remained living in them.

verses.latin: Tu autem vastata, quid facies? Cum vestieris te coccino, et ornata fueris monili aureo, et pinxeris stibio oculos tuos, frustra componeris: contempserunt te amatores tui, animam tuam quærent.
verses.english: And you, O ravaged Jerusalem, what will you do now? Though you clothe yourself in scarlet, and adorn yourself with golden jewelry, and paint your eyes with dark kohl, you will adorn yourself in vain. Your former allies and lovers have despised you; they will seek to take your very life.

verses.latin: Vocem enim quasi parturientis audivi, angustias quasi parturientis primum, vocem filiæ Sion, intermorientis, expansas manus suas: Væ mihi, quia defecit anima mea, propter interfectos.
verses.english: For I have heard a voice like that of a woman in labor, the deep distress like one giving birth for the first time. It is the voice of the daughter of Zion, gasping for breath and dying in agony, stretching out her hands in despair. Woe is me! For my soul fails within me because of all those who are slain!”

verses.latin: Circuite vias Jerusalem, et aspicite, et considerate, et quaerite in plateis ejus, si invenire poteritis virum facientem judicium, et quaerentem fidem: et propitius ero ei.
verses.english: Go through the streets of Jerusalem and look, observe, and search in its public places. See if you can find even one person who practices justice and lives faithfully before God. If you can, I will spare the entire city.

verses.latin: Et cum dixerint: Vivit Dominus: in hoc jurabunt mendaciter.
verses.english: And even when they swear, saying, 'As the Lord lives,' they are swearing falsely in their hearts.

verses.latin: Domine, oculi tui prospiciunt fidem: percussisti eos, et non doluerunt: attrivisti eos, et renuerunt accipere disciplinam: induraverunt facies suas super petra, et noluerunt reverti.
verses.english: O Lord, your eyes look for faithfulness in people. You struck them, but they felt no sorrow for their sins. You crushed them with your judgments, but they refused to accept discipline. They have made their faces harder than rock itself and refused to turn back to You.

verses.latin: Ego autem dixi: Forsitan pauperes sunt, et stulti, ignorantes viam Domini, judicium Dei sui.
verses.english: But I, Jeremiah, thought: 'Perhaps these are only the poor and foolish people, those who do not know the Lord’s way or the justice required by their God.'

verses.latin: Ibo ergo ad optimates, et loquar eis: ipsi enim cognoverunt viam Domini, judicium Dei sui: et ecce simul contriverunt jugum, rupere vincula.
verses.english: So I will go to the prominent leaders and speak with them, for they certainly know the Lord’s way and the justice demanded by their God. But look, they too have together broken the yoke of God’s law and have burst His bonds.

verses.latin: Idcirco percussit eos leo de silva, lupus vesperae vastavit eos, pardus vigilans super civitates eorum: omnis qui egressus fuerit ex eis, capiatur: quoniam multiplicatae sunt praevaricationes eorum, confortatae sunt aversiones eorum.
verses.english: Therefore, a lion from the forest has struck them down. A wolf of the evening has laid waste to them. A leopard watches continually over their cities. Everyone who ventures out from within them will be seized and torn apart. This is because their transgressions have become exceedingly numerous, and their apostasies against God have grown strong.

verses.latin: Super his quomodo propitius esse tibi potero? Filii tui dereliquerunt me, et juraverunt per eos qui non sunt Dii: et satiabam eos, et moechabantur, et in domo meretricis luxuriabantur.
verses.english: Considering all these things, how can I possibly show you mercy, O Judah? Your children have abandoned Me and have sworn their oaths by those who are not gods at all. I filled them with abundance, yet they committed adultery, and they indulged themselves in the houses of prostitutes.

verses.latin: Caballus impudicus et hinnibilis factus est omnis: unusquisque ad uxorem proximi sui hinniebat.
verses.english: Every one of them has become like a lustful, neighing horse. Each man whinnies after his neighbor's wife with unbridled desire.

verses.latin: Numquid super his non visitabo, dicit Dominus: aut super gentem talem non ulciscetur anima mea?
verses.english: Shall I not bring judgment for these things, declares the Lord? Or shall My very soul not take vengeance on such a nation as this?

verses.latin: Ascendite muros ejus, et dissipate, et consummationem nolite facere: auferte propagines ejus, quia non sunt Domini.
verses.english: Go up onto her walls and tear them down, but do not utterly destroy everything. Cut off her branches, for they do not belong to the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia praevaricatione praevaricata est in me domus Israel, et domus Juda, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt with Me with extreme treachery, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Negaverunt Dominum, et dixerunt: Non est ipse: et non veniet super nos malum: gladium et famem non videbimus.
verses.english: They have denied the very existence and power of the Lord, saying, 'He is nothing! Evil will not come upon us, nor will we ever see war or famine.'

verses.latin: Prophetae quoque loquuntur ventum, et responsum non est in eis: haec ergo eis evenient.
verses.english: The prophets also speak mere wind; there is no divine message from God in their words. Therefore, these judgments will indeed happen to them instead.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus Deus exercituum: Quia locuti estis verbum istud, ecce ego do verba mea in ore tuo in ignem, et populum istum in ligna, et comedet eos.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord, the God of the armies of heaven, says: 'Because you, O false prophets and people, have spoken this word of denial and falsehood, behold, I am putting My true words, spoken through Jeremiah, into your mouth as a raging fire, and this people will be like wood, and My words will consume them entirely.'

verses.latin: Ecce ego adducam super vos gentem de longinquo, domus Israel, ait Dominus: gentem robustam, gentem antiquam, gentem cujus ignorabis linguam, nec intelliges quid loquatur.
verses.english: Behold, O house of Israel, I am bringing upon you a nation from far away, declares the Lord. It is a strong nation, an ancient nation, a nation whose language you will not understand, nor will you be able to comprehend what they say.

verses.latin: Pharetra ejus quasi sepulchrum apertum, omnes fortes.
verses.english: Their quiver is like an open tomb, for all their warriors are mighty.

verses.latin: Et comedet messes tuas, et panem tuum: comedet filios tuos, et filias tuas: comedet gregem tuum, et armenta tua: comedet vineam tuam, et ficum tuam: et civitates munitas tuas, in quibus tu habes fiduciam, destruet gladio.
verses.english: And they will consume your harvests and your bread. They will devour your sons and your daughters. They will consume your flocks and your herds. They will devour your vines and your fig trees. And with the sword, they will destroy your fortified cities, in which you place your trust.

verses.latin: Verumtamen et in diebus illis, ait Dominus, non faciam consummationem in vobis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, even in those dreadful days, declares the Lord, I will not make a complete end of you.

verses.latin: Et cum dixeritis: Quare fecit Dominus Deus noster nobis haec omnia? dices ad eos: Sicut dereliquistis me, et servistis Deo alieno in terra vestra, sic servietis extraneis in terra non vestra.
verses.english: And when you ask, 'Why has the Lord our God done all these things to us?' you shall say to them: 'Just as you abandoned Me and served foreign gods in your own land, so too will you be forced to serve strangers in a land that is not your own.'

verses.latin: Annuntiate hoc domui Jacob, et audi fac in Juda, dicens:
verses.english: Declare this message to the house of Jacob, and make it heard in Judah, saying:

verses.latin: Audi popule stulte, et insensate: quibus sunt oculi, et non vident: et aures, et non audiunt.
verses.english: Hear this, O foolish and senseless people! You have eyes, but you refuse to see; you have ears, but you choose not to hear.

verses.latin: Me ergo non timebitis, ait Dominus: et a facie mea non dolebitis, qui posui arenam terminum mari, praeceptum sempiternum, et non egredietur illud: et commovebuntur fluctus ejus, et non poterunt: et intumescent, et non transibunt illud.
verses.english: Do you not fear Me, declares the Lord? Will you not tremble before My presence? It is I who set the sand as the sea’s boundary, an eternal decree it cannot pass. Though its waves surge and roar, they cannot prevail, and though they swell, they cannot cross over it.

verses.latin: Populo autem huic factum est cor irretitum et exasperans: recesserunt et abierunt.
verses.english: But this people has developed a stubborn and rebellious heart. They have turned away from Me and have departed from My ways.

verses.latin: Et non dixerunt in corde suo: Timeamus Dominum Deum nostrum, qui dat nobis pluviam temporaneam et serotinam in tempore suo: plenitudinem annuae messis custodens nobis.
verses.english: They do not say in their hearts, 'Let us fear the Lord our God, who gives us the seasonal rains, both the autumn and spring showers at their proper time, and who preserves for us the full bounty of the annual harvest.'

verses.latin: Iniquitates vestrae declinaverunt haec, et peccata vestra averterunt bonum a vobis.
verses.english: Your iniquities have caused all this abundance to be withheld, and your sins have turned away every good thing from you.

verses.latin: Quoniam inventi sunt in populo meo impii, insidiantes quasi aucupes ponentes laqueos et pedicas ad capiendum viros.
verses.english: For among My people, wicked men are found. They lie in wait, just like bird catchers setting snares and traps to capture other people.

verses.latin: Sicut laqueus plenus avibus, sic domus eorum plenae dolo: et per hoc magnificati sunt, et ditati.
verses.english: Just as a cage is full of birds, so their houses are full of deceit. And by means of this deception, they have become great and have grown rich.

verses.latin: Incrassati sunt, et impinguati, et praeterierunt sermones meos pessime: causam viduae non judicaverunt, causam pupilli non direxerunt, et judicium pauperum non judicaverunt.
verses.english: They have become well-fed and sleek. They have wickedly ignored My words. They have not judged the cause of the widow, nor have they taken up the case of the orphan, and they have failed to uphold the rights of the poor.

verses.latin: Numquid super his non visitabo, dicit Dominus: aut super gentem talem non ulciscetur anima mea?
verses.english: Shall I not bring judgment for these things, declares the Lord? Or shall My very soul not take vengeance on such a nation as this?

verses.latin: Stupor et mirabile factum est in terra.
verses.english: A dreadful and astonishing thing has taken place in this land.

verses.latin: Prophetae vaticinabantur mendacium, et sacerdotes applaudebant manibus eorum: et populus meus dilexit tale quid: quid ergo fiet in novissimo ejus?
verses.english: The prophets spoke false prophecies, and the priests ruled in agreement with them. And My people loved to have it so! But what will you do then, when the end comes for all of this?

verses.latin: Confortamini filii Benjamin de medio Jerusalem, et in Thecua clangite buccina, et super Bethacarem levate signum quia malum visum est ab aquilone et contritio magna.
verses.english: Prepare yourselves, O children of Benjamin, and flee from the midst of Jerusalem! Sound the trumpet in Tekoa, and raise a signal over Beth-Haccerem! For a great evil is being seen coming from the north, and a mighty destruction is approaching.

verses.latin: Speciosam et delicatam assimilavi filiae Sion.
verses.english: I have compared the daughter of Zion—the city of Jerusalem—to a beautiful and delicate woman.

verses.latin: Ad eam venient pastores et greges eorum, fixerunt in circuitu tentoria per singulos ad se redigent agros.
verses.english: Against her will come shepherds and their flocks—these are the invading armies. They will pitch their tents all around her, and each one will graze their flocks in her fields, taking possession of her land.

verses.latin: Sanctificate super eam bellum, surgite et ascendamus in meridie vae nobis quia declinavit dies quia longiores factae sunt umbrae vespere.
verses.english: The invaders cry out, 'Prepare for war against her! Rise up, let us attack her at noon!' Then they lament, 'Woe to us, for the day is declining! The evening shadows are growing long!'

verses.latin: Surgite et ascendamus in nocte et dissipemus domos ejus.
verses.english: So they determine, 'Rise up, let us attack by night, and let us destroy her palaces!'

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus exercituum succidite arbores ejus et aggerem. fundite in circuitu Jerusalem haec est civitas visitationis omnis calumnia in medio ejus.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord of hosts says: 'Cut down her trees, and cast up a siege mound all around Jerusalem. This is the city marked for punishment, for all manner of oppression is found within her.'

verses.latin: Sicut frigidam fecit cisterna aquam suam sic malitiam suam praeparavit illa nihil audietur in ea nisi vastitas et iniquitas.
verses.english: Just as a cistern keeps its water fresh, so she—Jerusalem—has kept her wickedness fresh and flowing. Nothing but violence and ruin will be heard within her walls.

verses.latin: Erudire Jerusalem ne forte recedat anima mea a te ne ponam te desertam terram inhabitabilem.
verses.english: Receive instruction, O Jerusalem! Be warned, lest My soul finally depart from you, lest I make you a desolate land, utterly uninhabitable.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum usque ad racemum colligent quasi in vinea reliquias Israël revertere quasi vindemiator ad cartallum.
verses.english: This is what the Lord of hosts says: 'They will thoroughly glean the remnant of Israel, like grapes in a vineyard, down to the last cluster. Return, you invaders, like a grape-gatherer to his basket, and glean again!'

verses.latin: Cui loquar et quem contestabor ut audiat ecce incircumcisas aures eorum et audire non possunt ecce verbum Domini factum est illis in opprobrium et non suscipiunt illud.
verses.english: To whom shall I speak? Whom shall I warn so that they might listen? Behold, their ears are spiritually uncircumcised and closed; they cannot hear. Behold, the Word of the Lord has become an object of scorn to them, and they do not accept it.

verses.latin: Idcirco furore Domini plenus sum laboravi sustinens effunde super parvulum foris et super concilium juvenum simul virum et mulierem effundam senem et plenum dierum.
verses.english: Therefore, I am full of the Lord's wrath; I am weary of holding it in. I must pour it out upon the children in the street, and upon the assembly of young men together. Indeed, I will pour it out upon man and woman alike, upon the old man and the one full of days—even the very aged.

verses.latin: Et transibunt domus eorum ad alteros agri et uxores simul quia extendam manum meam super habitantes terram dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Their houses will pass to others, their fields and their wives will be taken together. For I will stretch out My punishing hand upon the inhabitants of this land, says the Lord.

verses.latin: A minore quippe usque ad majorem omnes avaritia student et a propheta usque ad sacerdotem cuncti faciunt dolum.
verses.english: For from the least of them to the greatest, everyone is given over to greed and covetousness. From the prophets to the priests, all practice deceit.

verses.latin: Et curabant contritionem filiae populi mei cum ignominia dicentes pax pax et non erat pax.
verses.english: They tried to heal the brokenness of the daughter of My people—Israel—with superficial and shameful words, saying, 'Peace, peace!' when there was no peace at all.

verses.latin: Confoundentur quippe quia abominationem fecerunt quin potius confusione non sunt confusi et erubescere nescierunt quamobrem cadent inter ruentes in tempore visitationis suae corruent dicit Dominus.
verses.english: They will certainly be put to shame because they committed such abominations. But instead of being ashamed, they were not at all confused by their own wickedness and did not know how to blush. Therefore, they shall fall among those who are falling; in the time of their visitation—their punishment—they shall stumble, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus state super vias et videte et interrogate de semitis antiquis quae sit via bona et ambulate in ea et invenietis refrigerium animabus vestris et dixerunt non ambulabimus.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: 'Stand by the ways and look, and ask for the ancient paths. Ask which is the good way, and walk in it, and you will find rest for your souls.' But they—the people—replied, 'We will not walk in it.'

verses.latin: Et constitui super vos speculatores audite vocem tubae et dixerunt non audiemus.
verses.english: And I set watchmen over you, saying, 'Listen to the sound of the trumpet!' But they replied, 'We will not listen!'

verses.latin: Idcirco audite gentes et scito congregatio quanta ego faciam eis.
verses.english: Therefore, hear, O you nations, and know, O assembly of peoples, how great the judgments are that I will bring upon them!

verses.latin: Audi terra ecce ego adducam mala super populum istum fructum cogitationum eorum quia verba mea non audierunt et legem meam prohecerunt.
verses.english: Hear, O earth! Behold, I am bringing calamity upon this people—it is the fruit of their own evil thoughts and plans. For they have not listened to My words, and they have rejected My law.

verses.latin: Ut quid mihi tus de Saba adfertis et calamum suave olentem de terra longinqua holocausta vestra non sunt accepta et victimae vestrae non placuerunt mihi.
verses.english: To what purpose do you bring Me frankincense from Sheba, and sweet-smelling cane from a distant land? Your burnt offerings are not accepted by Me, and your sacrifices have not pleased Me.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus ecce ego dabo in populum istum ruinas et corruent in eis patres et filii simul vicinus et proximus peribunt.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord says: 'Behold, I will set stumbling blocks before this people; upon them, fathers and sons shall stumble together. Neighbor and friend shall perish together.'

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus ecce populus venit de terra aquilonis et gens magna consurget a lateribus terrae.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: 'Behold, a people is coming from the land of the north, and a great nation shall rise up from the farthest reaches of the earth.'

verses.latin: Sagittam et scutum arripiet crudelis est et non miserebitur vox ejus quasi mare sonabit et super equos ascendent paratus quasi vir pugnator adversum te filia Sion.
verses.english: They will grasp bow and shield; they are cruel and will show no mercy. Their voice will roar like the surging sea, and they will ride upon horses, arrayed as a warrior prepared for battle against you, O daughter of Zion—Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Audivimus famam ejus dissolutae sunt manus nostrae angustia adprehendit nos dolores quasi parturientem.
verses.english: We have heard the report of them, and our hands are paralyzed with fear. Anguish has seized us, and pains like those of a woman in childbirth.

verses.latin: Nolite exire in agros et in via ne ambuletis quoniam gladius inimici terror in circuitu.
verses.english: Do not go out into the fields, and do not walk on the roads, for the sword of the enemy brings terror and destruction all around.

verses.latin: Filia populi mei accingere cilicio et conspergere cinere luctum unigeniti fac tibi planctum amarum quia repente veniet vastator super nos.
verses.english: O daughter of My people, gird yourself with sackcloth and sprinkle yourself with ashes! Mourn as for an only son, and make a bitter lament, for suddenly the destroyer will come upon us.

verses.latin: Probatorem dedi te in populo meo robustum et scies et probabis viam eorum.
verses.english: I have made you, Jeremiah, an assayer among My people, a strong one. You are to know and test their way—their conduct.

verses.latin: Omnes isti principes declinantes ambulantes fraudulenter aes et ferrum omnes isti corrupti.
verses.english: All of them are rebellious princes, walking deceitfully. They are like bronze and iron—hardened and thoroughly corrupt.

verses.latin: Defecit sufflatorium in igne consumptum est plumbum frustra conflavit fusor malitia enim eorum non est consumpta.
verses.english: The bellows have blown out, and the lead is consumed by the fire. The refiner has melted the ore in vain, for their wickedness is not consumed or purged away.

verses.latin: Argentum reprobum vocate eos quia Dominus abjecit illos.
verses.english: Call them rejected silver, for the Lord has cast them away as worthless.

verses.latin: Sermo qui factus est ad Jeremiam a Domino, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Jeremiah, saying:

verses.latin: Sta in porta domus Domini, et praedica ibi verbum istud, et dic: Audite verbum Domini, omnis Juda, qui ingredimini per portas istas, ut adoretis Dominum.
verses.english: “Stand at the gate of the Lord’s Temple and proclaim this message there. Say, ‘Listen to the word of the Lord, all of you people of Judah, who come through these gates to worship the Lord!’”

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israel: Bonas facite vias vestras, et studia vestra, et habitabo vobiscum in loco isto.
verses.english: “This is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Amend your ways of living and your daily actions. If you do, I will continue to let you dwell in this place.

verses.latin: Nolite confidere in verbis mendacii, dicentes: Templum Domini, templum Domini, templum Domini est!
verses.english: Do not trust in the lies being told when people say, “This is the Temple of the Lord! The Temple of the Lord! The Temple of the Lord!” —as if the building itself will save you.

verses.latin: Quoniam si bene direxeritis vias vestras, et studia vestra: si feceritis judicium inter virum et proximum ejus,
verses.english: For only if you truly amend your ways of living and your daily actions, and if you truly act justly with one another,

verses.latin: advenae, et pupillo, et viduae non feceritis calumniam, nec sanguinem innocentem effuderitis in loco isto, et post deos alienos non ambulaveritis in malum vobismetipsis:
verses.english: and if you do not oppress the foreigner, the orphan, or the widow, and if you do not shed innocent blood in this place, and if you do not follow after other gods—which would only bring evil upon yourselves—

verses.latin: habitabo vobiscum in loco isto, in terra quam dedi patribus vestris a saeculo usque in saeculum.
verses.english: only then will I allow you to dwell in this place, in the land which I gave to your ancestors to keep forever.

verses.latin: Ecce vos confiditis in sermonibus mendacii, qui non prosunt vobis:
verses.english: But now, look, you are trusting in deceitful words that cannot help you.

verses.latin: furari, occidere, et adulterari, et jurare falso, et libare Baalim, et ire post deos alienos, quos ignoratis:
verses.english: You steal, murder, commit adultery, swear falsely by God’s name, offer sacrifices to the pagan god Baalim, and then go after other foreign gods whom you have no true knowledge of.

verses.latin: et venistis, et stetistis in conspectu meo in domo hac, in qua invocatum est nomen meum, et dixistis: Liberati sumus, eo quod fecerimus abominationes istas.
verses.english: And after all this, you come and stand before Me in this Temple, where My name is invoked, and you say, “We are safe now!” simply because you have committed all these abominations.

verses.latin: Numquid spelunca latronum facta est domus ista, in qua invocatum est nomen meum in oculis vestris? Ego, ego vidi, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Has this Temple, where My name is invoked by you, become nothing more than a hideout for robbers in your eyes? Yes, I Myself have seen this, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Ite ad locum meum in Silo, ubi habitavit nomen meum a principio, et videte quae fecerim ei propter malitiam populi mei Israel.
verses.english: Go now to My former dwelling place in Shiloh, where My name first dwelled among you, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of My people, Israel.

verses.latin: Et nunc, quia fecistis omnia opera haec, dicit Dominus: et locutus sum ad vos diluculo, et non audistis: et vocavi vos, et non respondistis:
verses.english: And now, because you have done all these wicked deeds, declares the Lord—even though I spoke to you persistently, rising early to speak, but you did not listen; and I called to you, but you did not answer—

verses.latin: faciam domui huic, in qua invocatum est nomen meum, et in qua vos habetis fiduciam, et loco quem dedi vobis et patribus vestris, sicut feci Silo.
verses.english: I will do to this Temple, where My name is invoked and in which you place your trust, and to this land that I gave to you and your ancestors, exactly what I did to Shiloh.

verses.latin: Et projiciam vos a facie mea, sicut projeci omnes fratres vestros, omnem semen Ephraim.
verses.english: I will cast you out of My sight, just as I cast out all your kinsmen, all the descendants of Ephraim—the northern kingdom of Israel.

verses.latin: Tu ergo noli orare pro populo hoc, neque assumas pro eis laudem et orationem: et non obsistas mihi, quia non exaudiam te.
verses.english: Therefore, you, Jeremiah, do not pray for these people. Do not offer up any praise or prayer on their behalf. Do not plead with Me, because I will not listen to you.

verses.latin: Numquid non vides quid isti faciant in civitatibus Juda, et in plateis Jerusalem?
verses.english: Do you not see what they are doing in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

verses.latin: Filii colligunt ligna, et patres succendunt ignem, et mulieres conspergunt farinam, ut faciant placentas reginae caeli, et libent diis alienis, et provocent me.
verses.english: The children gather wood, the fathers light the fire, and the women knead the dough to make ritual cakes for the “Queen of Heaven” —a pagan goddess. They pour out drink offerings to other foreign gods, all of which provokes My wrath.

verses.latin: Numquid me provocant? dicit Dominus: nonne semetipsos in confusionem vultus sui?
verses.english: Is it really Me they are provoking? declares the Lord. No, they are only provoking themselves, bringing shame and disgrace upon their own faces.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce furor meus et indignatio mea concipietur super locum istum, et super homines, et super jumenta, et super lignum regionis, et super fruges terrae: et succendetur, et non extinguetur.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: “Behold, My fury and My indignation will be poured out upon this place—upon the people, upon the animals, upon the trees of the region, and upon the produce of the earth. It will ignite, and it will not be quenched.”

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israel: Holocautomata vestra addite victimis vestris, et comedite carnes.
verses.english: This is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Go ahead and add your burnt offerings to your other sacrifices and eat all the meat yourselves—I have no desire for them.

verses.latin: Quia non sum locutus cum patribus vestris, et non praecepi eis in die qua eduxi eos de terra Aegypti de verbo holocausti et victimae:
verses.english: For when I brought your ancestors out of the land of Egypt, I did not speak to them or command them primarily about burnt offerings and other sacrifices.

verses.latin: sed hoc verbum praecepi eis, dicens: Audite vocem meam, et ero vobis in Deum, et vos eritis mihi in populum: et ambulate in omni via quam mandavi vobis, ut bene sit vobis.
verses.english: Instead, this is the command I gave them: ‘Listen to My voice, and I will be your God, and you will be My people. Walk in all the ways that I command you, so that it may go well with you.’

verses.latin: Et non audierunt, nec inclinaverunt aurem suam: sed abierunt in voluntatibus, et in pravitate cordis sui mali: et facti sunt retrorsum, et non in ante.
verses.english: But they did not listen, nor did they pay any attention. Instead, they walked according to their own desires and the stubborn wickedness of their evil hearts. They turned their backs on Me and did not move forward.

verses.latin: A die qua egressi sunt patres vestri de terra Ægypti usque ad diem hanc, misi ad vos omnes servos meos prophetas, per diem et diluculo consurgens mittens.
verses.english: From the day your ancestors departed from the land of Egypt until this very day, I have sent all My servants the prophets to you, tirelessly sending them day after day, rising early to send them.

verses.latin: Et non audierunt me, nec inclinaverunt aurem suam: sed induraverunt cervicem suam, et pessime egerunt super patres suos.
verses.english: Yet they did not listen to Me, nor did they pay any attention. Instead, they stubbornly stiffened their necks and behaved even worse than their ancestors.

verses.latin: Et loqueris ad eos omnia verba haec, et non audient te: et vocabis eos, et non respondebunt tibi.
verses.english: You will speak all these words to them, but they will not listen to you. You will call to them, but they will not answer you.

verses.latin: Et dices ad eos: Haec est gens quae non audivit vocem Domini Dei sui, nec recepit disciplinam: periit fides, et ablata est de ore eorum.
verses.english: Then you are to say to them: ‘This is the nation that has not listened to the voice of the Lord their God, nor has it accepted correction. Faithfulness has perished, and it is no longer found in their mouths.

verses.latin: Tonde capillum tuum, et projice, et sume in excelsis planctum: quia abjecit Dominus et reliquit generationem furoris sui.
verses.english: Cut off your hair and throw it away, and then raise a lamentation on the bare heights—a public mourning ritual. For the Lord has rejected and abandoned the generation that has aroused His wrath.

verses.latin: Quia fecerunt filii Juda malum in oculis meis, dicit Dominus: posuerunt offendicula sua in domo in qua invocatum est nomen meum, ut polluerent eam.
verses.english: “For the people of Judah have done evil in My sight, declares the Lord. They have placed their detestable idols in the Temple where My name is invoked, thereby defiling it.

verses.latin: Et aedificaverunt excelsa Thopheth, quae est in valle filii Ennom, ut comburerent filios suos et filias suas igni: quae non praecepi, neque cogitavi in corde meo.
verses.english: They have also built the high places of Topheth, which is in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and daughters in the fire—a horrifying act which I never commanded, nor did it ever enter My mind.

verses.latin: Idcirco ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et non dicetur ultra Thopheth, et vallis filii Ennom: sed vallis occisionis: et sepelient in Thopheth, eo quod non sit locus.
verses.english: Therefore, behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when this place will no longer be called Topheth, or the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, but instead, ‘The Valley of Slaughter.’ People will be forced to bury the dead in Topheth because there will be no other space left.

verses.latin: Et erit morticinum populi hujus in escam volatilibus caeli, et bestiis terrae, et non erit qui abigat.
verses.english: The dead bodies of these people will become food for the birds of the sky and for the wild animals of the earth, and there will be no one to frighten them away.

verses.latin: Et quiescere faciam de civitatibus Juda, et de plateis Jerusalem, vocem gaudii et vocem laetitiae, vocem sponsi et vocem sponsae: terra enim deserta erit.
verses.english: I will silence the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of the bridegroom and the bride, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, for the entire land will be utterly devastated and uninhabited.”

verses.latin: In tempore illo, dicit Dominus, ejicient ossa regum Juda, et ossa principum ejus, et ossa sacerdotum, et ossa prophetarum, et ossa habitantium Jerusalem, de sepulchris suis:
verses.english: “At that time,” the Lord declares, “they will dig up the bones of the kings of Judah, the bones of its princes, the bones of the priests, the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem from their graves.

verses.latin: et expandent ea ad solem, et ad lunam, et ad omnem militiam cæli, quæ dilexerunt, et quibus servierunt, et post quæ ambulaverunt, et quæ quæsierunt, et adoraverunt: non colligentur, et non sepelientur, sed in sterquilinium super faciem terræ erunt, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: They will then spread those bones out before the sun, the moon, and all the celestial bodies—which they loved, which they served, which they followed, which they sought out, and which they worshipped. The bones will not be gathered or buried; instead, they will lie like refuse on the surface of the earth,” declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Et eligent magis mortem quam vitam, omnes reliqui ex stirpe hac pessima, qui residui fuerint in cunctis locis ad quæ ejeci eos, dicit Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: And all the survivors from this evil lineage, those who remain in all the places where I have driven them, will prefer death over life,” declares the Lord of Armies.

verses.latin: Et dices ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus: Numquid qui cadit non resurget? et qui aversus est non revertetur?
verses.english: Then you are to say to them: “This is what the Lord says: 'When someone falls, do they not get up? When someone turns away, do they not come back?'

verses.latin: Quare ergo aversus est populus iste Jerusalem aversione contentiosa? apprehendunt mendacium, et nolunt reverti.
verses.english: Why then has this people of Jerusalem turned away with such stubborn defiance? They cling to lies and refuse to return to Me.

verses.latin: Attendi, et audivi: nemo est qui loquatur quod bonum est, nemo qui pœnitentiam agat super scelere suo, dicens: Quid feci? Omnes conversi sunt ad cursum suum, quasi equus impetu vadens ad prælium.
verses.english: I have listened and heard: no one speaks what is good, no one repents of their wickedness, saying, 'What have I done?' Everyone rushes headlong into their chosen path, like a horse charging wildly into battle.

verses.latin: Milvus in cælo cognovit tempus suum: turtur, et hirundo, et ciconia, custodierunt tempus adventus sui: populus autem meus non cognovit judicium Domini.
verses.english: Even the kite in the sky knows its appointed seasons; the turtle-dove, the swallow, and the stork observe the time of their migration. But My people do not know the judgment of the Lord.

verses.latin: Quomodo dicitis: Sapientes nos sumus, et lex Domini nobiscum est? Vere mendacium operata est manus scribarum, mentita est.
verses.english: How can you say, 'We are wise, and the Law of the Lord is with us'? Indeed, the lying pen of the scribes has turned it into a falsehood. Their interpretation is a lie.

verses.latin: Confusi sunt sapientes, et territi, et circumventi: verbum enim Domini projecerunt, et sapientia nulla est in eis.
verses.english: The wise are put to shame; they are terrified and trapped. For they have rejected the word of the Lord, so what wisdom is left in them?

verses.latin: Idcirco dabo mulieres eorum exteris, agros eorum hæredibus: quia a minimo usque ad maximum, omnes avaritiæ student: a propheta usque ad sacerdotem, cuncti faciunt dolum.
verses.english: Therefore, I will give their wives to strangers and their fields to new inheritors. For from the least of them to the greatest, all are greedy for dishonest gain; from prophet to priest, everyone practices deceit.

verses.latin: Et sanabant contritionem filiæ populi mei cum ignominia, dicentes: Pax, pax: et non erat pax.
verses.english: They treat the brokenness of My people superficially, saying, 'Peace, peace,' when there is no true peace.

verses.latin: Confusi sunt, quia abominationem fecerunt: immo confusione non sunt confusi, et erubescere nescierunt. Idcirco cadent inter ruentes, in tempore visitationis suæ corruent, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: They ought to be ashamed because they have committed such abominations. Yet, they are not at all ashamed; they do not even know how to blush. Therefore, they will fall among those who are falling; at the time of their punishment, they will collapse,” declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Congregans congregabo eos, dicit Dominus. Non est uva in vitibus, et non est ficus in ficu, et folium cecidit: et quæ dedi eis transierunt ab eis.
verses.english: “I will surely gather them for destruction,” declares the Lord. “There are no grapes on the vine, and no figs on the fig tree, and even the leaf has withered. What I had given them has passed away from them.”

verses.latin: Quare sedemus? convenite, et ingrediamur civitates munitas, et sileamus ibi: quia Dominus Deus noster silere nos fecit, et potum dedit nobis aquam fellis: quia peccavimus Domino.
verses.english: “Why do we sit here idly? Gather together, and let us enter the fortified cities and be silent there, for the Lord our God has made us silent and given us bitter, poisonous water to drink, because we have sinned against the Lord.

verses.latin: Exspectavimus pacem, et non erat bonum: tempus medelæ, et ecce turbatio.
verses.english: We waited for peace, but no good came; for a time of healing, but behold, there was only turmoil.

verses.latin: A Dan auditus est fremitus equorum ejus, a voce hinnituum fortium ejus commota est omnis terra: et venerunt, et devoraverunt terram, et plenitudinem ejus: urbem, et habitatores ejus.
verses.english: The snorting of their horses is heard from Dan; at the sound of the neighing of their mighty steeds, the whole land trembles. They have come and devoured the land and everything in it—the city and its inhabitants.

verses.latin: Ecce enim ego mittam vobis serpentes regulos, quibus non est incantator: et mordebunt vos, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: For behold, I am sending among you venomous serpents—vipers whose bites cannot be charmed away. And they will bite you,” declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Dolor meus super dolorem, super cor meum mœrens.
verses.english: My sorrow is beyond sorrow; my heart is mournful within me.

verses.latin: Ecce vox clamoris filiæ populi mei de terra longinqua: Numquid Dominus non est in Sion? aut rex ejus non est in ea? Quare ergo me provocaverunt in iracundiam in sculptilibus suis, et in vanitatibus alienis?
verses.english: Listen! The cry of my people is heard from a distant land: 'Is the Lord not in Zion? Is her King not there?' 'Why then have they provoked Me to anger with their carved idols and with their worthless foreign gods?'

verses.latin: Transiit messis, finita est æstas: et nos salvi facti non sumus.
verses.english: The harvest is over, the summer has ended, and we are not saved.

verses.latin: Super contritione filiæ populi mei contritus sum, et contristatus, obtenebravit me dolor.
verses.english: For the brokenness of my people, I am crushed; I am grieved, and despair has overwhelmed me.

verses.latin: Numquid resina non est in Galaad? aut medicus non est ibi? Quare igitur non est obducta cicatrix filiæ populi mei?
verses.english: Is there no balm in Gilead? Is there no physician there? Why then has the wound of my people not been healed?

verses.latin: Quis dabit capiti meo aquam, et oculis meis fontem lacrimarum? et plorabo die ac nocte interfectos filiæ populi mei.
verses.english: If only my head were a fountain of water, and my eyes an endless spring of tears! Then I could cry day and night for all the people of my nation who have been violently killed.

verses.latin: Quis dabit me in solitudine diversorium viatorum, et derelinquam populum meum, et recedam ab eis? quia omnes adulteri sunt, cœtus prævaricatorum.
verses.english: Oh, if only I had a traveler's lodging place far away in the desert! Then I would abandon my own people and run away from them. For they are all spiritually unfaithful to God, acting like adulterers, and their whole assembly is full of those who rebel against God's laws.

verses.latin: Et extenderunt linguam suam quasi arcum mendacii, et non veritatis: confortati sunt in terra, quia de malo ad malum egressi sunt, et me non cognoverunt, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: They make their tongues like a taut bow, ready to shoot out lies instead of truth. They have grown strong in their evil ways in the land, constantly progressing from one sin to another. 'They have not truly known Me,' says the Lord.

verses.latin: Unusquisque a proximo suo se custodiat, et in omni fratre suo non habeat fiduciam: quia omnis frater supplantans supplantabit, et omnis amicus fraudulenter incedet.
verses.english: Let everyone be on guard against their neighbor, and do not trust any brother. For every brother will try to trip you up with deceit, and every friend will walk about spreading slanders and lies.

verses.latin: Et vir fratrem suum deridebit, et veritatem non loquentur: docuerunt enim linguam suam loqui mendacium: impie egerunt, nec conversi sunt ut agerent pœnitentiam.
verses.english: People will mock their own brother, and they will refuse to speak the truth. For they have specifically trained their tongues to speak only lies. They have behaved wickedly, and they refuse to turn away from their sins and repent.

verses.latin: Habitaculum tuum in medio dolorum est: in dolo et non cognoverunt me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Your dwelling place is entirely surrounded by treachery. They continue to act in deceit, and because of this, they have not truly known Me,' says the Lord.

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Ecce ego conflabo, et probabo eos: quid enim aliud faciam a facie filiæ populi mei?
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord of heavenly armies says this: 'Behold, I will refine them through suffering, and I will test their hearts like metal. For what else can I possibly do with the behavior of My people?'

verses.latin: Sagitta vulnerans lingua eorum, dolum locuta est: ore suo pacem cum amico suo loquitur, et occulte ponit ei insidias.
verses.english: Their tongue is a deadly, wounding arrow, always speaking deceit. With their mouth, they speak words of peace to their neighbor, but secretly, they set traps and snares for them.

verses.latin: Super his ergo numquid non visitabo, dicit Dominus: aut super gentem hujuscemodi non ulciscetur anima mea?
verses.english: Because of all these sins, 'Shall I not visit them with My judgment?' says the Lord. 'And for a nation behaving in this manner, shall My very soul not take vengeance?'

verses.latin: Super montes assumam planctum et luctum, et super pulchra deserti lamentationem: quoniam exusti sunt, eo quod non sit vir pertransiens: non audierunt vocem possidentis, a volucre cæli usque ad pecora transierunt, et abierunt.
verses.english: I will take up a lament and mourning over the mountains, and a dirge over the beautiful pastures of the wilderness. For they have been so utterly burned and laid waste that no one can even pass through them.
