No sound of human or animal is heard, for even the birds of the sky and the cattle have fled away and are gone.

verses.latin: Et ponam Jerusalem in acervos lapidum, cubilia draconum: et civitates Juda dabo in solitudinem, eo quod non sit habitator.
verses.english: I will turn Jerusalem into heaps of rubble, a den for wild jackals. And I will make the cities of Judah utterly desolate, with no one left to live in them.

verses.latin: Quis est vir sapiens qui intelligat hoc, et cui loquatur os Domini, ut annunciet istud? quare periit terra, deserta est quasi solitudo, eo quod non sit qui pertranseat?
verses.english: Who is truly wise enough to understand this? To whom has the Lord spoken clearly enough to explain it? Why has the land perished? Why has it become desolate like a wilderness, with no one left to even pass through it?

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus: Quia dereliquerunt legem meam, quam dedi eis: et non audierunt vocem meam, et non ambulaverunt in ea.
verses.english: And the Lord Himself answered, saying: 'This has happened because they abandoned My law, which I gave to them. They did not listen to My voice, and they refused to live according to My commands.'

verses.latin: Et abierunt post pravitatem cordis sui, et post Baalim, quod docuerant eos patres eorum.
verses.english: Instead, they followed the stubborn wickedness of their own hearts and pursued the Baals—the false gods that their fathers had taught them to worship.

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Ecce ego cibabo populum istum absinthio, et potum dabo eis aquam fellis.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord of heavenly armies, the God of Israel, says this: 'Behold, I will feed this people with a bitter herb, like wormwood, and I will give them poisonous water to drink, like gall.'

verses.latin: Et dispergam illos in gentibus quas ignoraverunt ipsi et patres eorum: et mittam post eos gladium, donec consumantur.
verses.english: I will scatter them among nations that neither they nor their ancestors have ever known. And I will send the sword of war after them, until they are completely consumed and destroyed.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Attendite, et vocate lamentatrices, et veniant: et ad eas quæ sapientes sunt, mittite, et properent.
verses.english: The Lord of heavenly armies says this: 'Pay close attention! Call for the professional mourning women to come; send for those who are skilled in lamentation, and tell them to hurry!'

verses.latin: Festinent, et assumant super nos lamentum: percutiant oculi nostri lacrimas, et palpebræ nostræ effundant aquas.
verses.english: Let them hurry and begin a lament over us, so that our eyes may stream with tears, and our eyelids pour out floods of water.

verses.latin: Quia vox lamentationis audita est de Sion: Quomodo vastati sumus, et confusi vehementer? quia dereliquimus terram, quoniam dejecta sunt habitacula nostra.
verses.english: For a voice of lamentation is heard coming from Zion: 'How utterly destroyed we are! How profoundly we are shamed! For we have been forced to abandon our land, and our homes have been torn down and ruined!'

verses.latin: Audite ergo, mulieres, verbum Domini: et assumant aures vestræ sermonem oris ejus: et docete filias vestras lamentum, et unaquæque proximam suam planctum.
verses.english: Therefore, women, listen to the word of the Lord! Let your ears receive the solemn words that come from His mouth. Teach your daughters how to lament, and let each woman teach her neighbor a mournful dirge.

verses.latin: Quia ascendit mors per fenestras nostras, ingressa est domos nostras, interficere parvulos de foris, juvenes de plateis.
verses.english: For death has climbed through our windows; it has entered our very homes. It has come to kill the little children playing outside and the young men gathered in the public squares.

verses.latin: Loquere: Hæc dicit Dominus: Et cadet morticinum hominis quasi stercus super faciem regionis, et quasi manipulus post terga metentis, et non est qui colligat.
verses.english: Speak this message: 'Thus says the Lord: The corpses of men will fall like dung upon the surface of the land, and they will be like grain bundles left behind the reaper, with no one left to gather them for burial.'

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Non glorietur sapiens in sapientia sua, et non glorietur fortis in fortitudine sua, et non glorietur dives in divitiis suis.
verses.english: The Lord says this: 'Let no wise person boast in their own wisdom, and let no strong person boast in their own strength, and let no rich person boast in their own riches.'

verses.latin: Sed in hoc glorietur qui gloriatur, scire et nosse me, quia ego sum Dominus qui facio misericordiam, et judicium, et justitiam in terra: hæc enim placent mihi, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: But if anyone desires to boast, let them boast in this: that they truly know and understand Me—that I am the Lord who demonstrates steadfast mercy, unwavering justice, and righteousness throughout the earth. For these are the things that please Me,' says the Lord.

verses.latin: Ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et visitabo super omnem qui circumcisum habet præputium.
verses.english: 'Behold, the days are coming,' says the Lord, 'when I will bring judgment upon everyone who is circumcised physically but still holds an uncircumcised heart—meaning, they are outwardly religious but inwardly rebellious.'

verses.latin: Super Ægyptum, et super Juda, et super Edom, et super filios Ammon, et super Moab, et super omnes qui attonsi sunt in comam, qui habitant in deserto: quia omnes gentes habent præputium, omnis autem domus Israël incircumcisi sunt corde.
verses.english: This judgment will come upon Egypt, and upon Judah, and upon Edom, and upon the Ammonites, and upon Moab, and upon all those desert dwellers who shave the hair at the corners of their temples as a pagan practice. For while all these other nations are physically uncircumcised, the entire house of Israel is, in a more profound way, uncircumcised in their heart, showing no true devotion to God.

verses.latin: Audite verbum Domini, quod locutus est ad vos, domus Israel:
verses.english: Pay attention to the message of the Lord that He has spoken to you, O house of Israel.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Juxta vias gentium nolite discere, et a signis caeli nolite metuere, quae timent gentes:
verses.english: The Lord says this: Do not learn to live according to the ways of the gentile nations, and do not be afraid of the signs in the sky, which those pagan nations fear.

verses.latin: Quia leges populorum vanae sunt: lignum de saltu praecidit opus manus fabri in ascia.
verses.english: Because the customs of other peoples are empty and meaningless. It is a tree cut from the forest, an object crafted by the hands of a carpenter with an axe.

verses.latin: Pulchro et argento ornávit illud: et clavis et malleis firmávit, ut non moveatur.
verses.english: They make it beautiful with silver and gold. Then they fasten it with nails and hammers so that it will not fall over or move.

verses.latin: Tamquam stans in pomario cocomis, sic sunt, et non loquuntur: portanda sunt et non incedunt: nolite ergo timere ea, quia mala non possunt facere, neque bonum.
verses.english: They are like a scarecrow standing in a cucumber field; they cannot speak. They must be carried because they cannot walk on their own. Therefore, do not fear them, because they cannot do any evil, nor can they do any good.

verses.latin: Non est similis tui, Domine: magnus es tu, et magnum nomen tuum in fortitudine.
verses.english: There is no one like you, O Lord. You are truly great, and your name is mighty in strength.

verses.latin: Quis non timebit te, rex gentium? te enim decet honor: inter cunctos sapientes gentium, et in omnibus regnis eorum, nullus est similis tui.
verses.english: Who would not fear you, King of all nations? Indeed, honor is properly due to you. Among all the wise people of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, there is no one who is like you.

verses.latin: Pariter insipientes et stulti probabuntur: doctrina vanitatis eorum lignum est.
verses.english: All of them will equally prove to be foolish and stupid. The teaching of their worthless idols is nothing more than wood.

verses.latin: Argentum involutum et de Tharsis affertur, et aurum de Ophaz: opus fabri et manus aurificis: hyacinthus et purpura indumentum eorum: opus artificum universa haec.
verses.english: Beaten silver is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Ophir. It is the work of a craftsman and the hands of a goldsmith. Blue and purple cloth form their clothing. All these idols are simply the work of human artisans.

verses.latin: Dominus autem Deus verus est, ipse Deus vivens, et rex sempiternus: ab indignatione ejus commovetur terra, et non sustinent gentes comminationem ejus.
verses.english: But the Lord is the true God. He is the living God, and the eternal King. The earth trembles at His indignation, and the nations cannot endure His threats.

verses.latin: Sic ergo dicetis eis: Dii qui caelum et terram non fecerunt, pereant de terra, et de his quae sub caelo sunt.
verses.english: Therefore, you shall say to them: "The gods that did not make the universe and the earth will utterly perish from the earth, and from all that is under the universe."

verses.latin: Ipse fecit terram in fortitudine sua, praeparavit orbem in sapientia sua, et prudentia sua extendit caelos.
verses.english: He Himself made the earth by His own power. He established the world by His own wisdom, and by His own understanding, He stretched out the celestial bodies of the universe.

verses.latin: Ad vocem suam dat multitudinem aquarum in caelo, et elevat nubes ab extremo terrae: fulgura in pluviarum flexum fecit, et producit ventum de thesauris suis.
verses.english: At the sound of His voice, He brings abundant waters into the sky, and He raises clouds from the ends of the earth. He makes lightning flash during the turns of the rain, and He brings forth the wind from His storehouses.

verses.latin: Stultus factus est omnis homo a scientia, confusus est omnis artifex in sculptili, quoniam mendax est conflatio ejus, nec est spiritus in eis.
verses.english: Every human being has become foolish by their own supposed knowledge. Every artisan is put to shame by his carved idol, because his molten image is a lie, and there is no spirit of life within them.

verses.latin: Vana sunt, et opus risu dignum: in tempore visitationis suae peribunt.
verses.english: They are worthless, and their work is worthy of ridicule. In the time of their judgment, they will utterly perish.

verses.latin: Non sicut haec, pars Jacob, quia qui formavit omnia ipse est: et Israel virga haereditatis ejus: Dominus exercituum nomen illi.
verses.english: The portion of Jacob is not like these idols. For He who formed all things is the true God, and Israel is the tribe of His inheritance. The Lord of Hosts is His name.

verses.latin: Colligere de terra sarcinam tuam, quae habitas in obsidione.
verses.english: Gather up your goods from the land, you who live under siege.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego longe projiciam habitatores terrae in hac vice, et tribulabo eos ita ut inveniantur.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord says: "Behold, this time I will hurl out the inhabitants of the land far away, and I will distress them so severely that their wickedness will be revealed."

verses.latin: Vae mihi super contritione mea, ingravescit plaga mea: et ego dixi: Vere hac aegritudine attrita sum.
verses.english: Woe is me because of my brokenness. My wound is becoming severe. And I said, "Truly, I am crushed by this sickness."

verses.latin: Tabernaculum meum vastatum est, omnes funiculi mei dirupti sunt: filii mei exierunt a me, et non subsistunt: non est qui extendat ultra tentorium meum, et erigat pelles meas.
verses.english: My tent has been destroyed. All my ropes are broken. My children have gone out from me, and they are no more. There is no one left to spread out my tent or set up my tent coverings.

verses.latin: Quia stulte egerunt pastores, et Dominum non quaesierunt: propterea non intellexerunt, et omnis grex eorum dispersus est.
verses.english: Because the shepherds have acted foolishly. They have not sought the Lord. Therefore, they have not acted wisely, and all their flock is scattered.

verses.latin: Vox auditionis ecce venit, et commotio magna de terra aquilonis, ut ponat civitates Juda solitudinem, et cubile draconum.
verses.english: Listen! A sound of a rumor is coming. A great commotion approaches from the land of the north. Its purpose is to make the cities of Judah a desolate wilderness and a lair for jackals.

verses.latin: Scio, Domine, quia non est hominis via ejus: nec viri est ut ambulet, et dirigat gressus suos.
verses.english: I know, O Lord, that a human being's way is not his own path to choose. Nor is it for a man to walk and direct his own steps.

verses.latin: Corripe me, Domine, verumtamen in judicio, et non in furore tuo, ne forte ad nihilum redigas me.
verses.english: Correct me, O Lord, but do so with just judgment. Do not correct me in your furious anger, lest you reduce me to nothing.

verses.latin: Effunde iram tuam super gentes quae ignoraverunt te, et super provincias quae nomen tuum non invocaverunt: quia comederunt Jacob, et devoraverunt eum, et consumpserunt, et depopulati sunt decorem ejus.
verses.english: Pour out your wrath upon the nations that have not known you, and upon the regions that have not called upon your name. For they have consumed Jacob, and they have devoured and utterly destroyed him. They have laid waste to his homeland and its beauty.

verses.latin: Verbum quod factum est ad Jeremiam a Domino, dicens:
verses.english: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the Lord.

verses.latin: Audite verba pacti hujus, et loquimini ad viros Juda, et ad habitatores Jerusalem:
verses.english: "Listen to the terms of this covenant," the Lord commanded, "and speak them to the men of Judah and to all who live in Jerusalem."

verses.latin: et dices ad eos: Haec dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Maledictus vir qui non audierit verba pacti hujus,
verses.english: Then you must tell them: "This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: 'Cursed is anyone who does not listen to the terms of this covenant, and does not obey them.'"

verses.latin: quae praecepi patribus vestris in die qua eduxi eos de terra Aegypti, de fornace ferrea, dicens: Audite vocem meam, et facite omnia quae praecipio vobis: et eritis mihi in populum, et ego ero vobis in Deum:
verses.english: "These are the terms I commanded your fathers when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of that blazing iron furnace of slavery. I told them: 'Listen to My voice, and do everything I command you. If you do, you will be My people, and I will be your God.'"

verses.latin: ut suscitem juramentum quod juravi patribus vestris, ut darem eis terram fluentem lacte et melle, sicut est dies haec. Et respondi, et dixi: Amen, Domine.
verses.english: "I made this covenant so that I would keep the oath I swore to your fathers—that I would give them a land flowing with milk and honey, just as it is this very day." Then I, Jeremiah, answered, saying, "Amen, O Lord!"

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Clama omnia verba haec in civitatibus Juda, et foris Jerusalem, dicens: Audite verba pacti hujus, et facite illa.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me: "Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the open places of Jerusalem, saying: 'Listen to the words of this covenant, and obey them.'"

verses.latin: Quia contestans contestatus sum patres vestros, in die qua eduxi eos de terra Aegypti, usque ad diem hanc: mane consurgens contestatus sum, et dixi: Audite vocem meam.
verses.english: "For I solemnly warned your fathers from the day I brought them out of the land of Egypt until this very day. I rose early and repeatedly warned them, saying: 'Listen to My voice!'"

verses.latin: Et non audierunt, nec inclinaverunt aurem suam: sed abierunt unusquisque in pravitate cordis sui mali: et induxi super eos omnia verba pacti hujus, quae praecepi ut facerent, et non fecerunt.
verses.english: "But they would not listen, nor would they pay attention. Instead, each one stubbornly followed the evil desires of their own heart. So, I brought upon them all the curses of this covenant—the very words I commanded them to obey, but which they refused to do."

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Inventa est conspiratio in viris Juda, et in habitatoribus Jerusalem.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me: "A conspiracy has been discovered among the men of Judah and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem."

verses.latin: Reversi sunt ad iniquitates patrum suorum priorum, qui noluerunt audire verba mea: et hi abierunt post deos alienos ut servirent eis: irritum fecerunt domus Israel et domus Juda pactum meum, quod pepigi cum patribus eorum.
verses.english: "They have turned back to the wickedness of their ancestors, who refused to listen to My words. And these people have gone after foreign gods to serve them. The people of Israel and the people of Judah have broken My covenant, the one I made with their fathers."

verses.latin: Quam ob rem haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego inducam super eos mala, de quibus non poterunt effugere: et clamabunt ad me, et non exaudiam eos.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord says: "Behold, I am bringing upon them such evils and calamities that they will not be able to escape. When they cry out to Me, I will not listen to them."

verses.latin: Et ibunt civitates Juda, et habitatores Jerusalem, et clamabunt ad deos ad quos libant, et qui non salvabunt eos in tempore afflictionis eorum.
verses.english: "Then the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the false gods to whom they offer their libations, but those gods will not be able to save them in their time of affliction."

verses.latin: Secundum numerum enim civitatum tuarum, facti sunt dii tui, Juda: et secundum numerum viarum Jerusalem, posuisti aras confusionis, aras ut sacrificares Baalim.
verses.english: "For you, O Judah, have as many gods as you have cities! And according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem, you have set up altars of shame, altars to offer sacrifices to the Baals."

verses.latin: Tu ergo noli orare pro populo hoc, neque assumas pro eis laudam et orationem: quia non exaudiam in tempore clamoris eorum ad me, in tempore afflictionis eorum.
verses.english: "Therefore, Jeremiah, do not pray for this people, nor offer up any praise or prayer on their behalf. For I will not listen when they cry out to Me in their time of affliction."

verses.latin: Quid est quod dilecta mea in domo mea fecit scelera multa? Numquid carnes sanctae auferent a te malitias tuas, an in his poteris flectere?
verses.english: "Why has My beloved nation committed so many wicked deeds right in My own house, the Temple? Will the holy sacrifices you offer cleanse you of your evil deeds? Can these rituals truly turn you away from your sins?"

verses.latin: Oliva frondosa, speciosa, fructifera, pulchra, vocavit Dominus nomen tuum: ad vocem praeclarae grandinis, succendit igne lignum ejus, et combusta sunt rami ejus.
verses.english: "The Lord once called you a leafy olive tree, beautiful, fruitful, and pleasing. But now, at the sound of a great, roaring storm, He has set its wood on fire, and its branches are burned."

verses.latin: Et Dominus exercituum, qui plantavit te, locutus est super te malum, pro malis domus Israel, et domus Juda, quae fecerunt sibi, ut me ad iracundiam provocarent, sacrificantes Baalim.
verses.english: "And the Lord of hosts, who first planted you like an olive tree, has declared that disaster will come upon you because of the evils that the people of Israel and the people of Judah brought upon themselves. They provoked Me to wrath by offering sacrifices to the Baals."

verses.latin: Tu autem, Domine, ostendisti mihi, et cognovi: tunc ostendisti mihi studia eorum.
verses.english: But You, O Lord, have shown me what is happening, and I have come to know it. You then revealed to me their wicked schemes.

verses.latin: Et ego quasi agnus mansuetus, qui portatur ad victimam: et non cognovi quia cogitaverunt super me consilia, dicentes: Mittamus lignum in panem ejus, et eradamus eum de terra viventium, et nomen ejus non memorietur amplius.
verses.english: I was like a gentle lamb led to the slaughter, completely unaware that they had devised plots against me. They were saying: "Let us put wood into his bread"—meaning, "Let us destroy him by cutting off his sustenance and strength"—"and let us cut him off from the land of the living, so that his name will no longer be remembered."

verses.latin: Tu autem, Domine exercituum, qui judicas juste, et probas renes et corda, videam ultionem tuam ex illis: tibi enim revelavi causam meam.
verses.english: But You, O Lord of hosts, who judge justly and examine the innermost thoughts and hearts of all, let me see Your vengeance upon them. For I have laid my entire case before You.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus ad viros Anathoth, qui quaerunt animam meam, et dicunt: Non prophetabis in nomine Domini, et non morieris in manibus nostris.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord says concerning the men of Anathoth who seek your very life and say, "You must not prophesy in the name of the Lord, or you will die by our hands."

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus exercituum: Ecce ego visitabo super eos: juvenes morientur in gladio, et filii eorum et filiae eorum morientur in fame.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord of hosts says: "Behold, I will punish them! Their young men will die by the sword, and their sons and their daughters will die by famine."

verses.latin: Et reliquiae non erunt ex eis: inducam enim malum super viros Anathoth, annum visitationis eorum.
verses.english: "And there will be no remnant of them left alive. For I will bring calamity upon the men of Anathoth in the very year of their reckoning and punishment."

verses.latin: Justus es, Domine, si disputem tecum: verumtamen justo loquar ad te: Quare via impiorum prosperatur? bene est omnibus qui prævaricantur et inique agunt?
verses.english: You are righteous, Lord, if I were to contend with You. Yet, I will speak with You concerning justice. Why does the path of the wicked prosper? Why is it well for all who deal treacherously and act wickedly?

verses.latin: Plantasti eos, et radicem fixerunt: proficiunt et faciunt fructum: prope es tu ori eorum, et longe a renibus eorum.
verses.english: You planted them, and they have taken root; they grow and bear fruit. You are near to their mouths, but You are far from their inner hearts and consciences.

verses.latin: Et tu, Domine, nosti me, vidisti me, et probasti cor meum ad te: collige eos quasi gregem ad victimam, et sanctifica eos in diem occisionis.
verses.english: But You, Lord, know me; You have seen me and tested my heart concerning You. Gather them together like sheep ready for sacrifice, and set them apart for the day of their slaughter and destruction.

verses.latin: Usquequo lugebit terra, et herba omnis regionis siccabitur propter malitiam habitantium in ea? perierunt jumenta et volucres, quoniam dixerunt: Non videbit novissima nostra.
verses.english: How long will the earth mourn, and the grass of every field wither, because of the wickedness of its inhabitants? The beasts and the birds have perished, because the wicked have said, 'God will not see what becomes of us in the end.'

verses.latin: Si cum peditibus currens laborasti, quomodo contendere poteris cum equis? et cum in terra pacis securus fueris, quid facies in superbia Jordanis?
verses.english: If you have struggled running with footmen, how then will you be able to contend with horses? And if you have felt secure in a land of peace, what will you do when the Jordan overflows its banks?

verses.latin: Nam et fratres tui, et domus patris tui, etiam ipsi pugnaverunt adversum te, et ipsi clamaverunt post te plena voce: ne credas eis, cum locuti fuerint tibi bona.
verses.english: For even your brothers and your father’s household, even they have fought against you, and they have cried out loudly after you. Do not believe them, even when they speak pleasant words to you.

verses.latin: Reliqui domum meam, dimisi hæreditatem meam: dedi dilectam animam meam in manu inimicorum ejus.
verses.english: I have forsaken My house, My temple, and My people. I have abandoned My heritage, Israel. I have given My dearly beloved people into the hand of their enemies.

verses.latin: Facta est mihi hæreditas mea quasi leo in silva: dedit contra me vocem, propter hoc odivi eam.
verses.english: My heritage has become to Me like a roaring lion in the forest. She has raised her voice against Me, so I have treated her as an enemy.

verses.latin: Numquid avis discolor hæreditas mea mihi? An avis tincta circumdederunt me? Venite, congregamini, omnes bestiæ terræ, properate ad devorandum.
verses.english: Is My heritage to Me like a bird of various colors? Or have dyed birds—foreign invaders—surrounded Me? Come, gather together, all you beasts of the field, hurry to devour her!

verses.latin: Pastores multi demoliti sunt vineam meam, conculcaverunt partem meam, dederunt portionem meam desiderabilem in desertum solitudinis.
verses.english: Many shepherds—foreign invaders and their rulers—have destroyed My vineyard. They have trampled My treasured portion of land. They have turned My desirable portion into a desolate wilderness.

verses.latin: Posuerunt eam in dissipationem: luxit super me omnis terra, quia nullus est qui recogitet.
verses.english: They have laid it utterly waste. The entire land mourns before Me, because there is no one who takes these things to heart or repents.

verses.latin: Super omnes calles deserti venerunt vastatores: quia gladius Domini devorabit ab extremo terræ usque ad extremum ejus, non est pax omni carni.
verses.english: Over all the barren pathways, the destroyers have come. For the sword of the Lord will devour from one end of the land to the other. There is no peace for anyone.

verses.latin: Seminaverunt triticum, et spinas messuerunt: hereditabunt laborem, nec proderit eis: confundemini a fructu vestro, propter iram furoris Domini.
verses.english: They have sown wheat, but they have reaped thorns. They will inherit only toil, and it will not profit them. You will be put to shame by your harvest, because of the burning anger of the Lord.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus adversum omnes vicinos meos pessimos, qui tangunt hereditatem meam, quam distribui populo meo Israel: Ecce ego evellam eos de terra sua, et radices Juda evellam de medio eorum.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord concerning all My evil neighbors who have touched My inheritance—the land which I distributed to My people Israel: Behold, I will uproot them from their own land. And I will pull out the roots of Judah from the midst of those nations.

verses.latin: Et erit cum evellam eos, convertar et miserebor eorum, et reducam eos, virum ad hereditatem suam, et unumquemque ad terram suam.
verses.english: And it shall be, after I have uprooted them, I will turn and have compassion on them. I will bring them back, each person to his own inheritance, and each one to his own land.

verses.latin: Et erit, si eruditi didicerint vias populi mei, ut jurent in nomine meo: Vivit Dominus, sicut docuerunt populum meum jurare in Baal, ædificabuntur in medio populi mei.
verses.english: And it shall be, if they diligently learn the ways of My people, so that they swear by My Name, saying, 'As the Lord lives'—just as they taught My people to swear by Baal—then they will be built up in the midst of My people.

verses.latin: Quod si non audierint, evellam gentem illam evulsione et perditione, ait Dominus.
verses.english: But if they do not listen and obey, then I will utterly uproot and destroy that nation, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus ad me: Vade, et acquire tibi lumbare lineum, et pones illud super lumbos tuos: et in aquam non mittes illud.
verses.english: The Lord told me this: "Go get yourself a linen loincloth, and put it on your body around your waist. Don't ever wash it in water."

verses.latin: Et acquisivi lumbare juxta verbum Domini, et posui super lumbos meos.
verses.english: So I got the loincloth, just as the Lord had commanded. And I put it on.

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad me secundo, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to me again, a second time, saying this:

verses.latin: Sume lumbare, quod acquisisti, quod est super lumbos tuos, et surgens vade ad Euphraten, et absconde illud ibi in foramine petrae.
verses.english: "Take the loincloth you just got, the one you are wearing. Go to the Euphrates River, and hide it there in a crack in the rock."

verses.latin: Et abii, et abscondi illud juxta verbum Domini, sicut praeceperat mihi Dominus.
verses.english: So I went and hid it, just as the Lord had commanded me.

verses.latin: Et factum est post dies plurimos, dixit Dominus ad me: Surge, vade ad Euphraten, et tolle inde lumbare, quod praecepi tibi ut absconderes illic.
verses.english: After many days passed, the Lord told me: "Go now. Go back to the Euphrates River and get the loincloth, the one I told you to hide there."

verses.latin: Et abii ad Euphraten, et fodi, et tuli lumbare de loco ubi absconderam illud: et ecce computruerat lumbare, ita ut nullo usui aptum esset.
verses.english: So I went to the Euphrates. I dug it up and took the loincloth from where I had hidden it. But behold, the loincloth was completely rotted and ruined. It was useless.

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad me dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to me again, saying:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Sic putrescere faciam superbiam Juda, et superbiam Jerusalem multam.
verses.english: "The Lord says this: Just like this loincloth, I will cause the pride of Judah to rot away. And I will cause the great pride of Jerusalem to rot away."

verses.latin: Populum hoc pessimum, qui nolunt audire verba mea, et ambulant in pravitate cordis sui, et abierunt post deos alienos ut servirent eis, et adorarent illos: et erunt sicut lumbare hoc, quod nullo usui aptum est.
verses.english: "This wicked people, who refuse to listen to My words, and who follow the stubbornness of their own hearts, who have gone after other gods to serve them and worship them—they will become like this loincloth: good for nothing."

verses.latin: Sicut enim adhæret lumbare ad lumbos viri, sic agglutinavi mihi omnem domum Israël, et omnem domum Juda, dicit Dominus: ut essent mihi in populum, et in nomen, et in laudem, et in gloriam: et non audierunt.
verses.english: "Just as a loincloth clings closely to a man's body, so I had bound to Myself all the house of Israel and all the house of Judah," says the Lord. "My intention was for them to be My people, a source of fame, praise, and glory to Me. But they did not listen."

verses.latin: Dices ergo ad eos sermonem istum: Haec dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Omnis laguncula implebitur vino. Et dicent ad te: Numquid ignoramus quia omnis laguncula implebitur vino?
verses.english: "So you shall speak this proverb to them: 'The Lord God of Israel says this: "Every wine jar will be filled with wine." And they will say to you, 'Of course, we know that every wine jar will be filled with wine! What's the point?'"

verses.latin: Et dices ad eos: Haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego implebo omnes habitatores terræ hujus, et reges qui sedent super solium David, et sacerdotes, et prophetas, et omnes habitatores Jerusalem, ebrietate:
verses.english: "Then you shall say to them: 'The Lord says this: "Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land with a staggering drunkenness. This includes the kings who sit on David's throne, the priests, and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem."'"

verses.latin: Et dispergam illos, virum a fratre suo, et patres et filios pariter, ait Dominus: non parcam, et non miserebor, et non ignoscam, quin perdam eos.
verses.english: "I will scatter them, separating each person from their brother, fathers and sons alike," says the Lord. "I will show no mercy, no pity, and no forgiveness; I will simply destroy them completely."

verses.latin: Audite, et auribus percipite: nolite superbire, quia Dominus locutus est.
verses.english: Listen and pay close attention with your ears. Do not be so proud, because the Lord has spoken this warning.

verses.latin: Date Domino Deo vestro honorem, antequam conturbet pedes vestros, et antequam tenebrescant montes caliginosi: expectabitis lucem, et ecce umbra mortis, et in caliginem vertetur.
verses.english: Give honor to the Lord your God now, before He causes your feet to stumble on the dark mountains. Before the shadowy mountains darken fully, you will look for light, but behold, it will be the shadow of death instead. And everything will turn into deep gloom.

verses.latin: Quod si hoc audire nolueritis, in abscondito plorabit anima mea a facie superbiæ: plorans plorabit, et deducet lacrimam oculus meus, quia captus est grex Domini.
verses.english: But if you refuse to listen to this warning, my soul will weep in secret over your pride. It will weep bitterly, and my eyes will shed many tears, because the Lord's flock has been led away into captivity.

verses.latin: Dic regi, et dominatrici: humiliamini, sedete: quoniam descendit de capite vestro corona gloriæ vestræ.
verses.english: Tell the king and the queen mother: "Humble yourselves and sit in the dust!" "Because your glorious crown has fallen from your heads."

verses.latin: Civitates austri clausæ sunt, et non est qui aperiat: transgressa est omnis Juda, transducta est tota.
verses.english: The cities of the Negeb, the southern region of Judah, are shut up. No one can get in or out. All of Judah has been exiled, carried away completely.

verses.latin: Leva oculos tuos, et vide venientes ab aquilone: ubi est grex qui datus est tibi, pecus inclitum tuum?
verses.english: Lift up your eyes and look at those coming from the north. Where is the flock that was entrusted to you? Where are your glorious sheep?

verses.latin: Quid dices cum visitaverit te? Tu enim docuisti eos adversum te, et instituisti super caput tuum amici quasi principis: numquid non dolores apprehendent te quasi mulierem parturientem?
verses.english: What will you say when God punishes you? For you yourself have taught them to be against you, and you have appointed them as rulers over you, like princes over your head. Won't pains seize you, like a woman giving birth?

verses.latin: Si autem dixeris in corde tuo: Quare venerunt mihi hæc? Propter multitudinem iniquitatis tuæ revelata sunt pudenda tua, denudatæ sunt scælæ tuæ.
verses.english: If you say in your heart, 'Why have these terrible things happened to me?' It is because of your many sins that your shameful parts have been exposed. Your garment has been stripped off, and your body left bare.

verses.latin: Si mutare potest Æthiops pellem suam, aut pardus varietates suas: et vos poteritis bene facere, cum didiceritis malum.
verses.english: Can an Ethiopian change the color of his skin? Or can a leopard change its spots? Then you, who have become so accustomed to doing evil, can also do good.

verses.latin: Et dispergam eos quasi stipulam quæ raptatur a vento in deserto.
verses.english: Therefore, I will scatter them like straw, which is blown away by the wind across the desert.

verses.latin: Hæc est sors tua, portio mensuræ tuæ, dicit Dominus, quia oblita es mei, et confisa es in mendacio.
verses.english: "This is your fate, the portion I have allotted to you," says the Lord. "Because you have forgotten Me and have trusted in lies."

verses.latin: Unde et ego nudavi femoralia tua a facie tua, et apparuit ignominia tua.
verses.english: That is why I Myself have pulled up your skirt to expose your face. And all your public shame has been revealed.

verses.latin: Adultera tua, et hinnitus, rugitus equorum tuorum, scelus fornicationis tuæ: super colles ostendi abominationes tuas. Væ tibi Jerusalem, non mundaberis: usquequo adhuc?
verses.english: "Your spiritual adulteries, the lustful neighing of your horses, the wickedness of your fornication—I have seen your abominations on the hills. Woe to you, Jerusalem! You will not be cleansed. How much longer will you persist in this?"

verses.latin: Verbum Domini, quod factum est ad Jeremiam prophetam de sermonibus siccitatis.
verses.english: This is the message of the Lord which came to Jeremiah the prophet about the severe drought conditions.

verses.latin: Luxit Judas, et portae ejus conciderunt, et sederunt in terra mœrentes, et clamor Jerusalem ascendit.
verses.english: Judah mourned and her city gates collapsed in despair. The people sat on the ground, grieving, and the desperate cries of Jerusalem rose up.

verses.latin: Majores miserunt minores suos ad aquam : venerunt ad hauriendum, non invenerunt aquam, reportaverunt vasa sua vacua, confusi atque afflicti, et operuerunt capita sua.
verses.english: The leaders sent their servants to fetch water. They went to draw it, but they found no water. They returned with their empty vessels, feeling ashamed and distressed, covering their heads in despair.

verses.latin: Propter terræ vastitatem, quia non pluit in terra, confusi sunt agricolæ, operuerunt capita sua.
verses.english: Because the land was so desolate, and because no rain fell upon the ground, the farmers were utterly ashamed. They too covered their heads in deep despair.

verses.latin: Nam et cerva in agro peperit, et dereliquit, quia non erat herba.
verses.english: Even the wild deer in the field gave birth and then abandoned its young, because there was no grass for it to feed on.

verses.latin: Et onagri steterunt in rupibus, traxerunt ventum quasi dracones, defecerunt oculi eorum, quia non erat herba.
verses.english: And the wild donkeys stood on the bare rocks, gasping for air like desert beasts. Their eyes grew dim and faint, because there was no grass to be found anywhere.

verses.latin: Si iniquitates nostræ responderint nobis, Domine, fac propter nomen tuum, quia multæ sunt aversiones nostræ : tibi peccavimus.
verses.english: Lord, if our many sins are testifying against us, then for the sake of your holy name, please act! For we have turned away from you so many times, and we have truly sinned against you.

verses.latin: Expectatio Israël, Salvator ejus in tempore angustiæ : quare quasi colonus futurus es in terra, et quasi viator declinans ad divertendum?
verses.english: You are the true hope of Israel, its only Savior in times of deep distress. Why do you act as if you are a mere stranger in our land, or like a traveler who just stops for the night to rest, with no intention of staying?

verses.latin: Quare futurus es velut vir vagus, et quasi fortis qui salvam facere non potest? Tu autem in nobis es, Domine, et nomen tuum invocatum est super nos : ne derelinquas nos.
verses.english: Why do you seem like a bewildered man, or like a mighty warrior who is powerless to save us? But Lord, you are truly among us, and your holy name has been called upon us. Do not abandon us!

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus populo huic, qui dilexit movere pedes suos, et non quievit, et Dominus non placatus est eis : nunc recordabitur iniquitatum eorum, et visitabit peccata eorum.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says to this people, who loved to wander away and never settled in His ways. The Lord was not pleased with them. Now, He will remember their many sins, and He will punish their evil deeds.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me : Noli orare pro populo hoc in bonum.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to me: "Do not pray for this people's well-being."

verses.latin: Cum jejunaverint, non exaudiam preces eorum : et si obtulerint holocausta et victimas, non suscipiam ea : quoniam gladio, et fame, et peste, ego consumam eos.
verses.english: "Even when they fast, I will not listen to their prayers. And if they offer burnt offerings and sacrifices, I will not accept them. For I will utterly consume them with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence."

verses.latin: Et dixi : A, a, a, Domine Deus : prophetæ ipsi dicunt eis : Non videbitis gladium, et fames non erit in vobis, sed pacem veram dabit vobis in loco isto.
verses.english: And I said, "Oh, oh, oh, Lord God! The prophets themselves are telling them, 'You will not see a sword, nor will there be famine among you. Instead, He will give you true peace in this very place!'"

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me : Falso prophetant prophetæ in nomine meo : non misi eos, et non mandavi eis, neque locutus sum ad eos : visionem mendacem, et divinationem, et omne flagitium, et deceptions cordis sui prophetant vobis.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to me: "The prophets are speaking lies in My name! I did not send them, nor did I command them, nor did I speak to them. They are prophesying to you a deceitful vision, empty divination, every vile thing, and the deceptions that come from their own hearts."

verses.latin: Idcirco hæc dicit Dominus de prophetis qui prophetant in nomine meo, quos ego non misi, dicentes : Gladius et fames non erit in terra hac : in gladio et fame consummentur prophetæ illi.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord says concerning those prophets who are prophesying in My name, whom I did not send, and who insist: 'There will be no sword or famine in this land!' Those very prophets will be consumed by the sword and by famine.

verses.latin: Et populus cui prophetant, erit projectus in plateis Jerusalem propter famem et gladium, et non erit qui sepeliat eos : ipsi, et uxores eorum, filii, et filiæ eorum, et effundam super eos malum suum.
verses.english: And the people to whom these prophets lie will be cast out into the streets of Jerusalem because of famine and the sword. There will be no one left to bury them—neither the people themselves, nor their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters. Indeed, I will pour out the full consequence of their own evil upon them.

verses.latin: Et dices ad eos sermonem istum : Deducant oculi mei lacrimam per noctem et diem, et non taceant, quoniam contritione magna contrita est virgo filia populi mei, plaga pessima vehementer.
verses.english: And you, Jeremiah, shall say this word to them: "Let my eyes stream with tears day and night without ceasing, because the virgin daughter of my people has been utterly crushed with a great breaking, a very dreadful and grievous wound."

verses.latin: Si egressus fuero ad agros, ecce occisi gladio : et si ingressus fuero in civitatem, ecce attenuati fame. Prophetam quoque et sacerdotem duxerunt in terram quam ignorabant.
verses.english: "If I go out to the fields, behold, there are those slain by the sword. And if I enter the city, behold, there are those wasted away by famine. Even the prophet and the priest have been led into exile, to a land they do not know."

verses.latin: Numquid abjecisti Judam, aut Sion abominata est anima tua? quare ergo percussisti nos ita ut ultra sanari non possimus? expectavimus pacem, et non est bonum : et tempus curationis, et ecce turbatio.
verses.english: "Have you completely rejected Judah? Has your soul truly abhorred Zion? Why then have you struck us so severely that we cannot be healed? We looked for peace, but no good came; we hoped for a time of healing, but behold, there is only terror!"

verses.latin: Novimus, Domine, impietates nostras, iniquitatem patrum nostrorum, quia peccavimus tibi.
verses.english: "We acknowledge our wickedness, O Lord, and the iniquity of our fathers, for we have truly sinned against you."

verses.latin: Ne des nos ob nomen tuum in opprobrium, ne ignominia afficias solium majestatis tuæ : memento, ne irritum facias fœdus tuum nobiscum.
verses.english: "Do not give us over to public disgrace for the sake of your holy name. Do not dishonor the glorious throne of your majesty. Remember your covenant with us; do not annul it!"

verses.latin: Numquid sunt in sculptilibus gentium qui pluant? aut cæli possunt dare imbres? nonne tu es Dominus Deus noster, quem expectavimus? quia tu fecisti omnia hæc.
verses.english: "Can any of the idols of the nations bring rain? Or can the skies themselves give showers? Are you not the Lord our God, the only one we have waited for? For you alone are the one who has made all these things."

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Si steterit Moyses et Samuel coram me, non est anima mea ad populum istum: dimitte eos a facie mea, et egrediantur.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me: "Even if Moses and Samuel stood before Me interceding, My favor would not be with this people. Send them away from My presence, and let them depart for their judgment."

verses.latin: Et cum dixerint tibi: Quo egrediemur? dices ad eos: Haec dicit Dominus: Qui ad mortem, ad mortem: et qui ad gladium, ad gladium: et qui ad famem, ad famem: et qui ad captivitatem, ad captivitatem.
verses.english: And when they ask you, 'Where shall we go out to?' you shall tell them: 'Thus says the Lord: Those appointed to death, to death they shall go. And those appointed to the sword, to the sword they shall go. And those appointed to famine, to famine they shall go. And those appointed to captivity, to captivity they shall go.'

verses.latin: Et visitabo super eos quatuor species, dicit Dominus: gladium ad occidendum, et canes ad scindendum, et volatilia caeli et bestias terrae ad devorandum et dissipandum.
verses.english: And I will appoint over them four kinds of destroyers, says the Lord: the sword to kill, dogs to tear, the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy their corpses.

verses.latin: Et dabo eos in commotionem universis regnis terrae, propter Manassen filium Hezechiae regis Juda, super omnibus quae fecit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: And I will make them an object of horror and shaking to all the kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for all the detestable things he did in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Quis enim miserebitur tui, Jerusalem? aut quis contristabitur pro te? aut quis ibit ad rogandum pro pace tua?
verses.english: For who will have pity on you, Jerusalem? Or who will mourn for you? Or who will go to pray for your peace and well-being?

verses.latin: Tu me dereliquisti, dicit Dominus, retro abiisti: et extendam manum meam super te, et interficiam te: defatigatus sum deprecari.
verses.english: You have forsaken Me, says the Lord; you have turned your back. So I will stretch out My hand against you and destroy you. I am weary of relenting from judgment.

verses.latin: Et dispergam eos ventilabro usque ad portas terrae: interfectorios et perditorios faciam populum meum, a viis suis non sunt reversi.
verses.english: And I will scatter them with a winnowing fork to the very ends of the earth. I will make My people childless and destroy them, for they have not turned back from their wicked ways.

verses.latin: Multiplicatae sunt mihi viduae ejus super arenam maris: induxi eis super matrem adolescentis vastatorem meridie: subito irrui super eam, urbes et terrores.
verses.english: Their widows have become more numerous to Me than the sand of the sea. I have brought upon them, even upon the mother of young men, a destroyer at noonday, striking unexpectedly. Suddenly I have brought anguish and terrors upon her, even upon her cities.

verses.latin: Infirmata est quae pepererat septem, defecit, animam efflavit: occidit ei sol cum adhuc esset dies: confusa est et erubuit: et reliquias eorum in gladium dabo in conspectu inimicorum eorum, ait Dominus.
verses.english: She who bore seven children has grown weak; she has gasped her last breath. Her sun has set while it was still day, signifying a sudden and premature end to her prosperity. She has been shamed and disgraced. And their remaining ones I will deliver to the sword in the sight of their enemies, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Vae mihi, mater mea! quare genuisti me virum rixae, virum discordiae in omnem terram? non peccavi, et non foeneravi, omnes me maledicunt.
verses.english: Woe is me, my mother! Why did you give birth to me, a man of strife, a man of contention to the whole land? I have neither lent money at interest nor borrowed it, so I have no financial disputes. Yet everyone curses me.

verses.latin: Dixit Dominus: Si non laxavero te in bonum, si non supplicavero pro te in tempore afflictionis et in tempore tribulationis adversus inimicum.
verses.english: The Lord said: "Surely I will release you for your own good. Surely I will intercede for you in the time of affliction and in the time of tribulation against your enemy."

verses.latin: Numquid fœnerabitur ferrum de aquilone et chalybs?
verses.english: Can common iron be broken by iron from the north, or common metal by steel? (Meaning, Judah cannot withstand the northern invader).

verses.latin: Divitias tuas, et thesauros tuos in direptionem dabo gratis in omnibus peccatis tuis, et in omnibus finibus tuis.
verses.english: Your wealth and your treasures I will give as plunder without payment, because of all your sins and throughout all your borders.

verses.latin: Et adducam te cum inimicis tuis in terram quam nescis: ignis enim succensus est in furore meo, usque ad inferos ardebit.
verses.english: And I will make you serve your enemies in a land you do not know. For a fire has been kindled in My wrath, and it will burn to the lowest depths, even to the underworld.

verses.latin: Tu scis, Domine, memento mei, et visita me, et libera me a persecutoribus meis: noli in patientia tua suscipere me: scito quoniam sustinui pro te opprobrium.
verses.english: You know, O Lord, remember me, and come to my aid, and deliver me from my persecutors. Do not, in Your enduring patience, allow me to be consumed. Know that for Your sake I have suffered scorn and humiliation.

verses.latin: Inventi sunt sermones tui, et comedi eos: et factum est mihi verbum tuum in gaudium et in laetitiam cordis mei: quoniam invocatum est nomen tuum super me, Domine Deus exercituum.
verses.english: Your words were found, and I consumed them. And Your word became to me a joy and the delight of my heart, for I am called by Your name, O Lord, God of hosts.

verses.latin: Non sedi in concilio ludentium, et gloriatus sum a facie manus tuae: solus sedebam, quoniam comminatione replesti me.
verses.english: I did not sit with the assembly of those who mock or make merry, nor did I rejoice in the presence of Your powerful hand upon me. Instead, I sat alone, for You had filled me with Your stern warning of judgment.

verses.latin: Quare factus est dolor meus perpetuus, et plaga mea desperabilis renuit curari? facta est mihi quasi mendax aquarum et infidelis.
verses.english: Why has my pain become perpetual, and my wound incurable and refusing to heal? Have You become to me like a deceitful stream, like waters that fail when most needed and are therefore unfaithful?

verses.latin: Propter hoc haec dicit Dominus: Si converteris, convertam te, et ante faciem meam stabis: et si separaveris pretiosum a vili, quasi os meum eris: convertantur ipsi ad te, et tu ne convertaris ad eos.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord: "If you return to Me, I will restore you, and you shall stand before My face. And if you separate the precious from the worthless in your message, you shall be as My mouth. Let them turn to you and your message, but you must not turn to them and their ways."

verses.latin: Et dabo te populo huic in murum aereum firmissimum: et pugnabunt adversum te, et non prævalebunt, quia ego tecum sum ut salvem te, et eruam te, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: And I will make you to this people a strong bronze wall. They will fight against you, but they will not prevail, because I am with you to save you and to deliver you, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et eruam te de manu pessimorum, et redimam te de manu robustorum.
verses.english: And I will deliver you from the hand of evil men, and I will redeem you from the hand of the powerful.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Non accipies tibi uxorem, et non erunt tibi filii et filiæ in loco isto.
verses.english: "You shall not take a wife for yourself, and you shall have no sons or daughters in this place."

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus super filios et filias qui generantur in loco isto, et super matres eorum, quæ genuerunt eos, et super patres eorum, de quibus procreati sunt in terra hac:
verses.english: "For this is what the Lord says about the sons and daughters who are born in this place, and about their mothers who bore them, and about their fathers who fathered them in this land:"

verses.latin: Moriuntur ægritudinibus pessimalis: non plangentur, et non sepelientur: in sterquilinium super faciem terræ erunt: et gladio et fame consumentur: et erit cadaver eorum in escam volatilibus cæli et bestiis terræ.
verses.english: "They will die of terrible diseases; they will not be mourned, nor will they be buried. Their bodies will become like dung spread upon the face of the earth. They will be consumed by sword and by famine. And their corpses will be food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth."

verses.latin: Hæc enim dicit Dominus: Ne ingrediaris domum convivii, neque vadas ad plangendum, neque consoleris eos: quia abstuli pacem meam ab omni populo isto, dicit Dominus, misericordiam et miserationes.
verses.english: "For this is what the Lord says: 'Do not enter a house of feasting, nor go to mourn, nor offer them comfort. For I have taken my peace from all these people,' declares the Lord, 'along with my mercy and my compassion.'"

verses.latin: Et morientur magni et parvi in terra ista: non sepelientur, neque plangentur: et non seincident se, neque calvificentur pro eis:
verses.english: "Both great and small will die in this land. They will not be buried, nor will they be mourned. No one will cut themselves or shave their heads for them as a sign of grief."

verses.latin: Et non frangetur eis panis in mœrore ad consolandum super mortuo, et non dabitur eis potus consolationis super patre suo et matre sua.
verses.english: "And no one will break bread for them in mourning to comfort them over the dead. No cup of consolation will be given to them for their father or their mother."

verses.latin: Et domum convivii non ingredieris, ut epuleris cum eis, et bibas.
verses.english: "You shall not enter a house of feasting to eat and drink with them either."

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Ecce ego auferam de loco isto in oculis vestris, et in diebus vestris, vocem gaudii et vocem lætitiæ, vocem sponsi et vocem sponsæ.
verses.english: "For this is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, says: 'Behold, I will remove from this place, before your very eyes and during your lifetime, the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.'"

verses.latin: Et cum annuntiaveris populo huic omnia verba hæc, et dixerint ad te: Quare locutus est Dominus super nos omne malum hoc? quæ iniquitas nostra? et quod peccatum nostrum, quod peccavimus Domino Deo nostro?
verses.english: "And when you announce all these words to these people, and they say to you: 'Why has the Lord spoken all this great evil against us? What is our iniquity? And what is our sin that we have sinned against the Lord our God?'"

verses.latin: dices ad eos: Quia dereliquerunt patres vestri me, dicit Dominus, et abierunt post deos alienos, et servierunt eis, et adoraverunt eos: et me dereliquerunt, et legem meam non custodierunt.
verses.english: "Then you shall say to them: 'Because your fathers abandoned me,' declares the Lord, 'and went after other gods, and served them, and worshiped them. They abandoned me and did not keep my law.'"

verses.latin: Vos quoque pejus operati estis quam patres vestri: ecce enim unusquisque vestrum graditur post pravitatem cordis sui pessimi, ut me non audiat.
verses.english: "But you have acted even worse than your fathers! For behold, each one of you walks according to the stubbornness of your own evil heart, refusing to listen to me."

verses.latin: Et ejiciam vos de terra hac in terram quam ignoratis, vos et patres vestri: et servietis ibi diis alienis die ac nocte, qui non dabunt vobis requiem.
verses.english: "And I will cast you out from this land into a land which neither you nor your fathers have known. There you will serve other gods day and night, gods who will give you no rest."

verses.latin: Propterea ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et non dicetur ultra: Vivit Dominus, qui eduxit filios Israël de terra Ægypti:
verses.english: "Therefore, behold, the days are coming,' declares the Lord, 'when it will no longer be said: "As the Lord lives, who brought the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt!"'"

verses.latin: sed: Vivit Dominus, qui eduxit filios Israël de terra aquilonis, et de universis terris ad quas ejeci eos: et reducam eos in terram suam, quam dedi patribus eorum.
verses.english: "But instead: 'As the Lord lives, who brought the children of Israel out of the land of the north and out of all the lands where I had cast them!' For I will bring them back into their own land, which I gave to their fathers."

verses.latin: Ecce ego mittam piscatores multos, dicit Dominus, et piscabuntur eos: et post hæc mittam venatores multos, et venabuntur eos de omni monte, et de omni colle, et de cavernis petrarum.
verses.english: "Behold, I will send for many fishermen,' declares the Lord, 'and they will fish them out. And after that, I will send for many hunters, and they will hunt them down from every mountain and every hill, and out of the crevices of the rocks.'"

verses.latin: Quia oculi mei super omnes vias eorum: non sunt absconditæ a facie mea, neque operta est iniquitas eorum ab oculis meis.
verses.english: "For my eyes are upon all their ways. Nothing is hidden from my face, nor is their iniquity concealed from my sight."

verses.latin: Et reddam primum duplici iniquitates eorum et peccata eorum: quia contaminaverunt terram meam in morticinis idolorum suorum, et in abominationibus suis impleverunt hæreditatem meam.
verses.english: "And I will first repay them double for their iniquities and their sins, because they have defiled my land with the carcasses of their idols, and with their abominations they have filled my inheritance."

verses.latin: Domine, fortitudo mea et robur meum, et refugium meum in die tribulationis: ad te gentes venient ab extremis terræ, et dicent: Vere mendacium possederunt patres nostri, vanitatem quæ eis non profuit.
verses.english: "O Lord, my strength and my fortress, my refuge in the day of tribulation! To you, the nations will come from the farthest ends of the earth and say: 'Truly, our fathers inherited lies, worthless things that brought them no benefit.'"

verses.latin: Numquid faciet sibi homo deos, et ipsi non sunt dii?
verses.english: "Can a man make gods for himself, when they are not truly gods?"

verses.latin: Idcirco ecce ego ostendam eis hac vice, ostendam eis manum meam, et virtutem meam: et scient quia nomen meum Dominus.
verses.english: "Therefore, behold, I will make them know this time. I will show them my hand and my power, and they will know that my name is the Lord."

verses.latin: Peccatum Juda scriptum est stylo ferreo, in ungue adamantino, exaratum super latitudinem cordis eorum, et in cornibus ararum eorum.
verses.english: The sin of Judah has been etched into their very being with an iron stylus and a diamond point. It is engraved upon the tablet of their hearts, and upon the horns of the altars where they offer their sacrifices—a permanent sign of their idolatry.

verses.latin: Cum recordati fuerint filii eorum ararum suarum, et lucorum suorum, sub ligno frondoso, super colles excelsos.
verses.english: Their own children will remember their altars of false worship and their sacred groves under every green tree, on every high hill where they committed these sins.

verses.latin: Montes tui in deserto, fortitudo tua, omnes thesauros tuos in direptionem dabo, excelsa tua propter peccata in omnibus finibus tuis.
verses.english: Your mountains—which are like a wilderness—and your strength, all your treasures, I will give them over to plunder. Your high places, where you committed idolatry, will be given over because of your sins in all your territories.

verses.latin: Et relinques hereditatem tuam, quam dedi tibi: et servire te faciam inimicis tuis in terra quam ignoras: quoniam ignem succendistis in furor meus, usque in sempiternum ardebit.
verses.english: You will be forced to let go of your own inheritance, the land I gave you. I will make you serve your enemies in a land you do not know, because you have ignited a fire of My anger, and it will burn on and on, unceasingly.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Maledictus homo qui confidit in homine, et ponit carnem brachium suum, et a Domino recedit cor ejus.
verses.english: The Lord says this: Cursed is the man who trusts in man, who makes his own human strength his confidence, and whose heart turns away from the Lord.

verses.latin: Erit enim quasi myrica in deserto, et non videbit cum venerit bonum: sed inhabitabit siccitatem in deserto, terram salis et inhabitabilem.
verses.english: For such a man will be like a desert broom bush in the arid wasteland; he will not even perceive when good things come. Instead, he will live in the parched places of the wilderness, in a salt land that is completely uninhabited and barren.

verses.latin: Benedictus vir qui confidit in Domino, et erit Dominus fiducia ejus.
verses.english: Blessed is the man who places his trust in the Lord, and whose total confidence is the Lord Himself.

verses.latin: Et erit quasi lignum quod transplantatur super aquas, quod ad humorem mittit radices suas: et non timebit cum venerit æstus: et erit folium ejus viride, et in tempore siccitatis non perturbabitur, nec desinet facere fructum.
verses.english: And he will be like a tree that has been planted by flowing waters, sending out its roots by the stream. It will not fear when the summer's intense heat arrives, for its leaves will remain green. In a year of drought, it will not be anxious, nor will it stop producing its fruit.

verses.latin: Pravum cor hominis, et inscrutabile: quis cognoscet illud?
verses.english: The heart of man is twisted and perverse, and it is inscrutable—who can truly understand or know it fully?

verses.latin: Ego Dominus scrutans cor, et probans renes: qui do unicuique juxta viam suam, et juxta fructum adinventionum suarum.
verses.english: I am the Lord, the One who deeply searches the heart and tests the innermost desires and intentions. I give to each person according to the way they live their life, and according to the fruit of their actions.

verses.latin: Perdix fovit quæ non peperit: sic qui congregat divitias, et non in judicio: in dimidio dierum suorum derelinquet eas, et in novissimo suo erit insipiens.
verses.english: Just like a partridge that hatches eggs it did not lay, so is the person who gathers riches unjustly, not by righteous means. In the middle of his life, he will be forced to abandon them, and in the end, he will be exposed as a fool.

verses.latin: Solium gloriæ, altitudo a principio, locus sanctificationis nostræ.
verses.english: Your glorious throne, exalted from the very beginning of time, is the place where we are made holy by Your presence.

verses.latin: Expectatio Israël, Domine, omnes qui te derelinquunt confundentur: recedentes a te, in terra scribentur: quoniam dereliquerunt venam aquarum viventium Dominum.
verses.english: O Lord, You are the very hope of Israel! All who abandon You will be put to shame. Those who turn away from You will have their names written in the dust, forgotten and without hope, for they have abandoned the Lord, the true fountain of life-giving waters.

verses.latin: Sana me Domine, et sanabor: salvum me fac, et salvus ero: quoniam laus mea tu es.
verses.english: Heal me, O Lord, and then I will truly be healed. Save me, and then I will truly be saved, because You are the one I praise.

verses.latin: Ecce ipsi dicunt ad me: Ubi est verbum Domini? veniat.
verses.english: Look! These people say to me, "Where is the word of the Lord you speak of? Let it come to pass, if it is real!"

verses.latin: Ego autem non sum turbatus, te pastorem sequens, et diem hominis non desideravi tu scis: quod egressum est de labiis meis, rectum in conspectu tuo fuit.
verses.english: But I have not fled from being a shepherd, following You. I have not desired the day of human calamity, as You well know. What came out of my lips was always spoken correctly and truthfully in Your sight.

verses.latin: Non sis tu mihi in terrorem, tu fortitudo mea in die afflictionis.
verses.english: Do not become a terror to me; You are my strength in the day when I face affliction.

verses.latin: Confundantur qui me persequuntur, et non confundar ego: paveant illi, et non paveam ego: induc super eos diem afflictionis, et duplici contritione contere eos.
verses.english: Let those who persecute me be put to shame, but let me not be shamed. Let them be terrified, but let me not be terrified. Bring upon them a day of calamity, and crush them with a double, overwhelming destruction.

verses.latin: Verbum quod factum est ad Jeremiam a Domino, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Jeremiah, saying:

verses.latin: Surge et descende in domum figuli, et ibi audies sermones meos.
verses.english: "Go down to the potter’s house, and there you will hear My words."

verses.latin: Et descendi in domum figuli, et ecce ipse faciebat opus super rotam.
verses.english: So I went down to the potter’s house, and I saw him working on his wheel.

verses.latin: Et dissipatum est vas quod ipse faciebat de luto manibus suis: et conversus fecit illud vas alterum, sicut placuerat figulo ut faceret.
verses.english: But the vessel that the potter was shaping from clay with his hands was ruined. So he changed his mind and made another vessel, just as it seemed good to him, the potter, to do.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to me, saying:

verses.latin: Numquid sicut figulus iste, non potero facere vobis, domus Israel, ait Dominus? Ecce sicut lutum in manu figuli, sic vos in manu mea, domus Israel.
verses.english: "Can I not deal with you, O house of Israel, as this potter deals with his clay?" says the Lord. "Behold, just as the clay is entirely in the hand of the potter, so are you entirely in My hand, O house of Israel."

verses.latin: Subito loquar adversum gentem et adversum regnum, ut eradicem, et destruam, et disperdam.
verses.english: "If I pronounce a judgment against a nation or against a kingdom—meaning I will uproot it, pull it down, and destroy it—"

verses.latin: Si poenitentiam egerit gens illa a malo suo, quod locutus sum adversum eam, et ego agam poenitentiam super malo, quod cogitavi ut facerem ei.
verses.english: "—if that nation, concerning which I have spoken, turns away from its evil, then I will change My mind concerning the evil I had planned to bring upon it."

verses.latin: Et subito loquar de gente et de regno, ut aedificem, et plantem.
verses.english: "And if I pronounce a blessing upon a nation or upon a kingdom—meaning I will build it up and plant it—"

verses.latin: Et fecerit malum in oculis meis, ut non audiat vocem meam, et agam poenitentiam super bono, quod locutus sum ut facerem ei.
verses.english: "—and that nation does evil in My sight, refusing to obey My voice, then I will change My mind concerning the good I had promised to do for it."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo dic viris Iuda, et habitatoribus Ierusalem, dicens: Haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego fingo in vos malum, et cogito contra vos cogitationem: revertatur unusquisque a via sua pessima, et dirigite vias vestras, et studia vestra.
verses.english: Now then, speak to the men of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying: "Thus says the Lord: Behold, I am now forming a disaster against you and devising a plan to bring it upon you. Therefore, let each one of you turn away from your evil path, and correct your ways and your actions."

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt: Desperavimus, quia post cogitationes nostras ibimus, et unusquisque nequitiae cordis sui faciemus.
verses.english: But they replied: "That is hopeless! We will go our own way, and each of us will act according to the stubborn wickedness of his own heart."

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus: Interrogate gentes: quis audivit talia horrida, quae fecit nimis virgo Israel?
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord says this: "Ask the other nations: who has ever heard of such a horrifying thing—this betrayal that the virgin Israel, My once-pure people, has committed?"

verses.latin: Numquid deficiet de petra agri nix Libani? aut evelli possunt aquae redundantes, frigidae et ebullientes?
verses.english: "Does the snow on the rocks of Lebanon ever melt away completely? Do the cold, gushing waters that flow from the mountains ever dry up?"

verses.latin: Quia oblitus est mei populus meus, frustra libantes, et impingentes in vias suas, a semitis saeculi, ut ambularent per tramites, viam non publicam:
verses.english: "Yet My people have forgotten Me; they offer sacrifices to worthless idols. They have stumbled in their ways, straying from the ancient paths that lead to life, choosing instead to walk on unpaved byways—a path that is not meant for public, righteous use—"

verses.latin: Ut fieret terra eorum in desolationem, et in sibilum sempiternum: omnes qui praeteribunt per eam, obstupescent, et movebunt caput suum.
verses.english: "—resulting in their land becoming a desolation, a perpetual object of scorn and horror. Everyone who passes by it will be utterly appalled and will shake their head in disbelief."

verses.latin: Sicut ventus urens dispergam eos coram inimico: dorsum et non faciem ostendam eis in die perditionis eorum.
verses.english: "Like a scorching desert wind, I will scatter them before their enemy. I will show them My back and not My face—meaning I will abandon them and not help them—on the day of their destruction."

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Venite, et cogitemus contra Ieremiam cogitationes: non enim peribit lex a sacerdote, neque consilium a sapiente, nec sermo a propheta. Venite, et percutiamus eum lingua, et non attendamus ad universos sermones ejus.
verses.english: Then they said: "Come, let us devise plots against Jeremiah. For we have our own priests who teach the Law, our own wise men who give counsel, and our own prophets who speak the word of God—we don't need *him*. Come, let us attack him with our tongues through false accusations and slander, and let us ignore everything he says."

verses.latin: Attende, Domine, ad me, et audi vocem adversariorum meorum.
verses.english: Lord, pay attention to me, and hear the voice of my adversaries.

verses.latin: Numquid redditur pro bono malum, quia foderunt foveam animae meae? Recordare quod steterim in conspectu tuo, ut loquerer pro eis bonum, et averterem indignationem tuam ab eis.
verses.english: Is evil to be repaid for good? For they have dug a pit to trap me and take my life. Remember how I stood before You to intercede for them, to speak good on their behalf, and to turn Your indignation away from them.

verses.latin: Propterea da filios eorum in famem, et deduc eos in manus gladii: fiant uxores eorum absque liberis, et viduae: et viri eorum interficiantur morte, juvenes eorum confodiantur gladio in bello.
verses.english: Therefore, hand their children over to famine, and deliver them to the power of the sword. Let their wives become childless and widows. Let their men be slain by death, and their young men be run through by the sword in battle.

verses.latin: Audiatur clamor de domibus eorum, repente adduces super eos latronem: quia foderunt foveam ut caperent me, et laqueos absconderunt pedibus meis.
verses.english: Let a cry be heard from their houses, when You suddenly bring a band of marauders upon them. For they have dug a pit to capture me and have hidden snares for my feet.

verses.latin: Tu autem, Domine, scis omne consilium eorum adversum me in mortem: ne propitieris iniquitati eorum, et peccatum eorum a facie tua non deleatur: fiant corruentes in conspectu tuo, in tempore furoris tui confodiantur.
verses.english: But You, O Lord, know all of their plots against me, even those meant to bring about my death. Do not forgive their iniquity, and let not their sin be blotted out from Your sight. Let them be cast down before You; in the time of Your wrath, let them be struck down.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Vade, et eme tibi lagunculam figuli fictilem: et assumens tecum de senioribus populi, et de senioribus sacerdotum:
verses.english: The Lord says this: "Go and buy yourself an earthenware flask from a potter. Then take some of the elders of the people and some of the elder priests with you,

verses.latin: et egredieris ad vallem filii Ennom, quae est juxta introitum portae fictilis: et illic praedicabis verba quae ego loquar tibi:
verses.english: and go out to the Valley of Ben-Hinnom, which is near the entrance of the Potsherd Gate. There you will proclaim the words that I will speak to you.

verses.latin: et dices: Audite verbum Domini, reges Juda, et habitatores Jerusalem: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Ecce ego inducam afflictionem super locum istum, ita ut omnis qui audierit illam tinniant aures ejus:
verses.english: And you shall say: 'Hear the word of the Lord, kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem! The Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, says this: Behold, I am bringing such a disaster upon this place that everyone who hears of it will have their ears ring with horror and shock.

verses.latin: eo quod dereliquerint me, et alienum fecerint locum istum, et sacrificaverint in eo diis alienis, quos nescierunt ipsi et patres eorum, et reges Juda: et repleverunt locum istum sanguine innocentum:
verses.english: This is because they have abandoned Me and have made this sacred place foreign and profane by sacrificing in it to foreign gods—gods unknown to them, their fathers, or the kings of Judah. They have also filled this place with the blood of innocent people.

verses.latin: et aedificaverunt excelsa Baal, ut comburerent filios suos igni in holocaustum Baal: quae non praecepi, nec locutus sum, nec ascenderunt in cor meum.
verses.english: They have built high places for Baal to burn their sons with fire as offerings to Baal—a practice I never commanded, never spoke of, and one that never even entered My mind.

verses.latin: Propterea ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et non vocabitur ultra locus iste Topheth, et vallis filii Ennom, sed vallis occisionis.
verses.english: Therefore, behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when this place will no longer be called Topheth or the Valley of Ben-Hinnom, but instead, the Valley of Slaughter.

verses.latin: Et dissipabo consilium Juda et Jerusalem in loco isto: et cadere eos faciam gladio in conspectu inimicorum eorum, et in manu quaerentium animas eorum: et ponam cadavera eorum escam volucribus caeli, et bestiis terrae.
verses.english: In this very place, I will shatter the plans of Judah and Jerusalem. I will make them fall by the sword before their enemies and by the hands of those who seek to take their lives. I will also make their dead bodies food for the birds of the sky and the wild beasts of the earth.

verses.latin: Et ponam civitatem hanc in stuporem et in sibilum: omnis qui praeterierit per eam, obstupescet, et sibilabit super universa plagas ejus.
verses.english: I will make this city a desolate waste and an object of scornful whistling. Everyone who passes by it will be astonished and will whistle in derision at all its wounds and devastation.

verses.latin: Et cibabo eos carnibus filiorum suorum, et carnibus filiarum suarum: et unusquisque carnem amici sui comedet in obsidione, et in angustia qua coarctabuntur ab inimicis suis, et a quaerentibus animas eorum.
verses.english: I will make them eat the flesh of their own sons and the flesh of their own daughters. Each person will eat the flesh of their neighbor during the siege and in the desperate distress with which their enemies and those who seek their lives will confine them.

verses.latin: Et confringes lagunculam in oculis virorum qui tecum iuerint:
verses.english: Then you shall break the flask in the sight of the men who have gone with you.

verses.latin: et dices ad eos: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum: Sic confringam populum istum, et civitatem istam, sicut confringitur vas figuli, quod non potest ultra instaurari: et in Topheth sepelientur, eo quod non sit locus ad sepeliendum.
verses.english: And you shall say to them: 'The Lord of hosts says this: Just so will I shatter this people and this city, like a potter's vessel that is broken beyond repair. They will be buried in Topheth because there will be no other place left to bury them.'

verses.latin: Sic faciam loco huic, dicit Dominus, et habitatoribus ejus, et ponam civitatem istam sicut Topheth.
verses.english: So will I do to this place, says the Lord, and to its inhabitants. I will make this city like Topheth itself.

verses.latin: Et erunt domus Jerusalem, et domus regum Juda, sicut locus Topheth, immundae omnes: in omnibus domibus in quorum tectis sacrificaverunt omni militiae caeli, et libaverunt libamina diis alienis.
verses.english: The houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah will become as unclean as the place of Topheth. This is because in all the houses, on whose rooftops they sacrificed to all the host of heaven—the astral deities—and poured out drink offerings to foreign gods, they have been defiled.

verses.latin: Venit autem Jeremias de Topheth, quo miserat eum Dominus ad prophetandum, et stetit in atrio domus Domini, et dixit ad omnem populum:
verses.english: Then Jeremiah came back from Topheth, where the Lord had sent him to prophesy. He stood in the courtyard of the house of the Lord and spoke to all the people.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Ecce ego inducam super civitatem hanc, et super omnes urbes ejus, omne malum quod locutus sum adversum eam: quoniam induraverunt cervicem suam, ne audirent sermones meos.
verses.english: The Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, says this: 'Behold, I am bringing upon this city and upon all its towns every disaster that I have spoken against it. This is because they have stubbornly hardened their necks, refusing to listen to My words.'

verses.latin: Et audivit Phassur filius Emmer sacerdos, qui constitutus erat princeps in domo Domini, Jeremiam prophetantem sermones istos.
verses.english: Pashhur, the son of Immer, a priest who was appointed as the chief officer in the Temple of the Lord, heard Jeremiah speaking these prophetic words.

verses.latin: Et percussit Phassur Jeremiam prophetam, et misit eum in nervum, quod erat in porta Benjamin superiori, in domo Domini.
verses.english: So Pashhur struck Jeremiah the prophet and then put him in stocks, which were located at the Upper Benjamin Gate in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et factum est in crastinum, eduxit Phassur Jeremiam de nervo. Et dixit ad eum Jeremias: Non vocavit Dominus nomen tuum Phassur, sed Magor Missabib.
