verses.english: The next day, Pashhur released Jeremiah from the stocks. Jeremiah then said to him, "The Lord will no longer call you Pashhur; instead, He will call you Magor-Missabib"—meaning 'Terror on Every Side.'

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego dabo te in terrorem tibi, et omnibus amicis tuis: et corruent gladio inimicorum suorum, et oculis tuis videbis: et omnem Judam dabo in manum regis Babylonis, et perducet eos in Babylonem, et percutiet eos gladio.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord: 'Behold, I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends. They will fall by the sword of their enemies, and you will witness it with your own eyes. I will also give all of Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will carry them off to Babylon and strike them down with the sword.'

verses.latin: Et omnem substantiam civitatis hujus, et omnem laborem ejus, et omnem pretiosum, et universos thesauros regum Juda dabo in manibus inimicorum eorum: et diripient eos, et auferent, et ducent in Babylonem.
verses.english: 'And I will give all the wealth of this city, all its resources, all its precious things, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah into the hands of their enemies. They will plunder them, take them away, and carry them off to Babylon.'

verses.latin: Tu autem, Phassur, et omnes habitatores domus tuae, ibitis in captivitatem: et in Babylonem venies, et ibi morieris, et ibi sepelieris tu, et omnes amici tui, quibus prophetasti mendacium.
verses.english: 'And you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house, will go into captivity. You will go to Babylon, and there you will die, and there you will be buried—you and all your friends, to whom you prophesied lies.'

verses.latin: Seduxisti me, Domine, et seductus sum: fortior me fuisti, et invaluisti. Factus sum in derisum tota die, omnes subsannant me.
verses.english: Jeremiah then spoke to the Lord, saying, "You drew me in, O Lord, and I was drawn in to serve You. You are stronger than I, and You have prevailed over me. I have become a laughingstock all day long; everyone mocks me."

verses.latin: Quia jam olim loquor, exclamans vastitatem: et devastationem annuntio: et factus est mihi sermo Domini in opprobrium, et in derisum tota die.
verses.english: "For whenever I speak, I must cry out about violence and devastation; I announce it continually. So the word of the Lord has become a constant source of reproach and mockery for me, all day long."

verses.latin: Et dixi: Non recordabor ejus, neque loquar ultra in nomine illius. Et factus est in corde meo quasi ignis exardescens, clausus in ossibus meis: et defeci, ferre non sustinens.
verses.english: "But if I say, 'I will not remember Him, nor speak anymore in His Name,' then His word becomes in my heart like a burning fire, shut up in my bones. I become weary of holding it in, and I cannot endure it."

verses.latin: Audivi enim contumelias multorum, et terrorem in circuitu: persequimini, et persequemur eum: ab omnibus viris qui erant pacifici mei, et custodiebant latus meum: si quo modo deceptus caperetur, et haberem ultionem de eo.
verses.english: "For I hear the whisperings of many, and terror is on every side. They say, 'Denounce him! Let's denounce him!' All my former friends, who once watched my side, now wait for me to be deceived so they can catch me and take revenge."

verses.latin: Dominus autem mecum est quasi bellator fortis: idcirco qui persequuntur me, corruent, et infirmabuntur: non poterunt: confundentur vehementer, quia non intellexerunt aeternam ignominiam, quae nunquam delebitur.
verses.english: "But the Lord is with me like a powerful warrior. Therefore, those who persecute me will stumble and will not prevail. They will be greatly ashamed, for they have failed to act wisely. Their disgrace will be eternal; it will never be forgotten."

verses.latin: Et tu, Domine virtutum, probator justorum, qui vides renes et cor, videam, quaeso, ultionem tuam ex illis: tibi enim revelavi causam meam.
verses.english: "O Lord of hosts, You are the one who tests the righteous and sees into the depths of their minds and hearts. I beg You, let me see Your vengeance upon them, for I have entrusted my cause to You alone."

verses.latin: Cantate Domino, laudate Dominum: quia eripuit animam pauperis de manu malignorum.
verses.english: "Sing to the Lord! Praise the Lord! For He has delivered the life of the poor and oppressed from the hand of the wicked and malicious."

verses.latin: Maledicta dies in qua natus sum: dies in qua peperit me mater mea, non sit benedicta.
verses.english: "Cursed be the day on which I was born! May the day my mother bore me never be blessed!"

verses.latin: Maledictus vir qui annuntiavit patri meo, dicens: Natus est tibi puer masculus: et in gaudio laetificavit eum.
verses.english: "Cursed be the man who brought the news to my father, saying, 'A male child is born to you!'—and thereby filled him with great joy."

verses.latin: Sit homo ille sicut civitates quas subvertit Dominus, et non pœnituit: audiat clamorem mane, et ululatum in tempore meridiano.
verses.english: "May that man become like the cities that the Lord overthrew without remorse or a change of heart! May he hear screams in the morning and wailing at noon!"

verses.latin: Qui non interfecit me de vulva, ut esset mihi mater mea sepulchrum, et vulva ejus conceptus æternus.
verses.english: "Why did he not kill me while still in the womb, so that my mother's womb might have been my grave, and her womb an eternal conception?"

verses.latin: Ut quid de vulva egressus sum, ut viderem laborem et dolorem, et consumerentur in confusione dies mei?
verses.english: "Why did I come out of the womb at all, only to see trouble and sorrow, and to have my days consumed in confusion and shame?"

verses.latin: Verbum quod factum est ad Ieremiam a Domino, quando misit ad eum rex Sedecias Phassur filium Melchiae, et Sophoniam filium Maasiae sacerdotem, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord sent a message to Jeremiah when King Zedekiah sent Pashhur, son of Malchiah, and Zephaniah, son of Maaseiah the priest, to him, with a question for the prophet.

verses.latin: Interroga pro nobis Dominum: quia Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis propugnat adversum nos: si forte faciat Dominus secundum omnia mirabilia sua, et recedat a nobis.
verses.english: "Please ask the Lord for us, because Nebuchadnezzar, the King of Babylon, is fighting a war against us. We hope that the Lord might perform all His miracles as He has in the past, and make Nebuchadnezzar retreat from us."

verses.latin: Et dixit Ieremias ad eos: Sic dicetis Sedeciae:
verses.english: And Jeremiah said to them, "You will tell King Zedekiah this:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Ecce ego convertam vasa belli, quae in manibus vestris sunt, et quibus expugnatis regem Babylonis et Chaldaeos, qui obsident vos foris muros; et congregabo eos in medium civitatis hujus.
verses.english: 'The Lord, the God of Israel, says this: "Listen, I am going to turn against you the very weapons of war that are in your hands—the weapons you are using to fight the King of Babylon and the Chaldeans who are besieging you outside your city walls. I will then gather these besieging forces into the very heart of this city.

verses.latin: Et ego pugnabo contra vos in manu extenta, et in brachio forti, et in ira, et in indignatione, et in furore magno.
verses.english: I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and a mighty arm. I will fight with righteous anger, with indignation, and with great fury.

verses.latin: Et percutiam habitatores civitatis hujus, homines et pecora: peste magna morientur.
verses.english: I will strike down the inhabitants of this city—both people and their animals—and they will die from a terrible plague.

verses.latin: Et post haec, ait Dominus, dabo Sedeciam regem Juda, et servos ejus, et populum ejus, et quicumque derelicti fuerint in civitate hac a peste, et fame, et gladio, in manu Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis, et in manu inimicorum eorum, et in manu insequentium animam eorum: et percutiet eos in ore gladii, non miserebitur eorum, et non parcet, nec requiescet.
verses.english: 'After these things,' says the Lord, 'I will give Zedekiah, the King of Judah, along with his servants and his people—including anyone in this city who survives the plague, famine, and the sword—into the hands of Nebuchadnezzar, the King of Babylon. I will deliver them into the hands of their enemies, those who seek to take their lives. Nebuchadnezzar will strike them down without mercy, without sparing anyone, and without ceasing.'"

verses.latin: Et ad populum hunc dices: Haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego do coram vobis viam vitae, et viam mortis.
verses.english: And to this people you are to say: 'The Lord says this: "Listen, I am now setting before you the path to life and the path to death.

verses.latin: Qui habitaverit in civitate hac, morietur gladio, et fame, et peste: qui autem egressus fuerit, et transfugerit ad Chaldaeos qui obsident vos, vivet, et erit ei anima ejus quasi rapta.
verses.english: Anyone who stays inside this city will die by the sword, by famine, and by plague. But anyone who goes out and deserts to the Chaldeans who are besieging you will live. His life will be snatched away from danger, a bare escape, but he will live."

verses.latin: Quia posui faciem meam super civitatem hanc in malum, et non in bonum, ait Dominus: in manu regis Babylonis tradetur, et succendet eam igni.
verses.english: For I have set My face against this city for its destruction, not for its well-being,' says the Lord. 'It will be handed over to the King of Babylon, and he will burn it down with fire.'"

verses.latin: Et domum regis Juda: Audite verbum Domini:
verses.english: And regarding the house of the King of Judah, hear the word of the Lord:

verses.latin: Domus David, haec dicit Dominus: Judicate mane judicium, et eruite vi oppressum de manu calumniatoris: ne forte egrediatur quasi ignis indignatio mea, et succendatur, et non sit qui extinguat, propter malitiam studiorum vestrorum.
verses.english: 'O house of David,' the Lord says this: 'Administer justice diligently and rescue the one who is oppressed from the hand of his accuser. Do this quickly, lest My indignation burst out like fire, consuming everything, and there be no one to extinguish it, because of the wickedness of your actions.

verses.latin: Ecce ego ad te, habitatrix vallis, rupes campestris, ait Dominus: qui dicitis: Quis percutiet nos? et quis ingredietur in domos nostras?
verses.english: Listen, I am coming against you, O inhabitant of the valley—you who call yourself 'the rock of the plain,'” says the Lord. "You who say, 'Who can strike us down? Who can enter into our fortified homes?'"

verses.latin: Et ego visitabo super vos juxta fructum studiorum vestrorum, ait Dominus: et succendam ignem in silva ejus, et devorabit omnia in circuitu ejus.
verses.english: 'But I will punish you according to the consequences of your deeds,' says the Lord. 'And I will set fire to its dense forest—referring to the city and its inhabitants—and it will consume everything all around it.'"

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Descende in domum regis Juda, et loqueris ibi verbum hoc:
verses.english: The Lord God says this: 'Go down to the royal palace of the king of Judah, and speak this message there:''

verses.latin: Et dices: Audi verbum Domini, rex Juda, qui sedes super solium David, tu, et servi tui, et populus tuus, qui ingredimini per portas istas.
verses.english: 'Say: "Listen to the message from the Lord God, O King of Judah, you who sit on the throne of King David, you and your royal officials, and all your people who come through these city gates."

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Facite judicium et justitiam, et liberate vi oppressum de manu calumniatoris: et advenam, et pupillum, et viduam nolite contristare, neque opprimatis inique: et sanguinem innocentem ne effundatis in loco isto.
verses.english: The Lord God says: 'Do what is right and just. Rescue those who are robbed or unjustly oppressed from the power of their oppressors. Do not harm or oppress the foreigner, the orphan, or the widow. And do not shed innocent blood in this place.'

verses.latin: Si enim facientes feceritis verbum istud, ingredientur per portas domus hujus reges de genere David sedentes super solium ejus, et ascendentes currus, et equos, ipsi, et servi eorum, et populus eorum.
verses.english: For if you faithfully carry out this command, then kings from the royal line of David will continue to enter through the gates of this palace. They will sit on David's throne, riding in chariots and on horses, along with their royal officials and all their people.

verses.latin: Si autem non audieritis verba haec, in memetipso juravi, dicit Dominus, quia in solitudinem erit domus ista.
verses.english: But if you do not listen to these words, the Lord God says: 'I have sworn by Myself that this royal palace will become a heap of ruins, utterly deserted.'

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus super domum regis Juda: Galaad tu mihi es caput Libani, si non posuero te solitudinem, urbes inhabitabiles.
verses.english: For the Lord God says this concerning the royal palace of the king of Judah: 'Even though you are as glorious to Me as the forested heights of Gilead or the majestic cedars of Lebanon—regions known for their splendor—I solemnly declare that I will turn you into a desolate wasteland, with cities left uninhabited.'

verses.latin: Et sanctificabo super te vastatores, virum et arma ejus: et succident electam cedrum tuam, et in ignem mittent.
verses.english: I will consecrate destroyers against you—each man with his weapons. They will cut down your choicest cedar timbers, and they will throw them into the fire.

verses.latin: Et transibunt gentes multae per civitatem hanc, et dicet unusquisque proximo suo: Quare fecit Dominus sic civitati huic magnificae?
verses.english: Many foreign nations will pass by this city, and each one will ask his neighbor: 'Why has the Lord God done this to such a magnificent city?'

verses.latin: Et respondebunt: Quia dereliquerunt pactum Domini Dei sui, et adoraverunt alienos deos, et servierunt eis.
verses.english: And the answer will be: 'Because they abandoned the covenant of the Lord their God. They worshipped other foreign gods and served them instead of God.'

verses.latin: Nolite flere mortuum, neque plangere eum vehementer: plangite eum qui egreditur: quia non revertetur ultra, nec videbit terram nativitatis suae.
verses.english: Do not weep for King Josiah, who has died naturally, nor mourn him too excessively. Instead, weep for King Shallum (Jehoahaz), who is being led away into exile. For he will never return to this land, nor will he ever see the land of his birth again.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus ad Sellum filium Josiae regem Juda, qui regnavit pro Josia patre suo, qui egressus est de loco isto: Non revertetur huc amplius,
verses.english: For the Lord God says this concerning Shallum (also called Jehoahaz), the son of Josiah, King of Judah—he who reigned in place of his father Josiah, and who has departed from this place: 'He will never return here again.'

verses.latin: sed in loco ad quem transtulerunt eum ibi morietur, et terram nativitatis suae non videbit ultra.
verses.english: Instead, in the very place to which they have taken him captive, there he will die, and he will never see the land of his birth again.

verses.latin: Vae qui ædificat domum suam in injustitia, et coenacula sua non in judicio: proximum suum opprimit frustra, et mercedem operis sui non reddit ei:
verses.english: Woe to the king who builds his royal palace through injustice, and his luxurious upper rooms without any regard for justice! He forces his neighbors to work for him for nothing, and he does not pay them for their labor.

verses.latin: qui dicit: Ædificabo mihi domum latam, et coenacula spatiosa: qui aperit ei fenestras, et laqueata tabulis cedrinis, et depicta fucis.
verses.english: Woe to the king who says: 'I will build myself a grand and spacious palace, with vast upper rooms!' He then makes its windows wide, and panels its ceilings with expensive cedar wood, and paints it with bright, lavish colors.

verses.latin: Numquid regnabis, quoniam contendis in cedris? Pater tuus nonne comedit et bibit, et fecit judicium et justitiam tunc bene?
verses.english: Do you truly believe you are a king merely because you outdo others in building with cedar? Did not your father, Josiah, eat and drink and enjoy life? Yet he also practiced justice and righteousness, and because of this, everything went well for him.

verses.latin: Judicans causam pauperis, et egeni quasi non expediat illi: numquid non propter hoc est scire me? dicit Dominus.
verses.english: He defended the cause of the poor and the needy, ensuring they received justice, as if it were his own cause. Is this not truly what it means to know Me? declares the Lord God.

verses.latin: Oculi autem tui, et cor tuum non nisi ad avaritiam, et ad sanguinem innocentem fundendum, et ad calumniam, et ad iniquitatem faciendam.
verses.english: But your eyes and your heart are set on nothing but your own greed, on shedding innocent blood, on practicing oppression, and on committing constant injustice.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus ad Joakim filium Josiae regem Juda: Non plangent eum: Heu frater, et heu soror: Non plangent eum: Heu domine, et heu inclyte:
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord God says this concerning Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah: 'No one will mourn him by saying, "Alas, my brother! Alas, my sister!" No one will lament for him by crying, "Alas, my lord! Alas, his majesty!"'

verses.latin: Sepultura asini sepelietur, trahatur et projiciatur extra portas Jerusalem.
verses.english: He will be buried with the disgraceful burial of a donkey—his corpse will be dragged and cast out beyond the gates of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Ascende Libanum, et clama, et in Basan da vocem tuam, et clama per transeuntes: quia contriti sunt omnes amatores tui.
verses.english: O Jerusalem, go up to Lebanon and cry out! Raise your voice in Bashan! Call out from the heights of Abarim! For all your political allies have been shattered and destroyed.

verses.latin: Locutus sum ad te in fortitudine tua, et dixisti: Non audiam: haec est via tua ab adolescentia tua, quia non audisti vocem meam.
verses.english: I spoke to you when you were prosperous, but you defiantly said, 'I will not listen.' This has been your persistent way from your earliest youth, because you have never listened to My voice.

verses.latin: Omnes pastores tuos ventus pascet, et amatores tui in captivitatem ducentur: et tunc confunderis, et erubesces ab omni malitia tua.
verses.english: All your leaders will be swept away by the wind, scattered and destroyed. And your allies will be led into captivity. Then you will be shamed and utterly disgraced because of all your wickedness.

verses.latin: Quæ sedes in Libano, nidificans in cedris, quomodo gemes cum venerint tibi dolores, quasi dolores parturientis.
verses.english: You who live in your cedar-paneled palaces, as if nesting securely among the majestic cedars of Lebanon—how terribly you will groan when the pains of judgment come upon you, pains like those of a woman in childbirth!

verses.latin: Vivo ego, dicit Dominus, quia si fuerit Jechonias filius Joakim regis Juda annulus in manu dextera mea, inde evellam te:
verses.english: As surely as I live, declares the Lord God, even if Coniah (also called Jehoiachin), the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, were a cherished signet ring on My right hand, I would still tear you from it.

verses.latin: Et dabo te in manu quærentium animam tuam, et in manu quorum tu formidas faciem, et in manu Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis, et in manu Chaldæorum.
verses.english: I will give you into the power of those who seek to kill you, into the power of those whose faces you dread: into the power of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, and into the power of the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Et mittam te, et matrem tuam quæ genuit te, in terram alienam, in qua nati non estis: et ibi moriemini.
verses.english: I will hurl you and your mother who bore you into a foreign land, a land where neither of you were born, and there you will both die.

verses.latin: Et in terram ad quam levare animas suas desiderant, illuc non revertentur.
verses.english: And to the land to which they so deeply long to return, they will never come back.

verses.latin: Numquid vas fictile atque contritum iste vir Jechonias? numquid vas inutile? Quare projecti sunt ipse et semen ejus, et ejecti in terram quam ignoraverunt?
verses.english: Is this man Coniah just a despised and broken clay pot? Is he a vessel no longer fit for any use? Why are he and his offspring cast out and thrown into a land they have never known?

verses.latin: Terra, terra, terra, audi sermonem Domini.
verses.english: O land, O land, O land—listen closely to the message of the Lord God!

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Scribe virum istum sterilem, virum qui in diebus suis non prosperabitur: nec enim erit de stirpe ejus vir qui sedeat super solium David, et potestatem habeat ultra in Juda.
verses.english: The Lord God says this: 'Record this man Coniah as childless, meaning he will have no royal heir. He is a man who will not prosper in his lifetime. For none of his descendants will ever sit on the throne of David, nor will any ever again rule with authority in Judah.'

verses.latin: Vae pastores qui dispergitis, et dilaceratis gregem pascuae meae, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “Woe to the shepherds who scatter and tear apart the flock of My pasture!” declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus Deus Israel ad pastores, qui pascunt populum meum: Vos dissipastis gregem meum, et ejecistis illos, et non visitastis eos: ecce ego visitabo super vos malitiam studiorum vestrorum, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “Therefore, this is what the Lord God of Israel says to the shepherds who are supposed to feed My people: ‘You have scattered My flock, driven them away, and you have failed to care for them properly. So now, behold, I Myself will punish you for the evil of your actions and intentions,’ declares the Lord.”

verses.latin: Et ego congregabo reliquias gregis mei de omnibus terris, ad quas ejeci eos illuc: et convertam eos ad pascua sua, et crescent et multiplicabuntur.
verses.english: “And I Myself will gather the remnant of My flock from all the lands to which I have driven them away; and I will bring them back to their own pastures, and they will become fruitful and multiply.”

verses.latin: Et suscitabo super eos pastores, et pascent illos: et non timebunt ultra, et non pavebunt, et nullus quaeretur ex numero, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “And I will raise up new, good shepherds over them, and these shepherds will truly feed them. My flock will no longer be afraid or terrified, and not one of them will be missing from their number,” declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et suscitabo David germen justum: et regnabit rex, et sapiens erit: et faciet judicium et justitiam in terra.
verses.english: “Behold, the days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch—this will be a King who will reign, and He will be wise. He will execute justice and righteousness throughout the entire land.”

verses.latin: In diebus illis salvabitur Juda, et Israel habitabit confidenter: et hoc est nomen quod vocabunt eum: Dominus justus noster.
verses.english: “In those days, Judah will be saved, and Israel will dwell in security. And this is the name by which they will call Him: ‘The Lord Our Righteousness.’”

verses.latin: Propter hoc ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et non dicent ultra: Vivit Dominus, qui eduxit filios Israel de terra Aegypti:
verses.english: “Therefore, behold, the days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when people will no longer swear by saying, ‘As the Lord lives, who brought the children of Israel up from the land of Egypt!’”

verses.latin: sed: Vivit Dominus, qui eduxit et adduxit semen domus Israel de terra aquilonis, et de cunctis terris ad quas ejeceram eos illuc: et habitabunt in terra sua.
verses.english: “...but rather, they will say, ‘As the Lord lives, who brought up and brought in the descendants of the house of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the other lands to which I had driven them!’ And they shall dwell securely in their own land.”

verses.latin: Ad prophetas. Contritum est cor meum in medio mei, contremuerunt omnia ossa mea: factus sum quasi vir ebrius, et quasi homo madidus a vino, a facie Domini, et a facie verborum sanctorum ejus.
verses.english: Regarding the false prophets, Jeremiah laments: “My heart is broken within me; all my bones tremble. I am like a drunken man, like a man completely overcome by wine, because of the Lord and the sheer weight of His holy words.”

verses.latin: Quia adulteris repleta est terra, quia a facie maledictionis luxit terra, arefacta sunt arva deserti: factus est cursus eorum malus, et fortitudo eorum non recta.
verses.english: “For the land is filled with adulterers—those unfaithful to God. Because of God’s curse, the land mourns, and the pastures of the wilderness are dried up. The course of their actions has become evil, and the strength of their deeds is not righteous.”

verses.latin: Factus est enim et propheta et sacerdos pollutus, et in domo mea inveni scelus eorum, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “For both prophet and priest have become defiled. Even in My own Temple, I have found their wickedness,” declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Idcirco via eorum erit quasi lubricum in tenebris: impellentur enim, et corruent in ea: afferam enim super eos mala, annum visitationis eorum, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “Therefore, their path will be like slippery ground in the deep darkness. They will be driven on and stumble headlong into it. For I will bring disaster upon them in the year of their punishment and reckoning,” declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Et in prophetis Samariae vidi foedum: prophetabant in Baal, et decipiebant populum meum Israel.
verses.english: “Among the prophets of Samaria, I saw something truly disgusting: they prophesied by the pagan god Baal and led My people Israel astray.”

verses.latin: Et in prophetis Jerusalem vidi similitudinem peccatorum, et adulterium, et iter mendacii: et confortaverunt manus pessimorum, ut non converteretur unusquisque a malitia sua: facti sunt mihi omnes simul sicut Sodoma, et habitatores ejus quasi Gomorrha.
verses.english: “But among the prophets of Jerusalem, I have seen an even more shocking and appalling thing: they commit adultery and walk in lies. They strengthen the hands of evildoers, so that no one turns from their wickedness. To Me, all of them have become like Sodom, and its inhabitants like Gomorrah.”

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus exercituum ad prophetas: Ecce ego cibabo eos absinthio, et potabo eos felle: a propheta enim Jerusalem egressa est pollutio super omnem terram.
verses.english: “Therefore, this is what the Lord of armies says concerning these prophets: ‘Behold, I will feed them bitter wormwood and give them poisoned water to drink. For from the prophets of Jerusalem, a defilement has spread throughout the entire land.’”

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum: Nolite audire verba prophetarum, qui prophetant vobis, et decipiunt vos: visionem cordis sui loquuntur, non de ore Domini.
verses.english: “This is what the Lord of armies says: ‘Do not listen to the words of the prophets who are prophesying to you and deceiving you. They speak only the vision of their own deceitful hearts, and not a single word from the mouth of the Lord Himself.’”

verses.latin: Dicunt his qui blasphemant me: Locutus est Dominus: Pax erit vobis: et omni qui ambulat in pravitate cordis sui, dixerunt: Non veniet super vos malum.
verses.english: “They say to those who blaspheme Me, ‘The Lord has spoken: “Peace will be to you.”’ And to everyone who walks in the stubbornness of their own heart, they have falsely declared, ‘No evil will come upon you.’”

verses.latin: Quis enim affuit in consilio Domini, et vidit, et audivit sermonem ejus? Quis consideravit verbum illius, et audivit?
verses.english: “For who among them has truly stood in the private council of the Lord, so that he has genuinely seen and heard His word? Who has truly paid attention to His word and heard it?”

verses.latin: Ecce turbo Domini, furor egressus est, et tempestas valida super caput impiorum concidit.
verses.english: “Behold, the whirlwind of the Lord! His fury has gone forth like a powerful tempest, and it has fallen directly upon the heads of the wicked!”

verses.latin: Non revertetur furor Domini usque dum faciat et compleat cogitationem cordis sui: in novissimis diebus intelligetis sensum ejus.
verses.english: “The fury of the Lord will not turn back until He has fully executed and completely accomplished the plans of His heart. In the final days, you will understand His purpose clearly.”

verses.latin: Non mittebam prophetas, et ipsi currebant: non loquebar ad eos, et ipsi prophetabant.
verses.english: “I did not send these false prophets, yet they ran on their own initiative. I did not speak to them, yet they still prophesied.”

verses.latin: Si stetissent in consilio meo, audissent utique verba mea, et avertissent populum meum a via sua mala, et ab studiis suis pessimis.
verses.english: “If they had truly stood in My divine council, they would have certainly heard My words, and then they would have turned My people from their evil ways and from the wickedness of their deeds.”

verses.latin: Numquid Deus e proximo ego sum, dicit Dominus, et non Deus de longe?
verses.english: “‘Am I a God who is only near at hand?’ declares the Lord. ‘And not a God who is also far off?’”

verses.latin: Si absconditus fuerit vir in absconditis, ego non videbo eum, dicit Dominus? Numquid non caelum et terram ego impleo, dicit Dominus?
verses.english: “‘If a man hides himself in secret places, will I not see him?’ declares the Lord. ‘Do I not fill the entire universe and the earth?’ declares the Lord.”

verses.latin: Audivi quae locuti sunt prophetae, prophetantes in nomine meo mendacium, dicentes: Somniavi, somniavi.
verses.english: “I have heard what these prophets say, prophesying lies in My name and constantly declaring, ‘I had a dream! I had a dream!’”

verses.latin: Usquequo erit istud in corde prophetarum vaticinantium mendacium, et prophetantium seductionem cordis sui?
verses.english: “How long will this persist in the hearts of these prophets who prophesy lies—these prophets who speak only the deceptions of their own hearts?”

verses.latin: Qui volunt facere ut obliviscatur populus meus nominis mei propter somnia eorum, quae narrant unusquisque ad proximum suum, sicut obliti sunt patres eorum nominis mei propter Baal.
verses.english: “These are the prophets who intend to make My people forget My name through the false dreams that each one tells to his neighbor, just as their fathers forgot My name because of the pagan god Baal.”

verses.latin: Propheta qui habet somnium, narret somnium: et qui habet sermonem meum, loquatur sermonem meum vere. Quid paleis ad triticum? dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “Let the prophet who has a dream tell his dream for what it truly is. But let him who has My true word speak My word faithfully and truthfully! What does worthless chaff have in common with nourishing wheat?” declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Numquid non verba mea sunt quasi ignis, dicit Dominus, et quasi malleus contundens petram?
verses.english: “‘Is not My word like a consuming fire?’ declares the Lord. ‘And like a mighty hammer that shatters rock?’”

verses.latin: Propterea ecce ego ad prophetas, dicit Dominus, qui furantur verba mea unusquisque a proximo suo.
verses.english: “Therefore, behold, I am against these prophets,” declares the Lord, “who steal My words, each one from his neighbor, claiming them as their own!”

verses.latin: Ecce ego ad prophetas, dicit Dominus, qui assumunt linguas suas, et dicunt: Ait Dominus.
verses.english: “Behold, I am against these prophets,” declares the Lord, “who use their own tongues to speak and then falsely declare, ‘Thus says the Lord!’”

verses.latin: Ecce ego ad prophetas somniorum mendacium, dicit Dominus, qui narraverunt ea, et seduxerunt populum meum in mendacio suo, et in miraculis suis, quos ego non misi, neque mandavi eis: qui nihil profuerunt populo huic, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “Behold, I am against these prophets of lying dreams,” declares the Lord, “who have recounted them and have deceived My people with their lies and with their empty, baseless claims. I did not send them, nor did I command them, and they are of absolutely no benefit to this people,” declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Si ergo interrogaverit te populus hic, vel propheta, aut sacerdos, dicens: Quod est onus Domini? Dices ad eos: Vos estis onus: et abjiciam vos, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “Therefore, if this people, or a prophet, or a priest, asks you, saying, ‘What is the “burden” of the Lord?’—that is, the prophetic word or oracle—then you shall say to them: ‘You yourselves are the burden! And I will cast you off completely,’ declares the Lord.”

verses.latin: Et propheta, et sacerdos, et populus, qui dixerit: Onus Domini: visitabo super virum illum, et super domum ejus.
verses.english: “And as for the prophet, or priest, or anyone among the people who still mockingly says, ‘The burden of the Lord,’ I will severely punish that person and his household.”

verses.latin: Haec dicetis unusquisque ad proximum, et ad fratrem suum: Quid respondit Dominus? et quid locutus est Dominus?
verses.english: “Instead, this is what you should say, each one to his neighbor and to his brother: ‘What answer has the Lord given?’ and ‘What has the Lord truly spoken?’”

verses.latin: Et onus Domini ultra non nominabitis, quia uniuscujusque pondus sermo suus erit: et pervertitis verba Dei vivi, Domini exercituum, Dei nostri.
verses.english: “And the phrase ‘the burden of the Lord’ you shall mention no more, because each man’s own careless words will become his actual burden. For you are perverting the true words of the living God, the Lord of armies, our God!”

verses.latin: Haec dices ad prophetam: Quid respondit Dominus tibi? et quid locutus est Dominus?
verses.english: “This is what you should say to the prophet: ‘What answer has the Lord given you?’ and ‘What has the Lord truly spoken?’”

verses.latin: Si autem dixeritis: Onus Domini: propter hoc haec dicit Dominus: Quia dixistis sermonem istum: Onus Domini: et misi ad vos dicens: Non dicetis: Onus Domini:
verses.english: “But if you persist in saying, ‘The burden of the Lord,’ because you have said this very phrase—‘The burden of the Lord’—even after I specifically commanded you, saying, ‘You shall not say, “The burden of the Lord!”’—”

verses.latin: propterea ecce ego tollam vos portans, et projiiciam vos, et civitatem quam dedi vobis et patribus vestris, a facie mea.
verses.english: “Therefore, behold, I Myself will surely take you up and throw you away—remove you entirely from My presence—along with the city that I gave to you and to your fathers.”

verses.latin: Et dabo vos in opprobrium sempiternum, et in ignominiam sempiternam, quae nunquam oblivione delebitur.
verses.english: “And I will inflict upon you an everlasting reproach and an everlasting disgrace, which will never be erased from memory.”

verses.latin: Ostendit mihi Dominus: et ecce duo cophini ficorum positi coram templo Domini. Postquam transtulerat Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, Jechoniam filium Joakim regem Juda, et principes ejus, et fabros, et inclusores, de Jerusalem, et adduxerat eos in Babylonem.
verses.english: The Lord showed me a vision: and behold, there were two baskets of figs placed directly before the Lord's temple. This vision came after Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, had already carried away Jeconiah, the son of Jehoiakim, who was the king of Judah, along with his princes, the craftsmen, and the smiths from Jerusalem, bringing them as captives to Babylon.

verses.latin: Cophinus unus ficorum bonarum nimis, quasi ficus primi temporis: et cophinus unus ficorum malarum nimis, quae comedi non poterant eo quod essent malae.
verses.english: One basket contained figs that were exceedingly good, like the very first figs to ripen in the season. The other basket contained figs that were exceedingly bad, so rotten they could not possibly be eaten.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Quid tu vides, Jeremia? Et dixi: Ficus: ficus bonae, bonae nimis; et malae, malae nimis, quae comedi non possunt eo quod sint malae.
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to me, saying, "What do you see, Jeremiah?" And I answered, "I see figs: the good figs are very, very good; and the bad figs are very, very bad, so rotten that they cannot be eaten."

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Sicut ficus istae bonae, sic cognoscam transmigrationem Juda, quam emisi de loco isto in terram Chaldaeorum, in bonum.
verses.english: "Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Just as these good figs represent something positive, so I will look with favor upon the exiles of Judah whom I have sent from this place—from their homeland, into the land of the Chaldeans—for their ultimate good."

verses.latin: Et ponam oculos meos super eos ad placandum, et reducam eos in terram hanc: et aedificabo eos, et non destruam; et plantabo eos, et non evellam.
verses.english: "And I will fix My gaze upon them for their well-being and favor, and I will bring them back to this land of Judah. I will build them up, and I will not tear them down; I will plant them firmly, and I will not uproot them."

verses.latin: Et dabo eis cor cognoscendi me, quia ego sum Dominus: et erunt mihi in populum, et ego ero eis in Deum, quia revertentur ad me in toto corde suo.
verses.english: "And I will give them a transformed heart, a spiritual capacity to know Me truly—to understand that I am the Lord. Then they will truly be My people, and I will be their God, because they will turn back to Me with a single, undivided heart."

verses.latin: Et sicut ficus pessimae, quae comedi non possunt eo quod sint malae: haec dicit Dominus: Sic dabo Sedeciam regem Juda, et principes ejus, et reliquos de Jerusalem qui remanserunt in terra hac, et qui habitant in terra Ægypti.
verses.english: "And as for the very bad figs, the ones so rotten that they cannot be eaten—thus says the Lord: So will I treat Zedekiah, the king of Judah, and his princes, and the rest of the people of Jerusalem who remained in this land, and those who chose to live in the land of Egypt instead of going into exile."

verses.latin: Et dabo eos in vexationem et in afflictionem universis regnis terrae: in opprobrium, et in parabolam, et in proverbium, et in maledictionem in cunctis locis ad quae ejeci eos.
verses.english: "I will make them a source of trouble and distress for all the kingdoms of the earth. They will become a scandal and a byword, a proverb and a curse in all the places to which I will drive them away."

verses.latin: Et mittam in eos gladium, et famem, et pestem, donec consumantur de terra quam dedi eis et patribus eorum.
verses.english: "And I will send upon them the sword, and famine, and plague, until they are completely consumed and swept away from the land that I gave to them and their ancestors."

verses.latin: Verbum quod factum est ad Jeremiam super omnem populum Juda in anno quarto Joakim filii Josiae regis Juda, ipse est annus primus Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis.
verses.english: This is the message that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah—that was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon.

verses.latin: Quod locutus est Jeremias propheta super omnem populum Juda, et super omnes habitatores Jerusalem dicens:
verses.english: The prophet Jeremiah spoke this message to all the people of Judah and to all the residents of Jerusalem, saying:

verses.latin: A tertiodecimo anno Josiae filii Amon regis Juda, usque ad diem hanc, iste est vigesimus tertius annus: factum est verbum Domini ad me, et locutus sum vobis de nocte consurgens, et loquens, et non audistis.
verses.english: From the thirteenth year of Josiah, the son of Amon, king of Judah, until this very day—which is now the twenty-third year—the word of the Lord has come to me. I have spoken to you persistently, rising early each morning to speak, but you have not listened.

verses.latin: Et misit Dominus ad vos omnes servos suos prophetas, consurgens diluculo, et mittens, et non audistis, nec inclinastis aurem vestram ut audiretis.
verses.english: Furthermore, the Lord has sent all His servants, the prophets, to you, rising early and sending them repeatedly. Yet, you have not listened, nor have you inclined your ear to hear them.

verses.latin: Cum diceret: Revertimini unusquisque a via sua mala, et a pessimis cogitationibus vestris, et habitabitis in terra quam dedi vobis, et patribus vestris a saeculo et usque in saeculum.
verses.english: Their message was always: 'Turn back, each one of you, from your evil way and from your wicked thoughts. Then you will live in the land that I have given to you and to your fathers, for all generations, forever.'

verses.latin: Et nolite sequi deos alienos, neque colere eos, neque adorare eos: neque inritetis me in operibus manuum vestrarum, et non affligam vos.
verses.english: They also said: 'Do not follow other gods to serve them or worship them. Do not provoke Me to wrath with the works of your hands, and then I will not afflict you.'

verses.latin: Et non audistis me, dicit Dominus, ut inritaretis me in operibus manuum vestrarum in malum vobis.
verses.english: But you did not listen to Me, says the Lord. Instead, you provoked Me to wrath with the works of your hands, bringing harm upon yourselves.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus exercituum: Eo quod non audistis sermones meos,
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord of Hosts says: 'Because you have not listened to My words—'

verses.latin: ecce ego mittam, et assumam universas cognationes ab aquilone, ait Dominus, et ad Nabuchodonosor regem Babylonis servum meum, et adducam eos super terram istam, et super habitatores ejus, et super omnes nationes quae in circuitu illius sunt: et interficiam eos, et ponam eos in stuporem, et in sibilum, et in solitudines sempiternas.
verses.english: Behold, I will send for and gather all the tribes from the north,' says the Lord. 'I will send for Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, My servant, and I will bring them against this land and against its inhabitants, and against all the nations that surround it. I will utterly destroy them and make them an object of horror, a hissing, and an everlasting desolation.'

verses.latin: Et perdam ex eis vocem gaudii, et vocem laetitiae, vocem sponsi, et vocem sponsae, vocem molae, et lucernam accensam.
verses.english: 'I will take away from them the sound of joy and the sound of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstone grinding grain, and the light of the lamp that shines.'

verses.latin: Et erit omnis terra haec in solitudinem, et in stuporem: et servient gentes istae regi Babylonis septuaginta annis.
verses.english: 'And all this land will become a desolation and an object of horror. These nations will serve the king of Babylon for seventy years.'

verses.latin: Cumque impleti fuerint septuaginta anni, visitabo super regem Babylonis, et super gentem illam, dicit Dominus, iniquitatem eorum, et super terram Chaldaeorum, et ponam illam in solitudines sempiternas.
verses.english: 'When the seventy years are completed, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation,' says the Lord, 'for their iniquity. I will also punish the land of the Chaldeans, and I will make it an everlasting desolation.'

verses.latin: Et inducam super terram illam omnes sermones meos quos locutus sum adversum eam, omne quod scriptum est in libro hoc, quae prophetavit Jeremias adversum omnes gentes.
verses.english: 'I will bring upon that land all My words that I have spoken against it—everything that is written in this book, which Jeremiah has prophesied against all the nations.'

verses.latin: Quia servierunt eis, et ipsi multis gentibus, et regibus magnis: et reddam eis secundum opera eorum, et secundum facta manuum eorum.
verses.english: 'For many nations and great kings have subjugated them. I will repay them according to their deeds and according to the works of their own hands.'

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israel: Sume calicem vini furoris hujus de manu mea, et propinabis de illo cunctis gentibus ad quas ego mittam te.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: 'Take this cup of the wine of My wrath from My hand and make all the nations, to whom I send you, drink from it.'

verses.latin: Et bibent, et turbabuntur, et insanient a facie gladii quem ego mittam inter eos.
verses.english: 'They will drink and stagger and act madly because of the sword that I will send among them.'

verses.latin: Et accepi calicem de manu Domini, et propinavi cunctis gentibus ad quas misit me Dominus:
verses.english: So I took the cup from the hand of the Lord and made all the nations to whom the Lord sent me drink it.

verses.latin: Jerusalem et civitatibus Juda, et regibus ejus, et principibus ejus, ut daret eos in solitudinem, et in stuporem, et in sibilum, et in maledictionem, sicut est dies ista:
verses.english: This included Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, its kings and its princes, to make them a desolation, an object of horror, a hissing, and a curse, as it is this day.

verses.latin: Pharaonem regem Aegypti, et servos ejus, et principes ejus, et omnem populum ejus,
verses.english: I also made Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, his servants, his princes, and all his people drink.

verses.latin: et universos simul, omnesque reges terrae Hus, et omnes reges terrae Philisthinorum, et Ascalonem, et Gazam, et Accaron, et reliquias Azoti:
verses.english: And all the mixed peoples, and all the kings of the land of Uz, and all the kings of the land of the Philistines—including Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod—all drank.

verses.latin: et Idumaeam, et Moab, et filios Ammon:
verses.english: Edom, Moab, and the children of Ammon also drank.

verses.latin: et omnes reges Tyri, et omnes reges Sidonis: et reges terrarum insularum, quae trans mare sunt:
verses.english: All the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon, and the kings of the islands across the sea also drank.

verses.latin: et Dedan, et Thema, et Buz, et omnes qui attonsi sunt in comam,
verses.english: Dedan, Tema, and Buz, and all who shave the corners of their hair, drank too.

verses.latin: et omnes reges Arabiae, et omnes reges vulgi commixti, qui habitant in deserto:
verses.english: All the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the mixed peoples who live in the desert also drank.

verses.latin: et omnes reges Zamri, et omnes reges Elam, et omnes reges Medorum:
verses.english: All the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of Media also drank.

verses.latin: et omnes reges Aquilonis de prope et de longe, unumquodque adversum fratrem suum: et omnia regna terrae, quae super faciem ejus sunt: et rex Sesach bibet post eos.
verses.english: All the kings of the north, near and far, one against another, and all the kingdoms of the earth that are on the face of the universe drank. And the king of Sheshach—that is, Babylon—will drink after them all.

verses.latin: Et dices ad eos: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israel: Bibite, et inebriamini, et vomite, et cadite, et non surgite a facie gladii, quem ego mittam inter vos.
verses.english: Then you will say to them: 'This is what the Lord of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Drink, get drunk, vomit, fall, and do not rise again because of the sword that I will send among you.'

verses.latin: Cumque noluerint accipere calicem de manu tua ut bibant, dices ad eos: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum: Bibentes bibetis.
verses.english: If they refuse to take the cup from your hand to drink, then you will say to them: 'This is what the Lord of Hosts says: You shall surely drink!'

verses.latin: Quia ecce in civitate in qua invocatum est nomen meum, ego incipio affligere: et vos quasi innocentes ab infortunio liberabimini? Non liberabimini: quia gladium ego voco super omnes habitatores terrae, dicit Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: 'For behold, I am beginning to bring affliction on the city where My Name is invoked—Jerusalem. And do you think you, as if innocent, will be delivered from misfortune? No, you will not be delivered! For I am calling for a sword against all the inhabitants of the earth,' says the Lord of Hosts.

verses.latin: Et tu prophetabis ad eos omnes sermones istos, et dices ad illos: Dominus de excelso rugiet, et de habitatione sancta sua dabit vocem suam: rugiens rugiet super decorem suum: celeuma quasi calcantium in torculari, conclamabit adversum omnes habitatores terrae.
verses.english: Therefore, you are to prophesy all these words to them and say to them: 'The Lord will roar from on high; He will utter His voice from His holy dwelling. He will roar mightily over His habitation. With a shout like those treading the winepress, He will cry out against all the inhabitants of the earth.'

verses.latin: Pervenit sonitus usque ad extrema terrae: quoniam judicium Domino cum gentibus, causam habet cum omni carne, impios tradidit gladio, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: 'The sound will reach to the ends of the earth, for the Lord has a controversy with the nations. He has a case against all flesh. He will deliver the wicked to the sword,' says the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum: Ecce afflictio egredietur de gente in gentem, et turbo magnus surget a finibus terrae.
verses.english: This is what the Lord of Hosts says: 'Behold, disaster will go forth from nation to nation, and a great storm will arise from the farthest ends of the earth.'

verses.latin: Et erunt interfecti Domini in die illa a summo terrae usque ad summum ejus: non plangentur, et non colligentur, et non sepelientur: in sterquilinium super faciem terrae jacebunt.
verses.english: 'And those slain by the Lord on that day will be from one end of the earth to the other. They will not be lamented, nor gathered, nor buried; they will lie as dung on the surface of the earth.'

verses.latin: Ululate pastores, et clamate: et vos rugite principaliter gregis, quia completi sunt dies vestri ut interficiamini, et dispergam vos, et cadetis quasi vasa pretiosa.
verses.english: Wail, you shepherds, and cry out! Roll in the dust, you chiefs of the flock! For your days are fulfilled for you to be slaughtered, and I will scatter you, and you will fall like precious vessels broken into pieces.

verses.latin: Et peribit fuga a pastoribus, et salvatio a principalibus gregis.
verses.english: Escape will perish from the shepherds, and salvation from the chiefs of the flock.

verses.latin: Vox clamoris pastorum, et rugitus principalium gregis: quoniam vastavit Dominus pascua eorum.
verses.english: A sound of crying from the shepherds, and a howling from the chiefs of the flock, because the Lord has devastated their pastures.

verses.latin: Et conticuerunt arva pacis a facie irae furoris Domini.
verses.english: The fields of peace have been silenced because of the fierce anger of the Lord.

verses.latin: Dereliquit sicut leo cubile suum: quia facta est terra eorum in desolationem, a facie irae tyranni, et a facie irae furoris ejus.
verses.english: He has left His lair like a lion. Indeed, their land has become a desolation because of the fierceness of the oppressor's wrath, and because of the fierceness of His burning anger.

verses.latin: In principio regni Joakim filii Josiae regis Juda, factum est verbum hoc a Domino, dicens:
verses.english: In the early days of the reign of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, King of Judah, this message came from the Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Sta in atrio domus Domini, et loqueris ad omnes civitates Juda, qui veniunt ut adorent in domo Domini, universos sermones quos ego mandavi tibi ut loquaris ad eos: noli subtrahere verbum.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord: Stand in the courtyard of the Lord’s house and speak to all the cities of Judah who come to worship in the Lord’s house. Tell them all the words that I have commanded you to speak to them, and do not hold back a single word.

verses.latin: Si forte audiant, et convertantur unusquisque a via sua pessima: et pœniteat me mali quod cogito facere eis propter malitiam studiorum eorum.
verses.english: Perhaps they will listen to my words and turn back, each person from their wicked way of life. If they do, then I will relent and not bring the disaster I intend for them, which I planned because of the evil of their deeds.

verses.latin: Et dices ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus: Si non audieritis me, ut ambuletis in lege mea, quam dedi vobis:
verses.english: You shall say to them: Thus says the Lord: If you do not listen to Me and walk in My law which I have given to you—

verses.latin: et auscultetis sermones servorum meorum prophetarum, quos ego misi ad vos de nocte consurgens, et dirigens, et non audistis:
verses.english: and if you do not listen to the words of My servants the prophets, whom I have sent to you repeatedly, rising up early to send them, but you have not heeded them—

verses.latin: dabo domum hanc sicut Silo, et civitatem hanc dabo in maledictionem omnibus gentibus terræ.
verses.english: then I will make this house (the Temple) like Shiloh (a place of past destruction), and I will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.

verses.latin: Et audierunt sacerdotes, et prophetæ, et omnis populus, Jeremiam loquentem sermones istos in domo Domini.
verses.english: The priests, the prophets, and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the Lord’s house.

verses.latin: Cumque complesset Jeremias loqui omnia quæ præceperat Dominus ut loqueretur universis populis, apprehenderunt eum sacerdotes, et prophetæ, et omnis populus, dicentes: Morte moriaris.
verses.english: When Jeremiah had finished speaking everything the Lord had commanded him to speak to all the people, the priests, the prophets, and all the people seized him, shouting, “You must surely die!”

verses.latin: Quare prophetasti in nomine Domini, dicens: Quia domus hæc erit sicut Silo, et civitas hæc desolabitur, eo quod non sit habitator? Et congregatus est omnis populus adversum Jeremiam in domo Domini.
verses.english: They demanded, “Why have you prophesied in the name of the Lord, saying that this house (the Temple) will become like Shiloh, and that this city will be made desolate, without an inhabitant?” And all the people gathered together against Jeremiah in the Lord’s house.

verses.latin: Audierunt autem principes Juda verba hæc: et ascenderunt de domo regis in domum Domini, et sederunt in introitu portæ novæ domus Domini.
verses.english: When the princes of Judah heard these words, they came up from the king’s house to the Lord’s house and sat down at the entrance of the New Gate of the Lord’s house to hear the matter.

verses.latin: Et locuti sunt sacerdotes et prophetæ ad principes et ad omnem populum, dicentes: Judicium mortis est viro huic: quia prophetavit adversum civitatem hanc, sicut audistis auribus vestris.
verses.english: And the priests and the prophets spoke to the princes and to all the people, declaring, “This man deserves a sentence of death! For he has prophesied against this city, just as you have heard with your own ears.”

verses.latin: Et ait Jeremias ad omnes principes et ad universum populum, dicens: Dominus misit me ut prophetarem ad domum hanc, et ad civitatem hanc, omnia verba quæ audistis.
verses.english: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the princes and to all the people, saying, “The Lord sent me on a mission to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that you have heard.”

verses.latin: Nunc ergo bonas facite vias vestras, et studia vestra: et audite vocem Domini Dei vestri: et pœnitebit Dominum mali quod locutus est adversum vos.
verses.english: Now therefore, make your ways good and amend your deeds. Obey the voice of the Lord your God, and the Lord will relent from the disaster that He has spoken against you.

verses.latin: Ego autem ecce in manibus vestris sum: facite mihi quod bonum et rectum est in oculis vestris.
verses.english: But as for me, behold, I am in your hands. Do with me whatever seems good and right in your eyes.

verses.latin: Verumtamen scitote et intelligite: quoniam si occideritis me, sanguinem innocentem mittitis super vos, et super civitatem istam, et super habitatores ejus. In veritate enim misit Dominus me ad vos, ut loquerer in auribus vestris omnia verba hæc.
verses.english: Nevertheless, know and understand this: if you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood upon yourselves, upon this city, and upon its inhabitants. For truly, the Lord has sent me to you to speak all these words in your hearing.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt principes et omnis populus ad sacerdotes et ad prophetas: Non est viro huic judicium mortis: quia in nomine Domini Dei nostri locutus est ad nos.
verses.english: Then the princes and all the people said to the priests and to the prophets, “This man does not deserve the sentence of death, for he has spoken to us in the name of the Lord our God.”

verses.latin: Surrexerunt ergo viri de senioribus terræ, et dixerunt ad omnem cœtum populi, loquentes:
verses.english: And some of the elders of the land rose up and spoke to all the assembly of the people, saying:

verses.latin: Michæas Morasthites fuit propheta in diebus Ezechiæ regis Juda, et ait ad omnem populum Juda, dicens: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Sion quasi ager arabitur, et Jerusalem quasi acervus lapidum erit, et mons domus templi quasi excelsa silvarum.
verses.english: “Micah the Morasthite was a prophet in the days of Hezekiah, king of Judah. He said to all the people of Judah, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: Zion shall be plowed like a field; Jerusalem shall become a heap of ruins, and the mountain of the Temple shall be like the wooded high places.’

verses.latin: Numquid interfecit eum Ezechias rex Juda, et omnis Juda? absque timore Domini deprecatus est faciem Domini, et pœnituit Dominum mali quod locutus fuerat adversum eos. Et nos facimus malum grande contra animas nostras.
verses.english: Did Hezekiah, king of Judah, and all Judah put him to death for this prophecy? No! Instead, he feared the Lord and entreated the favor of the Lord, and the Lord relented from the disaster which He had spoken against them. And we ourselves are about to do great harm to our own souls by seeking to kill this prophet.”

verses.latin: Fuit quoque vir prophetans in nomine Domini, Urias filius Semei de Cariathiarim: et prophetavit adversum civitatem istam, et adversum terram istam, juxta omnia verba Jeremiæ.
verses.english: There was also a man who prophesied in the name of the Lord, Uriah the son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim. He prophesied against this city and against this land, according to all the words of Jeremiah.

verses.latin: Et audivit rex Joakim, et universi potentes, et omnes principes verba hæc: et quæsivit rex interficere eum. Et audivit Urias, et timuit, et fugit, et ingressus est Ægyptum.
verses.english: But when King Jehoiakim, and all his mighty men, and all the princes heard these words, the king sought to put him to death. When Uriah heard it, he was afraid, and he fled and went into Egypt.

verses.latin: Et misit rex Joakim viros in Ægyptum, Elnathan filium Achobor, et viros cum eo in Ægyptum.
verses.english: Then King Jehoiakim sent men into Egypt: Elnathan the son of Achbor, and other men with him into Egypt.

verses.latin: Et eduxerunt Uriam de Ægypto, et adduxerunt eum ad regem Joakim: et percussit eum gladio, et projecit cadaver ejus in sepulchris filiorum plebis.
verses.english: And they brought Uriah out of Egypt and brought him to King Jehoiakim. The king then struck him down with a sword and cast his dead body into the burial ground of the common people.

verses.latin: Igitur manus Ahicam filii Saphan fuit cum Jeremia, ut non traderetur in manus populi, et interficeretur.
verses.english: Nevertheless, the hand of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, was with Jeremiah, so that he was not delivered into the hands of the people to be put to death. Ahikam’s influence protected Jeremiah.

verses.latin: In principio regni Ioachim filii Josiae regis Juda, factum est verbum hoc ad Jeremiam a Domino, dicens:
verses.english: It was in the beginning of the reign of Joakim, the son of Josiah, who was the king of Judah, that this message from the Lord came to Jeremiah.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus ad me: Fac tibi vincula et jugum, et pones ea in collo tuo:
verses.english: The Lord said to me: "Make yourself literal chains and a wooden yoke, and then put them on your own neck." This was to be a visible sign of a coming servitude.

verses.latin: Et mittes ea ad reges Edom, et Moab, et filiorum Ammon, et Tyri, et Sidonis, in manu nuntiorum, qui veniunt ad Jerusalem ad Sedeciam regem Juda:
verses.english: Then send these chains and this yoke to the kings of Edom, and Moab, and the sons of Ammon, and Tyre, and Sidon. Send them through the hand of the messengers who are coming to Jerusalem, to King Zedekiah of Judah, probably for a council of alliance.

verses.latin: Et praecipies eis ut dicant dominis suis: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Haec dicetis dominis vestris:
verses.english: You shall command these messengers to say to their rulers: "This is what the Lord of all creation, the God of Israel, says. This is what you must tell your own rulers:"

verses.latin: Ego feci terram, et homines, et jumenta, quae sunt super faciem terrae, in fortitudine mea magna, et in brachio meo extento: et dedi eam ei qui placuit in oculis meis.
verses.english: "It was I who made the earth, and its people, and all the animals on the face of the earth, by my great strength and with my powerful outstretched arm. And I have given this earth to whomever I choose to give it to, to rule over."

verses.latin: Et nunc ego dedi omnes terras istas in manu Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis, servi mei: insuper et bestias campi dedi ei ut serviant illi.
verses.english: "And now, I have given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, who is my appointed servant. Moreover, I have also given him the wild animals of the field, so that they too will serve him."

verses.latin: Et servient ei omnes gentes, et filio ejus, et filio filii ejus: donec veniat tempus terrae ejus, et ipsius: et servient ei gentes multae, et reges magni.
verses.english: "All nations will serve him, and his son, and his grandson. They will serve him until the appointed time comes for his own land and for himself. Many nations and great kings will serve him."

verses.latin: Et gens et regnum quod non servierit ipsi Nabuchodonosor regi Babylonis, et quod non subjecerit collum suum sub jugo regis Babylonis, in gladio et fame et peste visitabo super gentem illam, ait Dominus, donec consumam eos in manu ejus.
verses.english: "But any nation or kingdom that will not serve this Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, and that will not put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, I will punish that nation. I will visit them with the sword, and with famine, and with plague,' says the Lord, 'until I have completely destroyed them by his hand.'"

verses.latin: Vos ergo nolite audire prophetas vestros, et divinos, et somniatores, et augures, et maleficos, qui vobiscum loquuntur, dicentes: Non servietis regi Babylonis:
verses.english: "Therefore, do not listen to your false prophets, nor your diviners, nor your dreamers, nor your soothsayers, nor your sorcerers, who speak to you saying: 'You will not serve the king of Babylon!'"

verses.latin: Quia mendacium prophetant vobis, ut longe vos faciant de terra vestra, et ejiciam vos, et pereatis.
verses.english: "For they are prophesying a lie to you. Their goal is to make you be removed far from your own land, so that I may cast you out, and you may utterly perish."

verses.latin: Porro gens quae subjecerit collum suum sub jugo regis Babylonis, et servierit ei, dimittam eam in terra sua, ait Dominus, et colet eam, et habitabit in ea.
verses.english: "However, the nation that *does* put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serves him—I will leave that nation in its own land,' says the Lord, 'and its people will be able to cultivate it and live in it peacefully.'"

verses.latin: Et ad Sedeciam regem Juda locutus sum secundum omnia verba haec, dicens: Subjicite colla vestra sub jugo regis Babylonis, et servite ei et populo ejus, et vivetis.
verses.english: I also spoke to King Zedekiah of Judah according to all these same words, saying: "Put your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon. Serve him and his people, and you will live."

verses.latin: Quare moriemini, tu et populus tuus, gladio, et fame, et peste, sicut locutus est Dominus adversus gentem quae servire noluerit regi Babylonis?
verses.english: Why should you and your people die by the sword, and by famine, and by plague, just as the Lord has spoken against any nation that refuses to serve the king of Babylon? Do not bring this destruction upon yourselves.

verses.latin: Nolite audire verba prophetarum dicentium vobis: Non servietis regi Babylonis: quia mendacium loquuntur vobis.
verses.english: Do not listen to the words of the prophets who are telling you: 'You will not serve the king of Babylon,' because they are speaking a complete lie to you.

verses.latin: Quia non misi eos, dicit Dominus, et ipsi prophetant in nomine meo mendaciter: ut ejiciam vos, et pereatis, tam vos quam prophetae vestri, qui vobis prophetant.
verses.english: "For I have not sent them," says the Lord. "And they are prophesying falsely in my name, so that I may cast you out, and both you and your prophets who prophesy to you may perish."

verses.latin: Locutus sum quoque ad sacerdotes, et ad populum hunc, dicens: Haec dicit Dominus: Nolite audire verba prophetarum, qui prophetant vobis, dicentes: Ecce vasa Domini adducentur de Babylone nunc cito: quia mendacium prophetant vobis.
verses.english: I also spoke to the priests and to this people, saying: "This is what the Lord says: 'Do not listen to the words of the prophets who are prophesying to you, saying: "Behold, the sacred vessels of the Lord will quickly be brought back from Babylon now!" because they are prophesying a lie to you.'"

verses.latin: Nolite eos audire, sed servite regi Babylonis, et vivite: quare enim fieret civitas haec in solitudinem?
verses.english: "Do not listen to them! Instead, serve the king of Babylon, and you will live. For why should this city become a desolate ruin?"

verses.latin: Quod si prophetae sunt, et sermo Domini est in eis, occurrant Domino exercituum, ne eant vasa quae derelicta sunt in domo Domini, et in domo regis Juda, et in Jerusalem, in Babylonem.
verses.english: "But if they truly are prophets, and if the word of the Lord is truly in them, then let them now make supplication to the Lord of all creation! Let them pray that the vessels which are still left in the House of the Lord, and in the house of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem, may not also be carried off to Babylon."

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus exercituum ad columnas, et ad mare, et ad bases, et ad reliqua vasorum, quae remanserunt in civitate hac,
verses.english: For this is what the Lord of all creation says concerning the great pillars, and concerning the large bronze basin called 'the Sea,' and concerning the bases that supported the lavers, and concerning the rest of the vessels that still remain in this city.

verses.latin: quae non tulit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, quando transtulit Jechoniam filium Joakim regem Juda de Jerusalem in Babylonem, et omnes optimates Juda et Jerusalem:
verses.english: These are the items that Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, did not take when he carried away Jeconiah, the son of Joakim, who was the king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël, ad vasa, quae derelicta sunt in domo Domini, et in domo regis Juda, et Jerusalem:
verses.english: Indeed, this is what the Lord of all creation, the God of Israel, says concerning those vessels that are still left in the House of the Lord, and in the house of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem:

verses.latin: In Babylonem transferentur, et ibi erunt usque ad diem visitationis eorum, ait Dominus: et afferri faciam ea, et restitui in loco isto.
verses.english: "They will be carried to Babylon, and there they will remain until the day I intervene and visit them," says the Lord. "Then I will cause them to be brought back from Babylon and fully restored to this holy place."

verses.latin: Et factum est in anno illo, in principio regni Sedeciæ regis Juda, in anno quarto, in mense quinto, venit Ananias filius Azur, propheta de Gabaon, ad me in domum Domini coram sacerdotibus et omni populo loquens,
verses.english: It came to pass in that year, at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah, king of Judah, specifically in the fourth year, in the fifth month, that Hananiah, the son of Azur, a prophet from Gibeon, came to me, Jeremiah, in the Temple of the Lord, speaking before the priests and all the people.

verses.latin: dicens: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Contrivi jugum regis Babylonis.
verses.english: Hananiah said: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon!

verses.latin: Adhuc duo anni dierum, et ego referri faciam ad locum istum omnia vasa domus Domini quæ tulit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis de loco isto, et transtulit ea in Babylonem.
verses.english: Within two full years, I will cause all the sacred vessels of the Temple of the Lord, which Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, took from this very place and carried away to Babylon, to be brought back to this place.

verses.latin: Et Jechoniam filium Joakim regem Juda, et omnes captivos Juda qui ingressi sunt in Babylonem, ego convertam ad locum istum, ait Dominus: quoniam conteram jugum regis Babylonis.
verses.english: And King Jeconiah, the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, along with all the people of Judah who were carried into captivity in Babylon—I will bring them back to this place,” says the Lord. “For I will shatter the yoke of the king of Babylon.”

verses.latin: Et ait Jeremias propheta ad prophetam Ananiam, coram sacerdotibus et in conspectu omnis populi qui stabat in domo Domini:
verses.english: Then Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Hananiah the prophet, in the presence of the priests and all the people who were standing in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: et dixit Jeremias propheta: Amen, sic faciat Dominus: suscitet Dominus verba tua quæ prophetasti, ut referri faciat vasa in domum Domini, et omnem transmigrationem de Babylone ad locum istum.
verses.english: Jeremiah the prophet said: “So be it! May the Lord do as you have said! May the Lord fulfill your words which you have prophesied, that He may bring back the sacred vessels to the Temple of the Lord, and all the exiles from Babylon to this very place.

verses.latin: Verumtamen hoc verbum quod ego loquor in auribus tuis et in auribus universi populi, hoc audi:
verses.english: Nevertheless, hear this word that I speak in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people.

verses.latin: Prophetæ qui fuerunt ante me et ante te ex principio, et prophetaverunt super terras multas et super regna magna de bello, et de afflictione, et de fame.
verses.english: The prophets who were before me and before you, from ancient times, prophesied concerning many lands and great kingdoms about war, disaster, and famine.

verses.latin: Propheta qui vaticinatur pacem: quando venerit verbum ejus, et impletum fuerit quod prophetaverat, tunc scietur propheta an Dominus miserit eum.
verses.english: But the prophet who prophesies peace—when his word comes to pass and what he has prophesied is fulfilled, then it will be known if the Lord truly sent that prophet.”

verses.latin: Et tulit Ananias propheta jugum de collo Jeremiæ prophetæ, et confregit illud:
verses.english: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke from the neck of Jeremiah the prophet and broke it.

verses.latin: et ait in conspectu omnis populi, dicens: Hæc dicit Dominus: Sic confringam jugum Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis post duos annos dierum, ab omnium gentium cervicibus.
verses.english: And he said in the presence of all the people: “Thus says the Lord: So will I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, from the necks of all the nations within two full years.” After this declaration, the people were encouraged to trust Hananiah's words.

verses.latin: Et abiit Jeremias propheta in viam suam.
verses.english: And Jeremiah the prophet went on his way.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad Jeremiam postquam confregisset Ananias propheta jugum de collo Jeremiæ prophetæ, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah after Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke from the neck of Jeremiah the prophet, saying:

verses.latin: Vade, et dic Ananiæ: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Jugum ligneum confregisti, et facies pro eo jugum ferreum.
verses.english: “Go and say to Hananiah: ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: You have broken a wooden yoke, but in its place, you will have a yoke of iron.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Jugum ferreum imposui super collum omnium gentium istarum, ut serviant Nabuchodonosor regi Babylonis, et servient ei: insuper et bestias terræ dedi ei.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: I have placed an iron yoke upon the neck of all these nations, so that they must serve Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, and they will serve him. Moreover, I have also given him the wild animals of the field.’”

verses.latin: Et dixit Jeremias propheta ad Ananiam prophetam: Audi, Anania: non misit te Dominus, et tu fecisti confidere populum istum in mendacio.
verses.english: And Jeremiah the prophet said to Hananiah the prophet: “Listen, Hananiah! The Lord has not sent you, and by your lies, you have made this people put their trust in a falsehood.

verses.latin: Idcirco hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce ego mittam te a facie terræ: hoc anno morieris: quia adversum Dominum locutus es.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, I will remove you from the face of the earth. This very year you shall die, because you have spoken words of rebellion against the Lord.’”

verses.latin: Et mortuus est Ananias propheta in anno illo, in mense septimo.
verses.english: And Hananiah the prophet died that same year, in the seventh month, just as Jeremiah had prophesied.

verses.latin: Haec sunt verba libri, quae misit Jeremias propheta de Jerusalem ad reliquias seniorum transmigrationis, et ad sacerdotes, et ad prophetas, et ad omnem populum, quem traduxerat Nabuchodonosor de Jerusalem in Babylonem:
verses.english: These are the words from the book that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem. It was addressed to the remaining elders who had been taken into exile, as well as to the priests, the prophets, and all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had led from Jerusalem into Babylon.

verses.latin: postquam egressus est Jechonias rex, et domina, et eunuchi, et principes Juda et Jerusalem, et fabri, et inclusores de Jerusalem.
verses.english: This message was sent after King Jeconiah, the queen mother, the court officials, the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, and the craftsmen and skilled workers had all been taken from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: In manu Elasa filii Saphan, et Gamariae filii Helciae, quos misit Sedecias rex Juda ad Nabuchodonosor regem Babylonis in Babylonem, dicens:
verses.english: The letter was carried by Elasah, the son of Shaphan, and Gemariah, the son of Hilkiah. These men had been sent by King Zedekiah of Judah to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, in Babylon. The letter said:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël, omni transmigrationi, quam transmigravi de Jerusalem in Babylonem:
verses.english: This is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says to all the exiles, all of whom I caused to be taken into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon:

verses.latin: Aedificate domos, et habitate: et plantate hortos, et comedite fructum eorum.
verses.english: Build houses and live in them. Plant gardens and eat the fruit they produce.

verses.latin: Accipite uxores, et generate filios et filias: et date filiis vestris uxores, et filias vestras date viris, et pariant filios et filias: et multiplicamini ibi, et nolite pauci fieri.
verses.english: Take wives and have sons and daughters. Give your sons wives, and give your daughters to husbands, so that they may bear sons and daughters. Multiply there in Babylon, and do not let your numbers diminish.

verses.latin: Et quaerite pacem civitatis, ad quam transmigrare vos feci, et orate pro ea ad Dominum: quia in pace illius erit et pax vobis.
verses.english: Also, seek the peace and prosperity of the city where I have caused you to be taken into exile. Pray to the Lord for that city, because your own peace will depend on its peace.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Non vos seducant prophetae vestri qui sunt in medio vestrum, et divini vestri: et ne attendatis ad somnia vestra quae somniatis:
verses.english: For this is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says: Do not let your own prophets who are among you, or your diviners, deceive you. Do not listen to the dreams you cause to have or interpret for yourselves.

verses.latin: quia mendaciter prophetant vobis in nomine meo: non misi eos, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: For they prophesy lies to you in My name. I have not sent them, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus: Cum cœperint impleri in Babylone septuaginta anni, visitabo vos: et suscitabo super vos verbum meum bonum, ut reducam vos ad locum istum.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord says: When Babylon's seventy years begin to be completed, I will visit you. I will bring about My good promise to you, that I will bring you back to this place.

verses.latin: Ego enim scio cogitationes meas, quas cogito super vos, ait Dominus, cogitationes pacis et non afflictionis: ut dem vobis finem et patientiam.
verses.english: For I know My plans, which I plan for you, says the Lord. They are plans of peace and not of affliction, to give you a hopeful future and an expected end.

verses.latin: Et invocabitis me, et ibitis: et orabitis me, et ego exaudiam vos.
verses.english: Then you will call upon Me, and you will come and pray to Me, and I will hear you.

verses.latin: Et quaeretis me, et invenietis: cum quaesieritis me in toto corde vestro.
verses.english: You will seek Me and find Me when you seek Me with all your heart.
