verses.latin: Et inveniar a vobis, ait Dominus: et reducam captivitatem vestram, et congregabo vos de cunctis gentibus, et de universis locis ad quae expuli vos, dicit Dominus: et reducam vos de loco ad quem transmigrare vos feci.
verses.english: And I will be found by you, says the Lord. I will restore you from your captivity and gather you from all the nations and from all the places to which I have driven you out, says the Lord. I will bring you back from the place to which I caused you to go into exile.

verses.latin: Quia dixistis: suscitavit nobis Dominus prophetas in Babylone.
verses.english: You say, 'The Lord has raised up for us prophets in Babylon!'

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus super regem qui sedet super solium David, et super omnem populum habitatorem civitatis hujus, fratres vestros qui non egressi sunt vobiscum in transmigrationem:
verses.english: But this is what the Lord says concerning the king who sits on David's throne, and concerning all the people who dwell in this city—your brethren who did not go out with you into exile:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum: Ecce ego mittam in eos gladium, et famem, et pestem: et ponam eos quasi ficus malas, quae comedi non possunt, eo quod sint pessimae:
verses.english: This is what the Lord of Armies says: Behold, I will send upon them the sword, and famine, and pestilence. I will make them like vile figs, which cannot be eaten because they are so bad.

verses.latin: et persequar eos in gladio, et fame, et peste: et dabo eos in vexationem universis regnis terrae: in maledictionem, et in stuporem, et in sibilum, et in opprobrium cunctis gentibus, ad quas ejeci eos:
verses.english: I will pursue them with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence. I will make them a terror to all the kingdoms of the earth, a curse, an astonishment, a hiss, and a reproach among all the nations to which I have driven them out.

verses.latin: eo quod non audierunt verba mea, dicit Dominus, quae misi ad eos per servos meos prophetas, de nocte consurgens, et mittens, et non audistis, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: This will happen because they have not listened to My words, says the Lord. They did not hear the messages I sent to them by My servants the prophets, though I was diligent in sending them. And you yourselves did not listen, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Vos ergo audite verbum Domini, omnis transmigratio, quam emisi de Jerusalem in Babylonem.
verses.english: Therefore, hear the word of the Lord, all you exiles, all whom I have sent from Jerusalem into Babylon.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël, ad Achab filium Coliae, et ad Sedeciam filium Maasiae, qui prophetant vobis mendaciter in nomine meo: Ecce ego tradam eos in manus Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis, et percutiet eos in oculis vestris.
verses.english: This is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says concerning Ahab, the son of Kolaiah, and concerning Zedekiah, the son of Maaseiah, who prophesy lies to you in My name: Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar, King of Babylon, and he will strike them down before your very eyes.

verses.latin: Et assumetur de eis maledictio ab omni transmigratione Juda, quae est in Babylone, dicentium: Ponat te Dominus sicut Sedeciam, et sicut Achab, quos frixit rex Babylonis in igne:
verses.english: And from them will be taken a curse by all the exiles of Judah who are in Babylon. They will say, 'May the Lord make you like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the King of Babylon burned in the fire!'

verses.latin: eo quod fecerint stultitiam in Israël, et fornicati sunt cum uxoribus civium suorum, et locuti sunt verbum in nomine meo mendaciter, quod non mandavi eis: ego sum judex et testis, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: This will happen because they have committed foolishness in Israel. They have committed adultery with their neighbors' wives and have spoken a word falsely in My name, which I did not command them. I am the Judge and the Witness, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et ad Semeiam Nehelamitem dices:
verses.english: And to Shemaiah the Nehelamite you shall say:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël, pro eo quod misisti libros in nomine tuo ad omnem populum qui est in Jerusalem, et ad Sophoniam filium Maasiae sacerdotem, et ad universos sacerdotes, dicens:
verses.english: This is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says: Because you have sent letters in your own name to all the people who are in Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah, the son of Maaseiah, the priest, and to all the other priests, saying:

verses.latin: Dominus dedit te sacerdotem pro Jojada sacerdote, ut sis dux et omnis viri furentis et prophetantis, et mittas eum in nervo, et in carcerem.
verses.english: 'The Lord has appointed you as priest in place of Jehoiada the priest, so that you should be an officer over every madman and prophet, and should put him in the stocks and in prison!'

verses.latin: Et nunc quare non objurgasti Jeremiam Anathothiten, qui prophetat vobis?
verses.english: 'So now, why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who prophesies to you?'

verses.latin: Quia pro hoc misit ad nos in Babylonem, dicens: Longe est, ædificate domos, et habitate: et plantate hortos, et comedite fructus eorum.
verses.english: Shemaiah's letter continued: 'Because for this very reason he sent to us in Babylon, saying: 'It is a long time; build houses and live in them; and plant gardens and eat their produce.''

verses.latin: Legerat ergo Sophonias sacerdos librum istum in auribus Jeremiae prophetae.
verses.english: Then Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the hearing of Jeremiah the prophet.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad Jeremiam, dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying:

verses.latin: Mitte ad omnem transmigrationem, dicens: Haec dicit Dominus ad Semeiam Nehelamitem: Pro eo quod prophetavit vobis Semeias, et ego non misi eum: et fecit vos confidere in mendacio:
verses.english: Send a message to all the exiles, saying: 'This is what the Lord says concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, though I did not send him, and has caused you to trust in a lie,'

verses.latin: propterea haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego visitabo super Semeiam Nehelamitem, et super semen ejus: non erit illi vir sedens in medio populi hujus, et non videbit bonum, quod ego faciam populo meo, ait Dominus: quia adversum Dominum locutus est.
verses.english: 'therefore this is what the Lord says: Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his descendants. He shall not have a man to dwell among this people, nor shall he see the good that I will do for My people, says the Lord, because he has spoken rebellion against the Lord.'

verses.latin: Verbum quod factum est ad Jeremiam a Domino, dicens:
verses.english: This is the prophetic message that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus Israel, dicens: Scribe tibi omnes sermones, quos locutus sum ad te, in libro.
verses.english: This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: 'Write down all the words I have spoken to you in a scroll, for future generations.'

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et convertam conversionem populi mei Israel et Juda, dicit Dominus: et convertam eos ad terram quam dedi patribus eorum, et possidebunt eam.
verses.english: For behold, days are surely coming, declares the Lord, when I will reverse the captivity and restore My people, both Israel and Judah, declares the Lord. I will bring them back to the very land that I gave to their ancestors, and they will possess it once again, in lasting peace.

verses.latin: Haec ergo sunt verba, quae locutus est Dominus ad Israel et ad Judam.
verses.english: These, then, are the specific words that the Lord has spoken concerning both the northern kingdom of Israel and the southern kingdom of Judah.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus: Vocem terroris audivimus: formido et non pax.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord says: 'We have heard a terrifying cry, a sound of utter dread and not of peace.'

verses.latin: Interrogate et videte si parit mas? quare ergo vidistis virum manum suam super clunem suam quasi parturientem, et omnis facies eorum conversa est in amaritudinem?
verses.english: Ask now, and observe: can a man give birth? Why then do I see every man with his hands on his loins, like a woman in labor, and every face turned pale with bitter anguish, as if in the throes of death?

verses.latin: Heu, quia magna dies illa, nec est similis ejus: et tempus tribulationis est Jacob, et de ipso salvabitur.
verses.english: Alas! For that day is great and terrible; there is no other like it. It is a time of extreme distress for Jacob—a period of unparalleled tribulation for God's chosen people—yet, in the end, he will be saved out of it.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa, ait Dominus exercituum: conteram jugum ejus de collo tuo, et vincula tua disrumpam: et non dominabuntur ei ultra alieni:
verses.english: And it will come to pass in that day, declares the Lord of hosts, that I will break the yoke of foreign oppression from your neck and tear off your bonds. Strangers will no longer make you their slaves or rule over you.

verses.latin: Sed servient Domino Deo suo, et David regi suo, quem suscitabo eis.
verses.english: Instead, they will serve the Lord their God and David their king—the Messiah, the true King from David's line—whom I will raise up for them to rule eternally.

verses.latin: Tu ergo ne timeas, serve meus Jacob, ait Dominus, neque formides, Israel: quia ecce ego salvabo te de terra longinqua, et semen tuum de terra captivitatis: et revertetur Jacob, et quiescet et prosperabitur, et non erit qui exterreat.
verses.english: Therefore, do not fear, My servant Jacob, declares the Lord, nor be dismayed, O Israel; for behold, I will save you from a distant land of exile, and your offspring from the land of their captivity. Jacob will return, find rest and security, and thrive, and no one will make him afraid or cause him terror.

verses.latin: Quoniam tecum ego sum, ait Dominus, ut salvem te: consummabo enim cunctas gentes, in quibus dispersi te: te vero non consummabo, sed castigabo te in judicio, nec quasi innocenti parcam tibi.
verses.english: For I am with you, declares the Lord, to save you. I will bring to a complete and utter end all the nations among whom I have scattered you. But I will not bring you to an utter end; rather, I will discipline you with precise justice, and I will by no means spare you as if you were innocent of sin.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus: Incurabilis est fractura tua, pessima plaga tua.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord says: 'Your brokenness seems incurable; your wound is a most grievous affliction.'

verses.latin: Non est qui judicet judicium tuum ad sanitatem: diligentium te nemo curavit te.
verses.english: There is no one to plead your case or to bring about your healing; among all those who once claimed to love you, no one has truly cared for your recovery.

verses.latin: Omnes amatores tui obliti sunt tui, te non quaerunt: plaga enim inimici percussi te, castigatione crudeli, propter multitudinem iniquitatum tuarum, dura sunt peccata tua.
verses.english: All your former allies and lovers have forgotten you; they do not seek you out now in your distress. For I myself have struck you with the blow of an enemy, with cruel chastisement, because of the multitude of your iniquities and the severity of your hardened sins.

verses.latin: Quid clamitas super contritione tua? incurabilis est dolor tuus: propter multitudinem iniquitatum tuarum, et dura peccata tua feci haec tibi.
verses.english: Why do you cry out over your crushing blow? Your pain seems incurable. Because of the multitude of your iniquities and your severe sins, I have done these things to you; this is the consequence of your actions.

verses.latin: Propter hoc omnes qui comedunt te, devorabuntur: et universi hostes tui in captivitatem ducentur: et qui te praedantur, praeda erunt: et omnes vastatores tui in vastitatem dabo.
verses.english: Therefore, all who devour you will themselves be devoured; and all your adversaries, every single one of your enemies, will be led away into captivity. Those who plundered you will become plunder, and all who ravaged you I will give over to utter desolation and ruination.

verses.latin: Quia obducam cicatricem tibi, et a plagis tuis sanabo te, dicit Dominus: quia Repulsa vocaverunt te, Sion ista, et non est qui requirat eam.
verses.english: For I will restore health to you and heal you of your deep wounds, declares the Lord, because they have called you 'Outcast Zion,' saying, 'This is Zion, and there is no one who cares for her or seeks her welfare.'

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego convertam conversionem domorum Jacob, et tabernacula ejus miserebor: et aedificabitur civitas in excelso suo, et templum juxta ordinem suum fundabitur.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord: 'Behold, I will reverse the captivity of Jacob's dwellings and have compassion on his tents, restoring them to their former glory. The city will be rebuilt on its ancient mound, and the Holy Temple will be established according to its proper design and divine order.'

verses.latin: Et egredietur de eis laus, voxque ludentium: et multiplicabo eos, et non minuentur: et glorificabo eos, et non attenuabuntur.
verses.english: From them will emanate songs of thanksgiving and the joyful sound of those who celebrate. I will multiply their numbers, and they will not decrease; I will bring them glory, and they will not be diminished or brought low.

verses.latin: Et erunt filii ejus sicut a principio, et conventus ejus coram me permanebit: et visitabo super omnes qui tribulant eum.
verses.english: And their children will be as they were in days of old, and their community will be established and secure before My presence. I will then visit My judgment upon all who oppress them and cause them tribulation.

verses.latin: Et erit dux ejus ex eo, et princeps de medio ejus procedet: et applicabo eum, et accedet ad me: quis enim hic est qui applicet cor suum ut appropinquet mihi? ait Dominus.
verses.english: Their ruler will be one of their own, a native, and their sovereign will come forth from their midst. I will bring him near, and he will approach Me directly. For who is this, declares the Lord, who would dare to risk his very life and dedicate his heart to draw near to Me as an intermediary?

verses.latin: Et eritis mihi in populum, et ego ero vobis in Deum.
verses.english: And you will once again be My people, and I will truly be your God, in a renewed covenant.

verses.latin: Ecce turbo Domini, furor egrediens, tempestas perennans super caput impiorum veniet.
verses.english: Behold, the whirlwind of the Lord, His fierce wrath bursting forth, a continuing storm, will come crashing down upon the heads of the wicked.

verses.latin: Non avertetur furor irae Domini, donec faciat et impleat cogitationem cordis sui: in novissimis diebus intelligetis ea.
verses.english: The fierce anger of the Lord will not turn back until He has accomplished and completely carried out the intentions and purposes of His heart. In the last days, you will understand these things clearly and fully.

verses.latin: In tempore illo, ait Dominus, ero Deus universis cognationibus Israël, et ipsi erunt mihi in populum.
verses.english: In that time, the Lord declares, I will be the God of all the tribes of Israel, and they will be My people.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Invenit gratiam in deserto populus qui remanserat gladio: vadet ad requiem suam Israël.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: The people who survived the sword found grace and favor in the desert. Israel will journey to its place of rest.

verses.latin: Longe apparuit ei Dominus. Et in caritate perpetua dilexi te: ideo attraxi te miserans.
verses.english: The Lord appeared to them from far away. He said, 'I have loved you, My people, with an everlasting love, a love that continues forever. That is why I have drawn you to Myself with steadfast mercy.'

verses.latin: Et ædificabo te rursum, et ædificaberis, virgo Israël: adhuc ornaberis tympanis tuis, et egredieris in choro ludentium.
verses.english: And I will build you up again, and you will be built up, O virgin Israel, a nation restored to purity. You will again adorn yourself with your tambourines, and you will go forth in the joyful dance of those celebrating.

verses.latin: Adhuc plantabis vineas in montibus Samariæ: plantabunt plantantes, et colent.
verses.english: You will again plant vineyards on the mountains of Samaria. Those who plant them will enjoy their fruits, and they will cultivate them securely, free from fear.

verses.latin: Quia erit dies, in qua clamabunt custodes in monte Ephraim: Surgite, et ascendamus in Sion ad Dominum Deum nostrum.
verses.english: For there will be a day when the watchmen on the mountain of Ephraim will call out, saying: 'Arise! Let us go up to Zion, to the Lord our God!'

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus: Exsultate in lætitia super Jacob, et hinnite inter capita gentium: personate, et laudate, et dicite: Salva, Domine, populum tuum, reliquias Israël.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord says: Sing with great joy over Jacob, and shout among the chief nations. Proclaim, praise, and say: 'Save, O Lord, Your people, the remnant of Israel!'

verses.latin: Ecce ego adducam eos de terra aquilonis, et congregabo eos de finibus terræ: inter quos erunt cæcus et claudus, et prægnans et pariens simul, cœtus magnus revertentium huc.
verses.english: Behold, I will bring them from the land of the north, and gather them from the farthest ends of the earth. Among them will be the blind and the lame, the pregnant woman and the one giving birth, all together—a great assembly of those returning here.

verses.latin: In fletu venient, et in consolatione adducam eos: et adducam eos per torrentes aquarum in via recta, et non impingent in ea: quia factus sum Israël pater, et Ephraim primogenitus meus est.
verses.english: They will come with weeping for their past sins, but I will lead them with comfort. I will guide them by streams of water on a straight path where they will not stumble. For I have become a Father to Israel, and Ephraim is My firstborn son, treated with special favor.

verses.latin: Audite verbum Domini, gentes, et annuntiate in insulis quæ procul sunt, et dicite: Qui dispersit Israël congregabit eum, et custodiet eum sicut pastor gregem suum.
verses.english: Hear the word of the Lord, O nations, and declare it in the distant islands, and say: 'He who scattered Israel will gather him, and He will guard him like a shepherd guards his flock.'

verses.latin: Quoniam redemit Dominus Jacob, et liberavit eum de manu potentioris.
verses.english: For the Lord has redeemed Jacob and has set him free from the hand of one stronger than himself.

verses.latin: Et venient, et laudabunt in monte Sion: et confluent ad bona Domini, super frumentum, vinum, et oleum, et fœtus pecorum et armentorum, et erit anima eorum quasi hortus irriguus, et ultra non esurient.
verses.english: And they will come and sing praises on Mount Zion. They will stream together to receive the good things from the Lord: abundant grain, new wine, and oil, and the young of flocks and herds. Their souls will be like a well-watered garden, and they will hunger no more, neither physically nor spiritually.

verses.latin: Tunc lætabitur virgo in choro, juvenes et senes simul: et convertam luctum eorum in gaudium, et consolabor eos, et lætificabo a tristitia eorum.
verses.english: Then the virgin nation will rejoice in the dance, and young men and old men will celebrate together. For I will turn their mourning into joy. I will comfort them and make them glad instead of sad.

verses.latin: Et inebriabo animam sacerdotum pinguedine: et populus meus bonis meis adimplebitur, ait Dominus.
verses.english: And I will satisfy the souls of the priests with rich abundance, and My people will be filled with My good things, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Vox in excelso audita est lamentationis, fletus, et luctus: Rachel plorans filios suos, et nolens consolari super eis, quia non sunt.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: A voice is heard in Ramah, a sound of bitter lamentation, weeping, and deep sorrow. Rachel is weeping for her children and refuses to be comforted for them, because they are no longer present.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Quiescat vox tua a ploratu, et oculi tui a lacrimis: quia est merces operi tuo, ait Dominus: et revertentur de terra inimici.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: Restrain your voice from weeping and your eyes from tears. For there is a reward for your labor and suffering, declares the Lord. Your children will return from the land of the enemy.

verses.latin: Et est spes novissimis tuis, ait Dominus: et revertentur filii ad fines suos.
verses.english: And there is hope for your future, declares the Lord. Your children will return to their own territory and borders.

verses.latin: Audiens audivi Ephraim translatum: Castigasti me, et eruditus sum ut juvenculus indomitus. Converte me, et convertar: quia tu es Dominus Deus meus.
verses.english: I have clearly heard Ephraim lamenting: 'You have disciplined me, and I have learned my lesson like an untamed young bull that must be broken. Turn me back to You, and I will be restored, for You are the Lord my God.'

verses.latin: Postquam enim convertisti me, egi pœnitentiam: et postquam ostendisti mihi, percussi femur meum. Confusus sum, et erubui, quoniam sustinui opprobrium adolescentiæ meæ.
verses.english: Indeed, after You turned me back, I repented. And after You showed me my errors, I struck my thigh in deep regret and sorrow. I was ashamed and disgraced, for I bore the reproach and consequences of my youthful rebellion.

verses.latin: Si filius honorabilis est mihi Ephraim, si puer deliciarum: ex quo locutus sum de eo, adhuc recordabor ejus. Propter hoc conturbata sunt viscera mea super eum: miserans miserebor ejus, ait Dominus.
verses.english: Is not Ephraim My precious son? Is he not a delightful child to Me? For as often as I speak concerning him, I still remember him with love and tenderness. Because of this, My innermost being yearns for him; I will surely have abundant mercy on him, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Statue tibi speculas, pone tibi amaritudines: dirige cor tuum in viam rectam, viam in qua ambulasti: Revertere, virgo Israël, revertere ad civitates tuas.
verses.english: Set up signposts for yourself, place markers for guidance to the way back. Direct your heart toward the straight path, the way in which you once walked obediently. Return, O virgin Israel, return to your cities.

verses.latin: Usquequo fluctuabis deliciis, filia apostata? Quia creavit Dominus novum super terram: Femina circumdabit virum.
verses.english: How long will you waver and wander aimlessly in your desires, O faithless daughter? For the Lord has created a new thing on the earth: A woman will encompass a man. This signifies a unique and unprecedented new order established by God, often understood as a spiritual reversal or a prophecy pointing towards the Incarnation of Christ.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Adhuc dicent verbum istud in terra Juda, et in urbibus ejus, cum convertero captivitatem eorum: Benedicat tibi Dominus, pulchritudo justitiæ, mons sanctus.
verses.english: This is what the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Again they will speak this word in the land of Judah and in its cities, when I restore their captivity: 'May the Lord bless you, O dwelling place of righteousness, O holy mountain of Zion!'

verses.latin: Et habitabunt in illo Juda et omnes civitates ejus simul, agricolæ et minantes greges.
verses.english: And Judah and all its cities will dwell there together, both farmers and those who lead flocks.

verses.latin: Quia inebriavi animam sitientem: et omnem animam esurientem saturavi.
verses.english: For I have satisfied the thirsty soul, and I have filled every hungry soul with good things.

verses.latin: Ideo quasi de somno excitatus sum, et vidi, et somnus meus dulcis mihi.
verses.english: At this, I awoke, as if from a deep vision or a blessed sleep, and I looked around. My sleep had been sweet and refreshing to me.

verses.latin: Ecce dies veniunt, ait Dominus: et seminabo domum Israël, et domum Juda semine hominum et semine pecorum.
verses.english: Behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of men and the seed of animals, causing them to multiply abundantly.

verses.latin: Et sicut vigilavi super eos, ut evellerem, et destruerem, et dissiparem, et disperderem, et affligerem: sic vigilabo super eos, ut ædificem, et plantem, ait Dominus.
verses.english: And just as I watched over them with vigilance to pluck up, to tear down, to demolish, to destroy, and to afflict, so will I watch over them to build and to plant, declares the Lord. My active hand will be for their good.

verses.latin: In diebus illis non dicent ultra: Patres comederunt uvam acerbam, et dentes filiorum obstupescunt.
verses.english: In those days, they will no longer say the proverb: 'The fathers ate sour grapes, and the children's teeth were set on edge,' blaming past generations for their own suffering.

verses.latin: Sed unusquisque in iniquitate sua morietur: omnis homo qui comederit uvam acerbam, obstupescent dentes ejus.
verses.english: Instead, each one will die for his own iniquity. Every person who eats sour grapes—his own teeth will be set on edge, for he will bear the consequences of his own actions.

verses.latin: Ecce dies veniunt, ait Dominus, et feriam domui Israël, et domui Juda fœdus novum:
verses.english: Behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah.

verses.latin: Non secundum pactum quod pepigi cum patribus eorum in die qua apprehendi manum eorum ut educerem eos de terra Ægypti, pactum quod irritum fecerunt: et ego dominatus sum eorum, ait Dominus.
verses.english: This new covenant will not be like the covenant I made with their fathers on the day I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt—that covenant which they broke and rendered void, even though I was their Lord and Master, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Sed hoc erit pactum quod feriam cum domo Israël, post dies illos, ait Dominus: Dabo legem meam in visceribus eorum, et in corde eorum scribam eam: et ero eis in Deum, et ipsi erunt mihi in populum.
verses.english: But this will be the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, declares the Lord: I will put My law within their inner being, and I will write it on their hearts, making it an internal spiritual guide. And I will be their God, and they will be My people.

verses.latin: Et non docebit ultra vir proximum suum, et vir fratrem suum, dicens: Cognosce Dominum: quia omnes cognoscent me a minimo eorum usque ad maximum, ait Dominus: quia propitiabor iniquitati eorum, et peccati eorum ultra non memorabor.
verses.english: And no longer will each man need to teach his neighbor, or each man teach his brother, saying: 'Know the Lord!' For they will all know Me intimately, from the least of them to the greatest, declares the Lord. For I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more at all.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus, qui dat solem in lumine diei, lunam et stellas in lumine noctis, qui turbat mare, et sonant fluctus ejus: Dominus exercituum nomen illi.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says, who gives the sun for the light of day, and the moon and stars for the light of night; who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar—the Lord of hosts is His name, indicating His power over all creation.

verses.latin: Si defecerint leges istæ a facie mea, ait Dominus: tunc et semen Israël deficiet, ut non sit gens coram me cunctis diebus.
verses.english: If these fixed laws of nature for the sun, moon, and stars should cease from before Me, declares the Lord, then also the offspring of Israel will cease from being a nation before Me for all days. This is a promise of Israel's eternal existence as a people.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Si mensurari potuerit cælum sursum, et investigari fundamenta terræ deorsum: et ego abjiciam omne semen Israël propter omnia quæ fecerunt, ait Dominus.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: If the universe above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth below can be explored, then I would also cast away all the offspring of Israel because of all they have done, declares the Lord. As the former is impossible, so is the latter.

verses.latin: Ecce dies veniunt, ait Dominus: et ædificabitur civitas Domino a turre Hanameel usque ad portam Anguli.
verses.english: Behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when the city of Jerusalem will be rebuilt for the Lord, extending from the Tower of Hananeel all the way to the Corner Gate.

verses.latin: Et exiet ultra regulam funiculi per omnem collem Gareb, et circuibit Goatha.
verses.english: And the measuring line will go out further, beyond the normal boundary, encompassing all the hill of Gareb and encircling Goath.

verses.latin: Et omnis vallis cadaverum et cineris, et omnis regio Hameel usque ad torrentem Cedron, et usque ad angulum portæ equorum orientalis, sanctum Domini: non evelletur, et non destruetur ultra in perpetuum.
verses.english: And the entire valley of dead bodies and ashes, a place once of waste and defilement, and all the region of Hammeel up to the Kidron Valley, and as far as the corner of the Horse Gate toward the east, will be holy to the Lord. It will not be uprooted or destroyed again, ever.

verses.latin: Verbum quod factum est ad Ieremiam a Domino, anno decimo Sedeciae regis Iudae: ipse est annus decimus octavus Nabuchodonosor.
verses.english: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah in the tenth year of King Zedekiah of Judah—which was also the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar’s reign.

verses.latin: Tunc exercitus regis Babylonis obsidebat Ierusalem: et Ieremias propheta erat clausus in vestibulo carceris, quod erat in domo regis Iuda.
verses.english: At that time, the Babylonian king's army was besieging Jerusalem. Jeremiah the prophet was imprisoned in the courtyard of the guard, which was located at the king of Judah’s palace.

verses.latin: Obtexerat enim eum Sedecias rex Iuda, dicens: Quare prophetas, dicens: Haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego tradam civitatem hanc in manu regis Babylonis, et capiet eam:
verses.english: King Zedekiah of Judah had locked Jeremiah up, asking, 'Why do you prophesy, saying: ‘This is what the Lord says: I am about to hand this city over to the king of Babylon, and he will capture it’?'

verses.latin: et Sedecias rex Iuda non effugiet de manu Chaldaeorum, sed tradetur in manu regis Babylonis, et loquetur os eius cum ore eius, et oculi eius oculos eius videbunt:
verses.english: ‘And King Zedekiah of Judah will not escape from the Chaldeans; instead, he will certainly be handed over to the king of Babylon. He will speak with him face to face, and see him eye to eye.’

verses.latin: et in Babylonem ducet Sedeciam, et ibi erit, donec visitem eum, ait Dominus: si enim pugnaveritis adversum Chaldaeos, nihil prosperum habebitis.
verses.english: ‘He will lead Zedekiah away to Babylon, and Zedekiah will remain there until I pay him attention,’ declares the Lord. ‘If you fight against the Chaldeans, you will have no success at all.’

verses.latin: Et dixit Ieremias: Factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: Then Jeremiah said: 'The word of the Lord came to me, saying:'

verses.latin: Ecce Hanameel, filius Sellum patrui tui, veniet ad te, dicens: Eme tibi agrum meum, qui est in Anathoth: tibi enim competit ex propinquitate ut emas.
verses.english: ‘Listen, Hanamel, the son of your uncle Shallum, is coming to you with an offer. He will tell you to buy his field, which is in Anathoth, because you have the right to redeem it by your family connection.’

verses.latin: Et venit ad me Hanameel filius patrui mei, secundum verbum Domini, ad atrium carceris, et ait ad me: Posside agrum meum, qui est in Anathoth, in terra Beniamin: quia tibi competit hereditas, et tu emptor es. Posside igitur. Et intellexi quia verbum Domini esset.
verses.english: Then my cousin Hanamel came to me in the courtyard of the guard, just as the Lord had foretold. He said to me, ‘Buy my field that is in Anathoth, in the land of Benjamin. You have the right to inherit it and to buy it. So take possession of it!’ And I understood that this was indeed the word from the Lord.

verses.latin: Et emi agrum ab Hanameel filio patrui mei, qui erat in Anathoth: et appendi ei argentum, septem stateres, et decem argenteos.
verses.english: So I bought the field from my cousin Hanamel, which was in Anathoth. I weighed out the silver for him—seven shekels and ten pieces of silver.

verses.latin: Et scripsi in libro, et signavi: et adhibui testes, et appendi pecuniam in statera.
verses.english: I wrote the details in a deed, sealed it, and had witnesses sign. Then I weighed out the money on the scales.

verses.latin: Et accepi librum possessionis, signatum, et apertum, iuxta constituta et legitima:
verses.english: Then I took the deed of purchase—both the sealed copy and the unsealed copy—in accordance with the customs and legal requirements.

verses.latin: et dedi librum possessionis Baruch filio Neri, filii Maasiae, coram Hanameel patrui mei, et coram testibus, qui scripti erant in libro emptionis, et coram omnibus Iudaeis qui sedebant in atrio carceris.
verses.english: I handed the deed of purchase to Baruch, the son of Neri, the son of Maaseiah. This was done in the presence of my cousin Hanamel, in the presence of the witnesses who had signed the purchase deed, and in the presence of all the Judeans who were sitting in the courtyard of the guard.

verses.latin: Et praecepi Baruch coram eis, dicens:
verses.english: And I instructed Baruch in their presence, saying:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israel: Sume libros istos, librum emptionis istum, et signatum, et librum hunc apertum: et pones illos in vase fictili, ut permanere possint diebus multis.
verses.english: ‘This is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, says: Take these documents—this sealed purchase deed and this unsealed document—and put them in a clay jar so they may last for many days.’

verses.latin: Haec enim dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israel: Adhuc possidebuntur domus, et agri, et vineae, in terra ista.
verses.english: ‘For this is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, says: Houses, fields, and vineyards will again be bought and owned in this land.’

verses.latin: Et oravi ad Dominum, postquam tradidi librum possessionis Baruch filio Neri, dicens:
verses.english: After I had given the deed of purchase to Baruch, the son of Neri, I prayed to the Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Heu, heu, heu, Domine Deus, ecce tu fecisti caelum et terram in fortitudine tua magna, et in brachio tuo extento: non est tibi difficile quidquam.
verses.english: ‘Ah, Sovereign Lord, God! Behold, You created the universe and the earth by Your great power and Your outstretched arm. Nothing is too difficult for You.’

verses.latin: Qui facis misericordiam in millibus, et reddis iniquitatem patrum in sinu filiorum eorum post eos: fortissime, magne, et potens, Dominus exercituum nomen tibi.
verses.english: ‘You show loving-kindness to thousands, but also bring the punishment for the iniquity of parents upon their children and their descendants after them. O Great and Mighty God, whose name is the Lord of armies.’

verses.latin: Magnus in consilio, et incomprehensibilis in cogitatu: qui respicis oculos tuos super omnes vias filiorum Adam, ut reddas unicuique secundum vias suas, et secundum fructum adinventionum eius.
verses.english: ‘Great in counsel and incomprehensible in thought! Your eyes observe all the ways of the children of Adam, so that You may give to each one according to their ways and according to the fruit of their deeds.’

verses.latin: Qui posuisti signa et portenta in terra Aegypti usque ad diem hanc, et in Israel, et in hominibus, et fecisti tibi nomen secundum diem hanc.
verses.english: ‘You performed signs and wonders in the land of Egypt and have continued to do so, even to this day, both in Israel and among mankind. You have made a Name for Yourself, which is renowned to this very day.’

verses.latin: Et eduxisti populum tuum Israel de terra Aegypti in signis, et in portentis, et in manu robusta, et in brachio extento, et in terrore magno.
verses.english: ‘You brought Your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs and wonders, with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and with great terror.’

verses.latin: Et dedisti eis terram hanc, quam iurasti patribus eorum ut dares eis, terram fluentem lacte et melle.
verses.english: ‘You gave them this land, which You had sworn to their fathers to give them—a land flowing with milk and honey.’

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt, et possederunt eam: et non obedierunt voci tuae, et in lege tua non ambulaverunt: omnia quae praeceisti eis ut facerent, non fecerunt: et facta sunt eis haec omnia mala.
verses.english: ‘They entered it and took possession, but they did not obey Your voice and did not walk in Your law. They did not do anything You commanded them to do, and so all these calamities have come upon them.’

verses.latin: Ecce munitiones perveniunt usque ad civitatem, ut capiatur: et civitas data est in manu Chaldaeorum, qui pugnant adversum eam, a facie gladii, et famis, et pestilentiae: et quaecumque locutus es, facta sunt, et tu ipse vides.
verses.english: ‘See how the siege ramps are built right up to the city walls for its capture! The city has been handed over to the Chaldeans, who are fighting against it, through the sword, famine, and pestilence. Whatever You spoke has now come to pass, and You Yourself see it!’

verses.latin: Et tu dixisti mihi, Domine Deus: Eme agrum pecunia, et adhibe testes: cum civitas data sit in manu Chaldaeorum.
verses.english: ‘Yet You, Sovereign Lord, God, said to me: “Buy the field with money and have witnesses,” even though the city has been given into the hands of the Chaldeans.’

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad Ieremiam, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying:

verses.latin: Ecce ego Dominus Deus omnis carnis: numquid mihi difficile erit quidquam?
verses.english: ‘Behold, I am the Lord, the God of all living beings. Is anything too difficult for Me?’

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego tradam civitatem hanc in manu Chaldaeorum, et in manu regis Babylonis, et capiet eam.
verses.english: ‘Therefore, this is what the Lord says: Behold, I am about to hand this city over to the Chaldeans and to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, and he will capture it.’

verses.latin: Et venient Chaldaei pugnantes adversum civitatem hanc, et succendent eam igni, et comburent eam, et domos in quarum tectis sacrificabant Baal, et libabant diis alienis libamina, ad irritandum me.
verses.english: ‘The Chaldeans who are fighting against this city will come in and set it on fire. They will burn it down, along with the houses on whose rooftops they offered sacrifices to Baal and poured out drink offerings to other gods to provoke My anger.’

verses.latin: Quia fuerunt filii Israel, et filii Iuda, iugiter facientes malum in oculis meis ab adolescentia sua: filii quippe Israel, blasphemia provocantes me in opere manuum suarum, ait Dominus.
verses.english: ‘For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have continually done evil in My sight from their youth. Indeed, the children of Israel have provoked Me to anger by the work of their hands, declares the Lord.’

verses.latin: Quia in iracundiam et in indignationem meam provocans fuit mihi civitas haec a die qua aedificata est, usque ad diem istam, ut auferatur de conspectu meo,
verses.english: ‘This city has been a constant provocation of My wrath and indignation from the day it was built until this very day, so that it must be removed from My sight.’

verses.latin: propter malitiam filiorum Israel, et filiorum Iuda, quam fecerunt sibi, provocantes me in opere manuum suarum, in lignis, et in lapidibus.
verses.english: ‘Because of all the evil that the children of Israel and the children of Judah committed—provoking Me to anger by the work of their hands with their wooden and stone idols.’

verses.latin: Et averterunt ad me terga, et non facies: cum et erudirem eos diluculo consurgens, et docerem, et nollent audire disciplinam.
verses.english: ‘They turned their backs to Me, not their faces. Even though I taught them diligently, rising early and instructing them, they refused to listen to My discipline.’

verses.latin: Et posuerunt idola sua in domo in qua invocatum est nomen meum, ut polluerent eam:
verses.english: ‘They set up their detestable idols in the very House where My Name is invoked, to defile it.’

verses.latin: Et aedificaverunt excelsa Baal, quae sunt in valle filii Ennom, ut consecrarent filios suos et filias suas Moloch: quod non praecepi eis, neque cogitatum est in corde meo ut facerent abominationem hanc, et in peccatum deducerent Iudam.
verses.english: ‘They built the high places of Baal in the Valley of Ben Hinnom to consecrate their sons and daughters to Molech. I never commanded them to do such an abomination, nor did it ever enter My mind that they would lead Judah into such sin.’

verses.latin: Et nunc propter haec, haec dicit Dominus Deus Israel, ad civitatem hanc, de qua vos dicitis, quod tradetur in manu regis Babylonis, in gladio, et in fame, et in peste:
verses.english: ‘And now, concerning all these things, this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says about this city, about which you yourselves are saying, “It will be handed over to the king of Babylon by sword, famine, and pestilence.”’

verses.latin: Ecce ego congregabo eos de universis terris ad quas eos eieci in furore meo, et in indignatione mea, et in ira grandi: et reducam eos ad locum istum, et habitare eos faciam confidenter.
verses.english: ‘Behold, I will gather them from all the lands to which I have driven them in My furious anger, My indignation, and My great wrath. I will bring them back to this very place and make them dwell here securely.’

verses.latin: Et erunt mihi in populum, et ego ero eis in Deum.
verses.english: ‘They will be My people, and I will be their God.’

verses.latin: Et dabo eis cor unum, et viam unam, ut timeant me omnibus diebus: et bene sit eis, et filiis eorum post eos.
verses.english: ‘I will give them one heart and one way of living, so that they may fear Me always. This will be for their own good and for the good of their children after them.’

verses.latin: Et percutiam illis pactum sempiternum, quo non desistam aedificans eos, et bene faciens eis: et timorem meum dabo in corde eorum, ut non recedant a me.
verses.english: ‘I will make an everlasting covenant with them: I will never stop doing good to them. And I will put My fear in their hearts so that they will not turn away from Me.’

verses.latin: Et laetabor super eos, ut benefaciam illis: et plantabo eos in terra hac in veritate, in toto corde meo, et in tota anima mea.
verses.english: ‘I will rejoice over them by doing good to them. I will plant them firmly in this land with all My heart and all My soul, truly and permanently.’

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus: Sicut adduxi super populum hunc omne malum hoc grande: sic adducam super eos omne bonum, quod ego loquor ad eos.
verses.english: ‘For this is what the Lord says: Just as I brought all this great disaster upon these people, so also will I bring upon them all the good that I promised them.’

verses.latin: Et possidebuntur agri in terra ista, de qua vos dicitis: Quia deserta est, eo quod non sit homo, et iumentum, et data sit in manu Chaldaeorum.
verses.english: ‘Fields will again be bought and owned in this land, about which you are now saying, “It is desolate, without man or beast, and given into the hands of the Chaldeans.”’

verses.latin: Agri pecunia possidebuntur, et scribetur liber, et signabitur, et adhibebuntur testes, in terra Beniamin, et in circuitu Ierusalem, in civitatibus Iuda, et in civitatibus montanis, et in civitatibus campestribus, et in civitatibus quae ad austrum sunt: quia reducam captivitatem eorum, ait Dominus.
verses.english: ‘Fields will be bought for money, deeds will be written, sealed, and signed by witnesses in the land of Benjamin and in the areas around Jerusalem, in the cities of Judah, in the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the western foothills, and in the cities of the Negev. For I will restore their fortunes,’ declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad Jeremiam secundo, cum adhuc clausus esset in vestibulo carceris, dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah a second time, while he was still imprisoned in the court of the prison, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus, qui facturus est illud et formaturus illud, et paraturus illud, Dominus nomen ejus:
verses.english: Thus says the Lord, who will bring these things about, who will shape them, and who will establish them—the Lord is His name:

verses.latin: Clama ad me, et exaudiam te, et annunciabo tibi magna et firma, quæ nescis.
verses.english: Call to Me, and I will hear you. I will declare to you great and unshakeable things, which you do not know.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël ad domos urbis hujus, et ad domos regum Juda, quæ destructæ sunt et dirutæ turribus et munitionibus,
verses.english: For thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city and the houses of the kings of Judah, which have been torn down to build up defenses against the siege towers and the ramparts of the enemy.

verses.latin: et venientibus ut pugnent contra Chaldæos, et impleant eas cadaveribus hominum, quos percussi in furore meo et in indignatione mea, et a quibus abscondi faciem meam propter omnem malitiam eorum:
verses.english: And concerning those who went out to fight against the Chaldeans: they will fill those houses with the corpses of the men whom I struck down in My wrath and in My indignation, because I hid My face from them on account of all their wickedness.

verses.latin: Ecce ego inducam eis cicatricem et sanitatem, et sanabo eos: et revelabo illis abundantiam pacis et veritatis.
verses.english: Behold, I will bring them healing and restoration, and I will cure them. I will reveal to them a lasting abundance of peace and truth.

verses.latin: Et convertam conversionem Juda et conversionem Israël, et ædificabo eos sicut a principio.
verses.english: I will restore the fortunes of Judah and the fortunes of Israel, and I will rebuild them as they were in the beginning.

verses.latin: Et mundabo eos ab omni iniquitate eorum, in qua peccaverunt mihi: et propitius ero cunctis iniquitatibus eorum, quibus peccaverunt mihi, et spreverunt me.
verses.english: I will cleanse them from all their iniquity by which they sinned against Me. I will forgive all their iniquities by which they sinned against Me and spurned Me.

verses.latin: Et erit mihi in nomen gaudii, et in laudem, et in gloriam cunctis gentibus terræ, quæ audierint omnia bona quæ ego facio eis: et pavebunt, et perturbabuntur in universis bonis, et in omni pace quam ego facio illis.
verses.english: And Jerusalem will be to Me a name of joy, a praise, and a glory before all the nations of the earth, who will hear of all the good things I do for them. They will be in awe and wonder at all the good things and all the peace that I bring to them.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Adhuc audietur in loco isto, quem vos dicitis esse desertum, eo quod non sit homo et jumentum, in civitatibus Juda et foris Jerusalem, et plateis ejus quæ desolatæ sunt, absque homine et absque habitatore, et absque jumento,
verses.english: Thus says the Lord: In this place, which you say is a desolate wilderness—where there is neither man nor beast—and in the cities of Judah, and outside Jerusalem, and in its streets which are laid waste, without man, without inhabitant, and without beast, there will still be heard:

verses.latin: vox gaudii et vox lætitiæ, vox sponsi et vox sponsæ, vox dicentium: Confitemini Domino exercituum, quoniam bonus Dominus, quoniam in sæculum misericordia ejus: et portantium munera in domum Domini: ego enim convertam conversionem terræ sicut a principio, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: ...the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voice of those saying: 'Give praise to the Lord of hosts, for the Lord is good, for His mercy endures forever!' And the voice of those bringing offerings into the house of the Lord. For I will restore the fortunes of the land as they were in the beginning, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Adhuc erit in loco isto deserto, absque homine et absque jumento, et in cunctis civitatibus ejus, habitatio pastorum, cubantium greges.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord of hosts: In this desolate place, where there is neither man nor beast, and in all its cities, there will again be a dwelling for shepherds, where flocks will lie down in peace.

verses.latin: Et in civitatibus montanis, et in civitatibus campestribus, et in civitatibus quæ ad austrum sunt, et in terra Benjamin, et in circuitu Jerusalem, et in civitatibus Juda, adhuc transibunt greges ad manum numerantis, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: And in the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the plain, and in the cities toward the south, and in the land of Benjamin, and in the areas around Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, flocks will again pass under the hand of the one counting them, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et suscitabo David germen justum: et faciet judicium et justitiam in terra.
verses.english: Behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will raise up a righteous Branch for David. He will execute true judgment and justice in the land.

verses.latin: In diebus illis salvabitur Juda, et Jerusalem habitabit confidenter: et hoc est nomen quod vocabunt eum, Dominus justus noster.
verses.english: In those days Judah will be saved, and Jerusalem will dwell securely. And this is the name by which they will call Him: 'The Lord is Our Righteousness.'

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus: Non interibit de David vir, qui sedeat super thronum domus Israël.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord: A man from the line of David will never be lacking to sit upon the throne of the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Et de sacerdotibus et Levitis non interibit vir a facie mea, qui offerat holocausta, et incendat munera, et faciat victimam cunctis diebus.
verses.english: And from the priests and Levites, a man will never be lacking before Me who offers burnt offerings, burns grain offerings, and makes sacrifices every single day.

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad Jeremiam dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Si irritum fieri potest pactum meum cum die, et pactum meum cum nocte, ut non sit dies et nox in tempore suo:
verses.english: Thus says the Lord: If My covenant with the day and My covenant with the night can be broken, so that day and night do not come at their appointed time,

verses.latin: et pactum meum irritum fieri cum David servo meo, ut non sit ex eo filius qui regnet in throno ejus, et Levitas et sacerdotes ministros meos:
verses.english: ...then My covenant can also be broken with David My servant, so that he will not have a son to reign on his throne, and likewise with the Levites, who are My priestly ministers.

verses.latin: sicut non complentur stellæ cæli, et arenam maris innumerabilem faciam semen David servi mei, et Levitas ministros meos.
verses.english: ...then just as the stars of the heavens cannot be counted, and the sands of the sea cannot be measured, so also will I make the descendants of David My servant, and the Levites My ministers, countless in number.

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad Jeremiam dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying:

verses.latin: Numquid non vidisti quid populus iste locutus sit, dicens: Duæ cognationes quas elegerat Dominus, abjectæ sunt? Et populum meum despexerunt, eo quod jam non sit gens coram eis.
verses.english: Have you not seen what this people has said, saying: 'The two families whom the Lord had chosen, Judah and Israel, have now been utterly cast off?' Thus, they have despised My people, considering them no longer a nation before them.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Si irritum fieri potest pactum meum cum die et nocte, et leges cæli et terræ:
verses.english: Thus says the Lord: If My covenant with day and night can be broken, and if the laws of the universe and the earth can be undone,

verses.latin: etiam pactum meum irritum fiet cum semine Jacob et David servi mei, ut non assumam de semine eorum principes qui præsint semini Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob.
verses.english: ...then also My covenant will be broken with the descendants of Jacob and David My servant. Then I would no longer choose rulers from their descendants to preside over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

verses.latin: Quia sicut non compleri possunt stellæ cæli, et arenam maris innumerabilem faciam semen David servi mei, et Levitas ministros meos.
verses.english: For just as the stars of the universe cannot be counted and the sands of the sea cannot be measured, so also will I make the descendants of David My servant and the Levites My ministers countless in number.

verses.latin: Verbum quod factum est ad Jeremiam a Domino, quando Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, et omnis exercitus ejus, et universa regna terræ quæ sub potestate manus ejus erant, et omnes populi, bellabant contra Jerusalem, et contra omnes civitates ejus dicens:
verses.english: This is the message that came from the Lord to Jeremiah at the time when Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, and all of his army, and all the kingdoms of the earth that were under his power, and all the peoples, were fighting against Jerusalem and against all its cities, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Vade, et loquere ad Sedeciam regem Juda, et dices ei: Hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce ego tradam civitatem hanc in manus regis Babylonis, et succendet eam igni.
verses.english: This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: 'Go and speak to Zedekiah, the king of Judah, and tell him: This is what the Lord says: Behold, I will give this city into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will burn it with fire.

verses.latin: Et tu non effugies de manu ejus, sed capieris, et in manu ejus traderis: et oculi tui oculos regis Babylonis videbunt, et os ejus ad os tuum loquetur, et in Babylonem ibis.
verses.english: And you will not escape from his hand, but you will be captured and handed over to him. Your eyes will see the eyes of the king of Babylon, and his mouth will speak to your mouth, and you will go to Babylon.

verses.latin: Verumtamen audi verbum Domini, Sedecia rex Juda: hæc dicit Dominus ad te: Non morieris in gladio.
verses.english: Nevertheless, hear the word of the Lord, O Zedekiah, king of Judah: This is what the Lord says to you: 'You will not die by the sword.'

verses.latin: In pace morieris: et secundum combustiones patrum tuorum, regum priorum qui fuerunt ante te, sic te comburent: et væ rex plangent te, quia verbum ego locutus sum, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: You will die in peace. And just as they burned spices for your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so they will perform the funeral burning ceremony for you. And they will mourn for you, saying, 'Alas, O king!' For I myself have spoken this word, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Jeremias propheta ad Sedeciam regem Juda, universa verba hæc in Jerusalem.
verses.english: And Jeremiah the prophet spoke all these words to Zedekiah, the king of Judah, in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et exercitus regis Babylonis pugnabat contra Jerusalem, et contra omnes civitates Juda quæ reliquæ erant, contra Lachis, et contra Azecha: hæ enim supererant de civitatibus Juda munitæ.
verses.english: And the army of the king of Babylon was fighting against Jerusalem and against all the remaining cities of Judah, against Lachish and against Azekah. For these were the only fortified cities of Judah that still remained.

verses.latin: Verbum quod factum est ad Jeremiam a Domino, postquam percussit rex Sedecias fœdus ad omnem populum in Jerusalem,
verses.english: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem,

verses.latin: ut dimitteret unusquisque servum suum, et unusquisque ancillam suam Hebræum, et Hebræam, liberos: et nemo teneret eum, id est, Judæum, in servitutem.
verses.english: that each man should set free his male servant and each man his female servant, whether Hebrew men or Hebrew women, making them free. And that no one should keep them, that is, any Jew, in servitude.

verses.latin: Audierunt ergo omnes principes, et universus populus, qui inierant pactum, ut dimitteret unusquisque servum suum, et unusquisque ancillam suam liberos, et ultra non tenerent eos in servitutem: et obedierunt, et dimiserunt.
verses.english: So all the officials and all the people, who had entered into the covenant that each man should set free his male servant and each man his female servant so they would no longer keep them in servitude, listened to it. And they obeyed and set them free.

verses.latin: Et conversi sunt post hæc: et retraxerunt servos et ancillas suas, quos dimiserant liberos, et subjugaverunt in famulos et famulas.
verses.english: But afterwards they turned back. And they took back their male and female servants whom they had set free, and they subjected them to be male and female slaves again.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad Jeremiam a Domino, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Ego percussi fœdus cum patribus vestris in die qua eduxi eos de terra Ægypti, de domo servitutis, dicens:
verses.english: This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: 'I made a covenant with your fathers on the day I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery, saying: '

verses.latin: Post septem annos dimittat unusquisque fratrem suum Hebræum, qui venditus est ei: et servierit tibi sex annis, et dimittes eum a te liberum: et non audierunt patres vestri me, nec inclinaverunt aurem suam.
verses.english: 'At the end of seven years, each of you shall set free his Hebrew brother who has been sold to him; and when he has served you for six years, you shall set him free from you.' But your fathers did not listen to Me, nor did they incline their ear to My commands.

verses.latin: Et conversi estis vos hodie, et fecistis quod rectum est in oculis meis, ut prædicaretis libertatem unusquisque ad proximum suum: et inistis pactum in conspectu meo in domo, in qua invocatum est nomen meum in ea.
verses.english: And you yourselves turned today and did what was right in My eyes, by proclaiming liberty each man to his neighbor. And you made a covenant before Me in the Temple, in the house where My name is invoked.

verses.latin: Et reversi estis, et contaminastis nomen meum: et retraxistis unusquisque servum suum, et unusquisque ancillam suam, quos dimiseratis ut essent liberi, et subjugaverunt eos, ut famuli et famulæ vobis essent.
verses.english: But you turned back and profaned My name. And each of you took back his male servant and each his female servant, whom you had set free to be at liberty. And you subjected them, so that they became your male and female slaves again.

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus: Vos non audistis me, ut prædicaretis libertatem unusquisque fratri suo, et unusquisque amico suo: ecce ego prædico vobis libertatem, ait Dominus, in gladio, et in peste, et in fame: et dabo vos in commotionem universis regnis terræ.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord says: 'You have not listened to Me, to proclaim liberty each man to his brother and each man to his friend.' Behold, I proclaim liberty to you, says the Lord, a liberty to die by the sword, by pestilence, and by famine. And I will make you a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.

verses.latin: Et dabo viros qui prævaricati sunt pactum meum, et non perfecerunt verba fœderis, in quo pepigerunt in conspectu meo vitulum, quem conciderunt in duas partes, et transierunt inter partes ejus:
verses.english: And I will give the men who have transgressed My covenant and have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before Me, when they cut a calf in two and passed between its parts—this was a ritual for making solemn covenants—

verses.latin: principes Juda, et principes Jerusalem, eunuchos, et sacerdotes, et omnem populum terræ, qui transierunt inter partes vituli.
verses.english: I will give the officials of Judah and the officials of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, and the priests, and all the people of the land who passed between the parts of the calf.

verses.latin: Et dabo eos in manus inimicorum suorum, et in manus quærentium animam eorum: et erit morticinum eorum in escam volatilibus cæli, et bestiis terræ.
verses.english: I will give them into the hands of their enemies and into the hands of those who seek their lives. And their dead bodies will be food for the birds of the sky and for the beasts of the earth.

verses.latin: Et Sedeciam regem Juda, et principes ejus, dabo in manus inimicorum eorum, et in manus quærentium animam eorum, et in manus exercituum regis Babylonis, qui recesserant a vobis.
verses.english: And Zedekiah, the king of Judah, and his officials, I will give into the hands of their enemies and into the hands of those who seek their lives, and into the hands of the army of the king of Babylon, who had withdrawn from you.

verses.latin: Ecce ego mandabo, dicit Dominus, et reducam eos in civitatem hanc: et præliabuntur adversum eam, et capient eam, et succendent igni: et civitates Juda dabo in solitudinem, eo quod non sit habitator.
verses.english: Behold, I will command, says the Lord, and I will bring them back to this city of Jerusalem. And they will fight against it, and capture it, and burn it with fire. And I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, so that there will be no inhabitant.

verses.latin: VERBUM quod factum est ad Jeremiam a Domino, in diebus Joakim filii Josiae regis Juda, dicens:
verses.english: This message came to Jeremiah from the Lord. It happened during the reign of Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, king of Judah. The Lord's message stated:

verses.latin: Vade ad domum Rechabitarum, et loquere eis, et adduc eos in domum Domini ad unam ex conclavibus, et propina eis vinum.
verses.english: "Go to the family of the Rechabites. Speak to them, and bring them into the Temple of the Lord, into one of its chambers. Then, offer them wine to drink."

verses.latin: Et assumpsi Jezoniam filium Jeremiae filii Habsaniae, et fratres ejus, et omnem domum Rechabitarum, et filios eorum, et uxores eorum, et totam multitudinem,
verses.english: So I, Jeremiah, brought Jaazaniah, son of Jeremiah, son of Habazziniah, along with his brothers and all the members of the Rechabite family—their sons, their wives, and their entire company.

verses.latin: et adduxi eos in domum Domini, ad gazophylacium filiorum Hanan filii Jegedeliae viri Dei, quod erat juxta gazophylacium principum, super gazophylacium Maasiae filii Sellum custodi portae.
verses.english: I led them into the Temple of the Lord. We went to the chamber belonging to the sons of Hanan, son of Igdaliah, a man of God. This room was located near the chamber of the princes, and it was above the chamber of Maaseiah, son of Shallum, who was the gatekeeper of the Temple.

verses.latin: Et posui coram domo Rechabitarum scyphos plenos vino, et calices: et dixi ad eos: Bibite vinum.
verses.english: Then I set before the Rechabite family, there in their chamber, many cups and goblets, all filled with wine. And I said to them, "Drink this wine."

verses.latin: Qui responderunt: Non bibemus vinum: quia Jonadab filius Rechab pater noster praecepit nobis, dicens: Non bibetis vinum, vos et filii vestri usque in sempiternum:
verses.english: They answered me, "We will not drink wine. Our ancestor, Jonadab, son of Rechab, commanded us, saying: 'You and your sons must never drink wine, not for all time.

verses.latin: et domos non aedificabitis, et sementem non seretis, et vineas non plantabitis, nec habebitis: sed in tabernaculis habitabitis cunctis diebus vestris, ut vivatis multis diebus super faciem terræ in qua vos peregrinamini.
verses.english: You shall not build houses to live in. You shall not plant any crops. You shall not plant vineyards, nor possess any of your own. Instead, you must live in tents all your days. This way, you will live many days upon the face of the earth where you are dwelling as sojourners —people who live in a place but do not own land or settle permanently.'"

verses.latin: Obuimus ergo et fecimus omnia quae praecepit nobis Jonadab filius Rechab pater noster: ita ut vinum non biberemus omnibus diebus nostris, nos et uxores nostræ, filii et filiæ nostræ:
verses.english: Therefore, we have obeyed and done everything that Jonadab, our ancestor, commanded us. We have not drunk wine throughout our entire lives—neither we, nor our wives, nor our sons, nor our daughters.

verses.latin: et non aedificemus domos ad habitandum, et vineam et agrum et sementem non habuimus:
verses.english: We have not built houses to live in, and we have had no vineyard, no field, and no crops to plant.

verses.latin: sed in tabernaculis habitavimus juxta omne quod praecepit nobis Jonadab pater noster.
verses.english: We have always lived in tents, exactly as our ancestor Jonadab commanded us."

verses.latin: Cum autem ascendisset Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis ad terram nostram, diximus: Venite, et ingrediamur Jerusalem a facie exercitus Chaldæorum, et a facie exercitus Syriæ: et propterea mansimus in Jerusalem.
verses.english: "However, when Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, came up and invaded our land, we said, 'Come, let us go into Jerusalem to escape the army of the Chaldeans and the army of Syria.' That is why we are currently staying in Jerusalem."

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad Jeremiam, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord's message came to Jeremiah, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Vade, et dic viris Juda, et habitatoribus Jerusalem: Numquid non accipietis disciplinam, ut obediatis verbis meis? ait Dominus.
verses.english: This is what the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, declares: 'Go and tell the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: Will you not accept My instruction and listen to My words?' says the Lord.

verses.latin: Verba Jonadab filii Rechab, quae praecepit filiis suis ne biberent vinum, praevaluerunt: et non biberunt usque ad hanc diem: et custodierunt praeceptum patris sui. Ego autem locutus sum ad vos, de mane consurgens, et loquens, et non obedistis mihi.
verses.english: The words of Jonadab, son of Rechab, which he commanded his sons—that they should not drink wine—have been strong and effective. They have not drunk wine to this very day, and they have diligently kept the command of their ancestor. But I, the Lord, have spoken to you repeatedly, rising early and speaking diligently, yet you have not obeyed Me.

verses.latin: Et misi ad vos omnes servos meos prophetas, consurgens diluculo, et mittens, atque dicens: Revertimini unusquisque a via sua pessima, et bona facite opera vestra: et nolite sequi deos alienos, neque colatis eos, et habitabitis in terra quam dedi vobis et patribus vestris: et non inclinastis aurem vestram, neque audistis me.
verses.english: I sent all My servants, the prophets, to you, rising early and sending them persistently. I told them to say: 'Return, each one of you, from your wicked ways, and do good works. Do not follow foreign gods, nor worship them, and then you shall dwell in the land that I have given to you and to your fathers.' But you have not paid attention, nor have you listened to Me.

verses.latin: Quia igitur filii Jonadab filii Rechab custodierunt praeceptum patris sui, quod praecepit eis: et populus iste non obedivit mihi:
verses.english: Because the sons of Jonadab, son of Rechab, have kept the command of their ancestor, which he gave them, but this people—the people of Judah—has not obeyed Me:

verses.latin: idcirco hæc dicit Dominus Deus exercituum, Deus Israël: Ecce ego adducam super Juda, et super omnes habitatores Jerusalem, omne malum quod locutus sum adversum eos: eo quod locutus sum ad eos, et non audierunt: et vocavi eos, et non responderunt mihi.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, declares: 'Behold, I am bringing upon Judah and upon all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the calamity and disaster that I have spoken against them. This is because I spoke to them, but they did not listen; and I called to them, but they did not answer Me.'"

verses.latin: Domui autem Rechabitarum dixit Jeremias: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Pro eo quod obedistis praecepto Jonadab patris vestri, et custodistis omnia mandata ejus, et fecistis omnia quæ praecepit vobis:
verses.english: Then Jeremiah said to the family of the Rechabites: "This is what the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, declares: 'Because you have obeyed the command of your ancestor Jonadab, and have kept all his statutes, and have done everything he commanded you;

verses.latin: propterea hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Non deerit vir de stirpe Jonadab filii Rechab, stans in conspectu meo cunctis diebus.
verses.english: therefore, this is what the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, says: "There shall never fail to be a man from the lineage of Jonadab, son of Rechab, who stands in My presence, serving Me, for all time.'"

verses.latin: Factum est autem in anno quarto Joakim filii Josiae regis Juda, verbum hoc ad Jeremiam a Domino, dicens:
verses.english: This happened in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim, who was the son of Josiah and king of Judah. This word came from the Lord to Jeremiah, saying:

verses.latin: Sume volumen libri, et scribe in eo omnes sermones, quos locutus sum ad te adversum Israël, et adversum Judam, et adversum omnes gentes, a die qua locutus sum ad te, ex diebus Josiae, usque ad diem hanc.
verses.english: “Take a scroll and write on it all the words that I have spoken to you against Israel, and against Judah, and against all the nations. Write everything I have said since I first spoke to you, from the days of Josiah, up until this very day.”

verses.latin: Si forte audiat domus Juda universa mala, quae ego cogito facere eis, ut revertatur unusquisque a via sua pessima: et propitius ero iniquitati eorum, et peccato eorum.
verses.english: “Perhaps the entire house of Judah will listen to all the terrible things that I plan to do to them. If they do, each person might turn away from their wicked path. Then I will be merciful and forgive their evil deeds and their sins.”

verses.latin: Vocavit ergo Jeremias Baruch filium Neriæ: et scripsit Baruch ex ore Jeremia omnes sermones Domini, quos locutus est ad eum, in volumine libri.
verses.english: So Jeremiah called Baruch, the son of Neriah. And Baruch wrote down everything Jeremiah dictated from the mouth of the Lord—all the words the Lord had spoken to Jeremiah—onto a scroll.

verses.latin: Et præcepit Jeremias Baruch, dicens:
verses.english: Then Jeremiah instructed Baruch, saying:

verses.latin: Ego clausus sum, nec valeo ingredi domum Domini.
verses.english: “I am confined and cannot go into the Lord’s Temple.”

verses.latin: Ingredere itaque tu, et leges de volumine, in quo scripsisti ex ore meo verba Domini, audiente populo in domo Domini, in die jejunii: insuper et audiente universo Juda, qui veniunt de civitatibus suis.
verses.english: “Therefore, you go in and read from the scroll. On it, you wrote down the words of the Lord at my dictation. Read it aloud to the people in the Lord’s Temple on a day of fasting. Also read it to all the people of Judah who come from their various towns.”

verses.latin: Et fecit Baruch filius Neriæ juxta omnia quæ præceperat ei Jeremias propheta, legens in libro sermones Domini in domo Domini.
verses.english: So Baruch, the son of Neriah, did everything that Jeremiah the prophet had commanded him. He read the words of the Lord from the scroll inside the Lord’s Temple.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in quinto anno Joakim filii Josiae regis Juda, in mense nono, præclamaverunt jejunium in conspectu Domini omnes populi in Jerusalem, et universa multitudo de civitatibus Juda, qui simul convenerant in Jerusalem.
verses.english: It happened in the fifth year of King Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month. All the people in Jerusalem and the entire multitude from the towns of Judah who had gathered together in Jerusalem proclaimed a fast before the Lord.

verses.latin: Legitque Baruch de volumine sermones Jeremiæ, in domo Domini, in cella Gamariæ filii Saphan scribæ, in vestibulo superiore: audiente universo populo.
verses.english: And Baruch read Jeremiah’s words from the scroll in the Lord’s Temple, specifically in the chamber of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan the scribe, which was in the upper court. All the people were listening.

verses.latin: Audivit autem Michæas filius Gamariæ filii Saphan, omnes sermones Domini ex libro.
verses.english: Now Micaiah, the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, heard all the words of the Lord as they were read from the scroll.

verses.latin: Et descendit in domum regis, ad gazophylacium scribæ: ubi omnes principes sedebant, Elisama scriba, et Dalaias filius Semeiæ, et Elnathan filius Achobor, et Gamarias filius Saphan, et Sedecias filius Ananiæ, et universi principes.
verses.english: Then Micaiah went down to the king’s palace, to the scribe’s chamber. There, all the officials were sitting: Elishama the scribe, Delaiah son of Shemaiah, Elnathan son of Akbor, Gemariah son of Shaphan, Zedekiah son of Hananiah, and all the other officials.

verses.latin: Et nuntiavit eis Michæas omnes sermones, quos audierat, legente Baruch ex volumine, in auribus populi.
verses.english: And Micaiah reported to them all the words that he had heard Baruch read from the scroll in the hearing of the people.

verses.latin: Miserunt itaque omnes principes ad Baruch, Judi filium Neriæ, filii Selemiæ, filii Cusi, dicentes: Volumen, de quo legisti audiente populo, sume in manu tua, et veni. Tulit ergo Baruch filius Neriæ volumen in manu sua, et venit ad eos.
verses.english: So all the officials sent Jehudi, the son of Neriah, son of Shelemiah, son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying: “Take the scroll from which you read in the hearing of the people and bring it with you. Come here.” So Baruch, the son of Neriah, took the scroll in his hand and went to them.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad eum: Sede, et lege hæc in auribus nostris. Et legit Baruch in auribus eorum.
verses.english: And they said to him, “Sit down and read these words to us.” So Baruch read them aloud to them.

verses.latin: Cumque audissent omnes sermones, obstupuerunt unusquisque ad proximum suum: et dixerunt ad Baruch: Nuntiare debemus regi omnes sermones istos.
verses.english: When they had heard all the words, they were astonished, each one looking at his neighbor. And they said to Baruch, “We must report all these words to the king.”

verses.latin: Et interrogaverunt Baruch, dicentes: Indica nobis quomodo scripsisti omnes sermones istos ex ore ejus.
verses.english: And they questioned Baruch, saying, “Tell us, how did you write all these words? Was it at his dictation?”

verses.latin: Dixitque eis Baruch: Ex ore suo loquebatur ad me sermones istos quasi legens, et ego scribebam in volumine atramento.
verses.english: And Baruch answered them, “He dictated all these words to me, as if reading them aloud, and I wrote them down on the scroll with ink.”

verses.latin: Et dixerunt principes ad Baruch: Vade, et abscondere tu et Jeremias: et nemo sciat ubi sitis.
verses.english: Then the officials said to Baruch, “Go, hide yourself, both you and Jeremiah. No one should know where you are.”

verses.latin: Ingressi sunt autem ad regem in atrium: et omnes sermones locuti sunt, audiente rege, ponentes volumen in gazophylacio Elisama scribæ.
verses.english: They then went to the king in the courtyard. They reported all the words to the king, after placing the scroll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe.

verses.latin: Misitque rex Judi ut sumeret volumen: qui tulit illud de gazophylacio Elisama scribæ. Et legit Judi audiente rege, et universis principibus, qui stabant circa regem.
verses.english: And the king sent Jehudi to bring the scroll. Jehudi took it from the chamber of Elishama the scribe. And Jehudi read it aloud, in the hearing of the king and all the officials who stood around the king.

verses.latin: Rex autem sedebat in domo hiemali, in mense nono: et ignis erat ante ipsum accensus in caminum.
verses.english: The king was sitting in his winter palace in the ninth month. A fire was burning before him in the brazier.

verses.latin: Cumque legisset Judi tres pagellas, vel quatuor, scidit illud cultello scribæ, et projecit in ignem, qui erat super caminum, donec consumeretur omne volumen igni, quod erat in camino.
verses.english: After Jehudi had read just three or four columns of the scroll, the king cut the scroll with a scribe’s knife and threw it into the fire that was in the brazier. He kept throwing pieces until the entire scroll was consumed by the fire in the brazier.

verses.latin: Et non timuerunt, neque sciderunt vestimenta sua, rex et omnes servi ejus, qui audierunt omnes sermones istos.
verses.english: Neither the king nor any of his servants who heard all these words showed any fear, nor did they tear their clothes in repentance, which was the custom when hearing a dire prophecy.

verses.latin: Verumtamen Elnathan et Dalaias et Gamarias, intercedebant ad regem, ne combureret librum: et non audivit eos.
verses.english: However, Elnathan, Delaiah, and Gemariah pleaded with the king not to burn the scroll, but he did not listen to them.

verses.latin: Et præcepit rex Jerameël filio Amelech, et Saraiæ filio Ezriël, et Selemiæ filio Abdeel, ut apprehenderent Baruch scribam, et Jeremiam prophetam: et abscondit eos Dominus.
verses.english: Then the king commanded Jerahmeel, the king’s son, Seraiah son of Azriel, and Shelemiah son of Abdeel, to seize Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet. But the Lord hid them, protecting them from capture.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad Jeremiam, postquam combusserat rex volumen, et sermones quos scripserat Baruch ex ore Jeremiæ, dicens:
verses.english: After the king had burned the scroll and the words that Baruch had written at Jeremiah’s dictation, the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah again, saying:
