verses.latin: Rursum sume volumen aliud, et scribe in eo omnes sermones priores, qui erant in volumine primo, quod combussit Joakim rex Juda.
verses.english: “Take another scroll again and write on it all the former words that were on the first scroll, which King Jehoiakim of Judah burned.”

verses.latin: Et ad Joakim regem Juda dices: Hæc dicit Dominus: Tu combussisti volumen istud, dicens: Quare scripsisti in eo, dicens: Veniet rex Babylonis cum festinatione, et dissipabit terram hanc, et auferet ex hac hominem et jumentum?
verses.english: “And to King Jehoiakim of Judah, you are to say: ‘This is what the Lord says: You burned this scroll, saying, “Why did you write on it that the king of Babylon will surely come and destroy this land, sweeping away both people and animals?”’”

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus super Joakim regem Juda: Non erit ei qui sedeat super solium David: et morticinum ejus projicietur ante faciem æstus per diem, et ante faciem gelu per noctem.
verses.english: “Therefore, this is what the Lord says concerning King Jehoiakim of Judah: ‘He will have no successor to sit on the throne of David. His dead body will be thrown out, exposed to the scorching heat by day and the freezing cold by night, without a proper burial.’”

verses.latin: Et visitabo super eum, et super semen ejus, et super servos ejus, iniquitates suas: et adducam super eos, et super habitatores Jerusalem, et super viros Juda, omnem calamitatem quam locutus sum ad illos, et non audierunt.
verses.english: “‘And I will punish him, his descendants, and his servants for their wickedness. I will bring upon them, upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and upon the men of Judah, all the disaster that I have declared against them, because they did not listen.’”

verses.latin: Jeremias autem assumpsit volumen aliud, et dedit illud Baruch filio Neriæ scribæ: qui scripsit in eo ex ore Jeremiæ omnes sermones libri, quem combusserat Joakim rex Juda igni: et insuper addita sunt multa verba consimilia priori.
verses.english: Then Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to Baruch, the son of Neriah, the scribe. And Baruch wrote on it, from Jeremiah’s dictation, all the words of the book that King Jehoiakim of Judah had burned in the fire. In addition, many other similar words were added to it, emphasizing the severity of the prophecies.

verses.latin: Et regnavit rex Sedecias filius Josiae pro Jechonias filio Joakim; quem constituit rex Babylonis Nabuchodonosor in terra Juda.
verses.english: King Zedekiah, Josiah's son, came to power, reigning in place of Jehoiachin, who was the son of Jehoiakim. King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon had appointed Zedekiah over the land of Judah.

verses.latin: Et non obedivit ipse et servi ejus et populus terrae verbis Domini quae locutus est in manu Jeremiae prophetae.
verses.english: But Zedekiah himself, along with his officials and the common people of the land, did not listen to the messages from the Lord that He had spoken through Jeremiah the prophet.

verses.latin: Et misit rex Sedecias Juchal filium Selemiae et Sophoniam filium Maasiae sacerdotem ad Jeremiam prophetam dicens: Ora pro nobis Dominum Deum nostrum.
verses.english: King Zedekiah sent Jehucal, Shelemiah's son, and Zephaniah, Maaseiah's son who was a priest, to Jeremiah the prophet. The king asked them to say: “Please pray for us to the Lord our God.”

verses.latin: Jeremias autem libere gradiebatur in medio populi: prophetae enim mittebantur in carcerem.
verses.english: At this time, Jeremiah was still moving about freely among the people of Jerusalem, for the other prophets had already been imprisoned.

verses.latin: Igitur exercitus pharaonis egressus est de Aegypto: et audientes Chaldaei qui obsidebant Jerusalem hujuscemodi nuntium, recesserunt ab Jerusalem.
verses.english: At that very moment, the Pharaoh’s army had marched out of Egypt to provide aid to Judah. When the Chaldean forces, who were besieging Jerusalem, heard this news, they temporarily withdrew from Jerusalem to meet the Egyptian threat.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad Jeremiam prophetam dicens:
verses.english: Then a specific message from the Lord came to Jeremiah the prophet, saying:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Sic dicite regi Juda, qui misit vos interrogare me: Ecce exercitus pharaonis qui egressus est ad vos in auxilium, revertetur in terram suam Aegyptum.
verses.english: “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: Tell the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of Me: ‘Behold, the army of Pharaoh, which came out to help you, will return to its own land of Egypt.'

verses.latin: Et revertentur Chaldaei, et pugnabunt contra civitatem hanc, et capient eam, et succendent igni.
verses.english: And then, after dealing with the Egyptians, the Chaldeans will return. They will fight against this city, capture it, and burn it down completely with fire.”

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Nolite decipere animas vestras, dicentes: Abibunt, et recedent a nobis Chaldaei: quia non abibunt.
verses.english: “This is what the Lord says: Do not deceive yourselves by thinking, ‘The Chaldeans will surely go away and withdraw from us permanently.’ I tell you, they will not withdraw permanently.

verses.latin: Et si percusseritis omnem exercitum Chaldaeorum qui proeliantur adversum vos, et relicti fuerint ex eis viri aliquot vulnerati, singuli de tentoriis suis consurgent, et succendent civitatem hanc igni.
verses.english: Even if you were to strike down the entire Chaldean army that is fighting against you, and only a few wounded men remained from them, each one of those men would still rise up from his tent and come to burn this city with fire. Their victory is inevitable.”

verses.latin: Itaque cum recessisset exercitus Chaldaeorum ab Jerusalem, ob exercitum pharaonis:
verses.english: So, when the Chaldean army had indeed withdrawn from Jerusalem because of Pharaoh’s advancing army,

verses.latin: egressus est Jeremias de Jerusalem, ut iret in terram Benjamin, et divideret ibi possessionem in conspectu civium suorum.
verses.english: Jeremiah decided to leave Jerusalem. His purpose was to go to the land of Benjamin to claim his portion of family land and settle a property dispute among his kinsmen.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset ad portam Benjamin, erat ibi custos portae, nomine Jerias filius Selemiae filii Ananiae: et apprehendit Jeremiam prophetam dicens: Ad Chaldaeos profugis.
verses.english: But when Jeremiah arrived at the Benjamin Gate of Jerusalem, a guard was stationed there named Irijah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah. He seized Jeremiah the prophet and accused him, saying: “You are trying to desert to the Chaldeans!”

verses.latin: Et dixit Jeremias: Falsum est, non fugio ad Chaldaeos. Et non audivit eum: sed comprehendit Jerias Jeremiam, et adduxit eum ad principes.
verses.english: Jeremiah immediately responded, saying: “That is false! I am not fleeing to the Chaldeans!” But Irijah would not listen to him. Instead, Irijah seized Jeremiah and brought him before the leading officials of the city.

verses.latin: Iratisque principibus contra Jeremiam, ceciderunt eum, et miserunt eum in carcerem qui erat in domo Jonathan scribae: hoc enim in carcerem versum erat.
verses.english: The officials were furious with Jeremiah. They ordered him to be beaten severely and then cast him into a prison that had been set up in the house of Jonathan the scribe, because Jonathan’s house had been converted into a temporary jail.

verses.latin: Itaque ingressus est Jeremias in lacum, et in cubiculis carceris: et sedit ibi Jeremias diebus multis.
verses.english: So Jeremiah was brought down into the cistern, which served as a dungeon, and into the cramped prison cells. Jeremiah remained there for many days.

verses.latin: Misit autem Sedecias rex, et tulit eum: et interrogavit eum in domo sua abscondite, et dixit: Putasne est sermo a Domino? Et dixit Jeremias: Est. Et addidit: In manu regis Babylonis traderis.
verses.english: However, King Zedekiah later sent for Jeremiah and had him brought to the palace. He questioned him secretly in his own house, asking: “Is there any new message from the Lord?” Jeremiah answered straightforwardly: “There is!” And then Jeremiah added: “You will certainly be handed over to the king of Babylon.”

verses.latin: Et dixit Jeremias ad regem Sedeciam: Quid peccavi tibi et servis tuis et populo tuo, quia misistis me in domum carceris?
verses.english: Jeremiah then said to King Zedekiah: “What wrong have I done to you, or to your officials, or to your people, that you have thrown me into this house of imprisonment?”

verses.latin: Ubi sunt prophetae vestri, qui prophetabant vobis, et dicebant: Non veniet rex Babylonis super vos et super terram hanc?
verses.english: “Where are your own prophets who prophesied to you,” Jeremiah challenged, “the ones who kept saying, ‘The king of Babylon will not come against you or against this land’?”

verses.latin: Nunc ergo audi, obsecro, domine mi rex: cadat deprecatio mea in conspectu tuo, et ne me remittas in domum Jonathan scribae, ne moriar ibi.
verses.english: “Now therefore, please listen, my lord king,” Jeremiah pleaded. “Let my urgent appeal come before you, and please do not send me back to the house of Jonathan the scribe, for if I return there, I will surely die.”

verses.latin: Et praecepit rex Sedecias ut commendarent Jeremiam in vestibulo carceris, et darent ei panem quotidianum de viculo pistorum, donec consumeretur omnis panis de civitate. Et mansit Jeremias in vestibulo carceris.
verses.english: So King Zedekiah gave a command that Jeremiah should be confined in the court of the guardhouse. He also ordered that Jeremiah be given a loaf of bread each day from the bakers’ street, and this continued until all the bread in the city was completely consumed. And so Jeremiah remained in the court of the guardhouse.

verses.latin: Audiit autem Sephatias filius Matthani, et Godolias filius Phassur, et Juchal filius Selemiae, et Phassur filius Melchiae, sermones quos loquebatur Jeremias ad omnem populum, dicens:
verses.english: Shephatiah the son of Mattan, Gedaliah the son of Pashhur, Jucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur the son of Malchiah heard the words that Jeremiah was speaking to all the people, saying:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Qui manserit in civitate hac, morietur gladio, et fame, et peste: qui autem exierit ad Chaldaeos, vivet, et erit ei anima sua quasi salus, et capietur.
verses.english: The Lord God says this: 'Whoever remains in this city will die by sword, by famine, and by plague. But whoever surrenders to the Chaldeans will live; his life will be spared as if by salvation, though he will be captured.'

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Tradendo tradetur civitas haec in manu exercitus regis Babylonis, et capiet eam.
verses.english: The Lord God says this: 'This city will certainly be handed over into the power of the army of the King of Babylon, and they will capture it.'

verses.latin: Et dixerunt principes ad regem: Rogamus ut occidatur vir iste: eo quod propter hoc dissolvit manus virorum bellantium qui relinquuntur in urbe hac, et manus universi populi, loquens ad eos sermones hujuscemodi: quia vir iste non quaerit pacem populi hujus, sed malum.
verses.english: Then the princes said to the king: 'We ask that this man be put to death. Because by saying words like these to them, he is weakening the hands of the soldiers who are left in this city, and also the hands of all the people. For this man is not seeking the peace of these people, but their harm.'

verses.latin: Et dixit rex Sedecias: Ecce ipse est in manu vestra: neque enim rex quicquam potest vobis contradicere.
verses.english: And King Zedekiah said: 'Look, he is in your hands; for the king can do nothing to oppose you.'

verses.latin: Tulerunt ergo Jeremiam, et projecerunt eum in lacum Melchiae filii Amelech, qui erat in vestibulo carceris: et submiserunt Jeremiam in funibus. Erat autem in lacu luto, et non aqua, et demersus est Jeremias in luto.
verses.english: So they took Jeremiah and threw him into the cistern of Malchiah, the son of Hammelech, which was in the court of the prison. They let Jeremiah down with ropes. Now there was only mud in the cistern, not water, so Jeremiah sank into the mud.

verses.latin: Audiens autem Abdemelech Aethiops, vir eunuchus, qui erat in domo regis, quod misissent Jeremiam in lacum (rex autem sedebat in porta Benjamin),
verses.english: Now Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, a eunuch who was in the king's household, heard that they had thrown Jeremiah into the cistern. (The king was then sitting at the Benjamin Gate).

verses.latin: et egressus Abdemelech de domo regis, locutus est ad regem, dicens:
verses.english: So Ebedmelech left the king's household and spoke to the king, saying:

verses.latin: Domine mi rex, male fecerunt viri isti quæcumque perpetrarunt in Jeremiam prophetam, mittentes eum in lacum, ut moreretur ibi a fame: non est enim panis ultra in civitate.
verses.english: 'My lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet, throwing him into the cistern so he might die there from hunger. For there is no more bread left in the city.'

verses.latin: Et præcepit rex Abdemelech Aethiopi, dicens: Tolle hinc triginta viros tecum, et levare Jeremiam prophetam de lacu, antequam moriatur.
verses.english: Then the king commanded Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, saying: 'Take thirty men from here with you, and lift Jeremiah the prophet out of the cistern before he dies.'

verses.latin: Assumptis ergo Abdemelech secum viris, ingressus est in domum regiam, quæ erat sub cellario: et tulit inde veteres pannos, et putrida vestium, et submiserat ea ad Jeremiam in lacum in funibus.
verses.english: So Ebedmelech took the men with him. He went into the king's house, to the room beneath the treasury, and from there he took old rags and worn-out clothes. And he let them down by ropes to Jeremiah in the cistern.

verses.latin: Et dixit Abdemelech ad Jeremiam: Pone veteres pannos, et haec quasi putrida, et vetusta, sub cubito manuum tuarum, sub funibus. Et fecit Jeremias sic.
verses.english: Then Ebedmelech said to Jeremiah: 'Put these old rags, these worn-out and decayed clothes, under your armpits beneath the ropes.' And Jeremiah did so.

verses.latin: Traxerunt ergo Jeremiam in funibus, et eduxerunt eum de lacu. Factus est autem Jeremias in vestibulo carceris.
verses.english: So they pulled Jeremiah up with the ropes and brought him out of the cistern. And Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.

verses.latin: Misit autem rex Sedecias, et adduxit Jeremiam prophetam ad se ad ostium tertium, quod erat in domo Domini: et dixit ad Jeremiam: Interrogo te sermonem: ne abscondas a me quidquam.
verses.english: King Zedekiah then sent for Jeremiah the prophet and had him brought to him at the third entrance, which was in the house of the Lord. And he said to Jeremiah: 'I am going to ask you a question. Do not hide anything from me.'

verses.latin: Et dixit Jeremias ad Sedeciam: Si annuntiavero tibi, numquid non interficies me? et si consilium dedero tibi, non audies me.
verses.english: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah: 'If I tell you, will you not surely put me to death? And if I give you counsel, you will not listen to me.'

verses.latin: Juravit ergo rex Sedecias secreto ad Jeremiam, dicens: Vivit Dominus, qui fecit animam nostram, si interficiam te, et si tradam te in manu virorum istorum, qui quærunt animam tuam.
verses.english: So King Zedekiah swore secretly to Jeremiah, saying: 'As the Lord lives, who created our lives, I will neither put you to death nor hand you over to these men who are seeking your life.'

verses.latin: Et dixit Jeremias ad Sedeciam: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum Deus Israël: Si exiens exieris ad principes regis Babylonis, vivet anima tua, et civitas hæc non incen detur igni: et tu vives, et domus tua.
verses.english: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah: 'The Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, says this: If you go out and surrender to the princes of the King of Babylon, your life will be spared, and this city will not be burned with fire; and you and your household will live.'

verses.latin: Si autem non exieris ad principes regis Babylonis, tradetur civitas hæc in manu Chaldaeorum, et succendent eam igni: et tu non effugies de manu eorum.
verses.english: 'But if you do not go out and surrender to the princes of the King of Babylon, this city will be handed over to the Chaldeans, and they will burn it with fire. And you will not escape from their hand.'

verses.latin: Et dixit rex Sedecias ad Jeremiam: In timore sum ego civium Judaeorum, qui transfugerunt ad Chaldaeos: ne forte tradar in manibus eorum, et illudant mihi.
verses.english: And King Zedekiah said to Jeremiah: 'I am afraid of the Jewish citizens who have deserted to the Chaldeans; I am afraid that I might be handed over to them, and they would mock me.'

verses.latin: Dixit autem Jeremias: Non te tradent. Audi, obsecro, vocem Domini quam ego loquor ad te, et bene tibi erit, et vivet anima tua.
verses.english: But Jeremiah said: 'They will not hand you over. Listen, I beg you, to the voice of the Lord that I am speaking to you. Then it will go well with you, and your life will be spared.'

verses.latin: Si autem nolueris exire, iste est sermo quem ostendit mihi Dominus.
verses.english: 'But if you refuse to surrender, this is the word that the Lord has shown me:'

verses.latin: Ecce omnes mulieres, quæ relictæ sunt in domo regis Juda, ducentur ad principes regis Babylonis: et ipsæ dicent: Illuserunt tibi, et prævaluerunt viri pacis tuæ: demerserunt in luto pedes tuos, et in lubricum duxerunt te.
verses.english: 'Behold, all the women who are left in the house of the King of Judah will be led out to the princes of the King of Babylon. And they themselves will say: “Your trusted friends have deceived you and have overcome you! They have let your feet sink into the mud, and they have led you astray into a slippery place.”'

verses.latin: Et omnes uxores tuas, et filios tuos educent ad Chaldaeos: et tu non effugies manus eorum, sed manibus regis Babylonis capieris, et civitas hæc incen detur igni.
verses.english: 'All your wives and your children will be led out to the Chaldeans. And you yourself will not escape from their hands, but will be captured by the hands of the King of Babylon. And this city will be burned with fire.'

verses.latin: Et dixit Sedecias ad Jeremiam: Nemo sciat verba haec, et non morieris.
verses.english: Then Zedekiah said to Jeremiah: 'Let no one know these words, and you will not die.'

verses.latin: Si autem audierint principes, quia locutus sum tecum, et venerint ad te, et dixerint tibi: Indica nobis quid locutus sis cum rege, et ne celes a nobis, et non te interficiemus:
verses.english: 'But if the princes hear that I have spoken with you, and they come to you and say to you: “Tell us what you said to the king, and do not hide it from us, and we will not put you to death;”'

verses.latin: Dices ad eos: Præsentaveram deprecationem meam coram rege, ne me faceret reverti in domum Jonathan, et ibi morerer.
verses.english: 'Then you shall say to them: “I presented my plea before the king, asking him not to send me back to Jonathan's house, lest I die there.”'

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo omnes principes ad Jeremiam, et interrogaverunt eum: et respondit eis juxta universa verba quae præceperat ei rex. Et tacuerunt ab eo: nihil enim fuerat auditum.
verses.english: So all the princes came to Jeremiah and questioned him; and he answered them according to all the words that the king had commanded him. So they ceased questioning him, for nothing had been heard about the actual conversation.

verses.latin: Mansit autem Jeremias in vestibulo carceris usque ad diem in quo capta est Jerusalem: et factum est verbum Domini ad eum.
verses.english: So Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison until the day Jerusalem was captured. And the word of the Lord came to him.

verses.latin: Anno nono Sedeciae regis Juda, mense decimo, venit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, et omnis exercitus ejus, ad Jerusalem, et obsederunt eam.
verses.english: In the ninth year of Zedekiah's reign as King of Judah, during the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar, the King of Babylon, came with his entire army to Jerusalem and laid siege to the city.

verses.latin: Et decimo uno anno Sedeciae, mense quarto, quinta die mensis, aperta est civitas.
verses.english: Then, in the eleventh year of Zedekiah's reign, in the fourth month, on the fifth day of that month, the city's defenses were breached.

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt omnes principes regis Babylonis, et sederunt in porta media, Neregel, Sereser, Semegarnabu, Sarsachim, Rabsares, Neregel, Sereser, Rebmag, et omnes reliqui principes regis Babylonis.
verses.english: All the princes of the King of Babylon entered the city and took their seats in the Middle Gate. These included Nergal-sharezer (the Samgar-nebo), Sarsechim (the Rab-saris), Nergal-sharezer (the Rab-mag), and all the other remaining princes of the King of Babylon.

verses.latin: Fugit autem Sedecias rex Juda, et universi viri bellatores, videntes eos, et egressi sunt nocte de civitate per viam horti regis, et per portam quae inter duas muros est, et egressi sunt ad viam deserti.
verses.english: But when King Zedekiah of Judah and all his fighting men saw them, they fled from the city by night. They went through the King’s Garden gate, which was between the two walls, and then escaped toward the desert road.

verses.latin: Et persecuti sunt eos exercitus Chaldaeorum, et apprehenderunt Sedeciam in solitudine Jericho: et apprehendentes eum, adduxerunt ad Nabuchodonosor regem Babylonis in Reblatha, in terra Emath: et locutus est judicia cum eo.
verses.english: The Chaldean army pursued them and captured Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. When they had seized him, they brought him to Nebuchadnezzar, the King of Babylon, at Riblah, which is in the land of Hamath, where the king pronounced judgment upon him.

verses.latin: Et occidit rex Babylonis filios Sedeciae in Reblatha in oculis ejus: et omnes nobiles Juda occidit Nabuchodonosor.
verses.english: The King of Babylon then executed Zedekiah's sons at Riblah, right before his very eyes. Nebuchadnezzar also killed all the nobles of Judah.

verses.latin: Oculos quoque Sedeciae eruit: et vinxit eum compedibus, ut duceretur in Babylonem.
verses.english: He also put out Zedekiah's eyes and bound him with bronze chains so that he could be led away to Babylon.

verses.latin: Domum autem regis, et domos populi, succenderunt Chaldaei igni: et muros Jerusalem destruxerunt.
verses.english: The Chaldeans set the king's palace and the people's homes on fire. They also tore down the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Reliquam autem plebem, quae remanserat in civitate, et perfugas, qui transfugerant ad eum, et reliquos de populo qui remanserant, transtulit Nabuzardan princeps militiae in Babylonem.
verses.english: Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard, carried away into exile in Babylon the rest of the people who had remained in the city, along with the deserters who had gone over to him, and all the remaining people.

verses.latin: Et de pauperibus plebis, qui nihil penitus habebant, reliquit Nabuzardan princeps militiae in terra Juda: et dedit eis vineas et cisternas in die illa.
verses.english: But Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard, left some of the poorest people in the land of Judah, those who had absolutely nothing. On that same day, he gave them vineyards and cisterns for their use.

verses.latin: Praeceperat autem Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis de Jeremia Nabuzardan principi militiae, dicens:
verses.english: Now, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon had given specific orders concerning Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard. He had said:

verses.latin: Tolle illum, et pone super eum oculos tuos, et ne facias ei quicquam mali: sed ut placuerit tibi, sic fac ei.
verses.english: "Take Jeremiah. Watch over him carefully and do not cause him any harm. Instead, treat him exactly as he wishes."

verses.latin: Igitur misit Nabuzardan princeps militiae, et Nabusezban Rabsaris, et Neregel Sereser Rebmag, et omnes optimates regis Babylonis,
verses.english: So Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard, along with Nebushazban (the Rab-saris), and Nergal-sharezer (the Rab-mag), and all the chief officers of the King of Babylon, sent men.

verses.latin: Miserunt, et tulerunt Jeremiam de vestibulo carceris, et commiserunt eum Godoliae filio Ahicam filii Saphan, ut duceretur in domum, et habitaret in medio populi.
verses.english: They sent for Jeremiah and had him brought out of the court of the prison. Then they entrusted him to Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, so that he could be taken to his home and live among his own people.

verses.latin: Ad Jeremiam autem factus fuerat sermo Domini, cum clausus esset in vestibulo carceris, dicens:
verses.english: While Jeremiah was still confined in the court of the prison, the word of the Lord had come to him, saying:

verses.latin: Vade, et dic Abdemelech Aethiopi, dicens: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israel: Ecce ego inducam sermones meos super civitatem hanc in malum, et non in bonum: et erunt in conspectu tuo in die illa.
verses.english: "Go and tell Ebed-melech, the Ethiopian: 'Thus says the Lord of Hosts, the God of Israel: "Behold, I am bringing My words of judgment upon this city, for evil and not for good. They will be fulfilled before your very eyes on that day."'

verses.latin: Et eruam te in die illa, ait Dominus: et non traderis in manibus virorum, quos tu formidas:
verses.english: "But I will rescue you on that day," declares the Lord, "and you will not be handed over to the men you fear."

verses.latin: sed liberans liberabo te, et gladio non cades: sed erit tibi anima tua in salutem, quia in me habuisti fiduciam, ait Dominus.
verses.english: "For I will certainly deliver you. You will not fall by the sword, but you will save your life because you trusted in Me," declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Verbum quod factum est ad Jeremiam a Domino, postquam dimisit eum Nabuzardan princeps militiæ de Rama, quando tulit eum vinctum in catenis in medio omnium qui migrabant de Jerusalem et Judæa, et ducebantur in Babylonem.
verses.english: The word from the Lord came to Jeremiah after Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, released him from Ramah. Nebuzaradan had taken Jeremiah, bound in chains, from among all the people who were being exiled from Jerusalem and the land of Judea, as they were being led away to Babylon.

verses.latin: Tollens ergo Nabuzardan princeps militiæ, Jeremiam, dixit ad eum: Dominus Deus tuus locutus est plaga hac super locum istum.
verses.english: So Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, took Jeremiah aside and said to him: “The Lord your God has spoken this disaster against this land.”

verses.latin: Et adduxit illam: et fecit Dominus sicut locutus est: quia peccastis Domino, et non audistis vocem ejus, et factus est vobis sermo hic.
verses.english: He has brought it about. The Lord has done exactly as He said He would, because you sinned against the Lord and did not listen to His voice. Therefore, this word from God has come to pass upon you.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo ecce solvi te hodie de catenis quæ sunt in manibus tuis: si placet tibi ut venias mecum in Babylonem, veni: et ponam oculos meos super te. Si autem displicet tibi venire mecum in Babylonem, reside hic: ecce omnis terra in conspectu tuo est, quod tibi placet, et quo volueris ire, illuc perge.
verses.english: “Now, look, I am releasing you today from the chains that were on your hands. If you wish to come with me to Babylon, then come, and I will personally watch over you and care for you. But if you do not wish to come with me to Babylon, then stay here. See, the whole land is before you; you may go wherever you please, and wherever you want to go, go there.”

verses.latin: Et silente illo et nihil respondente, rursum ait: Revertere ad Godoliam filium Ahicam filii Saphan, quem præposuit rex Babylonis civitatibus Juda, et habita cum eo in medio populi: vel quocumque tibi placuerit perge. Dedit quoque ei princeps militiæ cibaria et munera, et dimisit eum.
verses.english: When Jeremiah remained silent and gave no answer, Nebuzaradan spoke again: “Go back to Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has appointed as governor over the cities of Judah. You can live with him among the remaining people there, or you can go anywhere else that pleases you.” The captain of the guard also gave Jeremiah provisions and a gift, and then he let him go.

verses.latin: Venit autem Jeremias ad Godoliam filium Ahicam in Masphath, et habitavit cum eo in medio populi qui reliquus fuerat in terra.
verses.english: So Jeremiah went to Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, in Mizpah. He lived with Gedaliah among the people who were still left in the land of Judah.

verses.latin: Audierunt autem omnes principes exercitus, qui dissipati fuerant per regiones, ipsi et socii eorum, quod præfecerat rex Babylonis Godoliam filium Ahicam terræ, et commiserat ei viros et mulieres et parvulos, et de pauperibus terræ, qui non fuerant translati in Babylonem.
verses.english: Now, all the commanders of the armies who had been scattered throughout the surrounding regions—they, along with their men—heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, as governor over the land. The king had entrusted to him the care of the men, women, and children, and the poorest of the land, who had not been taken into exile in Babylon.

verses.latin: Venerunt itaque ad Godoliam in Masphath, Ismahel filius Nathaniæ, et Johanan et Jonathan filii Caree, et Sereas filius Thanehumeth, et filii Ophir, et Jezonias filius Maachati, ipsi et viri eorum.
verses.english: So these men came to Gedaliah in Mizpah, along with their soldiers: Ishmael, the son of Nethaniah; Johanan and Jonathan, the sons of Kareah; Seraiah, the son of Tanhumeth; the sons of Ephai; and Jezaniah, the son of Maacah.

verses.latin: Et juravit eis Godolias filius Ahicam filii Saphan, et sociis eorum, dicens: Nolite timere servire Chaldæis: manete in terra, et servite regi Babylonis, et bene erit vobis.
verses.english: Then Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, made an oath to them and their men, saying: “Do not be afraid to serve the Chaldeans. Stay in the land, serve the king of Babylon, and things will go well for you.”

verses.latin: Ecce ego habito in Masphath, ut parem ad præceptum Chaldæorum, qui veniunt ad nos: vos vero colligite vindemiam, et messem, et oleum, et reponite in vasis vestris, et habitate in urbibus vestris quas tenetis.
verses.english: “Look, I myself will reside in Mizpah to stand before the Chaldeans who come to us and to carry out their commands. As for you, go and gather your wine harvest, your grain harvest, and your olive oil. Store these provisions in your vessels, and then settle in the cities you have taken possession of.”

verses.latin: Sed et omnes Judæi qui erant in Moab, et in filiis Ammon, et in Idumæa, et in universis regionibus, audito quod dedisset rex Babylonis reliquias in Judæa, et quod præposuisset super eos Godoliam filium Ahicam filii Saphan:
verses.english: And all the Jews who were in Moab, among the Ammonites, in Edom, and in all the other surrounding regions—when they heard that the king of Babylon had allowed a remnant of the Jewish people to remain in the land of Judah, and that he had appointed Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, over them—

verses.latin: reversi sunt universi Judæi de cunctis locis ad quæ fugerant, et venerunt in terram Juda ad Godoliam in Masphath: et collegerunt vindemiam, et messem, et oleum multum valde.
verses.english: —all these Jewish people returned from all the places to which they had fled. They came back to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah in Mizpah, and they gathered a very abundant harvest of wine, grain, and olive oil.

verses.latin: Johanan autem filius Caree, et omnes principes exercitus qui dissipati fuerant in regionibus, venerunt ad Godoliam in Masphath,
verses.english: Johanan, the son of Kareah, and all the commanders of the armies who had been scattered in the surrounding regions, came to Gedaliah in Mizpah.

verses.latin: et dixerunt ad eum: Nescis quia Baalis rex filiorum Ammon immisit Ismahel filium Nathaniæ, ut interficiat te? Et non credidit eis Godolias filius Ahicam.
verses.english: And they said to him: “Do you not know that Baalis, the king of the Ammonites, has sent Ishmael, the son of Nethaniah, to murder you?” But Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, did not believe what they told him.

verses.latin: Johanan ergo filius Caree locutus est ad Godoliam seorsum in Masphath, dicens: Vadens interficiam Ismahel filium Nathaniæ, nemine sciente, ne interficiat te, et dissipentur universi Judæi qui congregati sunt ad te, et pereat reliquiæ Juda.
verses.english: Then Johanan, the son of Kareah, spoke to Gedaliah privately in Mizpah, saying: “I will go and kill Ishmael, the son of Nethaniah, without anyone else knowing about it. This is so he cannot murder you, which would cause all the Jews who have gathered around you to be scattered again, and the entire remnant of Judah to perish.”

verses.latin: Et ait Godolias filius Ahicam ad Johanan filium Caree: Non facies verbum hoc: quia mendacium loqueris de Ismahel.
verses.english: But Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, said to Johanan, the son of Kareah: “You must not do this thing, for you are speaking a lie about Ishmael.”

verses.latin: Factum est autem in mense septimo, venit Ismael filius Nathaniae, filii Elisamae, de genere regio, et optimates regis, et decem viri cum eo, ad Godoliam filium Ahicam in Masphath: et comederunt ibi panem simul in Masphath.
verses.english: It happened in the seventh month: Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, son of Elishama, who was of royal lineage, came to Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, in Mizpah. With Ishmael were officers of the king and ten other men. They ate a meal together there in Mizpah.

verses.latin: Surrexitque Ismael filius Nathaniae, et decem viri qui erant cum eo, et percusserunt Godoliam filium Ahicam, filii Saphan, gladio, et interfecerunt eum, quem praeposuerat rex Babylonis terrae.
verses.english: Then Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, and the ten men who were with him, stood up. They struck Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, with a sword and killed him. Gedaliah was the one whom the King of Babylon had appointed over the land.

verses.latin: Omnes quoque Judaeos qui erant cum eo, id est, cum Godolia, in Masphath, et Chaldaeos milites, qui ibi repperti fuerant, interfecit Ismael.
verses.english: Ishmael also killed all the Jews who were with Gedaliah in Mizpah. He also killed the Chaldean soldiers who were found there.

verses.latin: In die autem secunda postquam occiderat Godoliam, nullo sciente,
verses.english: On the second day after he had killed Gedaliah, and before anyone else knew about it,

verses.latin: venerunt viri de Sichim, et de Silo, et de Samaria, octoginta viri, rasi barba, et scissis vestibus, et radentibus se, et munera portantes, ut offerrent in domo Domini.
verses.english: eighty men arrived from Shechem, Shiloh, and Samaria. Their beards were shaved, their clothes torn, and their bodies gashed, as a sign of mourning. They were carrying grain offerings and incense to present at the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: Egressus est autem Ismael filius Nathaniae in occursum eorum de Masphath, plorans atque gradiens: et cum occurrisset eis, ait ad illos: Venite ad Godoliam filium Ahicam.
verses.english: Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, went out from Mizpah to meet them, pretending to weep as he walked. When he met them, he deceptively said to them, 'Come to Gedaliah, son of Ahikam.'

verses.latin: Cumque venissent ad medium civitatis, interfecit eos Ismael filius Nathaniae, et viros qui erant cum eo, in medio civitatis, et projecit eos in medium putei.
verses.english: When they had come into the middle of the city, Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, and the men who were with him, slaughtered them in the middle of the city. Then he threw their bodies into a pit.

verses.latin: Decem autem viri reperti sunt in eis, qui dixerunt ad Ismael: Noli interficere nos, quia thesauros habemus in agro, hordeum, et triticum, et oleum, et mel. Et cessavit, et non interfecit eos cum fratribus eorum.
verses.english: However, ten of those men were found among them. They pleaded with Ishmael, 'Do not kill us! We have hidden stores of barley, wheat, oil, and honey in the fields.' So Ishmael stopped, and he did not kill them along with their companions.

verses.latin: Puteus autem in quem projecit Ismael omnia cadavera virorum quos percussit propter Godoliam, ipse est quem fecit rex Asa, propter Baasa regem Israel: ipsum replevit Ismael filius Nathaniae interfectis.
verses.english: The pit into which Ishmael threw all the bodies of the men he had killed, in connection with Gedaliah's murder, was the large cistern that King Asa had made long ago, because of King Baasha of Israel. Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, filled it with the slain.

verses.latin: Assumpsit ergo Ismael omnem residuum populi qui erat in Masphath, filias regis, et omnem populum qui residuus fuerat in Masphath, quos commiserat Nabuzardan princeps militiae Godoliae filio Ahicam: et assumpsit eos Ismael filius Nathaniae, et abiit ut transiret ad filios Ammon.
verses.english: Ishmael then captured all the rest of the people who were in Mizpah: the king's daughters and everyone else who remained in Mizpah. These were the people whom Nebuzaradan, the commander of the guard, had entrusted to Gedaliah, son of Ahikam. Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, took them and set off to cross over to the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Audivit autem Johanan filius Caree, et omnes principes exercitus qui erant cum eo, omne malum quod fecerat Ismael filius Nathaniae.
verses.english: However, Johanan, son of Kareah, and all the army commanders who were with him, heard about all the evil deeds that Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, had committed.

verses.latin: Et assumptis universis viris, abierunt ut pugnarent contra Ismael filium Nathaniae: et invenerunt eum ad aquas multas quae sunt in Gabaon.
verses.english: So, gathering all their men, they went to fight against Ishmael, son of Nethaniah. They found him by the great waters that are in Gibeon.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset omnis populus, qui erat cum Ismael, Johanan filium Caree, et omnes principes exercitus qui erant cum eo, laetati sunt.
verses.english: When all the people who had been taken by Ishmael saw Johanan, son of Kareah, and all the army commanders who were with him, they rejoiced greatly.

verses.latin: Et conversus omnis populus quem ceperat Ismael in Masphath, reversus est, et abiit ad Johanan filium Caree.
verses.english: All the people whom Ishmael had captured in Mizpah turned around. They returned and went over to Johanan, son of Kareah.

verses.latin: Ismael autem filius Nathaniae effugit cum octo viris a facie Johanan filii Caree, et abiit ad filios Ammon.
verses.english: But Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, escaped with eight of his men from Johanan, son of Kareah, and fled to the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Tollens itaque Johanan filius Caree, et omnes principes exercitus qui erant cum eo, universas reliquias populi quas reduxerat ab Ismael filio Nathaniae de Masphath, postquam percusserat Godoliam filium Ahicam, fortes viros ad proelium, et mulieres, et parvulos, et eunuchos, quos reduxerat de Gabaon:
verses.english: So Johanan, son of Kareah, and all the army commanders who were with him, gathered together all the remnant of the people whom Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, had taken from Mizpah, after he had murdered Gedaliah, son of Ahikam. These were the strong men of war, the women, the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon.

verses.latin: et abierunt, et sederunt in Camham, quae est juxta Bethlehem: ut fugerent, et introirent Aegyptum,
verses.english: They then set out and settled in Geruth Kimham, which is near Bethlehem. Their plan was to flee and go into Egypt.

verses.latin: a facie Chaldaeorum: timebant enim eos, eo quod percusisset Ismael filius Nathaniae Godoliam filium Ahicam, quem praeposuerat rex Babylonis in terra Judae.
verses.english: They did this because they feared the Chaldeans. They were afraid of retaliation for the murder of Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, whom the King of Babylon had appointed over the land of Judah, by Ishmael, son of Nethaniah.

verses.latin: Accesseruntque omnes principes bellatorum, et Johanan filius Caree, et Jezonias filius Osaiæ, et universus populus a parvo usque ad magnum,
verses.english: Then all the commanders of the army, including Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, came near with all the people, from the least important to the greatest.

verses.latin: et dixerunt ad Jeremiam prophetam: Cadat oratio nostra in conspectu tuo, et ora pro nobis ad Dominum Deum tuum pro universo residuo hoc, quia derelicti sumus pauci de multis, sicut tu intueris oculis tuis.
verses.english: And they said to Jeremiah the prophet: 'Let our prayer be heard before you, and pray for us to God Our Lord. Pray for all of this small remnant of people. We have been left behind—only a few of us from the many—just as you yourself can see with your own eyes.'

verses.latin: Et annuntiet nobis Dominus Deus vester viam per quam ire debeamus, et sermonem quem facere.
verses.english: 'And let God Our Lord reveal to us the way in which we ought to go, and the message we should follow.'

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eos Jeremias propheta: Audivi: ecce ego oro ad Dominum Deum nostrum secundum sermones vestros: et omne verbum quodcumque responderit mihi, indicabo vobis: nec celabo vos quippiam.
verses.english: Jeremiah the prophet said to them: 'I have heard you. Behold, I will pray to God Our Lord on your behalf, according to your words. And every single message that He answers me with, I will tell you. I will not hide anything from you.'

verses.latin: Et ipsi dixerunt ad Jeremiam: Sit Dominus inter nos testis verus et fidelis, si non juxta omne verbum in quo miserit te Dominus Deus tuus ad nos, sic faciemus.
verses.english: And they themselves said to Jeremiah: 'May Our Lord be a true and faithful witness between us. We swear that we will do exactly according to every message that God Our Lord sends you to us with.'

verses.latin: Sive bonum, sive malum, voci Domini Dei nostri ad quem mittimus te, obediemus: ut bene sit nobis, cum audierimus vocem Domini Dei nostri.
verses.english: 'Whether the message is good or bad, we will obey the voice of God Our Lord, to Whom we are sending you, so that it may go well with us when we listen to the voice of God Our Lord.'

verses.latin: Factum est autem post dies decem, verbum Domini ad Jeremiam.
verses.english: Then, after ten days, the message from Our Lord came to Jeremiah.

verses.latin: Et vocavit Johanan filium Caree, et omnes principes bellatorum qui erant cum eo, et universum populum a minimo usque ad maximum.
verses.english: So Jeremiah called Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the commanders of the army who were with him, and all the people, from the least important to the greatest.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël, ad quem misistis me ut prosternerem preces vestras in conspectu ejus:
verses.english: And he said to them: 'Thus says God Our Lord, the God of Israel, to Whom you sent me to present your prayers before Him...'

verses.latin: Si sedentes manseritis in terra hac, ædificabo vos, et non dissipabo: plantabo, et non evellam: jam enim placatus sum super malo quod feci vobis.
verses.english: 'If you remain settled in this land, I will build you up and not tear you down. I will plant you and not pluck you up. For I have now relented from the disaster that I brought upon you.'

verses.latin: Nolite timere a facie regis Babylonis, quem vos pavetis: nolite metuere eum, dicit Dominus: quia vobiscum ego sum ut salvem vos, et eruam de manu ejus.
verses.english: 'Do not fear the king of Babylon, whom you are terrified of. Do not be afraid of him, declares Our Lord. For I am with you to save you and to rescue you from his power.'

verses.latin: Et dabo vobis misericordiam, et miserebor vestri, et reducam vos ad terram vestram.
verses.english: 'And I will show you mercy; I will have compassion on you. I will bring you back to your own land.'

verses.latin: Quod si dixeritis: Nolumus manere in terra hac, nec audire vocem Domini Dei nostri,
verses.english: 'But if you say: 'We do not want to remain in this land,' and if you do not listen to the voice of God Our Lord...'

verses.latin: dicentes: Nequaquam, sed in terram Ægypti pergemus, ubi non videbimus bellum, et vocem tubæ non audiemus, et famem non sustinebimus: et ibi habitabimus:
verses.english: '...saying: 'No, not at all! Instead, we will go into the land of Egypt, where we will not see war, and we will not hear the sound of the trumpet, and we will not suffer from famine!' —and so you intend to live there...'

verses.latin: propter hoc nunc audite verbum Domini, residuum Juda: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Si fixeritis facies vestras ut ingrediamini Ægyptum, et ingressi fueritis ibi, ut habitetis,
verses.english: 'Because of this, now hear the message of Our Lord, you remnant of Judah! Thus says Our Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: 'If you stubbornly set your faces toward entering Egypt, and if you indeed go there to live...'

verses.latin: gladius quem vos formidatis, ibi comprehendet vos in terra Ægypti: et fames pro qua timetis, ibi adhærebit vobis in Ægypto: et ibi moriemini.
verses.english: '...then the very sword that you dread will overtake you there in the land of Egypt. And the famine that you fear will cling to you there in Egypt. And there you will die.'

verses.latin: Et erunt omnes viri qui fixerint facies suas ut ingrediantur Ægyptum, ut habitent ibi, morientes gladio, et fame, et peste: nullus erit ex eis qui superfugiat, et effugiat a facie mali quod ego inducam super eos.
verses.english: 'And all the men who stubbornly set their faces toward entering Egypt to live there will die by the sword, by famine, and by plague. Not one of them will survive or escape from the disaster that I will bring upon them.'

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Sicut redundavit ira mea et indignatio mea super habitatores Jerusalem, sic redundabit indignatio mea super vos, si ingressi fueritis Ægyptum: et eritis in jusjurandum, et in stuporem, et in maledictionem, et in opprobrium, et nequaquam ultra videbitis locum istum.
verses.english: 'For thus says Our Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Just as My wrath and My indignation poured out over the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so will My indignation pour out over you if you enter Egypt. You will become an object of cursing, astonishment, malediction, and disgrace, and you will never again see this place.'

verses.latin: Verbum locutus est super vos Dominus, o reliquiæ Juda, ne eatis in Ægyptum: scitote scientes quia contestatus sum vobis hodie,
verses.english: 'Our Lord has spoken this message over you, O remnant of Judah: Do not go into Egypt! Know this for certain, because I have solemnly warned you today.'

verses.latin: quia simulastis in animabus vestris, dicentes: Oremus pro nobis ad Dominum Deum nostrum: secundum omnia quæcumque dixerit Dominus Deus noster nobis, sic faciemus: et nunc simulastis in animas vestras.
verses.english: 'For you acted deceptively with your own souls when you said: 'Let us pray to God Our Lord for us. According to everything that God Our Lord tells us, so we will do.' And yet now you have acted deceptively with your own souls.'

verses.latin: Et misistis me ad Dominum Deum nostrum, dicentes: Ora pro nobis ad Dominum Deum nostrum, et secundum omnia quæcumque dixerit tibi Dominus Deus noster, ita annuntia nobis.
verses.english: 'And you sent me to God Our Lord, saying: 'Pray for us to God Our Lord, and according to everything that God Our Lord tells you, so announce it to us.''

verses.latin: Et nunc scitote scientes, quia gladio, et fame, et peste moriemini in loco ad quem voluistis ire ut habitaretis ibi.
verses.english: 'Therefore, know this for certain now: you will die by the sword, by famine, and by plague in the very place where you desired to go and live.'

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum complesset Jeremias loquens ad populum universos sermones Domini Dei eorum, pro quibus miserat Dominus Deus eorum illum ad eos, omnia verba ista:
verses.english: And so it happened, when Jeremiah had finished speaking to all the people every single word of the Lord their God—those words for which the Lord their God had sent him on a mission to them—all these very words:

verses.latin: dixerunt Azarias filius Osajæ, et Johanan filius Caree, et omnes viri superbi, dicentes ad Jeremiam: Mendacium tu loqueris: non misit te Dominus Deus noster, dicens: Ne eatis in Aegyptum, ut ibi habitetis.
verses.english: Then Azariah, the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan, the son of Kareah, and all the arrogant men spoke, saying to Jeremiah: "You are speaking a lie! The Lord our God has not sent you on a mission, saying: 'Do not go to Egypt to live there.'"

verses.latin: Sed Baruch filius Neriæ incitat te adversum nos, ut tradas nos in manus Chaldæorum, ut interficiant nos, et transferant nos in Babylonem.
verses.english: "Instead, Baruch, the son of Neriah, is inciting you against us, so that you may hand us over into the power of the Chaldeans, to kill us and to carry us away to Babylon."

verses.latin: Et non audivit Johanan filius Caree, et omnes principes bellatorum, et universus populus, vocem Domini, ut manerent in terra Juda.
verses.english: So Johanan, the son of Kareah, and all the commanders of the soldiers, and all the people, did not listen to the voice of the Lord, so that they might remain in the land of Judah.

verses.latin: Sed duxit Johanan filius Caree, et omnes principes bellatorum, universas reliquias Judæ, quæ reversæ fuerant de cunctis gentibus ad quas fuerant ejectæ, ut habitarent in terra Juda,
verses.english: Instead, Johanan, the son of Kareah, and all the commanders of the soldiers, took all the remaining people of Judah who had returned from all the nations where they had been exiled, so that they might live in the land of Judah.

verses.latin: viros, et mulieres, et parvulos, et filias regis, et omnem animam quam dimiserat Nabuzardan princeps militiæ cum Godolia filio Ahicam filii Saphan, et Jeremiam prophetam, et Baruch filium Neriæ.
verses.english: They took the men, and the women, and the children, and the king's daughters, and every living person whom Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard, had left behind with Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan. And they also took Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch, the son of Neriah.

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt terram Aegypti: quia non obedierunt voci Domini: et venerunt usque ad Taphnis.
verses.english: And so they entered the land of Egypt because they had not obeyed the voice of the Lord, and they came all the way to Tahpanhes.

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad Jeremiam in Taphnis, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying:

verses.latin: Sume lapides magnos in manu tua, et absconde eos in crypta, quæ est sub muro latericio in porta domus Pharaonis in Taphnis, videntibus viris Judæis:
verses.english: "Take large stones in your hand and bury them in the hidden place that is under the brick pavement at the entrance of Pharaoh's house in Tahpanhes, with the men of Judah watching."

verses.latin: et dices ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Ecce ego mittam et assumam Nabuchodonosor regem Babylonis servum meum: et ponam thronum ejus super lapides istos quos abscondisti, et statuet tentorium suum super eos.
verses.english: "And you are to say to them: 'Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: "Behold, I myself am sending for and bringing Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, my servant. And I will set his throne upon these very stones which you have hidden, and he will pitch his royal tent over them."'

verses.latin: Et veniens percutiet terram Aegypti: quos in mortem, in mortem: et quos in captivitatem, in captivitatem: et quos in gladium, in gladium.
verses.english: "And when he comes, he will strike the land of Egypt. Those destined for death will face death; those destined for captivity will go into captivity; and those destined for the sword will die by the sword."

verses.latin: Et succendet ignem in domibus deorum Aegypti, et comburet eas, et captivas ducet illos: et exspoliabit terram Aegypti, sicut exspoliat pastor vestimentum suum de stercore: et egredietur inde in pace.
verses.english: "And he will set fire to the houses of the gods of Egypt; he will burn them and lead their idols into captivity. He will strip the land of Egypt clean, just as a shepherd thoroughly cleans his garment of clinging dirt or parasites. Then he will depart from there in peace."

verses.latin: Et comminuet statuas domus solis, quæ sunt in terra Aegypti, et domos deorum Aegypti comburet igni.
verses.english: "And he will break to pieces the sacred pillars of Heliopolis, which are in the land of Egypt, and he will burn the temples of the gods of Egypt with fire."

verses.latin: Sermo, qui factus est ad Jeremiam, de omni Judæo, qui habitabat in terra Ægypti, habitantes in Magdalo, et in Taphnis, et in Memphis, et in terra Phathures, dicens:
verses.english: This is the message that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews living in the land of Egypt. These were the Jews dwelling in Migdol, Tahpanhes, Memphis, and in the region of Pathros. The message stated:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Vos vidistis omne malum, quod adduxi super Jerusalem, et super omnes civitates Juda: et ecce sunt desertæ hodie, et non est in eis habitator.
verses.english: This is what the Lord of heavenly armies, the God of Israel, says: 'You yourselves have seen all the disasters I brought upon Jerusalem and upon all the cities of Judah. Behold, they are desolate ruins today, and no one lives in them anymore.'

verses.latin: A facie malitiæ eorum, quam fecerunt ut me ad iracundiam provocarent, et irent, et libarent diis alienis, et adorarent eos, quos et ipsi ignoraverunt, et vos, et patres vestri.
verses.english: This happened because of the evil deeds they committed, which provoked Me to anger. They did this by going and offering incense to other gods and worshipping them—false gods that neither they, nor you, nor your fathers had ever known.

verses.latin: Et misi ad vos omnes servos meos prophetas, consurgens diluculo, et mittens, dicens: Nolite facere rem abhominationis hujuscemodi, quam ego odi.
verses.english: Even so, I sent all My servants the prophets to you, again and again, rising early and sending them. I told them to say: 'Do not do this detestable kind of thing that I hate.'

verses.latin: Et non audierunt, nec inclinaverunt aurem suam, ut converterentur a malis suis, et non libarent diis alienis.
verses.english: But they did not listen, nor did they pay any attention. They refused to turn from their evil ways and stop offering incense to other gods.

verses.latin: Et effusa est indignatio mea, et furor meus, et exarsit in civitatibus Juda, et in plateis Jerusalem: et factæ sunt in solitudinem, et in vastitatem, sicut est dies hæc.
verses.english: So My indignation and My fury were poured out, and they burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. These places became a desolate ruin and a waste, just as you see them this very day.

verses.latin: Et nunc hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Quare vos facitis malum grande hoc contra animas vestras, ut intereat ex vobis vir et mulier, parvulus et lactens de medio Judæ, nec remaneant vobis reliquiæ?
verses.english: Now, therefore, this is what the Lord of heavenly armies, the God of Israel, says: 'Why are you doing this great evil against your own lives? You are causing men and women, infants and nursing babies to perish from among you in Judah, ensuring that no remnant remains for you.'

verses.latin: In eo quod me ad iracundiam provocatis in operibus manuum vestrarum, sacrificantes diis alienis in terra Ægypti, quo venistis ut ibi peregrinaremini, et interiretis, fieretisque in maledictionem, et in opprobrium cunctis gentibus terræ?
verses.english: You provoke Me to anger with the works of your own hands by offering sacrifices to false gods in the land of Egypt, where you have come to live as foreigners. By doing this, you ensure your own destruction, making yourselves a curse and a disgrace among all the nations of the earth.

verses.latin: Num obliti estis mala patrum vestrorum, et mala regum Juda, et mala uxorum eorum, et mala vestra, et mala uxorum vestrarum, quæ fecerunt in terra Juda, et in plateis Jerusalem?
verses.english: Have you forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, and the wickedness of the kings of Judah, and the wickedness of their wives? Have you forgotten your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives, which they all committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

verses.latin: Non sunt mundati usque ad diem hanc, et non timuerunt, et non ambulaverunt in lege mea, et in præceptis meis, quæ dedi vobis, et patribus vestris.
verses.english: They have not humbled themselves or been cleansed of their sins even to this very day. They have not feared Me, nor have they walked in My law and in My commandments, which I gave to you and to your fathers.

verses.latin: Propter hoc hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Ecce ego pono facies meas in vobis in malum, et in perditionem omnis Judæ.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord of heavenly armies, the God of Israel, says: 'Behold, I am setting My face against you with resolve to bring disaster and to destroy all Judah.'

verses.latin: Et assumam reliquias Judæ, quæ posuerunt facies suas ut ingrederentur terram Ægypti, et peregrinarentur ibi: et deficient omnes in terra Ægypti: cadent in gladio, et in fame: a minimo usque ad maximum gladio et fame morientur: et erunt in maledictionem, et in stuporem, et in execrationem, et in opprobrium.
verses.english: I will take the remnant of Judah who stubbornly set their minds on going into the land of Egypt to live there as foreigners. They will all perish in the land of Egypt; they will fall by the sword and by famine. From the least important to the most important, they will die by sword and famine. They will become a curse, an object of horror, a malediction, and a reproach.

verses.latin: Et visitabo super habitantes in terra Ægypti, sicut visitavi super Jerusalem, in gladio, et fame, et peste.
verses.english: I will punish those who live in the land of Egypt, just as I punished Jerusalem, with the sword, famine, and pestilence.

verses.latin: Et non erit qui effugiat, et evadat de reliquiis Judæ, qui ingrediuntur terram Ægypti ut peregrinentur ibi: quin potius revertantur in terram Juda, quam desiderant reversione animarum suarum ut habitent ibi: non revertentur, nisi qui fugerint.
verses.english: There will be no one who escapes and survives from the remnant of Judah who go into the land of Egypt to live there as foreigners. They will not return to the land of Judah, which they desire with all their souls to inhabit. No, they will not return, except for a very few who manage to flee in haste.

verses.latin: Responditque Jeremiæ omnes viri scientes se libasse diis alienis, et uxores eorum, et omnis turba de terra Judæ, in terra Ægypti, habitantes in Phathures, dicentes:
verses.english: Then all the men who knew that their wives were regularly offering sacrifices to false gods, along with their wives, and all the large crowd of Jews from the land of Judah who were living in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying:

verses.latin: Sermonem, quem locutus es ad nos in nomine Domini, non audiemus a te:
verses.english: 'The message you have spoken to us in the name of the Lord—we will not listen to it from you!'

verses.latin: sed facientes faciemus omne verbum, quod egredietur de ore nostro, sacrificare reginæ cæli, et libare ei libamina, sicut fecimus nos, et patres nostri, reges nostri, et principes nostri in civitatibus Juda, et in plateis Jerusalem: et saturati sumus panibus, et bene nobis erat, et malum non vidimus.
verses.english: 'No, we will certainly do everything we have vowed to do, which comes out of our own mouths. We will continue to offer sacrifices to the Queen of Heaven—that pagan goddess—and pour out drink offerings to her, just as we ourselves, and our fathers, our kings, and our princes did in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. When we did this, we were filled with bread, and it was well with us; we experienced no misfortune.'

verses.latin: Et ex quo cessavimus sacrificare reginæ cæli, et libare ei libamina, omnibus indigemus, et gladio, et fame consumpti sumus.
verses.english: 'But ever since we stopped offering sacrifices to the Queen of Heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked everything, and we have been consumed by the sword and by famine.'

verses.latin: Quod si nos sacrificamus reginæ cæli, et libamus ei libamina, numquid sine viris nostris fecimus ei placentas, ad colendam eam, et fundenda libamina?
verses.english: 'And when we women offer sacrifices to the Queen of Heaven and pour out drink offerings to her, do you think we make cakes in her image for her worship and pour out drink offerings to her without our husbands knowing about it and consenting?' This implies a rhetorical 'No, we do it with their full knowledge and consent.'

verses.latin: Et dixit Jeremias ad populum, contra omnes viros, et contra omnes mulieres, qui responderant ei verba hæc, dicens:
verses.english: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the people, to all the men and all the women who had answered him with those words, saying:

verses.latin: Numquid sacrificii, quæ obtulistis in civitatibus Juda, et in plateis Jerusalem, vos et patres vestri, reges vestri, et principes vestri, et populus terræ, non horum recordatus est Dominus, et ascendit super cor ejus?
verses.english: 'The sacrifices you offered in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem—you and your fathers, your kings, and your princes, and the people of the land—did the Lord not remember these things? Did these actions not come into His mind?'

verses.latin: Et non ultra poterat Dominus sufferre, pro malitia studiorum vestrorum, et pro abominationibus quas fecistis: et facta est terra vestra in desolationem, et in stuporem, et in maledictionem, eo quod non esset habitator, sicut est dies hæc.
verses.english: 'And the Lord could no longer tolerate it, because of the wickedness of your deeds and because of the detestable things you committed. Therefore, your land became a desolation, a place of horror, and a curse, without an inhabitant, just as you see it this very day.'

verses.latin: Quia incensum obtulistis, et peccastis Domino, et non audistis vocem Domini, et in lege ejus, et in præceptis ejus, et in testimoniis ejus non ambulastis: idcirco evenerunt vobis mala hæc, sicut est dies hæc.
verses.english: 'Because you offered incense and sinned against the Lord, and you did not obey the voice of the Lord, and you did not walk in His law, in His commandments, and in His testimonies, these disasters have come upon you, just as you see them this very day.'

verses.latin: Et dixit Jeremias ad omnem populum, et ad universas mulieres: Audite verbum Domini, omnis Juda, qui estis in terra Ægypti:
verses.english: Jeremiah then said to all the people and to all the women: 'Hear the message of the Lord, all of you from Judah who are in the land of Egypt!'

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël, dicens: Vos et uxores vestræ locuti estis ore vestro, et manibus vestris impletistis, dicentes: Facientes faciemus vota nostra, quæ vovimus, ut sacrificemus reginæ cæli, et libemus ei libamina. Firmastis igitur vota vestra, et impletistis ea.
verses.english: 'This is what the Lord of heavenly armies, the God of Israel, says: "You and your wives have spoken with your mouths and carried out with your hands, saying: 'We will certainly perform our vows which we made, to offer sacrifices to the Queen of Heaven and pour out drink offerings to her.' You have indeed confirmed your vows and have fulfilled them with your actions."'

verses.latin: Idcirco audite verbum Domini, omnis Juda, qui habitatis in terra Ægypti: Ecce juravi in nomine meo magno, dicit Dominus: quia non vocabitur nomen meum ultra per os omnis viri Judæ, in omni terra Ægypti, dicentis: Vivit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: 'Therefore, hear the message of the Lord, all of you from Judah who live in the land of Egypt: "Behold, I have sworn by My great name," says the Lord, "that My name will no longer be invoked by the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, no one saying: 'As the Lord God lives!' This means their claim to follow Me will cease."'

verses.latin: Ecce ego vigilabo super eos in malum, et non in bonum: et consumentur omnes viri Juda, qui sunt in terra Ægypti, gladio, et fame, donec consumantur funditus.
verses.english: '"Behold, I will watch over them for evil and not for good. All the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt will be consumed by the sword and by famine until they are utterly destroyed and perish."'

verses.latin: Et paucissimi, qui fugerint gladium, revertentur de terra Ægypti in terram Juda: et scient omnes reliquiæ Judæ, qui ingressi sunt terram Ægypti ut peregrinarentur ibi, cujus sermo firmetur, meus, an ipsorum.
verses.english: 'And only a very few who escape the sword will return from the land of Egypt to the land of Judah. Then all the remnant of Judah who entered the land of Egypt to live as foreigners there will know whose word stands firm: My word, or their word.'

verses.latin: Et hoc vobis signum, ait Dominus, quod visitabo super vos in loco isto, ut sciatis quia vere firmabuntur sermones mei contra vos in malum:
verses.english: 'And this will be a sign to you,' says the Lord, 'that I will punish you in this very place, so that you may know that My words will truly be established against you to bring disaster.'

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce ego tradam Pharaonem Ephree regem Ægypti, in manu inimicorum ejus, et in manu quærentium animam ejus: sicut tradidi Sedeciam regem Juda, in manu Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis inimici ejus, et quærentis animam ejus.
verses.english: 'This is what the Lord says: "Behold, I will hand over Pharaoh Hophra, the king of Egypt, into the hand of his enemies and into the hand of those who seek his life, just as I handed over Zedekiah, the king of Judah, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon—his enemy and one who sought his life."'

verses.latin: Verbum, quod locutus est Jeremias propheta ad Baruch filium Neriæ, cum scriberet hæc verba in libro, ex ore Jeremiæ, quarto anno Joakim filii Josiæ regis Juda, dicens:
verses.english: This is the message that the prophet Jeremiah spoke to Baruch, son of Neriah. This happened when Baruch was writing these words from Jeremiah's own dictation into a scroll, during the fourth year of Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, as king of Judah. Jeremiah delivered the message to Baruch, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël, ad te, Baruch:
verses.english: The Lord God of Israel says this to you, Baruch:

verses.latin: Dixisti: Væ mihi misero! Quia addidit Dominus mœstitiam dolori meo: laboravi in gemitu meo, et requiem non inveni.
verses.english: You said, 'Alas for me, I am miserable! The Lord has added more sorrow to my existing pain. I am exhausted from my constant groaning, and I cannot find any peace or rest.'

verses.latin: Hæc dicet ei: Hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce quos ædificavi, destruo: et quos plantavi, evello: et omnem terram.
verses.english: Then Jeremiah will say this to him: The Lord declares, 'Listen! What I have built up, I am now going to tear down. What I have planted, I am now going to uproot. This will happen throughout all the land.'

verses.latin: Et tu quæris tibi grandia? Noli quærere: quia ecce ego adducam malum super omnem carnem, ait Dominus: et dabo animam tuam tibi in salutem in cunctis locis, ad quæcumque perrexeris.
verses.english: And are you seeking great things and personal honors for yourself? Stop seeking them! For behold, the Lord declares, 'I am about to bring disaster upon all of humanity. But I will allow you to keep your life as a spoil of war, and you will be safe wherever you go.'

verses.latin: Verbum Domini, quod factum est ad Jeremiam prophetam adversum gentes.
verses.english: This is the word of the Lord, which came to Jeremiah the prophet, and it was a message against the nations.

verses.latin: Ad Ægyptum, adversum exercitum Pharaonis Nechao regis Ægypti, qui erat juxta flumen Euphraten in Charcamis, quem percussit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, in quarto anno Joakim filii Josiae regis Juda.
verses.english: It was a message concerning Egypt and the army of Pharaoh Neco, the king of Egypt. This army was stationed by the Euphrates River at Carchemish, where Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, defeated them. This battle happened in the fourth year of the reign of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, the king of Judah.

verses.latin: Præparate scutum et clypeum, et procedite ad bellum.
verses.english: To the Egyptian army, God says: Prepare your large shield and your small buckler, and go forth to war!

verses.latin: Jungite equos, et ascendite, equites: consistite in galeis, ornatæ galeis, politæ hastas, induite vos loricas.
verses.english: Harness your horses, O horsemen, and mount them! Stand ready with your helmets, fitted securely, and sharpen your spears. Put on your breastplates, O warriors!

verses.latin: Quid igitur? vidi ipsos terrore perculsos, et terga vertentes, robustos eorum cæsos, et in fugam conversos: non sunt reversi, pavore undique. Ait Dominus.
verses.english: But what is this that I see? I see them utterly terrified, turning their backs and fleeing! Their mighty warriors are cut down and have turned to run away. They have not returned because fear has gripped them from every side, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Non fugiet velox, et non salvabitur fortis: ad aquilonem sub manu fluminis Euphratis conciderunt, et corruerunt.
verses.english: The swift soldier will not escape, and the strong warrior will not be saved. By the Euphrates River, in the northern lands, they have stumbled and fallen down completely.

verses.latin: Quis est iste qui quasi flumen ascendit, et sicut fluviorum intumescunt gurgites ejus?
verses.english: Who is this that rises up like the Nile River, and whose waters surge like powerful torrents?

verses.latin: Ægyptus flumen ascendit, et sicut flumina intumescent gurgites ejus, et dicet: Ascendam et operiam terram: interficiam civitatem et habitatores ejus.
verses.english: It is Egypt, rising up like the Nile, and its waters will surge like torrents. Egypt says: 'I will rise up and cover the whole land! I will destroy its cities and all their inhabitants!'

verses.latin: Scandite equos, et exsultate in curribus, ite instructi fortes: Æthiopes et Libyes tenentes scutum, et Lydii tenentes et dirigentes sagittam.
verses.english: Mount your horses, and rejoice in your chariots, O mighty warriors! Go forth, Ethiopians and Libyans, holding your shields! And you, Lydians, hold and direct your arrows!

verses.latin: Dies autem ille Domini Dei exercituum, dies ultionis, ut sumat vindictam de inimicis suis: devorabit gladius, et saturabitur, et inebriabitur sanguine eorum: victima enim Domini Dei exercituum in terra aquilonis, juxta flumen Euphraten.
verses.english: But that day is the day of the Lord, the God of the heavenly armies—a day of vengeance, when He will take retribution on His enemies. The sword will devour until it is completely satisfied, and it will be drunk with their blood. For this is a sacrifice to the Lord, the God of heavenly armies, in the northern land, by the Euphrates River.

verses.latin: Ascende in Galaad, et tolle resinam, virgo filia Ægypti: frustra multiplicas medicamenta, sanitas non erit tibi.
verses.english: Go up to Gilead and gather healing balm, O virgin daughter of Egypt! You multiply your medicines in vain; there will be no healing for you from this wound.

verses.latin: Audierunt gentes ignominiam tuam, et ululatus tuus replevit terram: quoniam fortis ad fortem irruit, et ambo pariter conciderunt.
verses.english: The nations have heard of your shame and disgrace, and your wailing has filled the whole earth. For a mighty warrior has stumbled against another mighty warrior, and both of them have fallen together.

verses.latin: Verbum, quod locutus est Dominus ad Jeremiam prophetam, super eo quod venturus esset Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, et percussurus terram Ægypti.
verses.english: This is the word that the Lord spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, concerning Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, and his coming to strike the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Annuntiate in Ægypto, et auditum facite in Magdal, et resonet in Memphis, et in Taphnis: dicite: Sta, et para te, quia devorabit gladius juxta te.
verses.english: Announce it in Egypt! Make it heard in Migdol! Let it resound in Memphis and Tahpanhes! Say to them: 'Stand ready and prepare yourselves, for the sword will devour all around you!'

verses.latin: Quare ruit fortis tuus? non stetit, quoniam Dominus subvertit eum.
verses.english: Why has your mighty protector fallen? He did not stand, because the Lord Himself overthrew him.

verses.latin: Multiplicavit ruentes, ceciditque vir ad proximum suum, et dicent: Surge, et revertamur ad populum nostrum, et ad terram nativitatis nostræ, a facie gladii columbæ.
verses.english: Many have fallen, and one man has fallen upon his neighbor. They will say: 'Arise, let us return to our own people and to the land of our birth, away from the face of the sword of the oppressor from the north.'

verses.latin: Voca nomen Pharaonis regis Ægypti: tumultum horae.
verses.english: Call the name of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt: 'A mere boast at its appointed time,' or 'A great noise that quickly passes.'

verses.latin: Vivo ego, inquit Rex, Dominus exercituum nomen ejus: quia sicut Thabor in montibus, et sicut Carmelus in mari, ita veniet.
verses.english: 'As I live,' says the King, whose name is the Lord of heavenly armies, 'for as Tabor stands majestic among the mountains, and as Carmel rises by the sea, so surely will he come!'

verses.latin: Vasa transmigrationis fac tibi, habitatrix filia Ægypti: quia Memphis in solitudinem erit, et deserta atque inhabitabilis.
verses.english: Prepare for yourselves your traveling bags for exile, O dwelling daughter of Egypt! For Memphis will become a desolate wasteland, laid waste and completely uninhabited.

verses.latin: Ægyptus vitula speciosissima, stimulo de aquilone veniente, veniet ei.
verses.english: Egypt is like a most beautiful heifer, but a stinging gadfly, a deadly attack, will come to her from the north.

verses.latin: Mercenarii quoque ejus, qui versabantur in medio illius quasi vituli saginati, versi sunt, et fugerunt simul, nec steterunt: quia dies interfectionis eorum venit super illos, tempus visitationis eorum.
verses.english: Even her hired soldiers, who were among her like well-fed calves, have turned and fled together; they could not stand their ground. For the day of their slaughter has come upon them, the very time of their divine punishment.

verses.latin: Vox ejus quasi æris sonabit, quoniam cum exercitu properabunt, et cum securibus venient ei quasi cædentes ligna.
verses.english: Her voice will sound like the hiss of a serpent fleeing, because the enemy will march with an army and come against her with axes, like those who cut down trees in a forest.

verses.latin: Succiderunt saltum ejus, ait Dominus, qui suppleri non potest: quoniam multiplicati sunt super locustas, et non est eis numerus.
verses.english: They have cut down her forest, says the Lord, a forest that cannot be replenished. For the invaders are more numerous than locusts, and there is no numbering them.

verses.latin: Confusa est filia Ægypti, tradita est in manu populi aquilonis.
verses.english: The daughter of Egypt is utterly put to shame; she is delivered into the hand of the people from the north.

verses.latin: Dixit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Ecce ego visitabo super tumultum Alexandriæ, et super Pharaonem, et super Ægyptum, et super deos ejus, et super reges ejus, et super Pharaonem, et super eos qui confidunt in eo.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord of heavenly armies, the God of Israel: 'Behold, I am about to punish the mighty pride of Alexandria, and Pharaoh, and Egypt itself, and her gods, and her kings — even Pharaoh and all those who trust in him.'

verses.latin: Et dabo eos in manu quærentium animas eorum, et in manu Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis, et in manu servorum ejus: et post hæc inhabitabitur sicut diebus pristinis, ait Dominus.
verses.english: And I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants. But after these things, Egypt shall be inhabited again, as in the days of old, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et tu ne timeas, serve meus Jacob, et ne paveas Israël: quia ecce ego salvabo te de longinquo, et semen tuum de terra captivitatis: et revertetur Jacob, et requiescet, et prosperabitur, et non erit qui exterreat eum.
verses.english: But as for you, My servant Jacob, do not fear, and do not be terrified, O Israel! For behold, I will save you from distant lands, and your descendants from the land of their captivity. And Jacob shall return and rest and be at peace, and no one shall make him afraid.

verses.latin: Tu ergo ne timeas, serve meus Jacob, ait Dominus, quia tecum ego sum: quoniam ego consumam cunctas gentes ad quas ejeci te: te vero non consumam, sed castigabo te in judicio, nec quasi innocenti parcam tibi.
verses.english: Therefore, do not fear, O My servant Jacob, says the Lord, for I am with you. For I will utterly destroy all the nations among whom I have scattered you, but I will not utterly destroy you. Instead, I will discipline you with justice, and I will by no means let you go unpunished as if you were innocent.

verses.latin: Verbum Domini, quod factum est ad Jeremiam prophetam adversum Philisthiim, priusquam percuteret Pharao Gazam.
verses.english: The word of the Lord, which came to Jeremiah the prophet, was a prophecy concerning the Philistines. This prophecy came before Pharaoh attacked the city of Gaza.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Ecce aquae ascendunt ab aquilone, et erunt quasi torrens inundans, et operient terram, et plenitudinem ejus: urbem et habitatores ejus. Clamabunt viri, et ululabunt omnes habitatores terrae.
verses.english: The Lord declares: "Behold, a great flood of devastation is rising from the north, like an overflowing torrent. It will cover the land and all its inhabitants—the cities and everyone living in them. People will cry out in terror, and all the inhabitants of that land will wail."
