verses.latin: A voce ruentium armorum, et bellantium principum, a strepitu rotarum, et impetu quadrigarum, non converterunt patres manus ad filios, propter imbecillitatem manuum.
verses.english: At the terrifying sound of crashing weapons and the shouts of warring princes, at the loud rumbling of chariot wheels and the furious charge of war chariots, fathers will be too paralyzed by fear and despair to even reach out to save their children. Their hands will be too weak from terror to act.

verses.latin: Pro eo quod vastator venerit super omnes Philisthiim, et disperdat Tyrum et Sidonem cum omnibus auxiliis suis. SICCABIT enim Dominus Philisthiim, reliquias insulae Caphthoris.
verses.english: This devastation comes because a destroyer will come against all the Philistines, intending to destroy the cities of Tyre and Sidon, along with all their allied forces. For the Lord will completely annihilate the Philistines, those remaining descendants from the island of Caphtor.

verses.latin: Venit calvitium super Gazam, conticuit Ascalon et reliquiae vallis eorum: usquequo concideris, novacula Domini?
verses.english: Gaza has been stripped bare in mourning and desolation. Ashkelon is utterly silent, and the remaining inhabitants of their coastal plain are likewise silent. The prophet cries out, "How long will you continue to destroy, O razor of the Lord?"

verses.latin: O novacula Domini, usquequo non quiesces? in vaginam tuam convertere, quiesce, et sile.
verses.english: "O razor of the Lord, how long will you keep destroying? When will you finally rest? Sheathe yourself! Be still, and be silent!"

verses.latin: Quomodo quiescet, cum Dominus præceperit ei adversum Ascalonem, et adversum maritimas ejus regiones, ibique fundaverit illam?
verses.english: "How can it possibly rest when the Lord Himself has given it a command? He has directed it against Ashkelon and against all the Philistine coastal regions, and there He has appointed its destructive work."

verses.latin: Ad Moab hæc dicit Dominus exercituum Deus Israël: Væ super Nabo, quoniam vastata est, et confusa! capta est Cariathaim, confusa est fortis, et tremuit.
verses.english: The Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says this concerning Moab: Woe to Nebo, for it is laid waste and put to shame! Kiriathaim has been captured; her stronghold is disgraced and has trembled.

verses.latin: Non est ultra exsultatio in Moab super Hesebon cogitaverunt malum. Venite, et disperdamus eam de gente. Ergo silens conticiscens, sequetur te gladius.
verses.english: There is no more rejoicing in Moab over Heshbon. An evil plan has been devised: “Come, let us destroy Moab from being a nation.” Therefore, you will be silenced and pursued by the sword.

verses.latin: Vox clamoris de Oronaim, vastitas et contritio magna.
verses.english: A voice of crying is heard from Horonaim, a great devastation and destruction.

verses.latin: Contrita est Moab, annuntiate vocem parvulis ejus.
verses.english: Moab has been crushed. Proclaim her fate to her little ones.

verses.latin: Per ascensum Luith plorans ascendit in fletu: quoniam in descensu Oronaim hostes ululatum excitaverunt.
verses.english: With bitter weeping, they ascend the road to Luhith. For on the descent to Horonaim, the enemies have raised a cry of destruction.

verses.latin: Fugite, salvate animas vestras: et eritis quasi myrice in deserto.
verses.english: Flee, save your lives, and you will be like a desert bush in the wilderness.

verses.latin: Pro eo enim quod habuisti fiduciam in munitionibus tuis, et in thesauris tuis, tu quoque capieris: et exibit Chamos in transmigrationem, sacerdotes ejus et principes ejus simul.
verses.english: Because you trusted in your strongholds and your treasures, you also will be captured. Chemosh (the god of Moab) will go into exile, along with his priests and his princes.

verses.latin: Et veniet prædo ad omnem civitatem, et urbs nulla salvabitur: et peribunt valles, et dissipabuntur campi, quoniam dixit Dominus.
verses.english: A destroyer will come to every city, and no city will be saved. The valleys will perish, and the plains will be laid waste, for the Lord has spoken it.

verses.latin: Date florem Moab, quia florens egredietur: et civitates ejus desertæ erunt, et inhabitabilis.
verses.english: Give wings to Moab, that she may flee swiftly. Her cities will become desolate and uninhabited.

verses.latin: Maledictus qui facit opus Domini fraudulenter: et maledictus qui prohibet gladium suum a sanguine.
verses.english: Cursed is he who does the Lord's work deceitfully. And cursed is he who keeps his sword from shedding blood.

verses.latin: Fertilis fuit Moab ab adolescentia sua, et quiescebat in fœcibus suis: nec transfusus est de vase in vas, et in transmigrationem non abiit: idcirco mansit gustus ejus in illo, et odor ejus non est commutatus.
verses.english: Moab has been at ease from her youth, resting on her dregs like wine undisturbed. She has not been poured from vessel to vessel, nor has she gone into exile. Therefore, her taste remains in her, and her scent has not changed.

verses.latin: Propter hoc ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et mittam ei ordinatores, et stratores laguncularum: et sternent illam, et vasa ejus exhaurient, et lagunculas eorum collident.
verses.english: Therefore, behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will send men to Moab to tip her over and empty her out. They will empty her vessels and smash her jars.

verses.latin: Et confundetur Moab a Chamos, sicut confusa est domus Israël a Bethel, fiducia sua.
verses.english: Moab will be put to shame by Chemosh (her god), just as the house of Israel was put to shame by Bethel, their false god in whom they trusted.

verses.latin: Quomodo dicitis: Fortes sumus, et viri robusti ad prælium?
verses.english: How can you say, “We are mighty, strong men for battle”?

verses.latin: Vastata est Moab, et civitates illius ascendit: et electi juvenes ejus occisi sunt, ait rex, Dominus exercituum nomen ejus.
verses.english: Moab is laid waste, and her cities are attacked. Her chosen young men are slaughtered, says the King, whose name is the Lord of Armies.

verses.latin: Prope est interitus Moab, et malum ejus velociter properabit nimis.
verses.english: The destruction of Moab is near, and her calamity hastens swiftly.

verses.latin: Consolamini eum omnes qui estis in circuitu ejus, et universi qui scitis nomen ejus, dicite: Quomodo confracta est virga fortis, baculus gloriosus?
verses.english: All who surround Moab, and all who know her name, mourn for her. Say, “How has the strong staff, the glorious scepter, been broken?”

verses.latin: Descende de gloria, et sede in siti, filia Dibon: quoniam vastator Moab ascendit ad te, dissipavit munitiones tuas.
verses.english: Descend from your glory and sit in the dust, Daughter of Dibon. For the destroyer of Moab has come against you; he has torn down your strongholds.

verses.latin: Sta in via, et prospice, habitaculum Aroer: interroga fugientem, et eum qui evasit, dic: Quid accidit?
verses.english: Stand by the road and look, inhabitant of Aroer. Ask the fleeing one and the one who has escaped, saying, “What has happened?”

verses.latin: Confusa est Moab, quoniam victa est. Ululate, et clamate: annuntiate in Arnon, quoniam vastata est Moab.
verses.english: Moab is disgraced, for she is overcome. Wail and cry out! Proclaim by the Arnon River that Moab is laid waste.

verses.latin: Et judicium venit ad terram campestrem, super Helon, et super Jasa, et super Mephaath,
verses.english: And judgment has come upon the land of the plain: upon Holon, and upon Jahzah, and upon Mephaath,

verses.latin: Et super Dibon, et super Nabo, et super domum Deblathaim,
verses.english: And upon Dibon, and upon Nebo, and upon Beth-Diblathaim,

verses.latin: Et super Cariathaim, et super Bethgamul, et super Bethmaon,
verses.english: And upon Kiriathaim, and upon Beth-Gamul, and upon Beth-Meon,

verses.latin: Et super Carioth, et super Bosra, et super omnes civitates terræ Moab, longe vel prope.
verses.english: And upon Kerioth, and upon Bozrah, and upon all the cities of the land of Moab, far and near.

verses.latin: Abscissum est cornu Moab, et brachium ejus contritum est, ait Dominus.
verses.english: The horn (symbol of strength) of Moab is cut off, and her arm is broken, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Inebriate eum, quoniam contra Dominum erexit se: et illidet Moab in vomitu suo, et erit in derisum.
verses.english: Make Moab drunk, for she has defied the Lord. Moab will wallow in her own vomit and become a laughingstock.

verses.latin: Fuit enim in derisum tibi Israël, quasi inter fures reperisses eum: propter verba ergo tua, quæ adversum illum locutus es, captivaberis.
verses.english: Was not Israel a laughingstock to you, as if you had found him among thieves? Therefore, because of the words you spoke against him, you will be taken captive.

verses.latin: Relinquite civitates, et habitate in petra, habitatores Moab: et estote quasi columba nidificans in summo ore foraminis.
verses.english: Leave the cities and dwell in the rock, inhabitants of Moab. Be like a dove that makes its nest in the highest cleft of a rock.

verses.latin: Audivimus superbiam Moab, superbus est vehementer: sublimitatem ejus, et arrogantiam, et superbiam, et altitudinem cordis ejus.
verses.english: We have heard of Moab's great pride; she is exceedingly proud: her loftiness, her arrogance, her pride, and the haughtiness of her heart.

verses.latin: Ego scio, dicit Dominus, jactantiam ejus, et quod non sit juxta eam virtus ejus, nec juxta quod potest.
verses.english: I know her boasting, says the Lord, but her power is not equal to her boast, nor can she accomplish what she claims.

verses.latin: Idcirco super Moab ululabo, et ad omnem Moab clamabo, ad viros muri fictilis plangam.
verses.english: Therefore, I will wail over Moab; I will cry out for all of Moab. I will mourn for the men of Kir-Heres (the strong city of Moab).

verses.latin: De ploratu Jazer plorabo tibi, vinea Sebama: propagines tuæ transierunt mare, usque ad mare Jazer pervenerunt: super messem tuam, et vindemiam tuam prædo irruit.
verses.english: I will weep for you, O vine of Sibmah, with the weeping of Jazer. Your branches spread beyond the sea, reaching even to the Sea of Jazer. But a destroyer has fallen upon your harvest and your vintage.

verses.latin: Ablata est lætitia et exsultatio de Carmelo, et de terra Moab: et vinum de torcularibus sustuli: nequaquam calcator uva canet, vocem calcatoris.
verses.english: Joy and gladness have been taken away from the fruitful fields and from the land of Moab. I have removed wine from the winepresses. No one will tread the grapes and sing the treader's song.

verses.latin: De clamore Hesebon usque Eleale, et Jasa, dederunt vocem suam: a Segor usque Oronaim, vitula tribennis: aquæ quoque Nemrim pessimæ erunt.
verses.english: From the cry of Heshbon even to Elealeh and Jahaz, they have raised their voices. From Zoar to Horonaim, they cry like a three-year-old heifer. The waters of Nimrim also will be desolate.

verses.latin: Et auferam de Moab, ait Dominus, offerentem in excelsis, et succendentem simulacris ejus.
verses.english: And I will put an end to Moab, says the Lord, to anyone who offers sacrifices on the high places and burns incense to her idols.

verses.latin: Propterea cor meum super Moab quasi tibiæ sonabit, et cor meum super viros muri fictilis quasi tibiæ resonabit: quia plus quam quæ acquisierat, perierunt.
verses.english: Therefore, my heart will lament for Moab like a flute, and my heart will lament for the men of Kir-Heres like a flute. For the wealth she acquired has perished, even more than she possessed.

verses.latin: Omnis enim caput calvum, et omnis barba rasa erit: in cunctis manibus colligatio, et super omne dorsum cilicio.
verses.english: For every head will be shaved bald, and every beard cut off. On all hands will be gashes, and on every back, sackcloth. These are traditional signs of deep mourning.

verses.latin: Super omnia tecta Moab, et in plateis ejus omnis ploratus: quoniam attrididi Moab quasi vas inutile, ait Dominus.
verses.english: On all the rooftops of Moab and in her public squares, there will be universal lamentation. For I have crushed Moab like a useless vessel, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Quomodo contrita est, et ululaverunt! quomodo flexit cervicem Moab, et confusus est! et erit Moab in derisum, et in exemplum omnibus in circuitu suo.
verses.english: How she is broken! How they wail! How Moab has turned her back in shame! Moab will be an object of scorn and a warning to all around her.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce quasi aquila volabit, et extendet alas suas ad Moab.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord: Behold, an enemy will swoop down like an eagle and spread his wings over Moab.

verses.latin: Capta est Carioth, et munitiones captæ sunt: et erit cor fortium Moab in die illa, sicut cor mulieris parturientis.
verses.english: Kerioth is captured, and the strongholds are taken. The hearts of Moab's warriors on that day will be like the heart of a woman in labor.

verses.latin: Et delebitur Moab de gente, quoniam contra Dominum superbus extitit.
verses.english: And Moab will be destroyed from being a nation, because she defied the Lord.

verses.latin: Pavor, et fovea, et laqueus super te, o habitator Moab, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Terror, a pit, and a snare are upon you, O inhabitant of Moab, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Qui fugerit a facie pavoris, cadet in foveam: et qui conscenderit de fovea, capietur laqueo: hæc enim afferam super Moab annum visitationis eorum, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Whoever flees from the terror will fall into the pit, and whoever climbs out of the pit will be caught in the snare. For I will bring these things upon Moab in the year of their punishment, says the Lord.

verses.latin: In umbra Hesebon steterunt fugientes, quia non erat eis ultra virtus. Egredietur enim ignis de Hesebon, et flamma de medio Seon: et devorabit tempora Moab, et verticem filiorum tumultus.
verses.english: Those who fled stood helpless in the shadow of Heshbon, because they had no more strength. For fire will come out from Heshbon, and a flame from the midst of Sihon. It will devour the border regions of Moab and the heads of the boastful people.

verses.latin: Væ tibi Moab, periisti popule Chamos: quoniam comprehensi sunt filii tui, et filiæ tuæ in captivitatem.
verses.english: Woe to you, Moab! You have perished, O people of Chemosh. For your sons and your daughters have been taken captive.

verses.latin: Et convertam captivitatem Moab in novissimis diebus, dicit Dominus. Huc usque judicia Moab.
verses.english: Yet, in the latter days, I will restore the fortunes of Moab, says the Lord. Thus far is the judgment upon Moab.

verses.latin: Ad filios Ammon. Hæc dicit Dominus: Numquid non est filiis Israel, maritus, aut non est ei hæres? quare igitur hæreditario possedit Melchom Gad, et populus ejus habitavit in civitatibus ejus?
verses.english: To the descendants of Ammon. This is what the Lord says: Does Israel not have sons? Does Israel not have an heir? If so, why has the false god Milcom, or the king of Ammon, taken possession of the tribe of Gad's land? And why do his people dwell in its cities?

verses.latin: Idcirco ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et auditum faciam super Rabbath filiorum Ammon, tumultum prælii, et erit in tumulum dissipata, filiæque ejus igni succendentur: et possidebit Israël hæredes suos, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Therefore, behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will cause the sound of battle to be heard against Rabbah, the capital city of the descendants of Ammon. It will become a desolate mound of rubble, and its surrounding villages will be set on fire. Then Israel will truly possess what is its inheritance, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Ulula Hesebon, quoniam vastata est Gaï: clamate filiæ Rabbath, accingite vos ciliciis, plangite, et circuitate per sepes, quia Melchom in transmigrationem ducetur, sacerdotes ejus et principes ejus simul.
verses.english: Cry out, O Heshbon, for the city of Ai is devastated! Wail, O villages of Rabbah! Put on sackcloth, mourn, and wander through the ruins, for Milcom—your false god and king—will be taken into exile, along with his priests and his princes.

verses.latin: Quid gloriaris in vallibus? defecit vallis tua, filia mollis! quæ confidebas in thesauris tuis, et dicebas: Quis veniet super me?
verses.english: Why do you boast about your valleys? Your valley is ruined, O pampered daughter of Ammon! You trusted in your treasures and said, 'Who will attack me?'

verses.latin: Ecce ego inducam super te terrorem, dicit Dominus Deus exercituum, ab omnibus qui in circuitu tuo sunt: et dispergem te in omnes partes, et non erit qui congreget fugientia.
verses.english: Behold, I am bringing terror upon you from all those around you, says the Lord, the God of heavenly armies! I will scatter you in all directions, and there will be no one to gather the fleeing survivors.

verses.latin: Et post hæc reverti faciam captivos filiorum Ammon, ait Dominus.
verses.english: But after these things, I will restore the fortunes of the descendants of Ammon, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Ad Idumæam. Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Numquid non est sapientia in Theman? periit consilium a filiis, inutilis facta est sapientia eorum.
verses.english: Concerning Edom. This is what the Lord of heavenly armies says: Is there no longer wisdom in Teman, a place known for its wise men? Has counsel perished from the sons of Esau? Has their wisdom become useless?

verses.latin: Fugite, et terga vertite, recedite in profundum, habitatores Dedan: quoniam perditionem Esau adduxi super eum, tempus visitationis ejus.
verses.english: Flee, turn back, retreat into the depths, O inhabitants of Dedan, an allied nation! For I will bring the destruction of Esau's descendants (Edom) upon him, the time of his punishment.

verses.latin: Si vindemiatores venissent super te, nunquid reliquissent racemum? si fures in nocte, subripuissent quantum sufficeret eis.
verses.english: If grape gatherers came to you, wouldn't they leave some gleanings behind? If thieves came by night, they would only steal enough for themselves.

verses.latin: Ego vero nudavi Esau, revelavi abscondita ejus: et celari non poterit. Vastatus est Edis, et semen ejus, et fratres ejus, et vicini ejus: et non erit.
verses.english: But I myself will strip Esau (Edom) bare; I will uncover his hidden places, and he will not be able to hide. Edom is devastated, along with his children, his relatives, and his neighbors; there will be no one left.

verses.latin: Relinque pupillos tuos: ego faciam vivere, et viduæ tuæ in me sperabunt.
verses.english: O Edom, leave your orphans to Me; I will preserve their lives. And your widows will hope in Me, even amidst your destruction.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce quibus non erat judicium ut biberent calicem, bibentes bibent: et tu quasi innocens relinqueris? non relinqueris, sed bibens bibes.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord says: Behold, those who were not condemned to drink the cup of My wrath will certainly drink it. So then, will you, who are far from innocent, be left unpunished? No, you will not be left; you will surely drink the cup of My judgment.

verses.latin: Quia per meipsum juravi, dicit Dominus, quod in solitudinem, et in opprobrium, et in desertum, et in maledictionem erit Bosra: et omnes civitates ejus erunt in solitudines sempiternas.
verses.english: For I have sworn by Myself, says the Lord, that Bozrah, Edom's capital city, will become a desolate ruin, an object of reproach, a wasteland, and a curse. And all its cities will become everlasting desolations.

verses.latin: Auditum audivi a Domino, et nuntius ad gentes missus est: Congregamini, et venite contra eam, et consurgamus in prælium.
verses.english: I have heard a report from the Lord, and an envoy has been sent among the nations: 'Gather yourselves, and come against Edom! Let us rise up for battle!'

verses.latin: Ecce enim parvulum dedi te in gentibus, contemptibilem inter homines.
verses.english: For behold, I have made you small among the nations, despised among men.

verses.latin: Arrogantia tua decepit te, et superbia cordis tui: qui habitas in scissuris petrarum, et apprehendere niteris altitudinem collis. Cum exaltatus fueris quasi aquila, inde detraham te, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Your arrogance has deceived you, and the pride of your heart, you who dwell in the clefts of the rocks, like the city of Petra, trying to seize the heights of the hill. Though you make your nest as high as the eagle's, from there I will bring you down, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et erit Idumæa in desolationem: omnis qui pertransierit per eam, obstupescet, et sibilabit super plagas ejus.
verses.english: And Edom will become a desolation; everyone who passes by it will be horrified and will hiss in astonishment at its wounds.

verses.latin: Sicut subversa est Sodoma et Gomorrha, et vicinæ ejus, ait Dominus: non habitabit ibi vir, et non succedet in ea filius hominis.
verses.english: Just as Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighboring cities were overthrown, says the Lord, no one will live there, and no human being will dwell in it.

verses.latin: Ecce quasi leo ascendet de superbia Jordanis ad pulchritudinem robustam: quia subito currere faciam eum super illam: et quem ego elegero, illum præponam ei. Quis enim similis mei? et quis resistet mihi? et quis est iste pastor qui stare poterit contra vultum meum?
verses.english: Behold, one will come up like a lion from the thickets of the Jordan River against the strong pastures. For I will suddenly make him rush upon it. And the one whom I choose, him I will appoint over it. For who is like Me? And who will challenge Me? And what shepherd can stand before My face?

verses.latin: Idcirco audite consilium Domini, quod iniit de Edom, et cogitationes ejus, quas cogitavit de habitatoribus Theman: certe detrahent eos parvuli gregis, certe dissipabunt cum eis habitacula eorum.
verses.english: Therefore, hear the plan of the Lord that He has formed concerning Edom, and His intentions that He has devised concerning the inhabitants of Teman: Surely, the weakest of the flock will drag them away. Surely, their dwellings will be devastated along with them.

verses.latin: A voce ruinæ eorum contremuit terra: clamor in mari Rubro auditus est vocis ejus.
verses.english: At the sound of their fall, the earth will tremble. The cry of their destruction will be heard as far as the Red Sea.

verses.latin: Ecce quasi aquila ascendet, et advolabit, et expandet alas suas super Bosran: et erit cor fortium Edom in die illa sicut cor mulieris parturientis.
verses.english: Behold, he will ascend like an eagle and fly swiftly, spreading his wings over Bozrah. And on that day, the hearts of Edom's bravest warriors will be like the heart of a woman in labor.

verses.latin: Ad Damascum. Confusa est Emath et Arphad: quia auditum pessimum audierunt: turbati sunt in mari, solliciti esse non potuerunt.
verses.english: Concerning Damascus. Hamath and Arphad are shamed and dismayed, for they have heard terrible news. They are troubled like the restless sea; they cannot be at peace.

verses.latin: Dissolutus est Damascus, versa est in fugam, tremor apprehendit eam: angustia et dolores obtinuerunt eam, quasi parturientem.
verses.english: Damascus is weakened; she has turned to flee. Terror has seized her, and anguish and pains have overcome her, like a woman in labor.

verses.latin: Quomodo dereliquit civitatem laudabilem, urbem lætitiæ meæ?
verses.english: How is it that such a praiseworthy city, the city of My joy, has been abandoned?

verses.latin: Idcirco cadent juvenes ejus in plateis ejus: et omnes viri prælii conticescent in die illa, ait Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: Therefore, her young men will fall in her streets, and all her men of battle will be silenced on that day, says the Lord of heavenly armies.

verses.latin: Et succendam ignem in muro Damasci, et devorabit mœnia Benadad.
verses.english: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it will consume the palaces of Ben-Hadad, a royal title for the kings of Aram-Damascus.

verses.latin: Ad Cedar et regna Asor, quæ percussit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis. Hæc dicit Dominus: Surgite, ascendite ad Cedar, et vastate filios orientis.
verses.english: Concerning Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, attacked. This is what the Lord says: 'Rise up, go up against Kedar, and lay waste to the people of the East, the desert tribes.'

verses.latin: Tabernacula eorum, et greges eorum capient: pelles eorum, et omnia vasa eorum, et camelos eorum tollent: et vocabunt super eos formidinem in circuitu.
verses.english: Their tents and their flocks will be captured; their tent coverings, all their vessels, and their camels will be taken away. Terror will be proclaimed against them from every side.

verses.latin: Fugite, abite vehementer, in profundum recedite, habitatores Asor, ait Dominus. Quoniam iniit super vos Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis consilium, et cogitavit contra vos cogitationes.
verses.english: Flee, depart quickly, retreat into the depths, O inhabitants of Hazor, says the Lord! For Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, has formed a plan against you, and has devised intentions concerning you.

verses.latin: Surgite, et ascendite ad gentem quietam, et habitantem confidenter, ait Dominus: non ostia, nec vectes habent: soli habitant.
verses.english: Rise up, and go up against a nation that lives peacefully and securely, says the Lord. They have no gates nor bars; they dwell alone without defenses.

verses.latin: Et erunt cameli eorum in rapinam, et multitudo jumentorum in prædam: et dispergam eos in omnem ventum, recisos in comam: et ex omni latere eorum adducam perditionem eis, ait Dominus.
verses.english: Their camels will become plunder, and their great number of livestock will be spoil. And I will scatter them to every wind, those whose hair is trimmed at the temples (a sign of their custom). And from every side, I will bring destruction upon them, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et erit Asor in habitaculum draconum, deserta usque ad æternum: non manebit ibi vir, neque inhabitabit in ea filius hominis.
verses.english: And Hazor will become a dwelling for jackals, a desolation forever. No one will live there, nor will any human being dwell in it.

verses.latin: Verbum Domini, quod factum est ad Jeremiam prophetam adversum Ælam, in principio regni Sedeciæ regis Juda, dicens:
verses.english: The word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah, king of Judah, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Ecce ego confringam arcum Ælam, summam fortitudinem eorum.
verses.english: This is what the Lord of heavenly armies says: 'Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, which is their chief strength.'

verses.latin: Et inducam super Ælam quatuor ventos a quatuor plagis cæli: et dispergam eos in omnes ventos istos: et non erit natio, ad quam non veniant profugi Ælam.
verses.english: And I will bring upon Elam four winds from the four corners of the universe; and I will scatter them to all these winds. There will be no nation to which the refugees of Elam will not go.

verses.latin: Et terrere faciam Ælam coram inimicis suis, et in conspectu quærentium animam eorum: et adducam super eos malum, iram furoris mei, dicit Dominus: et mittam post eos gladium donec consumam eos.
verses.english: And I will cause Elam to be terrified before their enemies and before those who seek their lives. I will bring evil upon them, the fierceness of My wrath, says the Lord. And I will send the sword after them until I have consumed them.

verses.latin: Et ponam solium meum in Ælam, et perdam inde reges et principes, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: And I will set My throne in Elam, and there I will destroy its kings and princes, says the Lord.

verses.latin: In novissimis autem diebus reverti faciam captivos Ælam, ait Dominus.
verses.english: But in the last days, I will restore the fortunes of Elam, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Verbum quod locutus est Dominus super Babylonem, et super terram Chaldaeorum, in manu Jeremiae prophetae.
verses.english: This is the message that the Lord spoke concerning Babylon, and concerning the land of the Chaldeans, given through Jeremiah the prophet.

verses.latin: Annuntiate inter gentes, et auditum facite: levate signum, praedicate, et nolite celare: dicite: Capta est Babylon, confusus est Bel, superatus est Merodach, confusa sunt simulacra ejus, superata sunt idola eorum.
verses.english: Declare this among the nations; proclaim it loudly and make it known! Set up a signal; preach it openly and do not conceal it! Tell them: 'Babylon has been conquered! Bel, their false god, is shamed! Merodach, their idol, is broken! Her lifeless images are disgraced, their false gods are shattered!'

verses.latin: Quoniam ascendit contra eam gens ab Aquilone, quae ponet terram ejus in solitudinem, et non erit qui habitet in ea ab homine usque ad pecus: et moti sunt, et abierunt.
verses.english: For a nation from the North has marched against Babylon. They will turn her land into a desolate wasteland, and no one will live there, neither people nor animals. Her people will flee and scatter.

verses.latin: In diebus illis et in tempore illo, ait Dominus, venient filii Israel ipsi et filii Juda simul: plorantes properabunt, et Dominum Deum suum quaerent.
verses.english: In those days and at that time, says the Lord, the people of Israel and Judah will come together. They will come weeping, urgently seeking the Lord their God.

verses.latin: In Sion interrogabunt viam, huc facies eorum: venient et apponentur ad Dominum foedere sempiterno, quod nulla oblivione delebitur.
verses.english: They will ask the way to Zion, their faces turned towards it with earnest desire. They will come and join themselves to the Lord through an everlasting covenant, one that will never be forgotten or broken.

verses.latin: Grex perditus factus est populus meus: pastores eorum seduxerunt eos, ad montes iniquitatis tranferentes: de monte in collem transierunt, obliti sunt cubilis sui.
verses.english: My people have become a lost flock. Their leaders have led them astray, driving them to climb false mountains of sin. They wandered from hill to mountain, forgetting their true resting place and their spiritual home.

verses.latin: Omnes qui invenerunt eos, comederunt eos: et hostes eorum dixerunt: Non peccavimus, pro eo quod peccaverunt Domino decori justitiae, et exspectationi patrum eorum Domino.
verses.english: All who found them devoured them like prey. And their enemies justified themselves, saying: 'We are not guilty, for these people have sinned against the Lord, the very source of justice and glory, and the God whom their ancestors eagerly expected and worshipped.'

verses.latin: Recedite de medio Babylonis, et de terra Chaldaeorum egredimini: et estote quasi arietes ante gregem.
verses.english: Flee from Babylon's midst! Get out of the land of the Chaldeans! Lead the way like rams at the head of a flock, guiding others to safety.

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce ego suscito, et adducam in Babylonem congregationem gentium magnarum de terra Aquilonis: et praeparabunt se ad eam, et inde capietur: sagitta illorum quasi viri fortis interfectoris, non revertetur vacua.
verses.english: For behold, I am stirring up and bringing against Babylon a great alliance of nations from the northern lands. They will prepare for battle against her, and from that very direction, Babylon will be captured. Their arrows will be like those of a mighty warrior, striking true and not returning without their kill.

verses.latin: Et erit Chaldaea in praedam: omnes vastantes eam, adimplebuntur.
verses.english: And the land of Chaldea will become plunder. All who plunder her will take their fill.

verses.latin: Quoniam exsultatis, et magna gloria murmurastis, diripientes haereditatem meam: quoniam salitis quasi vituli super herbam, et mugitis quasi tauri.
verses.english: Because you rejoiced with shouts of triumph and plundered My chosen inheritance. Because you gamboled like calves in fresh pasture and bellowed like strong bulls in triumph.

verses.latin: Confusa est mater vestra nimis, et adaequata est ei quae genuit vos: ecce novissima erit inter gentes, deserta, invia, et arens.
verses.english: Your mother—Babylon itself—is utterly shamed, and she who bore you is disgraced. Behold, she will be the lowliest among the nations, a desolate wasteland, without roads, and parched dry.

verses.latin: Ab ira Domini non habitabitur, sed efficietur deserta universaliter: omnis qui transibit per Babylonem, obstupescet, et sibilabit super omnibus plagis ejus.
verses.english: Because of the Lord's burning wrath, Babylon will remain uninhabited and become a complete wasteland. Every person who passes by Babylon will be struck with awe and will hiss in dismay at all her devastating wounds.

verses.latin: Praeparate vos contra Babylonem per circuitum, omnes qui tenditis arcum: jacite in eam, non parcatis sagittis, quia Domino peccavit.
verses.english: Form your battle lines all around Babylon, all of you who draw the bow! Fire your arrows at her; do not hold back a single arrow, for she has deeply sinned against the Lord.

verses.latin: Conclamate adversus eam, undique dedit manum: prostratae sunt civitates ejus, diruta sunt moenia ejus, quoniam ultio Domini est: capite de ea, sicut fecit et ipsa, sic facite illi.
verses.english: Shout the battle cry against her from every side! Babylon has surrendered! Her cities are overthrown, her mighty walls are torn down, for this is the Lord's vengeance. Take revenge on her; deal with her exactly as she dealt with others.

verses.latin: Excidite sementem de Babylone, et tenentem falcem in tempore messis: a facie gladii columbae, unusquisque ad populum suum revertetur, et unusquisque in terram suam fugiet.
verses.english: Cut off the sower in Babylon, and the one wielding the sickle at harvest time, so no future crops will grow. Because of the invaders' sword, everyone will flee back to their own people, and each person will escape to their homeland.

verses.latin: Grex dispersus Israel, leones ejecerunt eum: primus rex Assur devoravit eum, iste novissimus Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis decalvavit eum.
verses.english: Israel is a scattered flock, driven away by ferocious lions. First, the king of Assyria devoured them. Then, this last one, Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, crushed their bones.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israel: Ecce ego visitabo regem Babylonis et terram ejus, sicut visitavi regem Assur.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, declares: 'Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, just as I punished the king of Assyria.'

verses.latin: Et reducam Israel ad habitaculum suum: et pascetur in Carmelo et Basan, et in monte Ephraim et Galaad saturabitur anima ejus.
verses.english: And I will bring Israel back to their own dwelling place. And they will graze in the fertile lands of Carmel and Bashan, and on Mount Ephraim and Gilead their souls will be fully satisfied.

verses.latin: In diebus illis et in tempore illo, ait Dominus, quaeretur iniquitas Israel, et non erit: et peccatum Juda, et non invenietur: quoniam propitius ero his, quos reliquero.
verses.english: In those days and at that time, says the Lord, the iniquity of Israel will be sought out, but none will be found; the sin of Judah will be sought, but it will not be found. For I will graciously forgive those whom I have preserved.

verses.latin: Ascende super terram Vexationum, et super habitantes Accad: vasta quae superflua sunt, et interfice quae sequuntur eos, et interfice, et committe in internecionem, ait Dominus, et fac omnia quaecumque praecepi tibi.
verses.english: Go up against the land of Merathaim—a land of double rebellion—and against the inhabitants of Pekod—a land of punishment. Completely destroy those who resist, and put to death those who follow them. Devote everything to utter destruction, says the Lord. Do everything I have commanded you.

verses.latin: Vox belli in terra, et contritio magna.
verses.english: The sound of battle echoes across the land, and the destruction is immense.

verses.latin: Quomodo confractus est, et contritus malleus universae terrae: quomodo effecta est in desolationem Babylon inter gentes.
verses.english: How completely broken and shattered is the hammer that struck down the whole earth—Babylon! How Babylon has become a wasteland among the nations!

verses.latin: Inlaqueavi te, et capta es Babylon, et nescisti: inventa es et apprehensa, quoniam contra Dominum provocasti.
verses.english: I have set a trap for you, Babylon, and you are caught, completely unaware! You are discovered and seized, because you dared to defy the Lord.

verses.latin: Aperuit Dominus thesaurum suum, et protulit vasa irae suae: quoniam opus est Domini Dei exercituum in terra Chaldaeorum.
verses.english: The Lord has opened His armory and brought forth the weapons of His wrath. For this is the work of the Lord God of hosts in the land of the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Venite ad eam de finibus, aperite ut sit in acervos: et interficite, et committite in internecionem: non sit reliquum.
verses.english: Come against her from every border; break open her granaries until her goods lie in heaps. And utterly destroy, leaving no survivors; let nothing remain.

verses.latin: Interfice omnes fortes ejus, descendant ad occisionem: vae illis, quoniam venit dies eorum, tempus visitationis eorum.
verses.english: Slay all her mighty warriors; let them go down to the slaughter! Woe to them! For their day has come—the time of their destined punishment!

verses.latin: Vox fugientium et eorum qui evaserunt de terra Babylonis, ut annuntient in Sion ultionem Domini Dei nostri, ultionem templi sui.
verses.english: Listen! The sound of those who flee and escape from the land of Babylon, they come to declare in Zion the vengeance of the Lord our God—the vengeance for His sacred Temple.

verses.latin: Annuntiate super Babylonem, plurimis tendentibus sagittam, omnis qui tenditis arcum, consistite adversus eam per circuitum, et nemo evadat: reddite ei secundum opus suum: juxta omnia quae fecit, facite illi: quia superbus extitit contra Dominum, adversus Sanctum Israel.
verses.english: Summon many archers against Babylon, all you who draw the bow! Surround her completely; let no one escape! Repay her for her deeds; do to her exactly as she has done to others, because she has acted with arrogant pride against the Lord, against the Holy One of Israel.

verses.latin: Idcirco cadent juvenes ejus in plateis ejus: et omnes viri bellatores ejus conticescent in die illa, ait Dominus.
verses.english: Therefore, her young warriors will fall in her streets. And all her fighting men will be utterly silenced on that day, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Ecce ego ad te, superbe, ait Dominus Deus exercituum: quia venit dies tuus, tempus visitationis tuae.
verses.english: Behold, I am against you, O arrogant one! says the Lord God of hosts. For your day has come—the time of your deserved punishment.

verses.latin: Et corruet superbus, et cadet, et non erit qui suscitet eum: et succendam ignem in urbibus ejus, et devorabit omnia in circuitu ejus.
verses.english: And that arrogant one will stumble and fall, with no one to help her rise again. And I will kindle a fire in Babylon's cities, and it will consume everything around her.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum: Calumniam sustinuerunt filii Israel, et filii Juda simul: omnesque capientes eos, tenuerunt, noluerunt dimittere eos.
verses.english: This is what the Lord of hosts says: The people of Israel and Judah have both suffered severe oppression. And all who took them captive held them tightly, refusing to release them.

verses.latin: Redemptor eorum fortis, Dominus exercituum nomen ejus: judicio defendet causam eorum, ut perturbet terram, et commoveat habitatores Babylonis.
verses.english: Their Redeemer is mighty; the Lord of hosts is His name. He will vigorously defend their cause in judgment, so that He may bring chaos upon the earth and shake the inhabitants of Babylon.

verses.latin: Gladius super Chaldaeos, ait Dominus, et super habitatores Babylonis, et super principes ejus, et super sapientes ejus.
verses.english: A sword of judgment hangs over the Chaldeans! says the Lord. It hangs over the inhabitants of Babylon, over her princes, and over her wise men.

verses.latin: Gladius super divinos ejus, et insaniet: gladius super fortes ejus, et pavebunt.
verses.english: A sword upon her diviners, and they will go mad with terror. A sword upon her mighty warriors, and they will be struck with fear.

verses.latin: Gladius super equos ejus, et super currus ejus, et super omne vulgus, quod est in medio ejus: et erunt quasi mulieres: gladius super thesauros ejus, et diripientur.
verses.english: A sword upon her warhorses and upon her chariots, and upon all the foreign mercenaries within her, and they will become as weak as women. A sword upon her treasures, and they will be plundered.

verses.latin: Siccitas super aquas ejus, et desiccabuntur: quia terra sculptilium est, et in portentis insaniunt.
verses.english: A drought upon her rivers and canals, and they will be dried up. Because it is a land full of carved images, and its people are driven to madness by their false gods.

verses.latin: Propterea habitabunt dracones cum faunis, et habitabunt in ea struthiones: et non habitabitur ultra usque in sempiternum, nec exstruetur usque ad generationem et generationem.
verses.english: Therefore, desert creatures will dwell there with howling animals, and ostriches will make their home in it. It will never again be inhabited, nor will it be rebuilt for all future generations.

verses.latin: Sicut subvertit Dominus Sodomam et Gomorrham, et vicinas ejus, ait Dominus, non habitabit ibi vir, et non veniet in ea filius hominis.
verses.english: Just as the Lord overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighboring cities, says the Lord, no man will live there, and no human being will settle in it.

verses.latin: Ecce populus veniens ab Aquilone, et gens magna, et reges multi consurgent a finibus terrae.
verses.english: Behold, a people is coming from the North—a great nation, and many kings will rise up from the far ends of the earth.

verses.latin: Arcum et scutum arripiunt: saevi sunt, et immisericordes: vox eorum quasi mare sonabit, et super equos ascendent: parati quasi vir ad proelium, contra te filia Babylon.
verses.english: They seize bow and shield for battle. They are cruel and show no mercy. Their battle cries will roar like the surging sea, and they will advance on horses. They are arrayed for battle like a mighty warrior, against you, O daughter Babylon.

verses.latin: Audivit rex Babylonis famam eorum, et dissolutae sunt manus ejus: angustias apprehendit, quasi parturiens.
verses.english: The king of Babylon has heard reports of them, and his hands have gone limp with fear. Anguish has gripped him, like the pain of a woman giving birth.

verses.latin: Ecce quasi leo ascendet de superbia Jordanis, ad pulchritudinem robustam: quia repente currere faciam eum ad illam: et quis est electus quem praeponam ei? Quis enim similis mei? et quis resistet mihi? et quis est iste pastor qui resistat vultui meo?
verses.english: Behold, like a lion rising from the thickets of the Jordan, he will come against Babylon's strong and beautiful pastures. For I will suddenly make him rush against her. And who is the chosen one whom I will appoint to rule over her? For who is truly like Me? And who can stand against Me? And what shepherd, what ruler, can resist My face?

verses.latin: Propterea audite consilium Domini, quod iniit super Babylonem, et cogitationes ejus, quas cogitavit super terram Chaldaeorum: nisi detraxerint eos parvuli gregum, nisi dissipatum fuerit cum eis habitaculum eorum.
verses.english: Therefore, listen to the plan of the Lord that He has formed against Babylon, and the intentions He has conceived concerning the land of the Chaldeans. Even the smallest of the flock, the weakest nations, will drag them away captive. Surely, their very dwelling place will be utterly destroyed along with them.

verses.latin: A voce captae Babylonis commota est terra, et clamor inter gentes auditus est.
verses.english: At the sound of Babylon's capture, the entire earth will tremble, and her cries will be heard among all the nations.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego suscitabo super Babylonem, et super habitatores ejus qui habitant in corde meo, quasi ventum pestilentem:
verses.english: The Lord says this: "Pay attention! I am stirring up against Babylon and against its inhabitants—those living deep within its core, whom I have specifically chosen to be at the center of My punitive will—a wind that brings destruction and plague."

verses.latin: Et mittam in Babylonem ventilatores, et ventilabunt eam, et demolientur terram ejus: quia venerunt super eam undique in die afflictionis ejus.
verses.english: I will send against Babylon destroyers, who will winnow it and clear out its land, much like a farmer separates chaff from grain; because enemies will come against it from every direction on the day of its calamity.

verses.latin: Non tendat qui tendit arcum suum, et non consurgat in lorica sua: nolite parcere juvenibus ejus, interficite omnem militiam ejus.
verses.english: Let the archer not prepare his bow; let him not rise up in his armor to fight. Do not spare its young men; put to death all its warriors.

verses.latin: Et cadent interfecti in terra Chaldæorum, et vulnerati in itineribus ejus.
verses.english: The slain will fall in the land of the Chaldeans, and those wounded to death will lie in its streets.

verses.latin: Quoniam non fuit viduata Israël et Juda a Deo suo, Domino exercituum: terra autem eorum repleta est delicto a Sancto Israël.
verses.english: For Israel and Judah have not been abandoned by their God, the Lord of armies, even though their own land was filled with sin against the Holy One of Israel.

verses.latin: Fugite de medio Babylonis, et salvet unusquisque animam suam: nolite tacere super iniquitatem ejus, quoniam tempus ultionis Domini est, vicissitudinem ipse retribuet ei.
verses.english: Flee from the midst of Babylon, and let each one save his own life! Do not remain silent about her wickedness, because this is the time of the Lord's vengeance; He Himself will repay her what she deserves.

verses.latin: Calix aureus Babylon in manu Domini, inebrians omnem terram: de vino ejus biberunt gentes, et idcirco commotae sunt.
verses.english: Babylon was like a golden cup in the Lord's hand, intoxicating the whole earth. The nations drank of her wine, and for this reason, they were driven mad.

verses.latin: Subito cecidit Babylon, et contrita est: ululate super eam, tollite resinam ad dolorem ejus, si forte sanetur.
verses.english: Suddenly Babylon has fallen and is shattered! Wail over her; get balm for her pain, in case she can still be healed.

verses.latin: Curavimus Babylonem, et non est sanata: derelinquamus eam, et eamus unusquisque in terram suam: quoniam pervenit usque ad cælos judicium ejus, et elevatum est usque ad nubes.
verses.english: "We tried to heal Babylon, but she was not healed. Let us abandon her, and let each one go to his own country; for her judgment has reached even to the skies, and is lifted up even to the clouds."

verses.latin: Protulit Dominus justitias nostras: venite, et narremus in Sion opus Domini Dei nostri.
verses.english: The Lord has brought forth our vindication. Come, let us declare in Zion the work of the Lord our God.

verses.latin: Acuite sagittas, implete faretras: suscitavit Dominus spiritum regum Medorum: et contra Babylonem ad perdendum eam, quoniam ultio Domini est, ultio templi ejus.
verses.english: Sharpen your arrows! Fill your quivers! The Lord has stirred up the spirit of the kings of the Medes against Babylon to destroy it, for this is the Lord's vengeance—the vengeance for His Temple.

verses.latin: Super muros Babylonis levate signum, augete custodiam, ponite custodes, praeparate insidias: quia cogitavit Dominus, et fecit quæ locutus est contra habitatores Babylonis.
verses.english: Raise a standard against the walls of Babylon! Increase the guard! Set watchmen! Prepare ambushes! For the Lord has planned and has done what He declared against the inhabitants of Babylon.

verses.latin: Qui habitas super aquas multas, dives in thesauris: pervenit finis tuus, stadium avaritiæ tuæ.
verses.english: O you who dwell by many waters, rich in treasures! Your end has come, the measure of your greed is full.

verses.latin: In Domino exercituum: Quia replebo te hominibus quasi brucho, et super te celeuma cantabitur.
verses.english: The Lord of armies has sworn: "I will surely fill you with men like a swarm of locusts, and a shout of triumph will be raised over you."

verses.latin: Ipse fecit terram in fortitudine sua, præparavit orbem in sapientia sua, et prudentia sua extendit cælos.
verses.english: It is He who made the earth by His power, who established the world by His wisdom, and by His understanding He stretched out the skies and the rest of the universe.

verses.latin: Ad vocem ejus dat multitudinem aquarum in cælo: et elevat nubes ab extremo terræ: fulgura in pluviam fecit, et produxit ventum de thesauris suis.
verses.english: At the sound of His voice, He brings forth the abundance of waters in the sky; He makes the clouds rise from the ends of the earth. He creates lightning with the rain, and He brings forth the wind from His storehouses.

verses.latin: Stultus factus est omnis homo a scientia, confusus est omnis artifex sculptile: quia inflatile est, et non est spiritus in eis.
verses.english: Every human is proven foolish in their knowledge; every craftsman of idols is put to shame by his carved image; for his idol is a mere empty breath, and there is no true spirit or life within them.

verses.latin: Vana sunt, et opus risu dignum: in tempore visitationis suæ peribunt.
verses.english: They are useless, and a work worthy of ridicule. In the time of their judgment, they will perish completely.

verses.latin: Non sicut hæc pars Jacob: quia qui formavit omnia ipse est, et Israël tribus hæreditatis ejus: Dominus exercituum nomen illi.
verses.english: The portion of Jacob is not like these empty idols; for He who formed all things, He is Jacob's God, and Israel is the tribe of His inheritance. The Lord of armies is His name.

verses.latin: Conquassatio mea tu, et arma bellica: et conquassabo in te gentes, et disperdam in te regna.
verses.english: "You, O Babylon, are My hammer and My weapons of war. With you, I will smash nations; with you, I will destroy kingdoms.

verses.latin: Et conquassabo in te equum et equitem ejus: et conquassabo in te currum et ascensorem ejus.
verses.english: With you, I will smash the horse and its rider; with you, I will smash the chariot and its driver.

verses.latin: Et conquassabo in te virum et mulierem: et conquassabo in te senem et puerum: et conquassabo in te adolescentem et virginem.
verses.english: With you, I will smash man and woman; with you, I will smash old and young; with you, I will smash the young man and the virgin.

verses.latin: Et conquassabo in te pastorem et gregem ejus: et conquassabo in te agricolam et jugales ejus: et conquassabo in te duces et magistratus.
verses.english: With you, I will smash the shepherd and his flock; with you, I will smash the farmer and his team of oxen; with you, I will smash governors and rulers.

verses.latin: Et reddam Babylonis, et cunctis habitatoribus Chaldææ, omne malum suum quod fecerunt in Sion, in oculis vestris, ait Dominus.
verses.english: And I will repay Babylon and all the inhabitants of Chaldea for all the evil they inflicted upon Zion. You will see it with your own eyes," says the Lord.

verses.latin: Ecce ego ad te, mons interfector, ait Dominus, qui corrumpis omnem terram: et extendam manum meam super te, et evolvam te de petris, et dabo te in montem combustionis.
verses.english: Behold, I am against you, O destroying mountain—a great power that corrupts the whole earth! declares the Lord. I will stretch out My hand against you, and I will roll you down from the rocks, and I will make you a burnt-out mountain.

verses.latin: Et non tollent de te lapidem in angulum, et lapidem in fundamentum, sed in sempiternas solitudines eris, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: They will not take from you even a stone for a corner, nor a stone for a foundation. Instead, you will be eternal desolation, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Levate signum in terra, clangite buccina in gentibus, sanctificate super eam gentes, annuntiate contra illam regibus Ararat, Menni, et Aschanaz: numerate contra eam Taphsar, adducite equum quasi bruchum pilosum.
verses.english: Raise a banner in the land! Blow the trumpet among the nations! Declare the nations holy for war against her! Summon against her the kings of Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz! Appoint a commander over her! Bring up cavalry like a swarm of bristly locusts!

verses.latin: Sanctificate contra eam gentes, reges Mediæ, duces ejus, et omnis terræ potestates, et cunctam regionem ejus.
verses.english: Prepare the nations against her for war: the kings of Media, their governors, all the rulers of all their lands, and their entire dominion.

verses.latin: Et commovebitur terra, et conturbabitur: quia evigilavit contra Babylonem cogitatio Domini, ut ponat terram Babylonis desertam et inhabitabilem.
verses.english: Then the earth will quake and tremble, because the Lord's purpose against Babylon has awakened—to make the land of Babylon desolate and uninhabited.

verses.latin: Cessaverunt fortes Babylonis a prælio, sederunt in præsidiis: arentavit fortitudo eorum, et facti sunt quasi mulieres: incensa sunt tabernacula ejus, contriti sunt vectes ejus.
verses.english: The mighty men of Babylon have ceased fighting; they remain in their strongholds. Their strength has withered, and they have become like women. Her dwellings are set on fire, her bars are broken.

verses.latin: Currens ad currentem veniet, et nuntius ad nuntium, ut annuntiet regi Babylonis quia capta est civitas ejus a summo usque ad summum.
verses.english: Runner will come to runner, and messenger to messenger, to announce to the king of Babylon that his city has been captured from one end to the other.

verses.latin: Et vadæ occupatæ sunt, et paludes incensæ sunt igni, et viri bellatores conturbati sunt.
verses.english: The river crossings have been seized, and the marshes are burned with fire, and the warriors are terrified and in disarray.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Filia Babylon quasi area, tempus trituræ ejus: adhuc modicum, et veniet tempus messionis ejus.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord of armies, the God of Israel: "The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor; the time for her to be trodden down is near. Yet a little while, and the time of her harvest—her destruction—will come."

verses.latin: Comedit me, devoravit me Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis: reddidit me quasi vas inane, absorbuit me sicut draco, replevit ventrem suum de deliciis meis, et ejectis me.
verses.english: "Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, has devoured me, he has crushed me. He has made me like an empty vessel; he has swallowed me like a dragon, filled his belly with my delicacies, and then cast me aside."

verses.latin: Iniquitas mea et caro mea super Babylonem, dicet habitatio Sion: et sanguis meus super habitatores Chaldææ, dicet Jerusalem.
verses.english: The people of Zion will say: "May the injustice done to me and my flesh be upon Babylon!" And Jerusalem will say: "May my shed blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea!"

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce ego judicabo causam tuam, et ulciscar ultionem tuam, et desolabo mare ejus, et siccabo venam ejus.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord says this: "Behold, I will plead your case, and I will take vengeance on your behalf. I will dry up her sea—meaning her power and resources—and make her spring of fresh water run dry."

verses.latin: Et erit Babylon in acervos, habitaculum draconum, stupor et sibilus, eo quod non sit habitator.
verses.english: And Babylon will become a heap of ruins, a dwelling place for jackals, an object of horror and hissing, because no one will inhabit it.

verses.latin: Simul ut leones rugient, et excutientur velut catuli leonum.
verses.english: They will roar together like lions; they will growl like lion cubs.

verses.latin: In calore eorum ponam potus eorum, et inebriabo eos ut torpeant, et dormiant somnum sempiternum, et non consurgant, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: In their heat, I will give them their drinks; I will make them drunk so that they become sluggish and sleep an eternal sleep, and do not awaken," says the Lord.

verses.latin: Ducam eos quasi agnos ad victimam, et quasi arietem ad hircos.
verses.english: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with goats to be sacrificed.

verses.latin: Quomodo capta est Sesach, et comprehensus est inclitus omnis terræ? Quomodo facta est in stuporem Babylon inter gentes?
verses.english: How has Sheshach—a symbolic name for Babylon—been captured? How has the renown of the whole earth been seized? How has Babylon become an object of horror among the nations?

verses.latin: Ascendit super Babylonem mare, in multitudine fluctuum ejus operta est.
verses.english: The sea has risen over Babylon; she is covered with the multitude of its waves, symbolizing overwhelming destruction.

verses.latin: Factæ sunt civitates ejus in desolationem, terra inhabitabilis et deserta: terra in qua nullus habitat, nec transit per eam filius hominis.
verses.english: Her cities have become a desolation, a land uninhabitable and deserted; a land where no one dwells, and no human being passes through it.

verses.latin: Et visitabo super Bel in Babylone, et ejiciam quod absorbuerat de ore ejus: et non confluent ad eum ultra gentes, sed et murus Babylonis corruet.
verses.english: And I will punish Bel, the chief idol of Babylon, and I will make him vomit out what he has swallowed from his mouth. Nations will no longer flow to him in worship, and even the wall of Babylon will fall.

verses.latin: Exite de medio ejus, populus meus, ut salvet unusquisque animam suam ab ira furoris Domini.
verses.english: Go out from her midst, My people! Let each one save his own life from the fierce anger of the Lord!

verses.latin: Et ne forte paveat cor vestrum, et timeatis a rumore qui audietur in terra: et veniet in anno rumor, et post hunc in anno rumor: et iniquitas in terra, et dominator super dominatorem.
verses.english: And lest your heart should faint, and you should be afraid of the rumor that will be heard in the land—when a rumor comes in one year, and after that, in another year, another rumor, bringing injustice in the land, and ruler rising against ruler.

verses.latin: Propter hoc ecce dies veniunt, et visitabo super sculptilia Babylonis, et omnis terra ejus confundetur, et universi interfecti ejus cadent in medio ejus.
verses.english: Therefore, behold, the days are coming when I will punish the carved images of Babylon, and all her land will be put to shame, and all her slain will fall in her midst.

verses.latin: Et laudabunt super Babylonem cæli et terra, et omnia quæ in eis sunt: quia ab aquilone venient ei prædones, ait Dominus.
verses.english: And the universe and the earth, and all that is in them, will sing for joy over Babylon, because destroyers will come against her from the north," says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et quemadmodum fecit Babylon, ut caderent interfecti in Israël, sic et Babylon cadet interfecta in universa terra.
verses.english: Just as Babylon caused the slain to fall in Israel, so too in Babylon will the slain fall throughout all the earth.

verses.latin: Qui fugistis gladium, venite, nolite stare: recordamini procul Domini, et Jerusalem ascendat super cor vestrum.
verses.english: You who have escaped the sword, come, do not stand still! Remember the Lord from afar, and let Jerusalem rise in your hearts.

verses.latin: Confusi sumus, quoniam audivimus opprobrium: operuit ignominia facies nostras, quoniam venerunt alieni super sanctificationem domus Domini.
verses.english: "We are ashamed, because we have heard reproach; dishonor has covered our faces, for foreigners have come against the holy places of the Lord's house."

verses.latin: Propterea ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et visitabo super sculptilia ejus, et in omni terra ejus gemet vulneratus.
verses.english: Therefore, behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will punish her carved images, and throughout all her land, the wounded will groan.

verses.latin: Si ascenderit Babylon usque ad cælum, et firmaverit in excelso robur suum: a me venient ei vastatores, ait Dominus.
verses.english: Even if Babylon should ascend to the very sky, and establish her strength firmly in the heights, from Me will come destroyers against her," says the Lord.

verses.latin: Vox clamoris de Babylone, et contritio magna de terra Chaldæorum:
verses.english: A sound of a cry comes from Babylon, and great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans!

verses.latin: Quoniam vastabit Dominus Babylonem, et perdet ex ea vocem magnam, et sonabunt fluctus eorum quasi aquæ multæ, dedit vocem tumultus eorum.
verses.english: For the Lord will devastate Babylon and destroy its great voice—the clamor of its people. Its waves will roar like many waters, giving forth the sound of their tumult.

verses.latin: Quoniam venit super eam, id est super Babylonem, prædo, et apprehendentur fortes ejus, et contrivetur arcus eorum: quia fortis remunerator Dominus, reddens retribuet.
verses.english: Because a destroyer comes upon her, that is, upon Babylon. Her mighty warriors will be captured, and their bows will be shattered; for the Lord is a strong avenger, surely rendering recompense.

verses.latin: Et inebriabo principes ejus, et sapientes ejus, et duces ejus, et magistratus ejus, et fortes ejus: et dormient somnum sempiternum, et non expergiscentur, ait Rex, Dominus exercituum nomen illi.
verses.english: "I will make her princes drunk, along with her wise men, her governors, her rulers, and her mighty warriors. They will sleep an eternal sleep and not awaken," says the King, whose name is the Lord of armies.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Murus Babylonis latior culmine diripietur, et portæ ejus excelsæ igni comburentur, et laboraverunt populi nequiter, et gentes in igne conturbatæ sunt.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord of armies: "The wide walls of Babylon will be utterly broken down, and her high gates will be burned with fire. The peoples have toiled in vain, and the nations have wearied themselves only for the fire."

verses.latin: Verbum quod præcepit Jeremias propheta Saraiæ filio Neriæ filii Maasiæ, cum iret a Sedecia rege Juda in Babylonem, in anno quarto regni ejus: Saraias autem erat princeps prophetiæ.
verses.english: This is the message that Jeremiah the prophet gave to Seraiah, the son of Neriah, son of Maaseiah, when Seraiah went with Zedekiah, the king of Judah, to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. Seraiah was the chief officer tasked with delivering prophetic messages.

verses.latin: Et scripsit Jeremias in libro uno omne malum, quod venturum erat super Babylonem: omnia verba hæc quæ scripta sunt contra Babylonem.
verses.english: Jeremiah wrote in a single scroll all the evil that was to come upon Babylon—all these words that are written against Babylon.

verses.latin: Et dixit Jeremias ad Saraiam: Cum veneris in Babylonem, et videris, et legeris omnia verba hæc,
verses.english: Jeremiah then said to Seraiah: "When you arrive in Babylon, and you see it, and you have read all these words—

verses.latin: dices: Domine, tu locutus es contra locum istum ut disperderes eum, ne sit qui habitet in eo, ab homine usque ad pecus, et ut sit desolatio sempiterna.
verses.english: you are to say: 'O Lord, You Yourself have spoken concerning this place, that You would destroy it, so that there will be no one living in it, neither man nor beast, and it will be an eternal desolation.'

verses.latin: Et cum compleveris legere librum istum, ligabis ad eum lapidem, et jactabis illum in medium Euphratis:
verses.english: And when you have finished reading this scroll, you are to tie a stone to it and throw it into the middle of the Euphrates River.

verses.latin: Et dices: Sic submergetur Babylon, et non consurget a facie afflictionis, quam ego adducam super eam, et dissolvetur. Hucusque verba Jeremiæ.
verses.english: And you are to say: 'Thus shall Babylon be submerged, and it will not rise from the face of the affliction that I will bring upon it, and it will be utterly broken.' Here ends the words of Jeremiah.

verses.latin: Viginti et uno anno erat Sedecias, cum regnare cœpisset: et undecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: et nomen matris ejus Amital, filia Jeremiæ de Lobna.
verses.english: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for eleven years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Hamutal, daughter of Jeremiah from Libnah.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum in oculis Domini, juxta omnia quæ fecerat Joachim.
verses.english: And he did evil in the sight of the Lord, just as Jehoiakim had done everything.

verses.latin: Quoniam in ira Domini factum est hoc in Jerusalem, et in Juda, donec projiceret eos a facie sua. Sedecias quoque recessit a rege Babylonis.
verses.english: Because of the Lord's anger, these events happened to Jerusalem and Judah, until He cast them out of His sight. Zedekiah also rebelled against the king of Babylon.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in nono anno regni ejus, in mense decimo, decima mensis, venit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, ipse et omnis exercitus ejus, in Jerusalem: et circumdederunt eam, et ædificaverunt in circuitu ejus munitiones.
verses.english: In the ninth year of Zedekiah's reign, in the tenth month on the tenth day of that month, Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem with all his army. They surrounded the city and built siege works all around it.

verses.latin: Et obsessa est civitas usque ad undecimum annum regni Sedeciæ regis.
verses.english: The city remained under siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah's reign.

verses.latin: Mense quarto, nona mensis, ingravescente fame in civitate, nec esset panis populo terræ,
verses.english: In the fourth month, on the ninth day of that month, the famine in the city became severe, and there was no bread left for the people of the land.

verses.latin: dirupta est civitas: et omnes viri bellatores fugerunt, et exierunt de civitate nocte, per viam portæ quæ est inter duos muros, et ducit ad hortum regis: porro Chaldæi obsidentes erant circa civitatem. Et profectus est Sedecias per viam campestrem.
verses.english: The city wall was breached, and all the soldiers fled. They went out of the city by night through the gate between the two walls, which led to the king's garden. The Chaldeans were besieging the city all around. Zedekiah proceeded along the road through the desert plain.

verses.latin: Et persecutus est exercitus Chaldæorum regem, et apprehenderunt Sedeciam in campo solitudinis Jerichus: et omnes viri bellatores qui erant cum eo, dispersi sunt.
verses.english: The Chaldean army pursued the king and captured Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. All the soldiers who were with him were scattered from him.

verses.latin: Comprehensum ergo regem adduxerunt ad regem Babylonis in Reblatha, quæ est in terra Emath: et locutus est cum eo judicia.
verses.english: So they brought the captured king to the king of Babylon at Riblah, which is in the land of Hamath. There, the king of Babylon passed judgment on him.

verses.latin: Et jugulavit rex Babylonis filios Sedeciæ in oculis ejus: sed et omnes principes Judæ jugulavit in Reblatha.
verses.english: The king of Babylon slaughtered Zedekiah's sons before his very eyes. He also slaughtered all the officials of Judah at Riblah.

verses.latin: Et oculos Sedeciæ eruit: et vinxit eum compedibus, et adduxit eum rex Babylonis in Babylonem, et posuit eum in domo carceris usque ad diem mortis suæ.
verses.english: Then he put out Zedekiah's eyes and bound him with bronze chains. The king of Babylon brought him to Babylon and put him in prison until the day of his death.

verses.latin: In mense quinto, decima mensis, ipse est annus nonusdecimus Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis, venit Nabuzardan princeps exercitus, qui stabat coram rege Babylonis, in Jerusalem:
verses.english: In the fifth month, on the tenth day of that month (which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon), Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard, who served the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: et succendit domum Domini, et domum regis, et omnes domos Jerusalem, et omnem domum magnorum succendit igni.
verses.english: And he burned the Lord's Temple, the king's palace, all the houses in Jerusalem, and every great house, burning them all with fire.

verses.latin: Et omnis exercitus Chaldæorum, qui erat cum principe exercitus, destruxit universum murum Jerusalem in circuitu.
verses.english: The entire Chaldean army, who were with the commander of the imperial guard, tore down all the walls around Jerusalem.

verses.latin: De pauperibus autem populi, et reliquos vulgi, qui remanserant in civitate, et perfugas qui transfugerant ad regem Babylonis, et cæteros de multitudine, transtulit Nabuzardan princeps exercitus.
verses.english: Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard, carried away into exile some of the poorest people, the remaining common people who were left in the city, the deserters who had gone over to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the multitude.

verses.latin: De pauperibus vero terræ reliquit Nabuzardan princeps exercitus vinitores et agricolas.
verses.english: But Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard, left some of the poorest people of the land to be vinedressers and farmers.

verses.latin: Porro columnas æreas quæ erant in domo Domini, et bases, et mare æreum quod erat in domo Domini, confregerunt Chaldæi: et asportaverunt omne æs in Babylonem.
verses.english: The Chaldeans broke into pieces the bronze pillars that were in the Lord's Temple, along with the bronze stands and the great bronze basin called 'the Sea' that was in the Lord's Temple. They carried all that bronze to Babylon.

verses.latin: Et lebetes, et forcipes, et tridentes, et scyphos, et mortariola, et omnia vasa ærea, in quibus ministrabant, tulerunt.
verses.english: They also took away the pots, shovels, snuffers, bowls, dishes, and all the bronze articles used in the Temple service.

verses.latin: Sed et hydrias, et thymiamateria, et urceos, et pelves, et candelabra, et mortaria, et cyathos, quotquot aurea, aurea: et quotquot argentea, argentea, tulit princeps exercitus.
verses.english: Furthermore, the commander of the imperial guard took away the basins, incense burners, pitchers, bowls, lampstands, dishes, and cups—whatever was gold, he took as gold; and whatever was silver, he took as silver.

verses.latin: Columnas duas, et mare unum, et bases duodecim quas fecerat rex Salomon in domo Domini: non erat pondus æris omnium vasorum horum.
verses.english: There were two pillars, one great basin, and twelve bronze stands that King Solomon had made for the Lord's Temple. The weight of the bronze of all these articles was beyond measure.

verses.latin: Et de columnis, decem et octo cubiti altitudinis erant columnæ unius: et funiculus duodecim cubitorum circuibat eam: porro et grossitudo ejus quatuor digitorum, cava, et inanis intrinsecus.
verses.english: As for the pillars, the height of one pillar was eighteen cubits (about twenty-seven feet), and a cord of twelve cubits (about eighteen feet) went around it. Its thickness was four fingers (about three inches), and it was hollow inside.

verses.latin: Et capitella super utramque ærea: et altitudo capitelli unius quinque cubitorum: et retiacula, et malogranata super capitella in circuitu, omnia ærea: similiter et columnæ secundæ, et malogranata.
verses.english: There were bronze capitals on top of each pillar. The height of one capital was five cubits (about seven and a half feet), with a network of bronze pomegranates all around the capitals—all made of bronze. The second pillar was similar, also with pomegranates.

verses.latin: Et fuerunt malogranata nonaginta sex dependentia: et omnia malogranata centum erant, retiaculis undique circumdata.
verses.english: There were ninety-six pomegranates hanging down, and all the pomegranates on the network amounted to one hundred, surrounding it on all sides.

verses.latin: Et tulit princeps exercitus Saraiam sacerdotem primum, et Sophoniam sacerdotem secundum: et tres custodes vestibuli.
verses.english: The commander of the imperial guard took Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the second priest, and the three doorkeepers.

verses.latin: Et de civitate tulit eunuchum unum, qui erat præfectus super viros bellatores: et septem viros de his qui stabant juxta regem, qui inventi sunt in civitate: et scribam principem exercitus, qui probabat tyrones de populo terræ: et sexaginta viros de populo terræ, qui fuerant in medio civitatis.
verses.english: From the city, he took one eunuch who was in charge of the soldiers. He also took seven men from those who stood near the king, who were found in the city. He took the commander of the army's scribe, who was responsible for conscripting the people of the land, and sixty men from the people of the land who were found in the midst of the city.

verses.latin: Tulit autem eos Nabuzardan princeps exercitus, et duxit eos ad regem Babylonis in Reblatha.
verses.english: Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard, took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.

verses.latin: Et percussit eos rex Babylonis, et interfecit eos in Reblatha in terra Emath: et translatus est Juda de terra sua.
verses.english: The king of Babylon struck them down and put them to death at Riblah, in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away into exile from their own land.

verses.latin: Iste est populus quem transtulit Nabuchodonosor: in anno septimo, Judæorum tria millia viginti et tres.
verses.english: These are the people whom Nebuchadnezzar carried into exile: in the seventh year, three thousand twenty-three Jews.

verses.latin: In anno decimo octavo Nabuchodonosor, animæ octo millia trecentæ triginta duæ de Jerusalem.
verses.english: In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar, eight thousand three hundred thirty-two people from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: In anno vigesimo tertio Nabuchodonosor, transtulit Nabuzardan princeps exercitus Judæos septingentas quadraginta quinque. Omnes animæ, quatuor millia sexcentæ.
verses.english: In the twenty-third year of Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard, carried away seven hundred forty-five Jews. All the people carried into exile totaled four thousand six hundred.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in trigesimo septimo anno transmigrationis Joachin regis Juda, duodecimo mense, vigesima quinta mensis, elevavit Evilmerodach rex Babylonis, anno primo regni sui, caput Joachin regis Juda, et eduxit eum de domo carceris.
verses.english: It came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin, king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-fifth day of that month, that Evil-merodach, king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin, king of Judah, and brought him out of prison.

verses.latin: Et locutus est cum eo bona, et posuit solium ejus super solium regum qui cum eo erant in Babylone.
verses.english: He spoke kindly to Jehoiachin and gave him a seat of honor higher than the seats of the other kings who were with him in Babylon.

verses.latin: Et mutavit vestes ejus de vestibus carceris: et comedebat panem jugiter coram eo cunctis diebus vitæ suæ.
verses.english: Jehoiachin changed his prison clothes, and he ate regularly in the king's presence for all the days of his life.

verses.latin: Et annonam ejus statuit, annonam perpetuam, quæ dabatur ei a rege Babylonis, statuta die singulis diebus, usque ad diem mortis suæ.
verses.english: And as for his allowance, a regular allowance was given to him by the king of Babylon, a set amount each day, until the day of his death.
